text: I took a trip to the city for my birthday with 12 friends, i picked this hotel because it was central to activities we had planned but also because it had good looking common areas and bars/restaurants  (if weather was bad i wanted us to have somewhere to gather) and one of the few that had 2 queens in a room. We loved it, rooms are usual NYC size, smaller, but nicely appointed, service all around was great, spaces were modern and fun. Its a doable 10/15 minute walk from penn station. Would stay here again, Great job Kimpton

title: Surprisingly good find!
text: The location is offbeat but surprisingly convenient — and our 23d floor room featured a spectacular Empire State Building view with light show. Sleek, chic rooms with sliding barn doors to bath, electronic pads with multiple newspaper news access. The on-site restaurants are choice, and the free happy hour wine is absolutely drinkable.  No complaints.  Front desk and bell service is friendly — a big thing in NYC — and helpful.

title: Gross.
text: Okay, I where do I begin? I’m a travel advisor and I work with other Kimpton properties internationally. So I randomly booked a night here with my partner - I wasn’t expecting a five star experience but I definitely expected more than I got. Honestly, front desk was nice, doorman was very accommodating at first. I was told that there was no room service at check in.. okay fine. We ordered Uber eats. We called the front desk and let them know that we had food coming, asked if we should come down or if they could have it brought up, we were told that they would be fine bringing it up. After an hour we called again - now we are told it will be $5,00. Okay whatever just bring my food. I call after 20 minutes asking if I should just come down and get it(it’s been a while since it arrived downstairs) they tell me it’s on it’s way - now at 2:00am I get the knock on my door - instead of “I’m sorry for your wait” I get “we don’t usually bring food up”. This isn’t a hostel, it’s supposed to be a 4.5 star hotel. Disgusting. If you are paying. The amount you should for a Kimpton would be much better spent at an edition or any property that isn’t run like a holiday inn with Kimpton prices. Don’t even get me started on the mildew smell in the lackluster room.

title: Sad excuse for a hotel
text:
Stayed at the hotel for one night last weekend. Had high expectation from these reviews and thus was very disappointed in my stay. 

THE GOOD
-Upon request, we were kindly upgrade to a suite  which was available when we checked in. 
-Room had a safe and bathrobes, no slippers. But bathrobes were not in plastic and given our negative feelings about the hotel we chose not to use them as there was no indication they had actually been cleaned. 
-Windows opened albeit just a bit. better than nothing but very noisy from the skateboarders in the park below.

THE NOT SO GOOD
-Suite didn't have a coffee pot or tea kettle. I requested a tea kettle which was delivered along with 2 brown mugs but I was told they have no tea. Apparently, you need to know to bring your own tea or go out shopping which is what we did. Really??? 
-Couldn't connect to wifi. luckily my cell service worked. 
-No complementary water in room (diamond and platinum members)
-One Reading light broken. 
-Tablet was missing. When we notified hotel they said there was no-one there to program a new tablet so we didn't have use of one. 
-Minibar price list is on the tablet. We called front desk twice to request an email of price list as we had a choice of $15 credit for Platinum amenity, finally we went downstairs and asked them to print it. 
-Phone was broken. Buttons don't work and they know that. You need to dial zero for operator. No sign indicating that procedure. (hey, just give us a hint)
-Huge chunks of brown paint peeling (and hanging) from the ceiling. White wall underneath. Housekeeper never noticed this??
-Shower made a thunderous thumping noise when in use, could hear it in the living room. 
-Asked for a list of local restaurant recommendations (again asked twice and then went to front desk for printing). List had 75 names on it. Only one had an address. They were located all over the city. Hey, is it so hard to include addresses so we can choose location?
-This was not that important but on my reservation I noted that it was a birthday celebration. No recognition of this. (I'm diamond) Wasn't expecting a gift but a simple "Happy Birthday" would have been nice. 
-They charged me for a minibar item which we did not take. Upon complaint, they say they have taken it off my credit card. So far credit has not shown up but it likely will. 
---More... but I'm tired of typing...plastic cups for happy hour, no food happy hour not even signature truffle popcorn, silly half drawers in room.................

There are a lot of great hotels in NYC. Needless to say, this is not one we will be returning to. I've only been to a few Kimpton's but recently to the Tokyo Kimpton and Philadelphia Palomar which both make Eventi seem like a Day's inn. But at least a Day's inn is cheap price.

title: Excellent Service
text: We initially booked 4 nights at the hotel. The location is great, close enough to walk to lots of places we wanted to see (Empire State Building, Tines Square, Rockefeller Plaza etc), with the subway nearby too. With our initial booking, the hotel assisted in organizing a driver to pick us up at the airport, which was very convenient. We were also able to have early checkin which got our visit to the city off to a great start. We booked an additional two nights and they kept our bags for the one night we were away from city - again, very convenient. The happy hour wine was a lovely addition to our day on the few evenings we were back at the hotel, the restaurant and bar were also nice to have access to - delicious pastry/dinner at both. From the valets, the cleaning staff to the front desk, all staff were friendly, professional and helpful - PLUS our room had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building

title: Best & Friendliest Hotel in NYC
text: My husband and I have been to Eventi several times over the years, we have enjoy not only the stay but the wonderful staff we encountered at each visit especially Kirk Bibby! He is our favorite staff member he always greets us with a wonderful smile and he has a wonderful personality and is very hospitable. Other staff members that are always there to help us when we need them are Diane, Emily, Jennifer, Victoria they are so helpful and advises us on everything from nearby establishments to where we should visit,  and the best restaurant suggestions. They truly make our experience one of a kind,and we are thankful for such a great staff of people when we visit the Eventi. Having a great staff makes for a great hotel and we certainly enjoy all the hospitality that Kirk, Derek, Johnny, Diane, Emily, Jennifer and Victoria always provide!!

title: Short stay in the city
text: Great stay!!! All staff were extremely accommodating and helpful!! Dino was on top of everything! Service with a smile!! Would definitely come back and stay and recommend to others!  Even the restaurants were amazing!!

title: Excellent in every way!
text: From the moment we arrived everything about staying at the Kimptom Event  was amazing.  Our room was perfect and clean.  The staff, Derick, Bernadino, Kirk and a lovely gentlemen that was sweeping and opening the door for us could not have been friendlier and welcoming.   Celine at checkin was extremely helpful, professional and could not have been nicer.  I have a feeling all the staff at this Kimpton are wonderful.  They seem to go out of their way to make sure your stay is perfect.  And, I can't forget mentioning all the coffee bar and dining room staff (breakfast) and the staff at your restaurant where we had brunch were extremely accommodating, knowledgable and friendly; not to mention the fact that the food was delicious!  I would definitely staying at this Kimpton again!!

title: Great Experience
text: We came to the city for one night to see a show.  This hotel was very nice and spacious.   The staff was  friendly and helpful.   We were allowed to check in early because our room was ready.     Our room was very clean and quiet.

title: Perfect place for fun weekend stay!
text: This hotel is lovely, clean, and has great beds! The employees are kind and welcoming, including the check in, doormen, security, and cleaning staff. We enjoyed the gym and Happy Hour. The decor has a fun vibe and the location was near so many places we wanted to dine and tour. We visited the High Line, Broadway, the Vessel, Eatily, the Gray Dog for breakfast and Journey Experience for dinner. We were close to Penn Station which made for easy travel.

title: Good hotel in ideal location
text: Good hotel, great house keeping and concierge staff. Location great to explore all main attractions on foot. Empire State, MSG, Times Square all easy walk. Subway station also handy to explore rest of the city. Room was great, we had a suite for our family of 4 and it was ideal.

title: Favorite in NYC
text: Favorite hotel in New York. Room was amazing with a great view of the Empire State Building. Location is perfect and walking distance to Times Square and Chelsea. We met Victoria, the manager, at check in and she was very welcoming with great suggestions for the neighborhood. Only wish that the hotel bar, the Vine, had been open later than 10pm every night, but we found many other good places in the area.

title: I only stay at a  Kimpton
text: The Eventi  is a very pleasant surprise. A New York City hotel. I was expecting the New York City hype. Very much not so. I could not have been happier with my stay. The Eventi is a short walk from Penn Station,Times Square and  in close proximity to the subway.The lobby is inviting and quite secure.The staff was efficient and attentive. This is a busy top notch hotel with very good restaurants.I was shocked by the quality of the Neapolitan style pizza that is served for lunch at "The Vine".  While I did not dine at the  onsite steak house there was a waiting  line outside the hotel for seating! The room had a great view of 6th Avenue and the Empire State Building and was well appointed.

title: Review of Kimpton Eventi
text:
Enjoyed my stay at the kimpton, front staff was very helpful, have stayed here multiple times and the level of service is very consistent 

Looking forward to my next stay in New York City and the kimpton

title: Uncomfortable Bed
text:
Concierge was friendly and prompt upon arrival.

I am laying in a bed in a room at The Kimpton currently. I can feel the spring system when I lie down by myself and the pillows are flat. I weigh 150lbs, or less.

title: Kimpton Scrooge - mean Christmas spirit.
text:
First the positives;

Great central location, easy for walking everywhere and close to numerous public transport options.
Rooms are of a good size, and well appointed.
We were lucky enough to have a good view of Empire State Building.

Disappointments:

For a regular Kimpton guest having visited many in USA and Europe, the Eventi was not up to expectations.
As a Diamond Ambassador IHG member, recognition was quite mean.  Despite the fact it was Christmas and the hotel had many available rooms left, the upgrade was the minimum they could give.

The hotel bar and restaurants feel very separate, meaning the public areas of this large hotel are very restrictive.  The wine hour, a feature of all Kimptons during our stay was in a corridor outside function rooms on an upper floor.  Wine was terrible, and there was no atmosphere.  Not worth having at all.

There was no water in the room, even for Diamond members.  There was a large bottle with a price tag and then 2 small bottles in the fridge without a price tag.  We assumed these were free but we were charged for them.

As a Diamond member we were entitled to free breakfast, however at Eventi we were made feel like second class citizens.  We were given a menu which looked interesting, however when we said we were Diamond members it was taken way from us and we were offered very limited options - no meat or fish options.  Even though it was free we didn’t return as it was so poor.  Service at breakfast was terrible also.

So overall a great disappointment,and the worst offer for an IHG member I have seen in any Kimpton.

title: Great location and interiors
text:
We stayed here for 8 nights for a birthday trip to New York. Overall we loved our experience, with just a few notes for improvement. 

Pro’s
- Great location. Within walking distance of so much of NYC. 
- Visable security guards. 
- Staff very friendly and helpful. Managers also attentive and responsive. 
- Beautiful interiors, marble bathroom. 
- Views from the room were beautiful too. 
- Tech in room was great. 
- Beds comfortable. 
- Good extra resources like umbrellas, coffee machine etc. 

Con’s
- There were no teabags in the room. We had to go to a local shop and buy some ourselves. They brought us a kettle to the room and milk (after 7am) but I found it odd there wasn’t any tea as every hotel I’ve ever stayed in has it! 
- There was a continuous smell of cannabis in our room (17th floor) on multiple nights, coming from another room. Although this was somewhat out of the hotels control, we chose to sleep down in the lobby a couple of nights due to our personal circumstances. The hotel sent security up to try and find the culprit as this was against their non smoking policy in the hotel (cannabis is now legal in NYC). This unfortunately didn’t deter the culprit as it continued throughout our stay. The hotel did reimburse us for the inconvenience, it’s just a shame that they couldn’t resolve the issue sooner. 

By the way - the steak restaurant next door is phenomenal! Best steak I’ve had. And the desserts are wonderful. Long queues each night (not just hotel guests) so get there early if you don’t want to wait. 

Thank you Kimpton Eventi.

title: Room for improvements
text: A special shout out to Yaya, from front desk, that made this stay worth paying for. Arrived at the property after 3PM, only to find a room with sub par hygiene. Yaya took ownership of the issue and quickly reassured me that everything is well taken care off. And she did just that and so much more. The location is great, the view is amazing, but what really ruined it for me, except for the concierge staff and front desk staff, the other staffs that I had interaction with is either disinterested in their job and borderline rude. Breakfast staff, and housekeeping staff def need overhaul. From 930am housekeeping are shouting on top of their lungs asking people what time they leaving. I understand that they wanna clean the room etc, but when you just landed from a long haul flight, and all you wanna do is sleep, this is just unacceptable. All in all, it was a good stay, because the simple act of kindness and decency of a few individuals. It is after all a hospitality industry, when you are not hospitable it shows.

title: Awfully rude front desk clerk
text: I booked a room here based on my company's recommendation.  Upon arriving at the front desk the clerk did not even look at me, turned away and I had to wait several minutes before she would talk to me.  She rushed through details including a hastily written wifi password.  I left for my room and quickly had trouble deciphering the wifi code/connection.  Annoyed I went downstairs to ask the clerk what her scribbled wifi notes were.  She very rudely repeated them (no writing) and scoffed at me.  Very rude for a $500/night room.  Glad my company paid for it.  Stay away from this place.

title: Such potential — make it better in 2023 IHG!
text:
This has the potential to be a 5 star stay. 

So far it has been 2 star stay due to their service and policies which are very inconvenient and nonsensical. 

1) Staying for 2 weeks due to business and booked a suite with a premiere city view, requested a high floor. Got a low floor, back of the building view. Asked if they could move us the next day when a room became available. They said yes but — you need to call us before noon tomorrow, we can’t tell you what room you will move to, bring all your stuff downstairs, fully check out and then wait and we can check you back in at 3 PM. Silly. Eventually we escalated to a manger who helped move us once a room was available directly to the new room (like is normal). 

2) Got sick during my stay and wanted to order food over the phone. FYI - despite what it says on their website and it being 2023 they do not do room service, or bring uber eats / caviar orders to the room. It’s like a dorm - you need to go downstairs and pick it up from a random table in the lobby. Anyways, I called the restaurant to place the order for pick up over the phone. They said they are unable to take orders over the phone and all orders must be placed in person. Again, why? Foolish. Intentionally wanted to minimize the time I spent in any common space because I was sick. The restaurant staff in person was clueless until a manager jumped in and helped get a basic order placed. 

In both instances — basic normal requests were made more difficult and required manager escalation to resolve. I don’t enjoy escalating to a manger. It’s as annoying for me as it probably is for the hotel. 

Their rooms, bathrooms, floor to ceiling windows, furnishings, desk space are all beautiful and well designed. Good lighting, closet space and outlets for work. No complaints. 

They are super dog friendly which is the only reason this is a 3 star review instead of a true 2 star.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
We stayed here Saturday and Sunday for New Years Ever, and omg it was amazing! Stylish yet approachable. Good vibe. We brought my son and his girlfriend so we had a Suite with soaking tub. 
1.Very nice suite room, view of Empire State Building was just amazing!
2. Great location - in the center of it all
3. Very accommodating staff
4. Beautiful and stylish interiors
5. Loved the restaurants, we ate at L'amico and really enjoyed our food and was priced at what you would expect for a NYC restaurant

Keep in mind this is the shortest list of recommendations I have ever written:
1. I wish there was a coffee maker or tea kettle in our room
2. There should have been a water, coffee or tea station in the lobby or beverage offered upon arrival as there is in other similar properties like the Pendry
3. Slippers
4. Speaker to connect to listen to music in the room
5. Since there was not closet in our bedroom part of the suite, I wish there was at least a hook for our our hanging items

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel front entrance had no sign at all. Our Uber driver almost could not find the hotel. It had lots of homeless people stationed around outside the hotel restaurant area. The hotel lobby and front desk area were so small. It was totally not inviting. Our room was good size, clean and functional, except the bed was not comfortable. The location of the hotel was excellent. The subway and train stations were a block away. 
Most of the popular tourist attractions were within easy walking distance.

title: Nice hotel x
text:
40th hotel we stayed at in over 42 cities visited in the past years. We stayed for 10 nights and it’s was ok.
Kirk at the door is very nice, friendly and respectful and all the door staff would always chat to me and my boys which is very nice. Couple of wonderful receptionists that are an asset to the hotel (sorry I can’t remember their names but gave feedback to the manager when leaving). 
The rooms are average for the price it costed us (around £5,400). Extra charge for breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks, movies which is the only thing I found negative as we had to pay extra for absolutely everything. Paid half this price is 5 starts hotels and it included breakfast and some even a private lounge with free food and drinks every day, spa, swim pool etc.
The room were clean and we had good heating.

One incident when my boys went upstairs with my bag so I didn’t have access to the lift. They wanted to escort me in my room but I insisted that they could verify my identity using other means then having security escorting me a cross the hotel. The receptionist who dealt with me then was extremely rude and made a very unprofessional comment so I had to ask for a manager who verified my identity. So security is good and I appreciate this but definitely reflecting on other ways to verify identity could be taken as constructive.

Breakfast was ok but we really eat the same things every morning as it lacks of much variety. Being French, I really love my French baguette but this is not served at the hotel. Being also English, I really love my cuppa but had to pay $5 each time I drank one and I usually drink 10 a day in the UK so I couldn’t really afford that lol…

My worse experience was the Italian restaurant. Some staff were ok but one particular Asian waiter was my worse nightmare and I have eating in 100s of restaurants. She was rude as I offer less tip than what is recommended saying “that how they make a living” and walking away from me. Feedback given to the restaurant manager when I was checking out. I would rate the restaurant 1 start for not paying their staff enough so they don’t have to be rude because of tops. Lot of lovely restaurants around.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and subject to having a good deal on prices, I would definitely stay there again x

title: Dated and aged rooms - and check your folio at check out!
text:
knew staying here after RC Nomad might be a bad decision due to the stark contrast. 🤦🏻‍♀️

I was not wrong but it was necessary to clock my IHG Ambassador 20k points so 2 nights it is! 🥹

The property is modern hippish, looking all modern and new in the lobby. But the rooms are a completely different thing 🫥

The dark carpet and generally dark wood themed room was not a welcoming sight, especially with the signs of wear and tear being super obvious. One of those rooms which I wouldn’t want to chill in sadly, though bathroom was thankfully brighter and feeling more modern than the rest of the space. ✅

Breakfast was adequate and did what it did 🍳

I did have fun trying the Social Password which gave me a free movie. Ah wells 🤡

But they charged my anyways for the movie after assuring that it will be noted in my folio and that all is good when I checked out in person. It was all quickly resolved via opening a case with IHG but I wouldn’t stay here again if the hotel cannot even deliver on this simple follow up.

title: Too cool for school!
text: Rooms are great in this hotel , decent size with floor to ceiling windows and great city views regardless of the direction.  Of course if you want something special then request a room facing the Empire State Building.  This hotel is in a no mans land of the city but is very convenient for so many things because of the myriad transport options.  There is plenty of very friendly staff but none of whom seem skilled or willing to actually do anything.  Ask a question and it just gets passed down the line.  Never anyone on the street to open the door or help with luggage or packages which is annoying in such a busy & insecure area of town.  It feels like the lobby and restaurants are run independently and almost like one giant co working hub which makes it difficult if you just want to sit and relax with a coffee or wine as its always so busy and noisy but not with guests it seems. Breakfast is good in The Vine but strange to only be able to choose from a small menu. - even an espresso or  cappucino is not included!  Feels very much like unnecessary nickel and diming of top customers especially when the service is slow and servers mostly cannot understand you.  The bar itself is small and doesn't ever really get going but probably because the bartender is slow and it takes too long to get a drink let alone a second one, a real opportunity wasted.  Still, if you can get it at the right rate its a solid option in lower midtown.

title: Exelente localização
text:
Já estive tantas vezes em NYC que perdi a conta, mas esta foi a primeira vez no Kimpton Eventi, e também a primeira vez no mês do Natal. 
Já me hospedei em um Kimpton em Savannah na Georgia, Washington DC e Chicago. Acho que as suítes Kimpton funcionam bem quando são mais do que 2 pessoas. Desta vez fui eu com as minhas duas filhas, para uma "girls trip" em NYC.

A localização do hotel é excelente. O staff tem dias, mas a maioria são naturalmente prestáveis e atenciosas. Obrigada ao staff.

O lobby não sendo grande está bem conseguido. E a King Suite, espaçosa, funcionou bem a nível de espaço, mas infelizmente ao contrário do que eu tinha pedido, um piso alto, ficamos no 6º andar o que a nível de acústico, durante a noite é muito barulhento e ouve-se tudo o que se passa na rua, mesmo com as janelas bem fechadas. O que foi pena pois a cama é muito confortável.

Sei que fizeram um "face lift" recente às suítes e está tudo imaculadamente limpo. E as senhoras que fazem a limpeza são de uma simpatia e atenção tendo em conta que estávamos numa situação diferente e inesperada. 

Infelizmente a minha filha magoou-se no quarto , desequilibrou-se e caiu, logo na primeira manhã e teve que fazer uma pequena cirurgia a dois dedos do pé. No resto dos dias (estive 5 noites) teve que andar de cadeira de rodas, o que nos condicionou bastante. 

A suíte funcionou, mas nós que gostamos de jantar fora, e tínhamos reservas para todas as noites, decidimos ficar pelo hotel para a minha filha descansar e não sair para jantar, infelizmente não existe Room Service e tínhamos que pedir de fora e ir buscar à entrada do hotel .Mesmo se pedimos dos restaurantes do hotel, o que não tive oportunidade de experimentar a comida, percebi que é ponto de encontro da cidade e bem frequentados, e também temos que ir buscar.

Também não há uma máquina de café no quarto, o que também não se percebe. Certo que no lobby logo pelas primeiras horas da manhã há café para os hóspedes, mas uma pessoa ter que se vestir às 7 da manhã para ir ao lobby buscar café também não é prático e funcional. 

No geral é mais um Kimpton que merece mais oportunidades. É um hotel para se voltar se houver garantia que o quarto fica num piso alto e que nos põe uma máquina de café no quarto e podemos sair para jantar ;-) 

Continuação de um bom trabalho !!!

title: So disappointing
text:
The lobby and downstairs eateries are nice, modern, lively but don't be fooled - what a freaking dump the actual rooms are. I am shocked this is a Kimpton property! The old room reminded me of a Motel 6 room but with marble bathrooms and smaller. The tiniest dingy stinking like a bowling alley room I’ve ever been in. Lots of street noise and hallway thin wall noise. Felt like I was sleeping on the street! Awful sleep quality, had to use earplugs on my vacation. What kind of terrible windows do they have here? Old ugly small elevators. 

I actually hated it so much that I cut my trip short because I didn’t want to spend one more night than I had to here. I took a loss of a night since it was non refundable (of course because once you get here and see what crap it is you’d try and book elsewhere). No free waters. No alarm clock - just the annoying tablet that is too bright and randomly turns itself on early in the morning. Lousy shower water pressure. No bathtub. TV kept resetting itself. Coffee shop is very limited selection. 

Feel like I got ripped off here and won’t be booking any Kimpton properties. Felt like a glorified dorm or hostel room. Last time I stayed in NYC I stayed at the Sofitel and it was so much nicer.  

Also when I left, I asked for a taxi and I'm pretty sure they tried to scam me, the cab wanted $120 for a trip to Newark airport. Told him pull over and got out. Got an Uber for $50 less. They have some kind of racket going.

title: Good option in Manhattan!
text:
With a central location, but just outside the hustle and bustle of Times Square, the Kimpton Eventi makes for a great stay in Manhattan.

I received a very warm welcome at check in and I was in my room in no time.  

By New York standards, the room was spacious.  Atelier Bloem amenities are provided, although for certain products such as hand lotion, a different brand was provided on certain days.  I don’t know if that was to do with stock availability.

As a Diamond Ambassador, I received complimentary breakfast at the Vine.  This was a smaller menu to the hotel’s main breakfast menu and you could choose one main item per person.

Overall, I found that there was a lack of space where you can sit and relax.  The hotel restaurants feel like they operate independently to the hotel and predominantly cater to main food dining.  There isn’t really somewhere you can sit and have a cup of tea/coffee without having to order food.  One evening when we attempted to get drinks at the Vine, despite it being quiet, it was difficult to get anyone’s attention and took a long time to even get menus.  In the end we decided to leave.

For a city full of cookie cutter hotels, the Kimpton Eventi remains a solid option, both in terms of location and room quality.

title: Bumpy start, smooth ending
text:
As with previous mentions, this hotel is centrally located to numerous metro lines and Penn Station - big perk to staying here. I am a long time Diamond Elite member with Kimpton / IHG but, sadly, my stay at Eventi got off to a bumpy start. The hotel does a good job of communicating with guests via text and they were quite responsive when I voiced some concerns. Big shout out to Victoria for her communication, dedication to providing the best customer experience and ironing out the wrinkles. 
Housekeeping is amazing and the rooms are nice and clean.

title: Great experience at a wonderful hotel
text: My husband and I were in NYC recently and stayed at the Kimpton Hotel Eventi.  If you are planning a trip to NYC and want to be close to everything (convenient to the Subway) but not in the middle of it (Time Square) you should check this place out.  Marilyn at the front desk was perfect and a wealth of knowledge in suggesting places to eat.  The staff was kind and very helpful.  We plan on staying here the next time we are in NYC.  The rooms are good sized for the city and the views were great.  All in all I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Nice location, but dont reach up
text:
The Hotel is nice, but will say it overrated for the quality. Booked a suite for 3 persons, but will say its not suitable for 3 adult since you have to pass the bedroom to get to the toilet. Its also difficult to adjust the heating, asked for help but did not get better. Breakfast room is cosy, but we tried almost all courses on the menu and they hardly tast anything. For the price they charge, it should be better. 
The location is very good, but will say its better for friends and adults. Not so good for family.

title: The Best Hotel New York has to offer
text:
Hotel Eventi was an overall standout experience.

Pros
The most luxurious and clean rooms you could dream of, the team really gave the impression that cleanliness was at the heart of everything they do the room was spotless and everything was topped up on every service of the room.

The inhouse tablet for conceierge request as well as local amenities info, as a new visitor to the city this really made us feel at home and welcomed while also providing us with some usual information for the city.

Staff were absolutely on point did not have anything but a pleasant experience with every member of staff we came in contact with.

In house dining, there are two in house dining options one for breakfast and another for lunch and evening dining.
Breakfast is provided by the vine restaurant and coffee bar the food and coffee in this restaurant was magnificent and was absolutely the best way to start the day.

L’Amico for evening dining wasn’t actually utilised during our stay however upon walking past the food looked stunning and we will absolutely ensure to make the most of it on our next visit.

Room was spacious and modernly decorated with the most stunning views, the bed was extremely comfortable and pillows made for the most comfortable of sleeps.

The bathroom felt very luxurious and again was spotless and very spacious.

The little touches of the room such as the numerous toiletries provided made the stay even better as well as the option to request any additional items you may need via the tablet.

The in house entertainment for time in the room was also great a wide option of movies to rent or nearly a 100 live tv stations to watch made the time in the room even more comfortable.

Cons
Absolutely nothing had the most amazing time and will be returning to only this hotel on our next trip.

Thank you to all of the staff that made our trip so wonderful from the girls at the front desk being so friendly and helpful, the concierge team welcoming us to the hotel helping with the bags and even helping flag us down a cab in the bad weather or sorting our airport transfer.

Two particular staff went above and beyond to to take care of us so the greatest of thanks to Jennifer and Deano (apologies if this is the incorrect spelling) both were lovely and helpful on multiple occasions.

title: Superb mid-town hotel in Manhattan.
text:
I was promptly greeted by Jennifer at the front desk. Jennifer exemplified professionalism in the hospitality service. She accommodated all my room requests, provided useful transportation tips, and explained facilities available at the hotel.
My room was quiet, immaculate, and spacious. Bed was very comfortable and climate controls functioned correctly.
Other notes: For AMTRAK riders, this hotel is a five minute walk from the Seventh Avenue entrance.
Subways are three minute walk from hotel.

We were looking for a hotel conveniently located to Lion King on Broadway, yet away from over populated Times Square area, and Eventi was literally the perfect spot. We booked one of the suites for our family of 4 and felt like it was more than enough space, which we know is hard to find in NYC.  We typically don't spend too much time in the room when we travel, but felt the need to soak up all that our room had to offer! The views were incredible - we couldn't get enough!

What really made our stay though was the staff. Every single person we came in contact with had a warm smile and genuinely wanted to help. Shout out to the killer front desk crew and Bell/Doormen: Johnny, Victoria, Diane, Marilyn, Jennifer. Derek, Alex,  Bernardo - who each helped make our small one night stay trip a big memory we will forever cherish. We can't wait to come back....and try out Skirt Steak (the line was around the corner!). Thank you, everyone!

title: Amazing Housekeeper!!
text: We wanted to specifically acknowledge the service provided by our housekeeper, Elvira. Hands down, she gave the absolute best service we've ever received at any hotel. She made sure we were taken care of every day of our stay and countless times offered to help in any way she possibly could. We could not have asked for a better service.

title: An outstanding experience that I hope all will partake in ~~~
text:
This is an outstanding hotel in New York City.  Hotel Eventi does what all others claim, but can't pull off.  The location is perfect no matter where you are coming from.  The hotel staff is stellar and the suites are fabulous.  It has a Vegas vibe without being pretentious.  Everything here was on point.  I have been in my share of NYC hotels, and they are often a pain, because they advertise one thing, and always fall short.  Hotel Eventi is the antidote.  First, the staff greets you with a warm welcome, as you enter this very cool lobby.  Check-in was easy and up to my floor.  Most floors are keycard access only, so safety is key.  They suite was a great respite from a trip that had a lot of twists and turns.  The room was immaculate, with a generous bathroom/shower.  The bed was wonderful and peaceful.  The windows are super insulated, so you barely hear any outside noise, including sirens.  Yes, you can actually get sleep here.  

Another thing is that if you know the Kimpton brand, you know they always deliver.  I was checked in by the wonderful Emily!  What I also loved is that everyone was truly enjoying themselves.  Everyone, including other patrons, were personable and respectful.  It was like one big party, but subdued like in a James Bond movie.  They have a restaurant on property, that although I did not have the opportunity to drop in due to other engagements, the aroma's coming out of there were incredible.  

Everything here is about treating you like family and showing that they care.  I asked for extra towels when I booked, and they left me plenty.  It was easy to relax and kick my feet up.  Whether you are visiting from another state, country or close-by and just want a place to stay in the city, you cannot go wrong here.  This place serves every purpose.  The General Services Manager, Victoria, was so extremely personable and attentive.  Anything they can do to help you have a great stay, they will.  NYC was really cold when I arrived, but my room got me away from all of that. 

I have found THE hotel I will now be reserving anytime I am flying into NYC.  The price point is great and you cannot beat the location.  I cannot say enough about my stay, as I have had so many bad experiences with hotels previously.  This has entirely changed my outlook  and I am so very thankful to all the staff for a wonderful stay.  I cannot wait to see you all on my return.  Do yourself a favor, book here!  If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. 

The photo I took of the Empire State Building was taken right from within my room!

Thank you!

title: Great Rooms, F&B and Front desk Team.  Hotel is the whole package!
text:
What a great stay.  The team at the desk was awesome, breakfast was great and the Speakeasy a great find.  Rooms are really spacious light, great bathroom and good to work in.  Special shout out to Diane and Jennifer at the Front Desk who helped me out during my stay SEVERAL times with work related requests.  The F&B team were great too, thanks to Chris for helping out with a last minute large table request! High five to the whole team!

See you again soon I hope!

title: Nearly flawless
text: Let’s start with the positive - great location, excellent views towards Empire State and Skyline. We stayed in a suite on the 20th floor with excellent views and less noise obstruction from the street. Beside a very negative start it was a pretty nice experience. Rooms are spacious and bathroom has a whirlpool tube. Beds are very comfortable and especially housekeeping staff is very friendly and attentive. Breakfast is expensive (as everywhere) but high quality and again friendly staff. So not a lot to complain if we wouldn’t have had such a bad start. Our flight has been late and our kids pre-arrived an hour earlier at the hotel but where not allowed to check in initially (same name and one kid above 18) . The front clerk was very unfriendly and unhelpful not even trying to call us and get things sorted - and yes I understand that the hotel is careful on that but I  have never seen such a unhelpful behaviour. On our arrival I asked the lady on the issue and got a very blunt and arrogant reply. Something I have not experienced as a platinum member of IHG before.

title: Terrible hotel and service
text:
Terrible hotel and terrible service. It’s the third time I stayed at this hotel and I have to say it’s becoming awful.  It started with water damage on my bathroom, then the room was not clean and then they’ve lost a package that has been delivered under my name to the reception. 

Ladies at the reception at not professional at all and were really rude, unkind and haughty. 

It doesn’t matter what happens to you or what mistakes they do you are going to have the same disrespectful conversation with them instead of a simple apology. 
My friends staying at the hotel had the exact same experience.

Coming from a frequent customer, I am telling you don’t go there. The new management has destroyed what made this hotel great in the past

title: The Eventi gets 5 stars from me
text:
I have been visiting the Eventi for over the past 8 years or so. It is the ONLY hotel I stay at in NYC. I visit every few weeks. Why do I stay?  The staff first and foremost. From the first time I visited until the last, the staff goes out of their way to make sure I am taken care of. From the guys at the door, reception, management and the restaurants. I have been given recommendations to restaurants that have become my favorites. And if there is ever an issue they are super responsive to correct it.

I know that for some travel has been difficult, myself included. It took a few minutes to get back to "normal" but I am here to say that the Eventi has it T-O-G-E-T-H-E-R!  

You are not going to find a bigger room in this city that has floor to ceiling windows and if you are lucky you can get a HUGE soaking tub AND an unfettered view of the Empire State Building.

It is in a perfect location to get everywhere you need to. 

I cannot say enough about this wonderful hotel. And definitely get a soprasetta pizza at L'Amico. You can thank me later

And did I mention they have a Peloton????

title: Not worth 600 a night.
text: I’ve been lucky enough to travel the world. And to stay in some exquisite hotels. For those of us who have travelled to Asia and the Middle East, a four-star hotel, there is incomparable to the US. This includes the quality of service, the Spa, the room, &  the ambience  Granted I made a late booking to the Kimpton Eventi in New York and for a standard room I ended up paying $600 a night. The room was very basic. There was no room service on Saturday night and when I called for silverware, I was asked to go down to the concierge’to get some plastic utensils.  This same $600 in the Middle East and Asia would end up being a presidential suite with first class service.  I’ve also stayed at much nicer hotels in Manhattan for $300  to $400 a night.  The room was clean and quiet but I expected a lot more for $600 a night. The staff was very nice when I shared my experience and I hope they can remedy the situation. I am open to giving it another chance.

title: Thank you
text:
Thank you for an amazing stay. 

We got married in New York & stayed at this lovely hotel. 

It was a smart & modern aesthetic with clean large rooms and had very attentive staff who went out of their way to make our stay special. 

A massive shout out to housekeeping - Hassania - not only was our room always spotless, but she also went out of her way to decorate our room and wish us luck on our wedding day. Also a special shout out to Fernando and Deano (doormen). They were both always really friendly, welcoming and accommodating, assisting in our transport to return to the airport.

title: Amazing Hotel. A Chelsea Must Stay
text: We really enjoyed our time here - hotel was clean, nicely modern, the vibe was upbeat and the staff here is personable, friendly and accommodating. From the time we walked in, Dino greeted us with a smile and directed us appropriately. Location is great also.

title: Dino is my hero!
text: Excellent hotel. Room was gorgeous and service fantastic. Special shoutout to Dino who saved me by getting the hotel car and walkng me two blocks in the rain to get picked up to the airport, as it was such bad traffic i couldnt get an uber or cab. Thank you Dino!!

title: Hotel Eventi  - One to return to.
text: Penn Street station is not the most welcoming way to get to New York and you have to be aware of your surroundings. As you clear the station, first sight of the Eventi on Sixth Avenue with its outside decorations for Halloween standing out against the rest of the dreary wet sidewalk says not your average hotel! Inside and meet the reception and portering teams and it's quite obvious the Eventi is different in a great, humorous, slightly quirky, welcoming way.  Stayed 4 nights and enjoyed our time thoroughly. Front of house staff were all kind and helpful.  The bar and bistro are lively and offer a good option, but the central location has so many food options when you venture out. The room was spacious, clean and quiet, looking toward Empire State ( in the mist).  Definite recommend and one for return visits when the weather is better.

title: Outstanding customer service
text:
From the moment I stepped out of the car I was treated like a VIP.  Bernadino -Bell,put me at ease after a long travel day.  Friendly and helpful.  
Check in was quick which was much appreciated.
Professional and knowledgeable service enhanced my stay.  Thank you Beradino and staff.

title: Fantastic venue for business meetings
text: Fantastic venue for business meetings; the food and service was perfect. I will use the space again. Don’t forget to visit the daily free wine tasting experience on the fourth floor. Also well worth the attendance.

title: Great hotel, great staff
text: Frequent business traveler but I hadn’t been back to Eventi since 2018. It’s lovely as ever and the staff was all on their game.  Positive attitudes, no one on their phones, and all eager to help with anything- finding cabs, giving directions, holding luggage, etc.  Particular shout out to Dino who was a joy.

title: Amazing staff
text:
As of right now, my stay has been amazing. The check-in was very smooth. The staff was eager to help me to my room.  The Front desk team was efficient and very helpful answering all my questions about local attractions and places to eat/visit. Truly appreciate the service provided by Wenye, Dino, Victoria and Yaya “the mighty Taurus”. Incredible personalities and the hotel is lucky to have team members like them. 

Truly appreciate the hospitality!!! See you every time I pop in town/

title: Location yes; luxury no
text: Great location for NYC. Easy walk to High Line and Broadway for a show. Not sure how the hotel can be billed as luxury - certainly not a great value for the price. Maybe I had a room yet to be updated?  Furniture was worn and outdated. Unpleasant view, but I was on a lower floor. Very long line and wait to check in upon arrival. Staff were doing their best but more staff are needed.  Staff friendly and helpful overall. Appreciated that security checks room keys upon return later in evening before providing access to elevator.

title: How do they let this park exist next to their beautiful hotel???
text: This Kimpton Hotel and Beatrice apartments are beautiful. Restaurants within & outside- fantastic. Views amazing. Park connected next door?  Horror show. Tragically there is a homeless camp in this beautiful park  (and yes the homeless, mentally ill population is a tragedy - I pray Eric Adam’s can fix). Defecating people, sleeping everywhere, trash strewn- clearly folks in desperate need of help.  A huge fight broke out while we were there- police involved. They cleaned it up- next day- they all returned. Be warned of this issue. I assume management is equally frustrated- not sure.

title: After 12 years, it's still my favorite!
text:
I've been staying at the Eventi since it opened in 2010. I'm a huge fan of Kimpton Hotels and am beyond thrilled whenever I travel for work and find the Eventi is an approved option in our travel tool. My company is frugal and the options are generally limited. The Eventi however, is by far, my FAVORITE NYC hotel. The location is ideal. It is also beautiful, quiet, and makes me feel like I'm at my home away from home. 

Now. It's literally been years since I was able to secure a work-approved rate at the Eventi. [I'm still surprised I was able to get it for this trip!] The minute I walked into the lobby at 9:45pm EST on Monday, 10/18/22, it was clear that the Eventi had only gotten better with age. It had been a FULL DAY of cross-country travel that felt like it started a week ago but in reality was really just 5am PST. Either way, I was beyond exhausted when Yaya began the check-in process. She was kind and her positivity immediately shifted my mood. Yaya seemed genuinely interested in identifying what she could do to make me comfortable as soon as possible -- before I was in the elevator she had ordered a Nespresso machine to the room along with some toiletries I had forgotten. Yaya's customer focus and devotion to creating a seamless customer experience was refreshing. I realized how much of a standout the Eventi and Kimpton experience is. I would absolutely stay here for personal travel. I hope whatever type of trip brings me back to NYC next will include a stay at the Eventi.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: This hotel is super cool, great wine hour, staff was super friendly. Room was very clean  bright and well appointed. The team here was awesome and really made the stay a great one.  The upgraded rooms are well worth the extra spend  and some fantastic views !

title: Decent hotel - great location and gym
text:
3 night work stay - corporate rate, but got small upgrade as IHG member. High-end room setup and great bathroom with walk in shower. 

Gym was above average, pelatons and great view of the surrounding buildings - weights to 50lb dumbbells and quite a bit of space with multiple benches.

Free wine happy hours in lobby every night - food in restaurant in lobby for dinner was great small plate sharing, although pretty small.

Breakfast was terrible service, slow, not very friendly - bagel with lox was $25+ tax and service and was just ok. Ate in office rest of the week.

Location is great - staff on reception and lobby super friendly - decent choice overall.

title: Very Central Location, Great View
text: It has a perfect location.  Being so close to everything is a big advantage.  The ambiance of the hotel is very impressive.  Especially our view was perfect.  Floor-to-ceiling glass windows and our view from the 22nd floor had a direct view of the Empire State Building.

title: Great all around
text: My wife and I had a great stay here recently.  The hotel is very nice -- totally new, with very stylish and updated feeling to the room and building overall.  The rooms are quite large for NYC standards.  Very high quality to everything.  Definitely recommend.

title: You must stay here….
text: This hotel is absolutely wonderful. Boutique style, ultra modern clean rooms which are a very good size for city. Central location with happy hour every evening and complimentary tea and coffee in the morning. All the staff are a credit to the hotel, so very friendly and accommodating and couldn’t do enough for us. Look no further you should definitely stay here. We will be back…

title: Fantastic Hotel in the middle of it ALL
text: I planned a 2 day conference and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. From the hotel style, location, food and beverage, hotel room size and conference room set-up and AV support. I would like to thank the entire staff of this great hotel, from reception Celine, Francisco and Dino, AV/VC Keith, Food and Beverage manager Arturo and Jeff and Jodi from the sales department. This was a very successful event and all our conference attendees really enjoyed their stay and the venue. We look forward to future bookings and recommending this hotel others.

title: Not for families whatsoever. Find somewhere else.
text:
Not sure what staff others experienced, but except for two doormen we found the staff dour and unhelpful. No explanation of hotel facilities, no smiles, just *very* brusque processing at front desk. 

Bar staff in the Italian restaurant tried to pass off an Earl Grey as English Breakfast tea (walked away from me and said “just don’t show him the packet”) and when challenged with being deceitful, shrugged.

Not a happy feeling hotel, small rooms, poor service, poor water pressure - 100% not recommended for families whatsoever.

title: Nice property, but...
text:
We stayed at this property a year ago and liked it a lot.  This time not as much so and for what to me seems like minor stuff.  The major stuff they have covered.  We stayed in a suite for 4 nights and battled with a entry door that wouldn't shut without forcefully pulling it, keys that had to be replaced three times, and a bathroom door that wouldn't close at all.  The head of security had to let me in late one night after the front desk person told me maybe you left the door open.  Turns out she was right, I didn't pull it hard enough. 

Look, the doormen here will bust their backside to get the door or get you a taxi, the room service staff are efficient and want to make you happy, the front desk staff is professional and helpful, and the restaurants are decent with good staff and fast kitchens.  They just need to maintain the place.

title: Friendly staff in NY
text: We stayed for three nights at Eventi Hotel, the room was very small for my husband, my baby and me, but clean and the bed and shower were very good. The staff was very kind and friendly especially Dino, who helped through out our stay.

title: great stay
text:
We like to thank all the staff for the warm welcome. 
Especially Dino & Winnie made us feel good. From the moment we arrived till we had to say good bye they took care of us and made our stay at the Kimpton special. We felt very welcomed due to their great hospitality. Thank you!

title: Fabulous Manhattan Hotel
text: Great hotel in Midtown Manhattan.  Very large rooms for a city hotel.  My room was clean and well appointed.  Loved the huge shower.  Excellent gym.  Great coffee in the morning.  Friendly staff.  Close to everything in Manhattan.  Highly recommended.

title: New York 5 stars
text: The Kimpton hotel came highly recommended by my siblings who frequently stay here when traveling in New York and San Diego. Let me tell you, it was the BEST hotel I’ve stayed at visiting New York and everyone working here made the stay 1000x times better. The room had a view of the Empire State Building (not shown in pic) and the restaurant down stairs had the best lemon ricotta pancakes I’ve ever had. Jennifer assisted us with our check in and was very attentive throughout our stay, definitely ask for her when you book your next stay. The best part was they do ask for a key card to enter the hotel after a certain time which made us feel very safe by the security, book the Kimpton Eventi for your next stay!

title: Nice hotel in NYC, above average
text: We booked about 20 rooms here for our daughter’s wedding. Excellent team members—from the front desk, to the super friendly and helpful doormen, and group sales reps!  The rooms are above average and spacious (for NYC) centrally located and the hotel has a nice bar and dining options. The only thing I would note is that we did book a lot of rooms and I felt as though something nice could have been done for the bride and groom suite. There was no thoughtful gesture - champagne, a box of chocolates, flowers just a token. We’ve stayed at a lot of Kimptons so I was a little surprised—chalking it up to Covid—still impacting staff #’s that’s why I still have 5 stars.

title: A perfectly curated, modern hotel right in the heart of NYC.
text:
A perfect place to stay in NYC, conveniently located near Penn Station and in the heart of Midtown. I loved how the hotel curated the lobby, restaurant, hallways, and bathrooms with beautiful art and art installations. The bathroom in the restaurant is one of the coolest bathrooms I've seen. 

The room was super open and had floor-to-ceiling windows where you can sit and watch the happenings of NYC below and look up to see the Empire State Building. Comfy bed and great amenities in the room as well. 

I loved the wine happy hour each day from 5-6!

title: Amazing Place to stay and host Corporate Events/Meetings
text:
The hotel staff are great and always super accommodating to guest needs. We had many people staying at the Kimpton from around the world and they could not stop talking about how great this place is. 

The door staff are so nice and will literally save your life. The bikers on the bike lane will run you over and not even stop. If Alex was not there to help I would have gotten hit by a speeding cyclist. 

My Hero Alex! Thank you again for saving me!

title: Fantastic stay and customer service!!
text:
I just had to leave a glowing review about the experience I’m having at The Eventi- I needed a quick room for a last minute work trip and managed expectations. Not because of the hotel- I had heard great things and eaten at the fantastic restaurant before- but because I grabbed a last minute room via Hotel Tonight and was prepared to take anything available.

I go to check in and am greeting by the delightful Emily M who couldn’t have been lovelier, made excellent suggestions about other local things to check out and took care of all of my needs within minutes. She even graciously upgraded me- something you don’t often find on a last minute booking, much less when booking via third party.  

I’m currently getting ready for my event in an absolutely beautiful and well appointed room, incredibly well lit bathroom, with every detail thought out- from steamers and irons for those of us busy travelers to in room Yoga Mats for those who are lucky enough to have a few minutes to focus on R&R or exercise. The room is also staying blissfully cool during a record heat wave in NYC- a little but incredibly important detail. 

Emily M was also sure to point out additional features such as cocktail hours, coffee and tea bars and such which give this hotel an added boost in my opinion. I would also add that the proximity to local transit hubs and attractions should be a bonus for most.

Definitely add this to your list, I will absolutely be back!

title: Comfortable, great location, fantastic staff
text:
I'm a 'regular' business traveler. I appreciate and enjoy a good hotel that is there when I need it (minibar, restaurant, breakfast) and not there when I don't (ability to hold off cleaning staff, choose to get text notifications or not).
Room on the 16th floor was quiet, comfortable and modern. 
Yaya and Emily at the front desk did a fantastic job of noting how I travel, and took care of me. Stayed in NYC quite a bit, and this is my new go-to down in the Flatiron.

title: Great stay!
text: Cleanest hotel I have ever been to m, hands down. Victoria, the manager was extremely attentive and wanted to make sure I had the best stay. If your staying there I suggest getting a suite with a oversized bathroom and shower. Overall great place to stay and I highly recommend

title: Best hotel experience in NYC
text: The Kimpton Hotel Eventi is modern, chic, and stunning! Everything from the central location, the welcoming staff, and the luxurious hotel amenities made my stay and experience in NYC incredible! The rooms are very spacious with the most gorgeous city views! There's almost no need to leave the hotel given the AMAZING lobby restaurant, L'Amico! I also highly recommend ending your day with an amazing cocktail by the fireplace at The Vine!

title: Great price for amazing 4.5 star service!
text:
After our horrible experience at The James Nomad, we checked out after the first night and checked into the Kimpton Eventi! This place is hands down awesome! Great customer service. They told us about their hotel. What was avail and what was not!  Amazing customer service! 

The room is very modern! Love the ceiling to floor glass window with amazing views from the 19th floor! They have  a free cocktail hour like the James but they actually have someone serving their guests! 

We have all the amenities and service of a 4.5 star hotel unlike the James and the price was cheaper! Beware of the James! Don’t bother when the Kimpton Eventi is literally down the street with so much more to offer.

title: Another wonderful Kimpton
text: We are loyal Inner Circle Kimpton people.  First trip back to NYC since the pandemic began.  Our go to Kimpton used to be the Ink 48 in Hell's Kitchen, but now that is no longer a Kimpton we decided to try the Eventi.  Overall a wonderful hotel for NYC.  Room was very small but corner windows on the 22nd floor made it great.  Service was phenomenal as with almost all Kimptons.  Special thanks to Dino and Julio who went out of their way to make our stay special.  Only real hiccup was wine hour which is always from 5-6.  First and second night no issues.  Third night we returned from our matinee around 5:20, went to the place it had been before and no one there.  Asked at the desk, and they said it had been from 4-5 that day.  No one had informed us, and the Ipad with info in the room said nothing.  No problem with moving the time, but guests should be informed of this.  Certainly didn't let it ruin our stay.  Overall would recommend this hotel if in NYC

title: Amazing staff! Beautiful location! Incredible restaurants!
text:
We spent a week in NYC this May and stayed at this incredible hotel. Our expectations were MORE then met. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and personable.
When we arrived, we were greeted at the front desk by Jennifer who was extremely friendly and told us she would try to get our room ready for an early check in. She went out of her way to get that done and called us when our room was ready
The doormen (Dino, Alex, Kirk and Derek) were consistently helpful and kind. They were always right there, opening the door, saying good morning and asking what we had planned for the day. Every morning they would give us directions to our destination, and every evening they would make sure to ask us how it was. When one of our phones were left in an Uber after dinner one night, they spent hours making sure we got it back, while Jodi, the manager kept us calm with conversation until our phone was returned to us.

The hotel itself was beautiful with incredible views of the city and located in a very centralized location. Our room was clean with amazing artwork and a huge bathroom and floor to ceiling windows. 
The hotel also boasts incredible restaurants with amazing food at a very reasonable price range with a beautiful atmosphere.

All-in-all everyone at the Eventi made us feel like family and it truly is a home away from home for us. This is definitely where we will be staying next time we come to the city, no questions asked.

title: Great staff
text: We stayed at the hotel for a week and the most impressive, beside the location, was the staff. So nice, polite and helpful, we had great communication, definitely won't forget them, especially Marilyn and Derek (hoping they will remember us). The hotel is on Sixth Avenue, and despite a traffic jam, the room was quiet. Nice beds, good night sleep, spacious room and bathroom.

title: Larger rooms for NYC, quiet, great staff
text: I have stayed here twice now, and both times have been great. Staff are very pleasant, hotel lobby area is super nice and the rooms are larger than most NYC hotel rooms. The rooms are quiet and clean, and the location is amazing. Even the pull out couch was comfortable for sleeping! I will definitely stay here again!

title: Kimpton Eventi Outstanding
text: A very big thank you to Dino! I had so many bags to carry to my Uber and he helped with every single one. Top notch service. And Arturo was absolutely amazing helping with our trade show event. Wow, I can’t say enough good things.

title: Great staff and great vibe
text: Upon arrival we were greeted by a wonderful positive smile from Jennifer. She explained all the great amenities and choices available to us.  The hotel vibe is boutique chic and was clearly a great choice visiting NY for a few days. Jennifer is a winner!!

title: Hotel stay
text: We had a nice stay at the hotel. My husband and I enjoyed the nice room and comfortable lobby.  We want to give a HUGE shout out to the two super friendly and knowledgeable doormen that were on duty during our stay.  Dino was so helpful giving us some recommendations regarding restaurants nearby and he got our yellow cabs quickly too! He made us feel so welcome every time we returned back to the hotel. Thanks Dino!!

title: Don’t go with a baby…
text:
My husband, baby, and I stayed at the Eventi for 2 nights.  Overall we had a really pleasant experience with the staff and the room but had a big issue with the sleep accommodations provided for our 10-month-old. 

1 week prior to our stay I called to ensure that a Pack & Play would be in the room upon arrival.  I asked for a guarantee so that I could feel confident traveling without my own Pack & Play.  We entered the room and a rusty crib was sitting there.  It was on wheels that didn't lock, had a completely dirty mattress, and a loose-fitting sheet (if you research safe sleeping guidelines for infants this is an absolute 'no').  When I spoke with the front desk and the housekeeping manager I was told that no Pack & Plays were available to replace this disaster of a crib (despite having been guaranteed one).  So I went out and purchased a Pack & Play on my own.

I’ve since contacted the manager twice to discuss the issue and have not heard back.

title: Wonderful stay for anniversary
text: We had a wonderful stay here for our anniversary. Victoria, the manager, was very helpful and professional, she upgraded our room to corner deluxe one to help us feel the atmosphere of NYC. Views from 23rd floor are stunning! Hotel stuff is very attentive and friendly, housekeepers are always smiling. The hotel is located in the center of everything, so we had a chance to explore Brooklyn and Upper Manhattan. Coffee shop on first floor is amazing, we never had an opportunity to explore the restaurant, but I’m pretty sure it’s nice as well. And wanted to say the design of this hotel - I loved it.

title: Quiet room
text: Having stayed in the city a few times last year for work, I gradually gave in for more luxury hotels than an inn/motel-like lodging options. Kimpton Hotel Eventi is super convenient. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet. It is also super close to Penn station, so I can take LIRR instead of driving in the future. Will stay here again :)

title: Wonderful Service!
text:
We love the Kimpton boutique hotels nationwide, and this was no exception. The rooms are tiny but modern and chic with good service. The lobby areas and restaurant/cafe areas were exceptional. 

Of particular note was Dino, our concierge & bell man who helped us hail taxis, recommended great places, and took care of us each day. He’s management material for sure!

title: What a letdown
text:
I’m a platinum elite member, as I frequent the Austin Kimpton, and I love it. 

If this place were rated a 3 star hotel it would be more accurate except, I can get food from vending machines at a 3 star. Zero in room dining, every phone prompt goes to a busy signal, and absolutely zero in room service. This is not a 4 star hotel, but they certainly charge a 4 star rate. 

After ten pm if you want food you have two options, to order door dash or go out. But if you order door dash expect to have to walk to the lobby to retrieve it. 

Want coffee in the am? Go walk downstairs to get it. Breakfast? Not a chance unless you dine in their restaurant. 

Why am I so salty? Had they told me at check in there was no in room amenities, I would have stayed somewhere else. The reception staff was rude when I asked why the phones went straight to busy signals. 

This was an incredibly disappointing stay. I won’t repeat.

title: Amazing hotel and fantastic experience.
text:
What an awesome hotel stay in New York. 

This was our first time in New York and I believe this hotel is what made us have such a great trip. 

First it has an amazing reception area and the ladies at reception are friendly and welcoming. We arrived early so used their storage area to store our suitcases so we could get out and explore. 

Check in was 3pm and we arrived but there was a slight delay to check in. We were communicated with and as we were not in a rush it was not a problem… eventually we checked in and got an amazing room over looking the Empire State building and 6th Avenue. (Also got complementary $30 to spend from the mini bar for the delay in checking in)

Room was great spacious, comfortable, warm and had great views. 

Throughout the stay if we asked for help/ telephone to make restaurant reservations or to ask for a local persons opinion the staff were more than happy to support. 

On final day we have the 12pm checkout, but again we’re able to use the luggage storage area. Thus it allowed us to use the most of our time seeing around New York. 

Thank you and if I was to return to New York I would happily stay again.

title: Nice comfortable hotel
text: Good hotel in a good location.  Seems to be popular with locals which caused the bars and restaurants to be very busy, good food in the restaurant and helpful staff made it a very pleasant stay.  Rooms comfortable and modern especially comfortable bed!

title: Outstanding Experience at the Eventi
text:
My three friends and I had a comfortable room and the cleaning staff were so friendly and thoughtful. They left a sweet note for us after we left a tip for them. Kyle was an excellent host in the bar area, he was very sweet and answered all of our questions about the area and gave us ideas of places to go. We had complimentary wine at the bar and ordered the wood oven pizza for an appetizer! It was the best pizza I've ever had. The glass of wine was a French red and was very good as well. The second night we sat next to the fireplace on a comfortable couch in the library and had our nightly complimentary wine. Beautiful and sweet room! We ate at Skirt Steak and the steak was good, but the unlimited fries were even better. It is a bistro so we didn't linger because we new there was a long line outside.  Unfortunately, we felt a bit rushed by the staff. They were pulling plates off the table while some were still eating. It kind of ruined the ambiance and feeling of the place. The third restaurant at Eveni is L'amico. We had several meals that were very delicious! We discovered that the cook is french even though it is an Italian restaurant. But he really knows what he is doing. I want to steal him and bring him back to Chicago!! The staff was great, and Kennito was our waiter and had wonderful suggestions and treated us to a dessert called Italian Meringue. We came back and had it again the next day! It was so good! For brunch I had Tiramisu French Toast that was to die for. It was pure perfection!
Celine and Jenn Z at the front desk were so accommodating and friendly. They gave us great recommendations for places to eat while we visited sites such as the World Trade Center and memorial. Kirk was great and held our luggage for us after we checked out. He was there to help load up our luggage when we came back to get it to go to the airport. He was such a friendly, and nice guy! This hotel is located in a perfect place! We could walk to Madison Square Gardens, Macy's on 34th and the Empire State Building. There is a Starbucks nearby, but you can have complimentary coffee at the hotel. I really want to go back and stay here again. I might even try Skirt Steak again, after all it recently opened and went viral on TicTok.

title: I would stay here again
text:
My friend and I chose the hotel because of location, having looked at the reviews. Nothing really to find fault with. The double room we had was large and included very comfortable beds. The housekeeping staff were very pleasant and helpful. We didn't want to use the minibar (seriously, who does that!) so we asked for another fridge in our room, and they brought one up immediately and plugged it in for us. 
There are a lot of stores nearby where you can buy anything you might have forgotten or need for the room. There's a Wholefoods store nearby on 7th, between 24th and 25th, and you could eat out of that place for a year!
The restaurants in the hotel are expensive, but I wouldn't expect anything else in the middle of Manhattan. 
So yes - if I wanted to be in that area, I would stay here again.
The front desk staff and concierge were also very pleasant and helpful.

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff
text: The location is amazing, the hotel is clean and the staff is so nice. Hassania helped clean my room and did such a phenomenal job. She was very  helpful and accommodating. She deserves to be recognized and she ended up giving me some bags to put my shoes in to travel back. I couldn’t get my room cleaned the next day since I had a meeting to take in my room. She made sure I had enough products and tissue.

title: Great staff!
text: Wonderful property! The team is very attentive and super approachable. I will definitely be coming back in the summer. Oh! The restaurants were also amazing! Eventi is is a hidden gem in the Nomad district.

title: A very disappointed experience!
text: Very uncomfortable bed , unfriendly staff. Doesn’t allow even half hour late checkout even it’s low season.. The view in the room is very decisive and don’t fall for it.  The phone never got through to any number!  Please don’t come! We are not going to stay here any more

title: Great Place To Stay For City Break
text:
Booked for 5 nights city break from UK 
Good location within walking distance from major attractions and a main  subway station to go further afield 
Local restaurants and shops cafes are all minutes walk away 
Rooms are clean Bathrooms well appointed 
Plenty of fresh towels linen and toiletries 
Our housekeeping lady was lovely 
Bed was large and comfortable 
Mini bar is ridiculously expensive 
There are no tea coffee facilities in room which was disappointing however complimentary coffee can be picked up in the lobby in the morning . 
Reception staff friendly and helpful 
Safe in our room and heating in my daughters room were not working but were fixed immediately on request 
We only ate in the restaurant once for breakfast which was lovely 
Waiters were friendly and efficient Food was great 
The hotel is quiet There is some road noise which calms down through the night but it is NYC so to be expected 
We were very happy with our stay here

title: Great all around
text:
Staff were outstanding - Victoria at the desk was helpful, friendly and knowledgable about the hotel and things to do in the area.
Excellent value for hotel location and boutique decor; and comfortable and stylish room.

title: Slightly tired hotel, good 3 or poor 4 stars
text: Staff were great and the lobby was stylish, elevators worked. Room was spacious but we might have got lucky with a corner view. Aircon worked if a little noisy. Decor was tired, worn carpets and bathroom fittings. Service was good but expect to be charged for any little thing eg water not in the minibar $8. During the stay the advertised free bikes, roof bar, spa were not available. On site bar and restaurant were good if a little expensive for the quality offered.

title: Publicité mensongère !
text: Scandaleux ! Nous payons une chambre avec vue sur la ville et baignoire pour apprendre au final sur place que c’est une erreur ! Seule les suites disposent d’une baignoire pour 100$ de plus par nuit !!!! Les photos de ma réservation sont pourtant clair mais le personnel ne veut rien entendre et soutient que c’est une erreur du site !

title: Family NYE trip
text:
There are “nicer” areas to stay in NY but it means you have to take the subway every time to see the city. This area is super central so if you prefer waking, this hotel is ideal.
Beds are comfy, beddings are clean. Victoria the front desk manager runs it with the personal touch of bed and breakfast and treats her guests w that personal touch. It’s getting harder for to find that kind of service experience these days.

title: Best stay in NYC yet!!
text: Perfect location. Amazing staff! Jodi greeted us on our late night arrival with a warm smile and friendly check in. Staff was knowledgeable and helpful with directions and recommendations. Complimentary coffee in the morning. Store and a 24 hour pizza across the street. Easy access to subway. Looking forward to another stay here for sure!

title: Hidden Oasis with INCREDIBLE food and AMAZING Hotel Staff!
text:
Wow. If you want to stay near Penn Station or Herald Square in NYC, look no further. The Kimpton Eventi is exciting without being overwhelming, trendy and fun without trying to hard. We came in for a night to enjoy L'Amico, which was ABSOLUTELY STELLAR. Our room was beautiful and had an amazing cityview. Beautiful spacious lobby with complimentary coffee and tea for co-working in the morning. 

Above all, Jen Zelouf was absolutely the sweetest and took every step to make our stay fantastic. We love everything about this hotel and hope to be back soon!

title: Chelsea Gem Amazing Staff
text:
I recently stayed at the Kimpton Eventi, located on 6th Ave. (between 29th and 30th St.) in Manhattan.  The location is outstanding. It was a few weeks before Christmas and one could feel the energy of being in the heart of the Big City.  Everything that one would want is in close proximity (including Macy's, Nordstrom Rack, Sephora KoreaTown, drugstore, wine store and countless restaurants).
Most of all, the hotel staff (from the Front Desk to the door persons) were incredibly helpful and friendly,  
Honorable mentions to Emily, Jodi and Jennifer at the Front Desk and Alex at the door. Also, Victoria Tuchinsky, Manager, was incredibly service oriented and professional.  
The room that I stayed in was spectacular, with an unparalleled view of Midtown.
Overall, what distinguishes this Hotel is the people and I would highly recommend this property if you are planning to visit NYC.  I will certainly be back.

title: Decent prorpety 20 blocks from NYU
text:
This is a decent IHG property in lower Manhattan.  It's not 5 star like the Intercontinental IHG properties we've stayed at before.  The staff here is quite good and helpful in all ways.  Service is limited due to COVID and we were okay with that.

We didn't try any of the food options here since there are so many higher rated places close by, but they were always full, so they must be good.  

It's a good 45 min walk from Rubin at NYU so taxiing to NYU is recommended.  The bellman is an expert & amazing at getting you a taxi.

The suite room we booked was perfect for us and will fit any family needing an extra bed in the living area.  The sofa bed isn't the best around but is sleep capable.

When our bill came out ~$140 more than the IHG quoted price L--a in accounting quickly resolved that.

We would stay again.  But the Hyatt Midtown is more convenient to Rubin Hall, although they don't have suites.

title: Great Location
text:
The Kimpton Hotel Eventi is a comfortable hotel in a good location of Manhattan. It's on 6th Ave, close to subway stations and not a long walk from so many great areas of the city if you're a walker. 
The rooms themselves are comfortable and well appointed. The front desk staff is friendly and efficient.

title: Great 5 night stay!
text:
We had a great 5-night stay at the Kimpton. The location is outstanding - very walkable to many sights including Broadway shows and well-connected with both subway stations and Penn Station within a very short distance. Although there was the typical big-city panhandling and regular sirens, we felt safe walking in the neighborhood both day and night.
