I had emailed ahead of time to let them know we would be arriving early. We were even earlier than planned after taking public transit from LaGuardia so we left our luggage, went for lunch and when we came back, our room was ready. 
I had booked a "Deluxe" category room which are the corner rooms. We were assigned a room on the 11th floor (#1101) and had an absolutely outstanding view of the Empire State Building and the skyline. It was a real treat to have such a great view! 
The room was very comfortable with a good-sized closet to put everything away. There was no seating other than a desk chair but the views made up for that. The bathroom is very large with lots of counter space and a huge walk-in shower. We were pleased that we were able to request daily housekeeping. After several Covid-era stays at other hotels with no housekeeping, it was a treat to come back to a fully made-up room after a busy day of sightseeing. Many compliments to the housekeeping staff!! 
I was very impressed with the ability to receive a quick response by text from the concierge. They set up our housekeeping time each day, recommended restaurants and answered questions within minutes every time. 
We always enjoy the evening wine reception when we stay at Kimptons. It's a nice chance to wind, review the day and decide on dinner. There was no information about it in the welcome letter nor did the front desk staff mention it so it was hard to know what to do as it wasn't in the lobby as other Kimptons do. The wine was available at the regular bar so it seemed awkward to ask for the complimentary wine while others were ordering expensive cocktails and snacks from the bar. The night the bar was closed, there was no wine reception which was a little disappointing. It was the same situation for the morning coffee. Instead of a carafe in the lobby for free use by guests, we had to get paper cups from the coffee bar barista and then pour our own coffee at the bar. 
We didn't utilize the hotel restaurant or bar other than for the above-mentioned services but they both seemed to have a lively atmosphere and looked inviting. We walked around the corner to Essa Bagel every morning and visited several neighborhood restaurants in the evenings. Don't miss a chance to visit Korea town! 
There was a problem with our bill on check-out but it was handled quickly, politely and in our favor by the front desk manager. Since we booked directly with Kimpton, I would have expected the "estimated charges" would have been closer than they were (around $75). This is a Kimpton problem, not a local hotel problem and it sounds like others had run into this previously. Be aware there is a $20/night "resort fee". 
We would absolutely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable stay in a great location.

title: Celine is the best!!
text: We had the warmest stay at the Kimpton, beginning with the warm and accommodating hostess, Celine. We had had a trip with lots of issues before coming to the Kimpton but after we checked in, life was great once again:) thank you for making our stay so special. It is a beautiful hotel!!❤️

title: November 2021 at the hotel Eventi-  One Bedroom "Premium" Room anything but premium
text:
This is a long review - why? Because there were so many things WRONG!!! 
I stayed here here beginning of November for two nights. I feel bad complaining since I got the room at a discounted Annual sale price. But over $800 for two nights is a big chunk of money to me and the One Bedroom "Premium" suite was definitely not premium. 
I communicated with multiple staff that this was a birthday trip for myself. NO mention of my birthday upon check in, no note in the room, nothing. 

In the room: First thing I noticed was the couch had a big rip in it (see photo) about 3 inches long. Hello Eventi!! Fix it - this is supposed to be "premium"and this is an easy fix!!!
 well now its down a few notches.....THEN I go into the bedroom, and the TV in the bedroom had all these wires hanging down from the back of it- definitely NOT PREMIUM, Hello Eventi!! FIX IT!! How hard can that be?? Really??
I tried to use the safe - BROKEN!! They send someone up to fix it. He says it can't be fixed and leaves. Seriously?????

Then I go into the bathroom. The doors and trim are supposed to be dark brown - well see the accompanying photos. I can not believe how badly the paint was chipped and PEELING off the door trim. GROSS!! and the trim near the floor was covered in crud. (I freaked out once the daylight came and I could see the crud on it) There is absolutely NO EXCUSE for this. touching up the paint is an easy fix Hello Eventi!! FIX IT

There was also marks on the door to the toilet that were drips from steam accumulated during a shower. How long has it been since that door was cleaned...maybe never??? Sorry didnt get a photo of that. 

!! getting way down there several notches BELOW "premium" My first morning I looked for the hairdryer...it was in a bag under the sink...(see photo) it was covered in dust!! I mean thick dust...obviously the area under the sink had not been cleaned in a very very long time.
The second shower head  was also broken- it would not stay up, it kept falling down . Hello Eventi FIX IT!! 
The lobby is nice  - but what good is a nice lobby?? You have to have the bedrooms up to snuff THAT'S where people are spending their time!!! This is supposed to be a luxury hotel and that was supposed to be a "Premium" room. NOT!! very disappointing. what's worse is they are easy fixes but Eventi does not seem to care.
The wifi , even for an IGH and Kimpton member was basically non existent is was so slow. I stopped using it.

Good things? I was able to text them with questions, I liked that. I am hearing impaired and the lobby acoustics are bad so texting was great for me.
Yes the ice machine is on the 5th floor with a giant scoop to get the ice in a big plastic bag they provide there but there is also hand sanitizer right by the ice machine and frankly that did not bother me at all.
They provide free coffee in the mornings, and they do still have a wine hour 5-6, which I missed both days but that's OK.
Also there was housekeeping everyday which surprised me. That was nice. I liked the location, close to Penn Station, I took the train so its a three block walk. It's also a few minutes to the Flat Iron district which I like. And its just a block from Herald Square if you are into that. There is a great Fairway Grocery store a couple blocks down...DON'T use the bogus store Sunsweet Fresh Market across the street - the cashier tried to rip me off!! and the food was awful. Fairway is much better!
So all in all - I give the actual room I stayed in 2 stars (the bed was nice but otherwise disappointing) and the hotel 3 stars. I should have spent my money at The Hotel Giraffe (AND for $100 LESS!!) . There you are guaranteed everything is always in tip top shape. I'll remember that next time.

title: Best of NYC hospitality
text:
We'd stayed 8 nights in October split into 2 stays of 4 nights with a week's hop to hawaii in between.  all staff we'd encountered from kevin and the rest in the front desk, to bartenders offering us coffee in the morning, and the housekeeping staff looking after our rooms, even to the lady who so meticulously cleans and disinfects the lobby area ever so often.  they were all professional, friendly, and so willing to ensure that we had a great stay.  

The Kimpton Eventi is a smallish hotel that has so much character because of the obviously close-knit team.  you can feel the love and camaraderie among all members of the staff, as they greet each other and go about their business of making the guests feel at home.  This translates to an almost family-like feel in the atmosphere.... something intangible and not easily replicated.
  
i wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel if you need to be walking distance of K-town, chelsea flower market, Time Square, and so much food and shopping.  The subway is a few blocks away and it also has a great italian restaurant on premise with outdoor tables street facing, great for people watching.

Our trip was the best in all our years visiting the city, and frankly we'd swore before our trip that this would be our last time staying so close to Time Square.  Now we're not so sure as Kimpton Eventi remains our only reason to be there.

Great job to all staff and i hope that you will remain the gem of Time Square.

title: No room service, unsanitary ice service
text:
First of all, the staff is extremely courteous and responsive.  And I had a high floor room that was quiet and had a nice view.

My complaint is that this hotel does not offer room service and not only that they don't offer service to bring ice to your room.  You have to travel to the 5th floor and fill up a bag (not even a bucket) of ice from a machine that is not sanitary.  While this is obviously a first-world problem, it's not acceptable for a luxury hotel.  I've been traveling during covid and never seen this.  In addition to having to go the 5th floor for ice, the ice is not a dispenser it is a machine and you have to use the same scoop that all customers use.  While it's fairly clear that covid is not transmitted by surfaces, this is still not sanitary and unacceptable.

title: Best of New York City with a Bit of KTown
text: We recently stayed at the Eventi for the second time. Once in 2018 and the most recent in October 2021, while the pandemic was still alive and well in Manhattan. I love most of the Kimpton Hotels for their service, eclectic decor and the love of dogs. I had 2 teenagers, a husband and a dog in tow. The rooms were really nicely sized, full amenities and the hotel staff checked in on us regularly. We were in NYC in July of 2021 and that was a disaster. We stayed at a former Kimpton hotel and the service was poor, the rooms not well maintained and we won't be going back anytime soon. But the Eventi has restored my confidence in trips to NYC for shopping, dining and a Broadway show. It helps that Kimpton is now part of IHG and can leverage the services of a much bigger chain. The restaurant was opened, there was still coffee and tea available in the morning and free wine at 5PM. And there was still valet service for my car. We'll be back!

title: Fantastic decor, service, location, value
text: Phenomenal service, decor, location. They offered yoga mats in the rooms, and they let us use two house bikes me and my teens used  to ride around the city.  Free coffee and wine at happy hour. My room had a view of the Empire State building. Jodi at the front desk was so helpful, friendly to us and called my room to make sure we were enjoying it. First class service.

title: Great hidden gem in the Tenderloin
text: Amazing checkin with Marilyn and it only got better from there. Housekeeping, security, and the evening front desk crew (Jennifer and Emily) were just as great and the finish level and amenities are top notch. This place deserves a “hidden gem” status. You’d pass right by if you weren’t looking for it. Not pretentious at all. Pretty understated in fact. Keep it up — can’t wait to come back.

title: Great Stay. Highly Recommend
text: Like any hotel, there are always a mix of positive and negative experiences. It happens. For my wife and I, we stayed 4 nights over Labor Day weekend. We were celebrating our 35th anniversary plus being the 20 year anniversary of 9/11, wanted to revisit and experience some different things. I'll be honest, the main reason I selected this hotel was because my wife asked for a soaking tub. The Kimpton has them! I'm IHG and booked with points. Check-in was early, so they stored our luggage and recommended a lunch place. All the staff were helpful and pleasant. Options for daily service, just have to tell them. Dine at their restaurant L'Amico one night - fantastic - great food and great service. Vines has free coffee in the morning and limited food option, so its just ok. You're within walking distance of Empire State building which also means bus and subway. Herald Square, Macy's is just a couple blocks away. You could walk to Times Square if you wanted. Overall - no complaints at all. It was a great experience.

title: Competitive Price for Great Room, but Service is Lacking
text:
I am not very familiar of the Kimpton brand but based on my positive stays at Kimpton Bangkok earlier this year I was interested in trying another Kimpton and I booked at Kimpton Eventi.  My stay was mixed; I liked the room but service was more in line with select service hotels, not full service.  

Suite upgrades for loyalty program elite guests at various hotel chains in NYC are not common but Kimpton surprised me at check-in with a wonderful upgrade to a suite as Spire Ambassador guest.

The suite was not huge but 500 square feet is not bad at all for NYC standards especially considering the numerous hotels with small entry level rooms who do not upgrade generously.  The bathroom was well done with marble everywhere and a spacious walk-in shower with good water pressure.  I also liked that the room had minimal use of carpet to give a clean feeling.  They also had Atelier Bloem bathroom amenities and Frette bathrobes.  

Service is where the hotel came up short in my opinion.  First of all due to covid there was no room service, however the restaurant was open so it’s not like they don’t have food, and the covid excuse would be more suitable if they suspended dinner in the restaurant instead of  room service.  It was more a matter that they didn’t want to send their staff to guest rooms.  This theme repeated itself when I needed documents to be printed.  When I stay at a limited service hotel like a Holiday Inn, I go to the business center and I do everything myself, but if I am staying at a full service hotel I do not hesitate to send a document by e-mail to front desk and ask them to bring it to my room when I am busy.  I do not recall any full service hotel ever refusing such demands so I was surprised when they told me I had to pick up my printout myself at reception.  No big deal but it does not give a feeling of a service-oriented hotel and to make matters worse, guests are charged a 20 USD amenity fee which is supposed to include business services so one more reason to feel their refusal was a bit awkward.

Unfortunately this topic did not end there.  I had the “do not disturb” light on while I was in my room on various days but housekeeping came knocking on my door at least once a day – the complete opposite attitude than their colleagues at reception: coming to my room when I did not want them to.  To make matters worse, one day there was even someone from security who came knocking on my door not long after housekeeping did and said it was because I had the DND light on the last couple of days so it was a health check.  Never mind that if they had accepted to bring my printed documents to my room they could have seen themselves that I was doing just fine, plus the fact that staff at front desk saw me alive and kicking when I picked up my documents.  So obviously they do not intend to respect DND signs and also do not communicate with front desk either. 

Overall I would say Kimpton Eventi can be a good fit or a bad fit depending on what guests value the most.  If someone wants a room and nothing else, I thought the value for the money was excellent; I stayed last month at Hyatt Herald Square for about the same price and the room was far inferior to Kimpton.  However if people expect top service from Kimpton then forget about it.  In the end what matters most is whether they deliver in line with price and they do, even if they might fall short relative to what the brand is supposed to be.

title: Gem in an ocean!
text: What an outstanding hotel from the IHG group where I take pride in being a Spire Elite guest. Great recognition by the hotel for my loyalty to IHG. Excellent rooms, room appointments, lighting, quality of the linen, and even toilet paper are far superior to that of Intercontinental Chicago! Great location and outstanding staff.

title: Opulent, Convenient, Perfect
text:
Far and away the best of four hotels we visited during a recent tour of the East Coast.

Kimpton Eventi was brilliantly located walking distance to Penn Station and to almost every subway in Manhattan. You can also walk to Times Square in about 15 minutes. 

Front desk generously upgraded us (IHG Platinum) to a stunning, comfortable, cool one-bedroom suite. Mood lighting, big marble shower, ample sofa. It felt wildly opulent but without the price. 

Complementary coffee from the baristas downstairs until 10:30am. 

I would have loved a small refrigerator or a tea setup in the room, but those are quibbles. 

10/10 would definitely stay at Kimpton Eventi again.

title: New York finest want to see you!
text:
My wife and I finally were able to plan a getaway since Covid hit and the Kimpton was our choice to call home during that time. Due to limited train arrivals, we found ourselves there quite early before checking in. On a lark, we asked if there was any chance our room was ready and to our surprise it was! Just one amazing example of the staff exceeding expectations.
Despite their reputation New Yorkers especially those in the hospitality industry can't wait to welcome tourists back to the Big Apple. Thankfully we had the pleasure of interacting with some of its finest. Marilyn, Veronica, Jodi, Celine, and Emily were delightful anytime we needed information, recommendations, and requests. I highly recommend the Kimpton Eventi to anyone looking for a highly personalized experience that's hard to beat.

title: Good but Far from Great
text:
Really 3.5 instead of four stars but giving them the benefit of the doubt.  Location is very convenient to Penn Station. Easy walk to/from trains to EWR and JFK. Also convenient for subway connections. Checked in in the middle of the night. Sometimes this is a dicey proposition since computers run updates, etc. I was checked in promptly and given a corner room after I explained that I did not want a connecting room. I also informed the agent that I had two back to back reservations. One was a Chase credit card free night and the other was a points stay. I assumed they’d put them together but that was not the case as I found out at the end of the stay.  

Room was good. Marble appointments in the bathroom, good climate control and large windows on two sides of the room. Desk for working and nice sized closet. Empty minibar which was fine by me. Those things are more trouble than they’re worth. The curtains were not blackout but at least the hallway outside the room was quiet during my stay. 

Wine hour was a disappointment. Figured they’d use the bar area but that was not the case. Had to ask a front desk agent for a tiny plastic cup of red or white. They couldn’t even manage to serve it in a real wine glass.  Would not have returned to the hotel at 5 PM had I known.  

On the last night of my stay I returned around midnight and discovered that my key didn’t work. No big whoop. I asked for a rekey at the front desk. They asked for another swipe of a credit card and then presented a new key. Took the elevator up and discovered the key still didn’t work.  Sheepishly returned to the front desk and found out they had double locked the room since they thought I was trying to steal a night.  Had to wait for an unmasked security guard to ultimately grant admittance to the room. Thanks a lot Kimpton.

Finally, Platinum status in the IHG rewards program amounts to jack squat. Had to plead for a 1 PM checkout and there were no other benefits besides a small point bonus at check in.

title: Beautiful Room, Seamless Checkin
text: Booked the Kimpton Eventi last minute and couldn’t be more pleased. Rooms are very spacious for New York and the the bathrooms have a beautiful marble throughout. The guest services associate assigned us a city view room that overlooked the Empire State Building. From the cleanliness to the sexy feel of the rooms, I will return!

title: Penn station work trip
text:
Great room size for nyc.  Modern and new finishes still.  Well located to penn station - one of the nicest non super luxury ($500) options available. Nice modern bathrooms.

Solid restaurants on lobby level however not open due to pandemic I’m assuming.

title: 5* service amazing staff
text: 5* service in the middle of the night.. thank you Wenye for going above and beyond! Being jetlagged and awake in the night is never fun but you did an amazing job of taking care of me so my stay felt personal and cared for. Hugely appreciated.

title: Go Elsewhere
text: Don't book here, it is absolutely not worth the money. I paid $365 for one night to stay in a worn out, outdated, basic room with absolutely nothing tipping on the line of luxury. This is a far cry from a Kimpton property. For starters, the carpet is so gross in the room, bunched up and rippled and a very easy way to trip. The bathroom was ok, towels were crunchy at best and very limited items like soap and shampoo. Our tablet didn't work which is how you use the TV, contact the desk etc. The bed, THE BED is horrible. Nothing more than what you would get at a Motel 6. We were not allowed access to the outdoor veranda where supposedly there is a large screen area. Only place to go outside was in the street or the front of the building. For $365 you would expect at least a bottle of water available to you in the room. Plan to go to the desk and request this where they will give you a tiny bottle of warm water. They do give you coffee in the morning, but absolutely nothing else without paying for it. Not a muffin, not a banana, not a yogurt. And to think we are charged a $20 resort fee (amenity fee for local and long distance calling as well as the gym use). Staff were generally nice but in no way did they provide excellent customer service. The hotel is dark and just didn't feel fresh or inviting outside of the lobby area. I have no doubt for less money you can find a much nicer, more updated and not so work hotel for you to enjoy your stay.

title: Independence Day 2021
text: This hotel is absolutely amazing, let me tell you why. The first starts with the front Lines. Derek who is a bellman/valet Took care of my car while it was parked in the underground garage and help me unload it and load it back, Jen was wonderful when booking my first time experience here at this hotel and set me up with the suite for my accommodations due to the fact that I am partially handicap, Kevin who is the front desk attendant made sure all my needs and questions were answered when I always kept coming down to the front desk to ask specific questions about the surrounding area for things to Do during my stay, And last but not least Jodi who made sure that the staff was taking care of me like I was a King, I couldn’t ask for a better stay in New York City at a beautiful hotel with an awesome view of the city as well. I will be back and I hope the staff will help me again just like they did this time for July 4th Weekend 2021. #oneofthegreatHotels

title: Great stay
text: Great service. Comfortable modern room with great view, 2 restaurants (did not eat there). Good location for shopping, theaters and transportation ( near MSG). Coffee in the morning at the bar. One bit of unusually good service. I picked up my stored suitcase and asked if the restaurant was open. I thought I’d charge my phone  while having a glass of wine. The front desk said the restaurants were not open now (Monday 4 PM). The bell captain asked what wine I liked, brought me a Cabernet on the house and showed me where chargers are, that made my day.

title: Nice hotel, but $20 per day for a resort fee?
text: The rooms are quite good, and the staff are nice. It's NY, so it's pricey and the rooms are a bit small.  My only complaint. And it's not a major issue, is that upon checking out, they charged us a $20 per day "resort fee."  Do they have a spa, beach or pool that I somehow missed? The lady checking us out appologized and told me that they get quite a few complaints about this fee. Perhaps management should re-think this idea?  Or, at least call the fee something else, like... "a cleaning fee" or, we'd like to increase our profits fee?

title: Solid Hotel Stay; Great Location
text: Been to NYC several times now and this was probably the best overall experience we've had in all the hotels we've stayed at. The location was great, the service was fantastic, and the room was a good size (by NYC standards).  The cute brunette working the front desk, I didn't catch her name (idk is that even politically correct to say anymore? but oh well I'll say it anyway ) was particularly helpful in giving restaurant and activity tips around the hotel.  The ONLY kinda complaint I might have is no daily room service due to Covid, but I think that's pretty much the norm right now in NYC and most cities.  I'll definitely be staying here my next time back to NYC.

title: Loved this Hotel & Staff
text: We stayed here twice to and from a vacation to break up our drive. We had our puppy with us and both times Marilyn at the desk was so helpful and great to us ensuring we got in our room as fast as possible. The staff went our of their way to help us with anything needed and the service felt special. It was a great feeling to be back in NYC and this hotel made our visit perfect.

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text:
We stayed here just a few weeks after the hotel reopened.  Kimpton has the best pet policy (no fees and no number or breed restrictions), and we chose this hotel because we were bringing our two dogs to New York for the first time.  It's worth noting the pet policy because when you bring dogs, this is literally something you talk with other people about in the elevator!  Everyone staying here with their dogs knows its the best place to stay.

Aside from the pets, this would still be a great place to stay in New York.  I don't think we quite saw all the hotel typically has to offer, as there were some restrictions/changes still in place at the tail end of the pandemic, but they were doing a great job under challenging circumstances.  The food options in the hotel are a bit more limited than they otherwise would be, but you've got a million options within walking distance, so you'll be fine.  The room was spacious and comfortable, more so than many other New York hotels we've stayed in previously.  It's a great location to stay in especially if you're coming in on the train, only a few blocks from Penn Station.

title: Highly recommend staying here for your New York visit!
text: I lived in New York for 14 years and moved to the west coast during Covid. I had to come back for a work trip and had no idea where to stay! I have never stayed in a hotel in the city since I always had an apartment. I booked and cancelled 3 other hotels after reading the reviews and finally settled on the Kimpton Hotel Eventi and I'm so glad I did! The location is perfect. Restaurants and bars within walking distance, close to different trains but most importantly the room was spacious and VERY clean. The view was gorgeous and the bed was extremely comfortable. With a lot of NY hotels, they can be small and cramped but my room was fantastic. The bathroom was large and modern and clean. The bed was very comfortable and I had room to move around and even a desk to work at. The staff at the front desk were beyond kind and accommodating and the free coffee in the morning was actually great. The room was quiet and I didn't hear any noise from the street at all. I will be traveling to NY a lot for work and I will absolutely stay here again.

title: Nice stay considering the hotel just re-opened
text: My best friend and I stayed the weekend Eventi re-opened and we had a wonderful time! The location is perfect, the staff welcoming and the restaurant was delicious! Given that the hotel opened only a few days prior to our arrival, we were happy that most of the amenities were available. All of the staff members were terrific, however, Victoria and Jennifer at the front desk were fantastic! They helped us with restaurant suggestions, directions and general questions. Each time we returned to the hotel they greeted us warmly and asked how our day was going. Their genuine interest in how we were enjoying the city made our stay even better. We look forward to returning when all of the amenities are available.

title: Wonderful stay!!!
text: My husband and I had an amazing experience at Eventi. We were greeted by such warmth and welcoming attitudes. It was a special trip for us and they made it even more lovely. We’d like to thank Jennifer and Victoria for their kindness and being so helpful with any of our accommodations and needs. We love Kimpton hotels and always try and stay at one during our travels. Eventi is one of our favorites and we will always be back!

title: Rude check-in experience
text: I tried to check in, having prepaid my stay, after having dropped my credit card on the way from the train to the hotel. I had spent half an hour in the rain looking for the misplaced card. Management was unwilling to waive the card swipe for incidentals to allow me to check in, instead cancelling my stay and sending me out into the rainy evening. The manager emphasised that the hotel didn’t accept cash, but actually the right thing to do would have been just to waive the incidental hold. What’s worse is that I was treated rather rudely through the experience and definitely without any visible compassion, which seems to line up with other guest complaints here about snobbiness. Another hotel next door was able to let me check in by working with me on the problem politely and eventually asking me if I could show a photo of the card to match with my ID.

title: A great spot in Chelsea
text: I liked the location and features of the hotel.  My room was very nice and well appointed, with large floor to ceiling windows and black out drapes.  The fitness center was also a plus.  However, the staff were truly outstanding and accommodative.  Jennifer and Diane on the front desk are the best!  Superb professionalism, courtesy and helpfulness.  I can hardly wait to return.

title: Not ready to reopen
text: Be warned. The hotel only reopened 5/18 and they are not at any quality or level worthy of the Kimpton brand. The facilities were essentially abandoned since March 2020 with no maintenance or cleaning. The rooms (we had to move, the 1st one was so bad I refused to unpack) were actually dirty. Splashes and stains on the walls. Actual debris that you could (& I had to because housekeeping works limited hours so they had no one on site at the time) SCRAPE off the wall. The rooms were poorly maintained pre-covid because the furniture looks beaten up and that has nothing to do with being closed for over a year. But the filth is gross.  I scrubbed down the walls of the 2nd room (which by the way had trash still in the trash can), the last few photos show what those towels looked like after.

title: 10th Wedding Anniversay
text:
My wife and I travelled to New York for our 10th wedding anniversary back in July 2019, We had the most amazing time, seeing the usual sites of New York, spending the day in Central Park on Independence Day, getting lunch form Whole Foods Market nearby.
The stay at Kimpton Hotel Eventi was superb, the staff were helpful, the restaurant L'Amico was fantastic, the breakfasts at The Vine was delicious every morning. I would recommend staying at this hotel to whoever wants to travel to NYC and no doubt we will back again very soon!

The photos are the view from our room of the top half of the Empire State day and night and the view from there looking down at the hotel itself.

title: Another City, Another Kimpton
text:
We typically frequent Kimpton hotels when we travel with our dogs— they have a great pet friendly policy and are super sweet to our pups. Due to so many Kimpton (IHG) stays, we are also climbing the ranks in status. 

I booked the Suite during the annual Kimpton sale and it was a great price for a suite in NYC. I called in advance to secure a fridge and microwave for the room— they have mini fridges but no microwaves :( I also let reception know we were staying during my husband’s birthday (they could also see this on his IHG profile) and they said they would have something nice in the room upon arrival. Imagine my disappointment when we opened the door to nothing :( :( meh . 

The suite was spacious for the pups with floor to ceiling window views of the city. The infamous happy hour wasn’t the best I’ve experienced at a Kimpton— only wine and the same type each night (Chardonnay and Merlot) meh. There was also no door person and the valet was not easy to find— seemed like there was only 1 person working valet? 

If you have pets, there’s not much grass around but our dogs loved the concrete “park” right behind the hotel. There are trees with mulch and lots of space to walk around instead of navigating the busy sidewalks.

title: Home is a Hotel
text:
There's a corner in Manhattan where Chelsea meets the flower district and the streets smell like a garden. Along its 6th Avenue line lies a hotel, which is home to the city's most prized lobby.

Equal parts luxe and seduction the lighting, leather and lure of Hotel Eventi's lobby emits a secret scent of magnetism. And though aesthetics and aroma may be what draws some in, it's the staff that keeps them there.

Hotel Eventi is my favorite hotel in all of New York City – and I once stayed in 41 of the city's best boutique hotels in eight months for an article. 

There is only one I call home.

As a creature of comfort, Eventi is an easy choice for any, but that's not what makes it home. Eventi is home because it's familial. A quality derived solely from the people who work there -- 

Johnny Lluberes. 
A man of authentic charm and character, who is as efficient as he is humble, helpful and exceedingly awesome.

Victoria Tuchinsky
I introduced her to my mother. An introduction I do rarely. 
But one-half minute spent with Victoria and one needn't wonder why. Class is difficult to describe but you know it when you meet it.

Francois Etienne.
My recent and first ever interaction with Francois was over the phone.
Wit and service are two qualities hard achieved on their own, and almost never appearing together. Harder still is emitting not one but both over the phone.

Pauline Stanisz.
There is a grace that few possess, and even fewer can display while in the service of others. Pauline is one of the very few. She is as lovely as she is smart. 

Megan Smith made my day with a simple sentence. A talent one cannot help but applaud and admire.

Malek Hasan I had never met, and within 30 seconds of doing so, had me smiling all the way to my room.

But before we even walk through Eventi's door, Captain Kirk Bibby with a graciousness and ease all his own, welcomes my fiancé and me with real and genuine welcome. Every time.

(to name just a few among many others.)

title: Convenient location
text:
I stayed here with my spouse for my birthday trip. The hotel restaurant, The Vine, was good with excellent customer service (given complimentary sparkling wine and waiter suggested food based on his experience). The atmosphere of the hotel in general was quiet and cozy (dim lighting, no crowds in the lobby areas). Upon check in we were upgraded to a higher floor room (22nd floor, corner room 2201) which had great views of the Empire State Building and city below. The room was functional, not very big despite the good views. 
The room temperature did not match the a/c readout; it got very cold at night and the blankets on the bed are not heavy or comfortable. I would suggest bringing your own blanket (BYOB). The room was clean overall, but a few hairs were left in the shower from the last guest presumably. The 'Do Not Disturb' button is a cool feature as opposed to using a door hanger. 
The wine hour was good as it usually is with Kimpton, and I did not visit the gym. 
The location was within walking distance to everything I came to do: Times Square, NYPL, Morgan Library and Museum, Bryant Park, Empire State Building, several food spots. 
I would choose this hotel again for a NYC stay.

title: 3 weeks on business
text: Stayed here for 20 nights on business, room was clean and very comfortable. Hotel restaurants and bar get very busy so book early to avoid disappointment. Very conveniently located for Penn Station and plenty of other shops and restaurants.

title: Unfriendly welcome to hotel
text: I like this hotel but the receptionists are not nice and unwelcoming - find this every time I stay. Other staff are good but the receptionists always desperately bad here which is disappointing for an otherwise good hotel.

title: Super
text:
Chambres plutôt spacieuses pour New York, excellente situation, très bon petit déjeuner buffet ou à la carte pris au restaurant Eventi de l'hôtel décoré avec charme, bar sympa au rez-de-chaussée un peu bondé et bruyant le soir (le week-end sans doute en particulier), room service efficace commandé sur une tablette (le choix n'est pas immense mais c'est bon, venant du resto: salades, burger, club sandwich, calamars, frites…)
Un excellent spot pour New York.

title: Perfect location, pet friendly, hotel, Kimpton Hotel Eventi  YES!
text: We  made reservations for two rooms, a king suite and double queen connected.  however upon arrival, this was not the case, and told the rooms are not configured that way. Our King suite was clean, not too small, with  a sliding door dividing the two rooms of the suite the bedroom with King bed and the sitting area with sleeper sofa. The bathroom was the biggest room with a great rain shower and soaking tub.  Two nice sinks with plenty of counter space , plus we all liked the feature of another door to the toilet. The beds even the sofa bed were very comfortable with  great pillows and sheets!  The Hotel is easy walk to Madison Square Garden. Say Hi to Derek , Trevor  the door men, hard working guys! From the hotel we also walked to the High Line, a renovated elevated subway line, converted to a walking path! Awesome walk among the buildings but above the traffic! Take a walk along High Line  from 31street south and it leads to The Vessel  another walking stairway that is several stories tall and not for the faint of heart with fear of heights!   Lots to see and always plenty to do in NYC . The Kimpton does it right and they allow pets!  We always enjoy a visit, but love to come home to vermont vacation dash rentals  dot com is our  home!

title: A Nice Stay and a Good Value
text:
From some of the mixed reviews here I was bracing myself for disappointment, but I was pleasantly surprised during our recent stay at the Hotel Eventi.  

First, I paid about $330 a night for three nights in an executive one bedroom.  This room has a small, separate living room with a sofa bed perfect for sleeping two kids, but not big enough for an adult couple.  I thought this was a good deal, for a well-located hotel in midtown Manhattan.  There were some similar deals at other hotels available, but I think this one offered the most convenient location for bopping around manhattan.  

The room is not big, but it was comfortable.  This hotel is the tallest building within a couple of blocks, so I think a majority of the rooms would enjoy good views as we did.  While not big, the room functioned very well.  There is a long hallway from the front entrance into the living room.  This was a good place to put the kids luggage on a luggage rack.  It would be more helpful if this hallway had some hanging hooks installed where you could hang coats, bathrobes, etc.  There was a sofa bed, chair, desk, desk chair, mini-fridge, large tv and floor lamp in the living room.  There was also a large window framing rooftop views of Manhattan.  We were on the 19th floor.  

The bedroom featured a queen-sized bed, two night stands each with one drawer, a small closet with a safe and iron/ironing board, and another large tv.   The bathroom was large with a big shower area, large sink vanity and separate toilet area.  There was also a Japanese-style bench in the shower.  

The room could probably use a refurbishing as things were pretty nicked-up and getting rundown.  The closet was also way too small and there were not enough drawers to be able to put your clothes away if you don’t want to live out of a suitcase.  Also, because the closet was so small, and the bed sat on a platform, there was nowhere to store empty luggage.  There was also no way to make coffee or tea in the room.  Really ubiquitous oversights that many hipster hotels unfortunately suffer from.  

I was also not impressed with the check-in experience.  First, there’s no signage outside the hotel regarding valet parking or where to pull up.  Your only option is to double-park and run into the lobby to let someone know you need a valet.  Also the gentleman who checked us in could not have been less friendly.  He never looked up from his screen or made any effort to be welcoming as he checked us in.  Not a great start.  

Also as soon as I got to the room, I got like 4 or 5 of the same text welcoming me to the hotel and asking if I needed anything.  Technology is great, but if you can’t get it right it can simply become an another annoyance...

Aside from the fairly minor complaints above, I was actually pretty happy with our stay.  We never waited in a long line while there, which in NYC is rare.  The room overall functioned very well for the four of us, and best of all featured great views of the city.  The bed linens and towels were all of good quality and seemed clean and newish.  The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows.  The ac/heat system did a good job of keeping the room comfortable and the industrial-strength, double-paned windows did a good job of insulating us from the city’s soundtrack.  

Our housekeeper - Li Li - was excellent and was very observant of and attentive to our needs.  

We enjoyed a very nice dinner at L’Amica off the lobby, and got a quickly delivered and plentiful room-service breakfast one morning.  We used the in-room tablet to order the breakfast which seemed to work well.  

I think valet parking at $50 a night is a good deal.  Most garages in the area wanted $70 a night for parking - so much easier to just let the hotel take care of it all...

I’m not a fan of hip hotels.  I tend to like the older, classic, larger hotels.  With that said, I was very happy at Hotel Eventi.  I think we got a nice room, in a convenient location, with great views, and a generally nice staff for a very reasonable price for NYC.

title: Thank you, Megan - Concierge!
text: Megan, the Concierge, went above and beyond to ensure my group had an amazing stay. She was patient, pleasant, very helpful and very easy to interact with. Thank you, Megan, for making the trip a great one!!

title: Great Stay!
text: The hotel location was great close to everything we wanted to see/do. The staff was very helpful in helping us with directions to our restaurant and to our concert venue. The room was clean and comfortable. Highly recommend.

title: Great job Team Eventi
text: We love the location of the Eventi Hotel and the people who work at the hotel.  Meeting planners dream team awaits!  The meeting space has been refreshed - great restaurants, great rooms and banquet.  And most important, great service.

title: SO KIND & PROFESSIONAL
text: The team here are so lovely, they went out of their way to make our stay the most special it could be. I was overseas so had to communicate by email and then replied to quickly . I highly recommend this to anyone who wants excellent customer service!!

title: Lovely location and staff
text:
The location of the hotel is fantastic, short walk to the Empire state building, Macy's and Times Square with equally good metro access. The staff are also really lovely and happy to help with any queries. We didn't eat in the restaurant or cafe / coffee bar however it was always busy and the food looked great.

The one minor (and I stress minor) let down was the state of repair of parts of the hotel. This could be seen in our room where there was a lot of writing from builders work over the walls and a few scuffed and scratch items but was most evident for the lifts which seemed to be perpetually broken with only one working. Being on then 16th floor this wasn't ideal for us although luckily we were able to walk down if needed. I can imagine it was more of a pain for other guests though.

Overall I'm sure the lifts issue has been fixed by now and in any case it shouldn't deter from this cool city hotel and it's great location.

title: Original & great atmosphere
text: I was really impressed with the atmosphere of this hotel. So relaxed yet friendly and professional at reception, a buzzing bar and restaurants and great views from the two corner rooms we booked on a high floor. The rooms and communal areas were very modern and comfortable and a great location to base yourself for sightseeing.

title: Another great visit to the Hotel Eventi
text: This is the best hotel with an ideal location, amazing restaurants and first class service.  If you find you are in need of anything they will do their best to get it for you.  You truly feel like VIP when you enter their doors.  Everyone from the bellmen, front desk staff and housekeeping greet you pleasantly when you stay at this hotel.  Great energy as well as being pet friendly.

title: Muy buena experiencia
text: El hotel tiene una ubicación formidable, el equipo que te atiende en el hotel es muy amable y servicial. Las habitaciones cuentan con un adecuado espacio, con un mobiliario moderno y funcional y de buen gusto. Cómo cereza en el pastel sus dos restaurantes cuentan con un variado menú y buen sazón.

title: Kimpton Hotel Monaco Hotel Portland
text:
I wanted to say the service at this hotel is phenomenal. Valets Eric and Andrew were very professional (well worth the price). Scott at the front desk spent a ton of time helping me. He even set up birthday dinner reservations for myself and my wife. Rooms are great! nice and clean.

Phenominal staff and service...Thank you!

title: AMAZING EXPERIENCE
text:
We had the best time in NY and much due to the lovely staff of the hotel and the great room. Megan (the concierge) has even decorated the room as a surprise for my husband birthday.
Will definitely come back!

title: Great location, cool hotel
text: We stayed here for a weekend for a gymnastics meet and hotel was great location to Penn Station and to meet. Very cool vibe, great onsite dining, nightly wine cocktail hour, and in-room tech amenities all merit great review. One big negative - shower - water pressure for all three of our showers was so poor. Not sure if it was our room, but it would make me question staying here again.

title: Excellent location and great vibe !
text: This hotel is located in the heart of manhattan! Kimpton is a great trendy hotel, we had an amazing stay from the time we checked in. Checked in by an enthusiastic host, who explained the hotel facilities and also the wine hour in the even and other services as well. The hotel lobby was really buzzing, they have a fantastic italian restaurant and a fabulous bar! In new york you hardly would stay in the hotel, but one could easily do that here instead of venturing out. The room was moderately big,clean and great size bathroom. The bed too was comfortable. I used the gym too which was great, overall it was a great stay ! Kudos to the team I am definitely coming back.

title: No bad apples here in the Big Apple
text:
Wow!!
Mrs.Electric and myself are lucky enough to have been around. And Mrs. Electric knew that I had a certain birthday coming up so she became very busy behind my back and booked some flights. And so ( to my intense surprise ! ) I found that we were going to spend my special birthday in New York for 8 nights. We flew out on 24th December and flew back to Blighty on the evening of 01/01/2020, arriving rather reluctantly at London Heathrow at around 07.25 a.m.
We both researched where to stay in New York very carefully. We have been in bed ( so to speak!) with the IHG brand since , I think, 1991 and I am currently a Spire Elite Ambassador, without the attitude that some seem to adopt when they get there. Indeed, I refer to myself as being a 'Spire Elite Ambassador Thingy Whatsit Whatever'. Because life is too short to take this sort of thing seriously!! And also it gives the management and staff a clue that they can joke with us. 
Kimpton became part of IHG approximately 3 years ago. And of all the IHG properties in New York, our Intuition kept us returning to look at the Kimpton Eventi. And so we hit those buttons and booked 8 nights here. 
...and we absolutely 100% ADORED it!!! It was the darker colours of the lobby area that enticed us here initially. Neither of us are particularly formal. We love our music and arty things and casual is the way that we feel most comfortable. 
And this hotel can adapt to casual or formal at the drop of a hat. They do it all!
We were greeted on checking in by Malek who was informative, welcoming and immaculately presented. We looked around as he did his thing and it was like coming home.Everything was so...comfortable. We were escorted to our room by a great guy named Kirk , who also brought our suitcases to the room. We got along so well, it was like we had known him for ages.And we hope that the things we spoke of get sorted. This was, in actual fact, a preview of how great the rest of the staff were going to be. We had a corner room and we had a view of the Empire State Building out of the side window. Incredible! 
The Room.... we loved our room too. If you want a gleaming neon lit vibrating bed in an over the top 21st century monstrosity of a room, then you will not find it here. What you WILL find is a good relaxing room in calm colours. There is also a tablet ( No, not medicinal ones, I have plenty of those, sadly!) next to your bed where you can order food etc. There ARE a few signs of wear and tear and so there should be. It IS a hotel room after all!! The shower was a big walk in job and even I managed to put away my heavy rock persona and showered every day. It was nice!!
Breakfast is available at extra cost. We sampled it one morning and it was fine. It didn't wow us, to be honest, but the breakfast room was quite full each morning. We are not really breakfast people. So usually we opted for complimentary coffee in the lobby area every morning which is served with a variety of types of milk. There is also hot chocolate and squirty cream. My doctor would kill me if he saw what I did to my body each morning...lol. And that gorgeous half and half milk? To a guy who has to have skimmed milk here in the U.K., it tasted like Christmas, birthday, and New Year rolled into one. Oh, hang on...it was....haha.
Location of the Hotel is superb. It is also pet friendly so you get the chance to meet other animal lovers and their pets too. Excellent.The on site restaurants are The Vine, and L'Amico. L' Amico was our choice for New Years Eve and the food was superb.
Wine. You will have to suspend belief on this , but every day between 17.00 and 18.00 complimentary wine is served. Yup. You read that correctly!!! It isn't always served in the same location within the hotel and I note that other reviewers found this to be a problem. We thought that it was great fun!! It's nice quality too. If wine is not your thing, there is a lovely alternative which is a sort of warm cider with a shot of bourbon.Or water if you respect your livers more than we do...haha.( in actual fact i only drink on holiday or at concerts).

The manager and staff. Collectively and individually superb. These are the ones who looked after us so wonderfully.....Malek of course on reception. Kerry, our room attendant (lovely!) Tatiana, who although she didn't service our room personally, has to be one of THE funniest Russian ladies I have ever met, Amanda ( manager of rooms), Anastasia at breakfast ( more edible than even the food!), Ana ( general cleaning duties. A lovely lady),Jeannie( room servicer). On reception , and in no particular order...Diane, Jennifer, who became more and more funny as the stay progressed.( I still want her hair!!!), Paulina( those wonderful nails and rings...), Jennifer ( South Korea),, Celine and Mary Lyn, and the wonderful Dallin who served wine a couple of times. Rafaela, Stephenson, The two managers who hosted the wine session on New Years Eve were also fantastic.
And finally...Kevin from concierge. What a remarkable man. Mrs.Electric and I shared so many conversations with this Gentleman. An incredible man. Talented too.
Without these wonderful people the Eventi would be just a building. Everyone who works here is instrumental in bringing the hotel to life every day. 
And New York? Adorable. It was only our second time here ( the first being in March 1993 when I was younger, healthier and slimmer, and the whole world was a different place....). People had told  me that New York isn't a friendly place. 

RUBBISH. We found everyone to be very warm and friendly and funny too. I think that you reap what you sow. If you walk around with a spindle in a personal place, then that is how you will be treated. We loved our time here and we loved the Eventi. Take a chance with people. Plant a little humour seed when you engage with them. And you will be astonished at the humour tree that will grow before your very eyes. Will we return to the Kimpton Eventi? YES. Of course we will. Because there are no bad apples here either. Be nice to the staff. Their job is brutally hard. And why not join the IHG rewards club while you are at it! Well done!!

title: Construction
text:
First morning, 
Awoke to hammering from construction in rooms.
Called front desk first morning.
They said what hammering....
Talked to desk manager, he said he would check in to it. Did not hear back.
Came back in afternoon to smell of paint/glue.
Had to open windows in 30 temps to air out rooms.
Mini fridges warm, called, said they don’t work anyway and are unplugged.
    Dirty hand towel.
Bathroom light not working.
Would have left but wife and daughter didn’t want to repack.
Groundhog Day next morning.
Hammering first thing in morning.
Kevin desk manager said would check into it...
Said manager in meeting and would call,
never did.....
Kevin said would give us $100 credit.
I would give them $100 for a little peace and quiet.
Awoke 2nd morning to no heat in either room.
   “Breaker Off”.  But Brrrr in a 28 degree morning.

title: Stay somewhere else
text:
My room literally had no heat in the middle of winter. I wasn’t able to be moved to another room unless I downgraded so I bared it until the next day when I was moved to a “suite”. Literally the smallest bedroom I’ve ever been in. It was super noisy and bright from outdoor lights. I called to say I wasn’t happy and wanted my previous room type and was told I couldn’t move until the next day (when I was checking out) so I just sucked it up. 

Fast forward to 2 am  and I couldn’t sleep. I called the manager and pleaded to be moved to a different room and they refused. Finally she allowed me to move to my no heat old room as long as I’d be out I time for the hvac workers to come in the morning. Like really?! 

I actually got engaged at this hotel and now I think it’s one of the worst stays in a hotel I’ve ever had. Never been contacted about it as well.

title: Pretty Good
text:
The Eventi is a nice hotel, location in good - nice to be just away from the hustle and bustle of Time Sq, but near enough to it if you want it.  Reception / lobby is nice but quite small and gets quite busy. We were there from Christmas Day and I was disappointed there were no Christmas lights or decorations at all in the lobby! 
The room was nice - we got an upgrade for being Spire Elite. We were given false information from reception about being about to use our Raid the Bar vouchers (for being aspire) in the restaurant. To be fair, the honoured them in the end but they should train their staff better. 
The daily wine hour kept moving - three different locations, none of which were very cosy - unless you like drinking wine in an over-lit lift lobby. 
The room was an upgrade, which was nice. It was a good size but nothing special - as others have said, not much better than a holiday inn.  The hotel is still using tiny  single use shower gel bottles - this is pretty poor. 
Overall, I would stay again but the hotel has no wow factor once you get beyond the lobby.

title: Nice Long Weekend
text: We spent a long weekend at the Kimpton Hotel Eventi.  This is a nice hotel that is in a good location for exploring NYC.  All the hotel staff that we encountered were pleasant and helpful.  The rooms were a decent size for NYC and the Kimpton extras (coffee, WiFi, WINE, upgrade) are always appreciated.  I'd stay again without hesitation.  Also, big props to the fact that this property doesn't charge an "amenity fee" or a "resort fee".

title: The rooms vs lobby
text:
The location is OK.
The lobby and public areas are cool and look like recently renovated, but the rooms are VERY BASIC and feel a bit like a Holiday Inn... except for the mind-blowing views!
The staff at the front desk and the bellboys were not particularly welcoming and seemed to busy or tired to care much about the hotel guests or to assist them.
This could be a really good hotel if the room finishings were improved and especially if the customer service improves.

title: Short but sweet weekend
text:
We stayed here for my daughters birthday weekend. I booked a 1 BR suite so she and her friend could have their own space. The room was clean and nice, and housekeeping made the sofabed for us. We were given a room on a high floor, and the view was wonderful. When you check in, they ask if you'd like to reserve a car service back to the airport---I highly recommend you take them up on the offer. It costs only slightly more than an uber but you get a nice clean SUV, a professional driver and they show up on time. 

Restaurant options were very good. L'Amico gets packed during brunch, but you can give the hostess your name and # and they'll text you when your table is ready. The Vine is a also great option.

Location is great! It's a 10 minute walk to Penn Station. It took us 15 minutes to walk to our broadway show. On the way back we had a delicious late-night dinner in Koreatown.

Room rate was reasonable. 

I would stay here again, whether for business or personal.

title: Definitely Not 5 Stars
text:
I travel between NYC and Boston frequently.  This was my first stay at this property and brand.  I probably won’t be back.  I choose to stay at the Kimpton Hotel Event based on reviews and its 5 star rating.  This hotel is very average 4 star hotel at best.  There are better 4 stars hotels in NYC

Overall:  Average quality hotel and rooms with inattentive staff

The good:  
- Room was clean.  
- Hotel is conveniently located for midtown.

The bad: 

- Plumbing is an issue.  The pipes bang when hot water is requested for a shower.  The banging or knocking is loud enough that you can hear it happening in other bathrooms besides your own.  Bathroom sinks drain slowly, so you have to turn off water and wait for the accumulated water to drain. 

- Basic amenities missing such as a coffee maker or shower cap.  You can request a coffee maker and will get one if you are lucky.  I think there is 1 coffee maker for every 4-5 rooms or fewer.

- Poor communication and service considerations.  I requested a coffee maker and was told that one would be brought right up.  It never arrived, so I went to the nearby Starbucks.  When I returned, I addressed it with the front desk and was again told that they would bring it right up…. they never brought a coffee maker nor did they ever follow up to let me know that they didn’t have any coffee makers.  I eventually went the the director of housekeeping, who is curt, rude, and clearly inexperienced with customer service.  She told me that they were out of coffee machines.  Also, they don’t carry shower caps… so plan ahead if you or your significant other needs one for any reason.

-  Door men are missing…. the bell hops stand around and do not open doors for arriving/departing guests with bags.

THE UGLY:  
- The elevators were out of order.  The hotel has 3 small/medium sized elevators in the lobby, which every guest must use to get to their room.  Almost every day of our stay there was a problem with the elevators.  The wait for an elevator was particularly painful when large groups of people were checking in or checking out of the hotel.

title: Excellent boutique in midtown
text: This lovely Kimpton is typical of the brand. Great service, generous extras, and clean updated rooms. I love Kimptons generally, and not all are created equal (BTW, the best one I’ve been to is in Portland), and this one is very solid. Nice lobby, friendly staff, and comfortable rooms. Free coffee in the mornings. Decent workout facility. Two Peletons, a bunch of cardio machines, a rack of dumbbells and one weight machine. I’m a CrossFit cultist and found enough in the gym to keep me occupied for two days. Location is good for attractions but not food. Midtown is tough to find a meal in and we went to the West Village for the best food. I’d stay here again, but I think I prefer Kimpton’s Ink 48 in Hell’s Kitchen by a nose.

title: New Home Away From Home!
text:
I had researched hotels in NYC for 6 months before making booking Kimpton Eventi My husband was unhappy that our yearly business meeting that we always  attend was permanently moved from Boston to Manhattan and he didn't think he would like NY. Well, turns out I made the right choice because my husband loved the hotel from the minute we arrived and he's not easy to please as we are used to staying in 5 Star resorts whenever we travel, so his expectations are hard to meet, to put it mildly.  

To add to this, my mother also booked the hotel and had arrived before us. She is elderly and the staff at the hotel restaurant doted on her like she was the only guest in the building.  She was waited on hand and foot and brought 3 different kinds of gelato after lunch which she adored. During her entire stay, the hotel staff went above and beyond to make her feel welcome, comfortable and cared for. 

As for myself and my husband, we were put on a high floor in a suite and a bottle of champagne arrived from management because they discovered that we were there on business and to celebrate our 25th Anniversary. But even without the thoughtfulness of sending up champagne, the staff at this hotel are genuine and friendly and seem happy to be there.  The doorman is genuinely kind and helpful, the front desk staff is upbeat and friendly, the my mother said room service was flawless. And we loved the location - right in the middle of everything!

As for the rooms, the white marble bathrooms are huge which is very rare in NYC - plenty of space to place cosmetics, hairspray etc. and having the toilet in a separate closet is appreciated. The floor to ceiling windows throughout are a great feature and one of the main reasons I chose to book this hotel along with the location which is within walking distance to just about everything. Some have criticized the scraped up wood flooring in the rooms, however, I believe this was an error made when the interior designer suggested bamboo flooring which is upscale and expensive but sadly does not hold up well with wear and tear.  I would suggest that when the hotel decides to replace the flooring, they use a sturdy synthetic wood that can withstand dings from suitcases and heavy traffic. Anyway, the scratches on the wood flooring really didn't pain us and if we were going to nit pick I'd say a coffee maker in the room would be welcome but really, we absolutely loved our suite. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet at night, so we got a good nights sleep each night. 

In closing, I cannot say enough about the hotel. We loved out stay. Thank you Kimpton Eventi for our new home away from home!!! We will be back in May!

title: Very good. The hotel itself is wonderful;
text:
This was our second visit to this property and we were very pleased. We were checked into the hotel by Megan, who was very pleasant and efficient.  We were assigned room 1815; it was a 1BR suite.  The suite was very nice and contained all the usual amenities, including a single person jacuzzi tub. The bed was comfortable, and with the amount of space we had, it was hard to remember that we were in the middle of the city.  
Jennifer, a manager, left fruit and water in our room while we were at the wine hour, which was also very nice.  However, the constant changing of floors each evening had guests confused.  Only there one night, we had no problem, but others were complaining in the elevators.
Housekeeping, however, could be improved.  They failed to supply hand towels and even after being told we could have a 2pm checkout, they came knocking at 12:05pm, while we were getting ready. Communication should be improved when it comes to late checkouts. Had the housekeeper made it into the room, she'd have found naked people in the midst of getting dressed!  
Aside from the housekeeping concerns I have, the hotel met our expectations and I will surely be back soon!

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: The staff took great care to make sure our stay was exceptional.  I would highly recommend this hotel.  Anyone that normally stays in the Omni or Marriott would appreciate the level of service.  Just might not be large enough for some groups.

title: Not our best Eventi experience
text:
If you, like I, sneer at the many “reviews” online that serve as little more than litanies of consumers’ complaiints, then read no further. This — whatever it is — is not for you.

It is said that good hotels and good restaurants prefer that any complaints be aired in real time on the spot rather than allowing them to fester into scathing critiques on Yelp or Trip Advisor. And it it precisely because my respect for this consideration that I share the following.

For several years now, my wife and I have stayed at the Eventi every time we we have come to New York. It’s a pretty good hotel within easy walking distance of Penn Station. I’ve given them favorable reviews in the past. Let this one serve as a codicil. Overall, though none of our stays has been perfect, we’ve always been pleased enough to return and probably will again.

On this particular occasion, a three night stay in December of 2019, we arrived just before 4:00 PM on a Friday only to be told that, in spite of a posted check-in time of 3:00, our room was not ready. This had occurred on our previous stay at the Eventi, at which time we were offered drink vouchers to soothe any potential friction. We accepted and minutes later our room was ready. This time, we were not going to be bought off so easily. Remembering the unreadiness of the room of the previous visit, we had taken a later train secure in the belief that, of course, our room would be ready by 4:00. As we had uptown commitments at 4:30 we had to postpone, we were not happy campers. The room took a seemingly interminable 15-20 minutes to ready. The clerk handed over the keys with apologies and the happy news that for our troubles, we had been upgraded! Upon arrival, the room appeared to be exactly the one bedroom executive suite we had booked and paid for. Any upgrade was not in evidence. I called down to the desk clerk, who by now had clearly branded me as trouble, and passed the call on to Jennifer, the on-duty manager, who assured me that, yes, the room WAS an upgrade as it had a view of the Empire State Building and a Jacuzzi. Well, even though neither is a perk I would have willingly paid extra for, if that is the Eventi’s idea of a PREMIUM one bedroom executive suite, so be it. Except for one — no two, things. The room —604, for the record — had neither a view of the Empire State Building nor a Jacuzzi. 

It was time to talk to a manager face to face. To minimize any potential disruption, I went down to the lobby the next morning at 6:00 where I voiced my concern to François, the manager on duty. I made it clear that my concern was that I had been told I had been given an upgrade when I clearly had not. In fact, I had been brushed off with a clear untruth. François suggested that he would talk to his colleagues to see what they could do. I returned to my room after suggesting that ANY gesture would be appreciated as acknowledgement of the late check-in compounded by a blatant, if perhaps unintended, falsehood. 

Fast forward to 9:00 AM Monday. We checked out, awaiting any sign that even the slightest note of our unresolved concerns had been taken. 

Crickets. 

We once spent an awful weekend at a resort on the  eastern shore of Maryland. I wasn’t going to say a thing until the checkout clerk asked me about my stay. I answered her honestly, paid the bill and left. Two days later I got an email from the manager who was upset that the clerk had not brought me directly to him so he could address my complaints. At the end of the month, there appeared on my credit card statement an entirely unsolicited refund of every penny we had spent on our stay. Now that’s extreme and WAY beyond any expectation. We’re home now after a nice weekend in NYC. We managed to adjust our schedule to accommodate the very late check-in, but I’ve gotta tell ya, being told we had been upgraded when I hadn’t still sticks in my craw. But not as much as the utter failure to make up for it.

As I said at the outset, the Eventi is a pretty good hotel, one that’s very convenient for us. I’ll probably simmer down and on the occasion of our next visit to NYC book a room at the Eventi. But I’ll call from the train to make sure the room is ready. This stay has shattered any misguided sense of loyalty I had to this hotel, but in spite of this, I’m more than likely to give in grudgingly to the convenience of an Eventi stay, if with lowered expectations.

title: A room with a view
text:
Stayed at the Eventi for a few nights as part of holiday. As it was my birthday, my partner emailed the hotel and negotiated a corner room with a great view of the Empire State Building.

The hotel is in a great location, the soundproofing is more effective than most and the air conditioning worked well. Comfortable bed and nicely styled room which was smaller than usual for the US, but this is common in NY. Nice food and bar options on ground floor which are popular with locals. In room service etc is not cheap, but lots of shops in the area. 

This was the second time we had stayed at the hotel, and it is starting to show a bit of wear. Where they hold the wine hour inside lacks atmosphere compared to other Kimpton Hotels. Great newly renovated meetings rooms, although we were kicked out of one even though booking was not for hours which felt a little unnecessary (not a lot of space in room to work). Found service very friendly, but slightly pedestrian in delivery.

title: Big disappointment!
text:
I just returned from our annual girls weekend in New York. I travel to NY often, and have stayed at many hotels in the area. Every holiday season we take a girls trip to the city.We enjoy eating, drinking ,walking and shopping! We always reserve a suite so that we have a separate area to sit and visit.
   I was excited about the Eventi, as I have stayed in other Kimpton hotels and enjoyed them.
Unfortunately I cannot recommend nor would I stay at this property again.
  Pros- the staff was very kind. They have a free evening wine hour ,although it’s on the third floor,in a weird area.It was not a comfy warm space . We got a glass and took it to our room as there was really no sitting area.
  Cons- check in was a nightmare. We arrived at 11am, dropped off our luggage and went on our merry way. We arrived back at 4:45 and were greeted by a 30 minute wait to see if our room was ready. No excuse for this kind of line. The couple in front of us were very upset as their room was still not ready at 4:45. Our room was a suite- room 804. The furniture was very nicked up, and the suite could use a good cleaning. It’s time for a room renovation!! The couch was very worn and the pull out mattress was horribly uncomfortable!
   The bathroom was nice, but had wrapped plastic cups!! Seriously this is not a motel 6!! Toiletries in tiny plastic bottles. Large dispensers of high end toiletries and real glasses in the bathroom would provide a better experience and would be better for the environment.
   The restaurant has a 28 dollar breakfast buffet, which did not look very appealing, so went around the corner to Brown Bagels( great)!! The hotel does offer free coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby every morning which was a nice touch.
  After you check in you will get a text checking to see if everything is ok. I did not respond. The next morning I received another text asking me to rate the hotel and it stated “ tell us how you really feel, we want to know”. At this point I did text them my concerns. I got a text back that basically said- sorry for the check in issues, we were really busy”. Do not ask for my opinion ( twice), unless you are going to take the time to address my issues!!!
  We love staying in the Nomad area, easy to get uptown or downtown! From my past experiences, I believe there are much nicer Nomad hotels available at the same price point.
   Cheers and happy travels!!

title: Très bien situé + très bon service
text:
L'hôtel est extrêmement bien situé sur la 6ème Avenue, proche de tout. Le style mêle mélange de moderne et de style new-yorkais, et c'est très appréciable ! Le service est le grand point fort de l'hotel : depuis la chambre vous pouvez commander plein de plats diffrents (payant), mais également commander via une tablette tous les accessoires dont vous avez besoin (rasoirs, brosse à dents, dentifrice, machine à cafe et capsules, bouilloire, coupe-ongle etc.). Le personnel est tres agreable et au petit soin.
La chambre est tres spaciuse (King Room) et la vue aux etages elevees est juste fabuleuse ! Nous etions au 21eme etage avec mon homme (sur 23). 
Je souhaite particulirement remercier Jennifer Zelouf et Marylin Joseph pour avoir pris en compte nos demandes concernant la chambre et de nous avoir ramené des muffins et une coupe de champagne à l'occasion de l'anniversaire de mon compagnon ! Vous avez fait de notre voyage un moment exceptionnel ! Et encore une fois, la chambre en corner au 21eme est juste magnifique !!!!
Gros + : la literie !!!
N'hesitez pas.

title: It’s been a week and management still has not responded
text:
Upon check in I got a text asking me to rate my satisfaction. A couple of times after failing to get a phone call through to housekeeping right after checking in, I texted back and the minor issues (request for robe, chair removed, and extra towels) were handled. 
After check out I sent the following text and to this day, no response. So I am posting it here:
1). Notification of a failed NY City legionnaires inspection was given only a few days prior to my visit (too late to switch accommodations to a different hotel or Airbnb). I grew up with “water insecurity” so any potential water issues screw with my head (I get a little PTSD). I called ahead of time with many questions and was reassured. I asked if bottled water was being provided to all guests and was told no, which is odd since other hotels (in New York, Vegas, Dubai, Bahamas, Austin, etc) will supply guests with free bottled water in fitness rooms, at hotel front counters, at pools, etc.
2). First room I was given had multiple carpet tripping hazard issues (needed stretching), and an extremely strong air freshener smell (couldn’t even breathe). I asked to switch & also requested higher room- agreed to pay $50 more per night for view but when I got to the second room, the only difference was no gagging smell. Carpets still had multiple tripping hazards and desperately in need of stretching, unsightly leather chair had areas of the polyurethane finish worn off, wooden shower chair was a biohazard, and there was hair on bathroom floor. 
Rolls in the carpet are a serious tripping hazard for guests and I’m shocked this is being ignored. It’s also unsightly. But after seeing the same problems in both rooms, I could only surmise all rooms are like this and I didn’t ask again to switch. 
3). I did immediately ask for the heavy large white leather chair (with scratched up wood finishing and peeling off polyurethane) to be removed since it was unsightly, blocked my view, and took up too much space. It looked like something your found by the curb that someone else was trying to throw away and I am surprised no one is noticing how distressed & unsightly the chair is.
4). Having a wood stool in the bathroom is extremely unsanitary. I had to hide it behind the curtains so I didn’t have to look at for 4 days. The wood shower stool had polyurethane peeling off, wood rot on the legs, and was discolored from water staining. There’s no way to sanitize something like this between guests. And, just like the other chair, it looked like something picked up from a discarded furniture pile on the street.
4). The flooring in your fitness center is also a major tripping hazard. It needs to be corrected immediately. You also need to replace the dirty yoga mats, provide free bottled water, and have an attendant full time wiping down equipment after each use OR provide wipes and a sign to remind guests to wipe off. Staph happens all the time in fitness rooms and it’s usually a requirement to wipe off after each guest’s use. The fitness room is a serious biohazard and tripping hazard.
5). This was the final straw: the water completely shut off while I was in the shower covered in soap. I was likely the first person to notify staff, but the first person I spoke with was rude (wanted to send someone to my room, she didn’t like that I said it was inconvenient since I was naked, wet, covered in soap- she snarkily replied to me ‘can’t you put on a robe?, I replied, ‘how about I wait until you get more complaints since in my opinion this appears to be a system wide problem’). The manager follow up was better: Francois called back shortly to tell me technicians were allowed in another guests room to check and they subsequently discovered it was system wide: a water pump. I was offered $50 deduction on bill which I accepted. 
Considering my inconvenience when the water shut off on me (wet w soap, made me late for a 4:00, had to dry off getting ready w/ soap on me, have a rash now from where the soap was still on my skin), the late notification of legionnaires, the failure to provide free bottled water during this time, the tripping hazard carpets, distressed chairs, the fitness room problems, the snarky comment and rude demeanor when I initially notified someone, (especially since my room didn’t come with a robe, AND the robe I had requested the first day was in my dirty laundry pile), are all issues that make me feel like I did not get the value I normally get at other hotels.
