These problems lead me to believe not only is there a systemic problem with maintenance and training, but since the hotel is not investing in upkeep or staff training, that the hotel cares more profits than anything else. Otherwise they would be spending the money required to maintain basic standards and be more willing to comp guests things like free nights or free bottled water. 
There’s a lot of hotels in NY to choose from. For the price I paid, I absolutely did not get the value I deserved. 
This Kimpton hotel needs to pay the money to supply free bottled water during this legionnaires water problem, free water to people who LOST water (even after the legionnaires thing gets resolved), get rid of the disgusting furniture and biohazard shower chairs, pay for carpet stretching, pay to get the fitness room flooring properly secured, provide free bottled water in fitness room, install sanitary equipment wipes in fitness room with a sign (maybe it’s there and I didn’t see it- in which case they need to install more), and instruct staff to be more sensitive when guests are in peril. 
Management needs to offer more than $50 credit when a guest gets as inconvenienced as I was- I spent the remainder of my stay afraid to use any water for brushing teeth or drinking. 
The follow up inconvenience subsequent to my water shutting off are as follows: 
1). I didn’t want to pay the $10 for each minibar water bottle so hauled myself across the street to get water at the minimart to cover the remainder of my stay, 
2). A painful rash,
3). I looked like crap for my 4:00 date, 
4). The time I spent standing around, on the phone talking, hauling water, (my time is valuable) and the money it cost for me to buy & haul bottled water, the inconveniences, easily negated the $50 credit. 
5). The childhood water insecurity PTSD mentioned above was super triggered when the water shut off, when the fitness room had no water, and when free bottled water was not provided.
6). For something like water shutting off while covered in soap, I should have been comped the last night.
The fact that easy and simple solutions (offer free bottled water, stretch carpets, repair fitness floors, install wipes, discard old furniture, train staff, offer better comps to distressed guests) have not been implemented, makes me wonder about all Kimpton hotels being in distress and unwilling to spend $ on basic upkeep. 
After this, I don’t don’t think I will ever be staying at a Kimpton property ever again.

title: Love this hotel!
text: Location is perfect. Close to times square but far enough to be out of the caos. Great atmosphere at night to lounge or eat. Especially if you are not into clubs or bars. Enough to keep it lively but not too much that you get a headache. Got upgraded to a room on a corner so we had windows on two sides - small on one side but gave alot of light. Clean and in order considering all the people passing through. Very close to flatiron and union square. Not far from Chelsea market. Subway stations super close by.

title: Good location
text: It is a solid choice. Service was fine and the hotel is nice, but nothing super special. The location is great an you can walk everywhere from the Hotel. The restaurant was very good and the service was excellent..

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
Our visit to Kimpton was for a fun 4 day trip to the city for 3 friends.  When we first arrived, we were greeted by a fun and upscale ambiance in the lobby and the staff was very very friendly and had us checked quickly and efficiently.  

We had a room with 2 queen beds.  I felt like the rooms were large compared to other hotel rooms in the city. We all three had plenty of room for luggage and storage.  I have no complaints at all.  

Definitely check out The Vine Bar and Restaurant.  This place is so great to come in and have a drink after a long day of touring the city.  Ask for Keira and Mimi!! They were such a pleasure to talk to and they will take good care of you

Check out was easy and they even provide you with car service to the airport ($65) no need to take a taxi or an Uber.

title: Not bad, but nothing to write home about
text: Stayed at this hotel for one night. The room was small, but comfortable. Had everything I needed and was quiet, and a great view of the Empire State Building. The price is high, but you’re paying for location. My biggest issue with this hotel was an unexpected charge when I got my credit card bill of $18.51. I called the hotel, and they said it was for two beers taken from the mini bar. They were very good about believing me when I said I didn’t have anything from the mini bar, and said they’d refund the amount to the card. However, I wonder how many guests would not bother to call, or would think that the charge was legitimate. This is the kind of error that should not happen.

title: Excellent choice
text: Location worked well.Easy walking distance to Penn Station.   Front desk helpful and nice.  Room perfect for price.  Suggest asking for higher floors. Had a good view of the city.  clean and well maintained.

title: Fine choice for NYC
text:
Chose this hotel as we were arriving via Amtrack to Penn Station which is a few blocks away. Overall a nice hotel in a very convenient location with 3 subway lines close by and also within walking distance to Times Square.

Now on to the downside, (1) the lifts at this hotel are terrible: one of the the call buttons on our floor does not work and one lift vibrates heavily before it reaches ground level. (2) The holder for the hand-shower in our room is loose and would not lock which points to poor housekeeping as the issue should have been resolved prior to check-in. (3) There is a bicycle lane next to the pavement and one has to be extra careful getting in and out of cars to avoid being knocked over by cyclists.

If (1) and (2) can be resolved I may have a better opinion of this hotel.

title: SHOULD BE A LAW TO DISCLOSE
text:
Our travel agent booked a room here at our request for Nov. 14-17 NYC trip. When I arrived early, the front desk suggested lunch at one of the two restaurants at hotel. Nasty hostess at L'amico told me it would be a 45 minute wait even though there were 4-5 tables open right in front of me. I tried the other restaurant The Vine, with another snobby hostess and several empty tables and got the same response. Almost if eating alone..you are not welcome or seated even when you say you are a guest at the hotel. This set the tone for our one night stay! Upon checking in at 3 pm; no one disclosed any health issues at their hotel. I arrive in room and disvover on the desk a 2 page letter from hotel and NYC Health Department that Kimpton Eventi Hotel
had 2 separate customers contract LEGIONAIRES DISEASE in late October!!
They claim water has tested safe and guilty shower heads have all been changed..but NYC Health says DO NOT SHOWER, breathe mist..baths only!!

There should be a law requiring health disclosures at time of booking and certainly at time of check in! 
Their offer of 2 bottles of free water and "Don't worry all is safe" were not enough to keep us there more than one night.. along with construction street noise plus the worn out furniture and false claims about 500 sq ft suite!

This hotel is certainly not worth the health risk nor the price for suite!

title: Excellent Service
text: Our check-in was EXCELLENT, especially with concierge Jennifer -- she was fast, thorough, informative & friendly. Restaurants & bar service friendly, efficient & helpful beverage & dish selections. A tad noisy so conversations may be difficult in a larger group in the bar. We were given a corner room on the 22nd floor (total 23 stories tall) with grand view. We'd love to come back during the spring or summer to enjoy the outdoor dining. Safe was broken, but the repair was done with polite alacrity.

title: Mixed Messages for Us
text:
We stayed at this great hotel for three nights, there were some very positive points and some area's for improvement. Starting with the down side:  

We only ate here twice, as we were put of by the additional costs, of 18% gratuity and tax oF 8.5%. I fail to understand why I should expect to pay $18 gratuity on a $100 bottle of wine? Does the sever do something diferent to buying a $30 bottle? We had the buffet breakfast, which was $28. Unfortunately, we aked if it was possible to have eggs, sunnyside up, instead of scrambled. The answer was yes, but then we were charged $22, obviously a "golden chicken" laid these eggs. So having been, I think, overcharged for four eggs, at $5.5 each, so in proper money £4.40 per egg. Average free range egg, 28p, so a mark up of 1500%. I was asked if I wanted to include a tip, but declined as I didn't feel that £82 for breakfast was good value or money. The rest of the breakfast was top draw though and I would have been happy to tip the sever the $10 or 18%. So I hope the sever got his $10 rom the hotel??

In the evening I had Calamari for two, which was "massive" and I couldn't finish it all. The bar staff were very attentive and the service was very good. The reception staff were fabulous and certainly made you feel most welcome and appreciated. 

It was my wife's birthday while we were there and they surpriced us with cake and fizz. The room we had was comortable, clean and well appointed,
The other little touches included a glass or two of wine between 5 and 6pm in a quiet annex on the 5th floor and coffee to take out in the mornings. 

Overall we enjoyed our stay and would seriously consider staying again. I appreciate that in the US tips are expected. However, my view is that expensive food and wine, should be served with high levels of service from staff, and tips on top must be earned through exceptional service, not just standard service. It is the customers prerogative to tip generously or not, as they reflect on the experience they have had.

title: Valued Customer Not Feeling Valued
text:
The Kimpton Eventi (Kimton Brand) has always been a preferred choice of stay for myself and husband. We have always valued the boutique/history of the IHG chains and have been regular guests at the Eventi which is a  beautiful hotel with wonderful amenities in the heart of NYC.

I have never posted on Tripadvisor - however over the past week I have been trying to modify my 2019 holiday reservation and the hotel has not cooperated to modify my 4 night vacation to 3 nights without a large financial penalty. I then tried to cancel my reservation which is over 6 weeks away and I am still being required to pay a large penalty. I am  disappointed that the hotel does not do more for its valued guests and try and make accomodations when warranted especially to those guests who have been loyal to the brand.

I will be looking at other hotel brands at future stays in NYC and in the US.

title: Good hotel
text:
This hotel is pretty good. The location is good. The staff at the front desk when I checked in was fine. The tablet system they have in the room is pretty good. You can request whatever you need on the tablet. They deliver within 5-10 minute which was excellent. But, I think they have housekeeping issues. Their room attendants need to do a better job to clean the room. There are many places covered with dust. I didn’t feel like to touch any glasses bc they look dirty. There were men’s hair in the amenity box. They replaced a bar soap which used only a couple of times. That was so waisted. But, they need to bother to change a lotion bottle for new guests. When I opened the bottle for first time, it was obvious that the lotion was used before. I requested new and they brought up quickly. 
I stayed in room 2103. The view was great. But I still heard traffic noise from the street down (6th ave). I think this is the same wherever you stay in Manhattan. There was strange noise coming from ceiling at night for both days I stayed there. It started around midnight and continued throughout the night. It repeats every 10-15 min. That kept me up. It sounds like someone was using a plunger in the toilet. But I didn’t hear the noise during daytime. 
They don’t have a coffee maker but you can request and they deliver pretty quickly. But, coffee is pretty bad. The complimentary coffee in the lobby is much better. It’s better to go down to get a couple of cups of coffee in the morning. There is no shower cap but again you can request. 
I didn’t get to use, but they have wine hour from 5 to 6pm every evening. I wish I experienced that. 
Overall, this hotel is a great value for the price I paid $236+tax a night. But, I would avoid room 2103 for the strange noise. The room size is normally small - hotel rooms are small in Manhattan. This was my first time staying in Kimpton and I am glad I did. I always thought Kimpton is a great brand and my experience confirmed they are. Will I stay here again? Yes as long as the price is reasonable.

title: Such a great place to stay
text: The reviews are accurate, this is a great hotel to stay in when you are in NYC.  The location is great - on 6th Ave, close to many locations you'll want to visit (Empire State Bldg, 5th Avenue, Bryant Park etc...). The hotel itself is beautiful - rooms are great, floor to ceiling windows and if you are lucky to get a room with view, you'll be able to see the Empire State Building. We were here celebrating an anniversary and we found a bottle of champagne waiting for us when we arrived in our room. Hotel staff are all fantastic - very accommodating, friendly, and just great to chat with.  Have stayed in a lot of boutique hotels in NYC and this is just amazing.

title: Good but nothing extraordinary
text:
We stayed two nights after a cruise arriving from Bayonne NJ. I had e-mailed using the pro-forma on their website twice to ask some questions but never got a response to both questions. There is no e-mail address on their website.

We were very early for check in but the bellman looked after our luggage until the room was ready. I was advised by front desk we were first on the wait list for our room and would receive a text. It never came. We did some sightseeing and got back about 3pm to be told yes the room is ready!

Our room was on the 19th floor and facing the Empire State building. Unfortunately it was also facing 6th Ave and was very noisy from the NYFD sirens and car hooting for a lot of the day and night. Why don’t NYC hotels use double glazing to sound proof? In addition there is construction work going on right opposite the hotel so the noise from that started about 6.45 am on both mornings. The room was a fair size.

We ate one evening meal in the L’Amico restuarant which was okay but nothing special. However it does seem to be popular. The other evening meal and both breakfasts were in The Vine which were again okay. We took the buffet breakfasts. The first buffet was cold and we had to wait for bacon to be cooked a but the second one was hot

As is usual with Kimpton, there are no coffee machines in the room unless you ask for one (which we did). Coffee in reception usually disappears by about 10am. If you get a coffee from the bar you are charged for it!

All the staff were friendly but it is probably not a hotel we would rush back to. There are better Kimpton hotels.

title: Perfect For Our Needs
text:
The Kimpton Eventi was the perfect hotel for our needs. We had a fantastic stay at the La Peer in Beverly Hills, so decided to give NYC a try. 
I am a bit claustrophobic so I do not like to take elevators. I emailed prior booking to ask if there were stairs Id be permitted to take. I got a response before our trip saying that it would be no problem, that a staff member would just show me where they were upon my arrival.  When our room was ready, a staff member showed me to the stairwell (behind a staff door) and told me I was free to use at any time. This was so helpful as it eased my mind. Also, the staff took it upon themselves to book us on a lower floor so I wouldn't have to climb an outrageous number of stairs. I really appreciated that!
The hotel is a >10 minute walk from Penn Station. The room was a good size for NYC. It had a king sized bed with floor to ceiling windows. We had plenty of room to move around and open a large suitcase. The room also had plenty of outlets and mirrors. The rain shower was amazing, I was impressed! 
We stayed for two nights, but were only able to partake in the complimentary happy hour on our first night. Wine was served from 5-6p on the terrace on the 5th floor. It is November, so a large tarp was covering the terrace with heat lamps. Plenty of seating. I suggest taking advantage of this. 
One other perk that I really enjoyed were the Peloton bikes in the fitness center. I was so excited to be able to give one a try.

title: Nice place, close to landmarks and stores
text:
I stayed at the Kimptom Hotel for just two days, so there are many services I probably never availed of. But overall, I found the stay very comfortable. I got checked in quickly (thanks Kevin), the room was wonderful, reliable internet and even with an iron and a press board.
I didn't try much of the food--was quite unwell during my stay--even though it looked really good. 
I even noticed somebody enter with their pet and was told that Kimpton is pet friendly. That's great.

Another thing I liked was that it is close to landmarks like the Empire State Building, if you plan to get on a hop-on-hop-off bus tour. 
There is a convenience store down the road and a food store bang opposite the hotel, across the road, where you can get full buffet meals, freshly-cut fruit, milk cartons, cereal, sweets and all. Best thing is it is open 24 hours and there is place to sit and eat your meals in peace.

Once again, if the Kimpton Eventi staff is reading this... Thanks for a peaceful stay and please convey my regards to Kevin... All the way from Bombay. 🙏🏾✌🏾🤙🏽

title: Great location, amenities, rooms...with a few minor glitches
text:
The Kimpton Eventi is trying hard to be a great hotel, and it's close. The location in midtown/lower Chelsea is perfect. You basically can walk everywhere. The best shopping, good restaurants and theatre district are very close. Both the village and central park are 20-30 minute walks. The rooms in the Kimpton are well-furnished and large for NYC. They don't have a coffee pot in the room (bad), but will bring one up on request (better). They also will loan you things like phone chargers, irons, nail clippers, shaving cream, toothbrush and paste, curling irons, etc. (very thoughtful). The marble bathrooms are big and beautiful. The people are extremely helpful. (Celine at the front desk is a real charmer). If you need something--like making up the sofa bed or more hangers--they'll be up in a jiffy.
The negatives are minor annoyances--the "crave" ipad in the room on the night table is lit at night, so you either have to turn it face down, which disconnects the power and make setting an alarm impossible, or move it to another plug. Also, for some reason, hangers and towels (perhaps the two most requested items in hotels) are not on the request list. Sometimes the phone takes awhile to be answered. They provide a car service from the airport, but it's very expensive. And it can be hard to get your room cleaned. If you don't want to be disturbed when they come (usually at 9am), they leave a note under your door and you have to call to schedule another time. Sometimes they don't come back. Lastly, the chair at the desk in the bedroom can't be pushed back, because the carpet under the bed is too long and the chair can't roll back over it.
Having said all that, we loved the hotel, and the negatives are all very minor and can be easily fixed. We'll definitely return and hope that we can go up to 5 stars next time.

title: Medical/Scientific Cardiac Advisory Panel
text: This stand-out boutique hotel has it all--fun, comfort, class and great service. The physicians would come again in a heart-beat. Great vibe, energetic and yet still quiet where it needs to be. Perfect location.

title: Disappointing for a Kimpton
text: If this was any hotel it would be fine, but as a Kimpton loyalist (who's spent far too much time traveling for work) this one is disappointing to say the least. One of the robes had makeup all over it, the bathroom has a stool in it, which is covered in mold. I had to clean out the shower after I made the mistake of moving the the stool. The TV barely works and isn't worth bothering with, internet is pretty slow so I can't stream. I was put on hold by the front desk asking about internet and the line just disconnected. Also the elevators are very slow and the button you press your key card into falls off when tapped. I've barely seen anyone at the door (which is pretty standard at these hotels) and seems understaffed. Location is mid town, so good if thats what you are looking for. I think this is a heavily trafficked property that needs a good refresh.  Like I said, for a hotel it's fine, even nice, but as a Kimpton I expect way more.

title: Super gelegenes Stadthotel
text: Das Kimpton hat uns ein Doppelzimmer im 23. Stock bereitgestellt. Eine super Aussicht war garantiert. Unser Bett war Spitze. Eher hart als weich konnten wir uns sehr gut erholen. Das Bad war ebenfalls sehr groß wenngleich ein wenig mehr Ablagefläche hilfreich gewesen wäre. TV wartet mit HBO und ESPN Programm auf. Die beiden ins Hotel integrierten Restaurants sind lecker wenn auch teuer. Das GYM ist groß und bieten Laufbänder, Spinningräder sowie Kurzhanteln und Kettlebells. Die Lage ist wirklich top. Alle großen Sehenswürdigkeiten sind einfach und schnell fußläufig erreichbar. Die nächsten U-Bahn Haltestellen sind ca. 2 Minuten entfernt. Wir kommen wieder!

title: Perfect location, great amenities and lovely rooms
text:
The Eventi Kimpton is a great hotel on Manhattan. The location in midtown and 6th Avenue is perfect for exploring NYC. Macy’s is around the corner and plenty of good restaurants in a short walking distance. The rooms are well decorated and looking clean and modern. All service staff is friendly, professional and helpful. The breakfast is very good and the lobby is very inviting. 

All in all very recommendable

title: Great stay.  Great location.
text:
I stayed a few nights while on a business trip and was pleasantly surprised. The room size was larger than some in the city and the amenities and staff made this place a great stay. 

In the room you don’t have a coffee pot and coffee/tea is available in the lobby. I was so excited to see they would bring you a coffee pot on request. Huge win. 

The hotel was also within walking distance to a lot of great restaurants and sight seeing attractions. I’ll come again!

title: Mid 30s couple expecting child - great hospitality, brand & location, trendy. Kimpton Eventi (NY) & Everly (LA)
text:
We booked to stay in at The Everly in LA as well as Kimpton NY from 5th Oct to 15 Oct to celebrate our delayed honeymoon (now baby-moon). We are familiar with IHG hotels opting to stay at the Intercontinental when we can.  On one of the days (day 6) I was feeling very tired and unwell and utilise the room service for breakfast as well as dinner on the same night. I was disappointed that initially when I ordered room service for dinner at 9:30pm, the wait time was scheduled for half an hour (this would be 10pm) however after calling the front desk at 10:22pm realised my order did not come through at all.. The lady at the front desk went to find out what happened and apologise many times about the order. She asked if I still require dinner, a rush order would be put through. At this point I was quite distressed I was on my own, didn’t feel I could go out, I was feeling unwell all day (which is why room service was called for breakfast the same morning), I went to sleep whilst my husband went to meet his friend in the city - all I wanted was food and as I was pregnant And needed to eat immediately. I received a call 10 min after my call advising that the dessert special was no longer available. the lady must have heard me crying (quite emotional at this point. I was in a city 1000 miles from home, couldn’t explore it as my body was exhausted, my husband wasn’t here and I was hungry). Did I have hormones running through my body perhaps but I just wanted food and I requested it through the iPad which I think is a brilliant idea and it didn’t work and so instead of waiting half an hour for food the food actually came out at about 1040 which was an hour and 10 minutes after I ordered. Jeff the food and beverage manager at the Eventi called right after the front desk lady calls again and apologise. He also asked if there was something he could do to make my night better.He also wanted to call back in half an hour to see if I was Ok. As I just wanted to be left alone I said thanks but no thanks and all I wanted was water. 

When the food arrived it was two people at the door- one who dropped the food tray and Jeff with a large jug of water and two glasses. Jeff also explained that perhaps there was a glitch in the system when guests ordered the steak. I am ok with mistakes but only if it is followed up with a genuine apology, reason and a fix that satisfies my concern. Both genuinely apologies in person and said the meal was complimentary.

I work in HR back home in Australia that is my profession. I am also a former travel agent. The level of service that I received after something didn’t work out, was what I expected. Without the modcons of having a kettle in the room, I would expect to fully utilise the food in the kitchen and mini bars. I have been privy to eat and stay in very fine hotels and Kimptom hotels is definitely up there. The food in Eventi far exceeds the taste and selection at the Everly. However the Everly surprised us with A bottle of sparkling, chocolate’s, a cookie and note of well wishes to celebrate our honeymoon. Both are different and trendy in their own ways. The front desk people at both hotels were also very friendly so positive feedback must also be given to them. Please upgrade your telephone service so that all Kimpton hotels can dial international numbers or at least text them so if a guests can check in earlier a text would be sent to their international mobile and that would be an advantage. 

Would I stay at Kimptom Hotels again?  absolutely and would spread my feedback where I can. What came out of an order not being placed came a story that I have recounted to you, service that was rectified and recommendations to our family, friends and other future travellers.

title: Great hotel
text: Due to circumstances had to pick  this  hotel  at the last minute but so glad we did.     We were on the  22nd floor  room  11 , on entering the room as we arrived in darkness, we were greeted with a magnificent  view of the Empire  State  building all lit up through a ceiling to floor wall to wall window. Very  comfortable  bed, spacious enough room and a gd size bathroom  with nice toiletries  which were supplied daily. The rooms were kept scrupulously  clean by  Kerry, she was very nice and efficient.  Rest of the staff that we met seemed nice and helpful.    There was a free wine hour on the terrace  open to all guests daily just not enough seating. Free tea or coffee in reception  in the morning , didn't get to dine at the hotel but maybe next time. No problem leaving luggage after checkout. Overall a nice first experience of New York.   Found this out before we went joined the ihg rewards (app on play store) no cost and gives you free wifi at the hotel and other loyalty rewards.

title: My favorite New York hotel.
text:
This is probably the fourth time I have stayed at this Kimpton and I just like the place.   It is a beautiful hotel with good restaurants and comfortable, contemporary rooms.   I found the armchair stuffed into a corner of the room away from the TV a bit odd and the rooms could stand a little more than the minimalist pencil type drawings.  The views, depending on the location of the rooms, are pretty good from the 23rd floor.
     Other posters rant about getting rides to the airport via shuttles or Uber.   Unless one has a huge amount of luggage, I don't see why people bother.   It is less than a ten minute walk to Penn Station for the train to Newark Airport.   Penn Station itself wins no prizes, but the train is frequent and fast, connecting to the monorail to the airport terminals for a fraction of the cost a ride in a taxi would be.

title: Good location, close to Koreatown
text:
We decided to use our IHG free anniversary night at the Kimpton Hotel Eventi. It's not far from the subway station which made it easy to reach the hotel by foot. We were greeted prompted and asked if we needed a tour of the hotel which was a nice gesture. We also had a $15 raid the bar credit to use which is a plus even though prices are inflated.

The room we were in had two beds and were pretty big for a room in NYC. The windows were high and provided a decent view of the city. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. The bathroom had a sliding door and was pretty big. It has a stand up shower only with a rainfall showerhead.

This location is not very far from Times Square but we wanted to visit Koreatown only. It's a small portion of the street but has a good amount of places to eat and shop.

We definitely wouldn't mind coming back to stay here again in the future.

title: Ambiance
text: Boutique style and friendly staff. Catering services were top of their game.  Location and event rooms were private and nice.  Check in was quick and easy and we loved how close everything was.  Great restaurant choices and atmosphere.

title: Receptionist lied
text: I loved everything about the hotel, but after checking in the receptionist offered me a price for a ride to the airport which was 65 dollars. She told me this would be cheaper than the lyft price, but I checked the prices on my app straight away and showed her it was 45 dollars. She then said this is because they didnt include tax. Today morning i left the hotel to go to the airport and the cost was 47 dollars total. Im kind of disappointed that a hotel like kimpton would do this.

title: IHG Excellence in NYC
text:
After the nightmare staying at The Grand Hyatt we moved to the Kimpton.... had been previously for drinks but decided to stay...

Hugely good idea!!!!!

Friendly staff..caring and engaging.

Loved it ... the rooms are lovely and spacious. Couldn't fault it.

We were celebrating and they were very generous and caring... you don't find that much these days. There was a genuine want to look after guests and this stems from obviously a guest focused General Manager.

Loved it and I will make this one of my base hotels in New York moving forward ....

Make sure you stay

title: Excellent hotel close to Times Square
text: I absolutely love this hotel. Modern, clean, functional, very central and close to Times Square. Beautiful marble bathroom. It's also a 10-minute walk to Eataly Flat Iron, which I absolutely love. The bar on the ground floor is nice, and the Amico restaurant too, although the food (Italian) is not very authentic. Anyway I really loved this hotel. I will return again.

title: Nice but costly
text: Really enjoyed my two-night stay near 6th and 30th St.   Room was very quiet, beds very comfortable, room very spacious by Manhattan standards.  Bathrooms well appointed with terrific water pressure in the showers. Staff was very accommodating and offered to arrange car service.  Everything was clean and modern.  No problems whatsoever.  Very glad I was there on business though, at almost $600 per night.  Would definitely stay there again on a business trip.

title: Home away from home
text: I’ve been staying at this hotel for over 9 years since it opened and I just can’t get enough of it. Design is completely on point, rooms are so well appointed and comfortable. I’ve even copied some of its  design for my own home. Staff is the best, super friendly and they always make me feel at home. The restaurant additions are just amazing with great food and a very chill vibe. Location is perfect and easy access to the subway on 6th Ave. I’ll keep coming here anytime I’m in NYC. Thanks Eventi!

title: Great staff and Beautiful room
text: My wife and I stayed three nights at the hotel and we have nothing but positive things to say. The staff at reception were wonderful and the room they gave us was modern, clean and had views of the city. Location was central and safe. Highly recommend. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Fun spot, great location
text: We love Kimpton’s and stay at them whenever we can. We were just here for a quick trip to NYC. This is one of two or three Kimpton’s in the city, this one is in the perfect location. Great vibe with two restaurants.

title: Fab stay
text: This hotel has a lovely vibe about it. All staff friendly and efficient. Rooms have everything required a great beds! The food and drinks at the vine were fantastic. Central for shopping and exploring. I hope to return again

title: Gorgeous!
text:
We rarely stay in the city but now wouldn’t stay anyplace else!
Had an event at Second, the on-site catering hall. What a gorgeous event, space and hotel.
Excellent service, spotless, and the food is to die for!

title: Best of the NYC hotels I've stayed
text: Had a fantastic stay at the Hotel Eventi for three days this week. From the friendly and funny gentleman at the front desk who checked me in - to the daily wine hour - and the wonderfully spacious room (so rare for NYC!). Especially having stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House the weekend prior and having been disappointed with their service, food, and cleanliness of our room - the Eventi was such a fantastic stay!

title: Always a fantastic stay
text: My favorite hotel in the city- the lobby and on site restaurants are fantastic, the rooms are average NYC size, but well designed to make the most of the space. The service is really what makes the EVENTI so special. From the valet to the concierge to the manager, everyone is always working to ensure our stay is top notch.  The gym features two peleton bikes- so you can take your spin class without leaving the hotel! I stay at this hotel regardless of where my meetings in NYC take me. Its my home away from home in NYC.

title: Hôtel vieillissant
text: J'avais déjà écrit un avis sur cet hôtel il y a deux ans mais j'ai pensé que l'actualiser serait utile. On avait adoré cet hôtel, c'est pourquoi on y est retourné mais là on a trouvé que tous les meubles étaient abîmés, la moquette à changer, les serviettes de bain s'effilochent et les peignoirs ont déteint. C'est dommage pour un hôtel très bien situé.

title: Great Hotel in a Convenient Location
text: The Kimpton Hotel Eventi is a nice hotel in a very convenient location in mid-town Manhattan. You can easily walk to Central Park, Times Square, Little Italy and Penn Station is around the corner for the train. The rooms are small which isn't surprising in a city hotel. They have a lovely hosted wine hour on the terrace every evening. My only complaint is it was sometimes challenging to have ice sent to the room and the front desk didn't answer a few times I called.

title: Great Vibe
text:
The Eventi has a relatively small lobby space that connects two pretty good restaurants and the result is a great vibe in a small space.  I tried both restaurants when I stayed at the hotel. The buffet had a lot of options and the pastries are particularly good. There was also a wine hour in an outdoor space on the 5th floor.  I was traveling alone, and it was not a space which promoted mingling, which was a bit disappointing, but if you were in a group, it would have been great.
The hotel rooms are average in size for NYC and were well appointed. Great wifi and it was mostly quiet in the evenings, except for the nearby fire station and the occasional fire truck. I would stay here again.

title: Luxe and chic in flatiron
text: I checked in last night for a 3 night stay, my second time at this property, and so happy I did! I have top tier status with IHG, Marriott, and Hilton and could have chosen to stay anywhere but the Eventi is the best below the super luxe, high priced group of hotels in Manhattan. The rooms are perfect, and suites are actually well worth the upgrade. The staff is fantastic, Jennifer checked me in last night and was an absolute pro. Fitness center is on the smaller side but has literally everything I need, including a Peloton bike. Restaurants and on site la colombe are excellent. Amenities are great. Looking forward to staying here more often.

title: Excellent hotel, let down with a number of small issues
text:
When we first arrived, we absolutely loved the initial impression such a cool well designed hotel. Once in our room we had some excellent views of the empire state building and again, room was fantastic.

The issues we had were to do with the rooms cleanliness. They were resolved after we made a few calls.

I don't want the above to overshadow our stay though as we would stay here again in a heart beat. The service has been fantastic, happy hour is surprisingly generous and very very free. I love the complimentary coffee and tea in the reception area every morning from 7am. 

We have it 4 as we do expect a level of cleanliness in the rooms at the price we paid and the star level of the hotel. I'm hoping this was just an unfortunate occurance and I would recommend the hotel to others.

title: Great hotel with a great restaurant
text:
Had a fab stay at the Eventi. I stayed for 6 nights on business and had a friend stay for a couple of days too. It’s cool and trendy but comfortable and in a great part of town, which makes accessing places all over town easy. 

The staff were helpful and friendly and the restaurant adjoined to the hotel was the best meal we had during the whole stay... delicious traditional Italian. I’m still dreaming about the spaghetti pomodoro. We also had nice cocktails at the hotel bar. 

The rooms are spacious with awesome showers and super comfy beds. 

The hotel also offers free coffee in the mornings and a free wine hour for guests in the evening, which is a nice touch at The the end of the day- plus there’s a well equipped gym and roof terrace, both of which I enjoyed. 

Can’t criticise the place at all!

title: NYC holiday
text: I stayed here for 2 nights with my 16 year old daughter. Got there at 5.30 and was told about wine hour which was a bonus 😃  room was excellent no issues at all.  Found the hotel a little pricey so didn’t eat here.  Got back to the hotel on second day at 5.30 so went for wine but no sign of it. I thought it was everyday but obviously not ☹️.  Nice hotel, nice location but a little pricey x

title: Best part is wine hour
text: We enjoyed our stay at Kimpton Hotel Eventi. The interior felt new and modern and also cozy. The staff were always friendly and extraordinary serviceminded. The wine hour was a nice surprise. Don't miss that!

title: 4-night family visit
text:
Very good hotel.

Good location for tourist stuff in NY.

Room wasn’t too small - 4 of us survived with twin beds for 4 nights!

Staff were friendly and helpful - they managed to squeeze us in at their busy restaurant on the night we arrived.

Breakfast was only good, no better - but to be honest, with so many alternatives nearby that isn’t much of a problem.

I’d certainly stay there again!

title: Fantastic hotel, amazing experience
text:
I just adore this property for so many reasons! Location is excellent, staff is unfailing helpful, friendly, eager to accommodate your needs, exceptional restaurant on site, great bar, excellent room service......

We had a 500 square feet suite with a small living area, separate bedroom and a vast bath with soaking tub, separate shower area, double sinks and private toilet. Beautifully appointed and a great home away from home...

Will definitely make return visits to this excellent hotel! If you have never tried a Kimpton you are in for a treat - very service focused and each property is unique.  No cookie cutter approach with them!!!

title: Family visit adultish vibe
text:
First visit with 7 yr old to the Big Apple was an adventure that started with this hotel in the most subtle way.  “Wow what a fancy place” followed by “I need to use the bathroom.”  Interesting W.C.  with wall art/attire embroidery gone un noticed by a young mind focused on the marble all around but will make Mom or Dad chuckle.  
Staff kind and friendly.  
Easy walk from Penn Station.  Manageable walk to Times Square and Theatres.  Taxi readily available on 6th.  
Room neatly appointed but clearly showing its age with uneven carpeting and scrapes and knicks n dark furniture.  Most electrical outlets worked.  Not really a problem.  Kimpton preferences online were detailed with high room and foam pillow requests. 
Room unremarkable view,  but quiet and fun to count water towers with a kid in a brief non digital activity.  
Everything was clean and fresh.  
Good place to explore with family or couples getaway.

title: Good location, great breakfast but lacks character
text:
I enjoyed my stay in this hotel, however It does lack luxury and feels more of a business hotel. 

The location is great for a morning walk with a coffee without the craziness feel of central NYC. Good for access to Times square. 

Breakfast is delicious and I loved the look and vibe of the restaurant. 

Okay for a business trip but wouldn’t recommend for a holiday.

title: A good hotel, although not perfect
text: I stayed here for one night in late July 2019.  The room was attractive and the bed was comfortable.  I am an IHG Club platinum member so I usually get some type of room upgrade, although here that didn't seem to happen. The rooms on the other side of the building had a view of the Empire State Building, and my room was rather small. They did give me a credit to be used for the minibar in the room, but the Reese's Peanut Butter cups were six months expired, and the Snickers bar and a Heineken beer were only a week away from expiring.  They brought me fresh replacements, but shouldn't the staff check these things (especially considering that a candy bar is $5).  My allergies acted up and when I checked the air conditioning filter it was very dirty.  Maintenance came up and changed it out in 5 minutes, but again, shouldn't these things be checked by the staff so that customers don't have to report issues like this?  There is no coffee machine in the room. They do have morning coffee in the lobby, but if I have to put on all my clothes and shoes, I'm going out to Starbucks.  The hotel is attractive and in a good location, but I will stay elsewhere next time.  It's a nice place, but my expectations were too high.

title: What a view!
text: The view of the Empire State building from our room was amazing. Room on 22nd floor was comfy and spacious, would have been nice to have a coffee machine but this was only a minor thing. Lovely comfy bed and well equipped bathroom. Tried both resteraunts during out stay for breakfast, dinner and drinks- great atmosphere! Friendly and helpful staff, get walkable location to many sights. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Fantastic hotel & service
text:
This hotel was great value. The rooms were comfortable and quiet and the lobby was really comfortable and modern.
The in-house breakfast cafe / bar were really nice. The adjoining restaurant also served up amazing pizzas!
Good gym. If back in NYC, this is my hotel.

title: Pleasant Stay
text:
Overall we had a very pleasant stay at the Eventi. The room was the typical size for NYC, very clean, but showed some slight wear. Controlling everything from an iPad was cool and good bath products. Bathrobes were a nice touch but they were washed and starched so many times it was like putting on a burlap bag. 

The location is great if you are coming into Penn Station or attending something at Madison Square Garden. The hotel sort of bills itself as in Chelsea and perhaps that’s technically true. But certainly not the heart of it. 

Valet was a bit slow and the bike lane out front is pretty dangerous. Guy working the door was great but the front desk clerk was a bit cold. 

A nice touch was the free wine hour which was held on an outdoor terrace. However, we really didn’t enjoy it because there were only about 20 seats. Literally. After a busy day, standing with a glass of wine wasn’t all too enjoyable. 

Price paid was very reasonable for NYC. 

I wish TripAdvisor would add a half star. While I would stay at the Eventi again, it’s more like 3.5 stars.

title: You know your stay is going to be bad when ....
text: When you see garbage from the last person still in the room.  Step up your cleaning and inspections, why has this become normal.  Also asked them to call me when room was ready and did not receive a callback.  Front desk staff are well trained so that is a plus.

title: Hipster Central
text:
Very cool hotel centrally located in midtown manhattan.
Great restaurantants and bars in the lobby, as well as morning complimentary coffee and organic tea.
The rooms  are NY small but the bathroom has a nice shower and plush towels and bathrobes.
Convenient to transportation, broadway and Ess-a-Bagel.

title: Great NYC Choice
text:
We like Kimpton's and this is certainly at the top of the list in ticking all the boxes.
Great Midtown location, rooms comfortable and quiet, fantastic staff, good well priced car valet, nice choice of restaurants L'Amico and Vine, good 5pm wine hour.
This is now our 1st choice in NYC, already looking forward to our next stay.

title: Location location location!!!
text:
At 30th street and 6th avenue/ Broadway. (Centrally located to everything in manhattan.)
New York is a walking city and even in 100+ degree heat, we were able to bypass the taxis and subways for many of our little trips around the city.
Would definitely return!

title: Great Find! Great Value!!!
text: Enjoyed our stay at Kimpton Hotel Eventi.  Front desk were friendly and helped celebrate a special birthday.  Room was good size and had everything you could want.  Tablet is provided to order anything you may need or want.  Very easy to use or can always use the phone.

title: always first rate. good people, property and location.
text:
everything was as we requested it.
Had some hot water issues in the morning one day -hotel staff explained there was work being done on the system and it would be corrected shortly. everything back to normal thereafter and Manager volunteered to adjust our room rate for that day.  after thanking him for something we did not ask or expect, he then indicated that additional points would be added to our Kimpton [IHG] account.
in short, they take care of "the customer."

title: Anniversary trip
text: Close proximity to everything!! king size room (#2007) for 2..again, city view but nothing with the wow factor, can see Empire State Building from our room..spacious bathroom..would definitely stay again, but we like to explore different parts of the city

title: Deluxe King Room with City View
text:
I originally booked another hotel for my weekend getaway in NYC when I stumbled across the Kimpton Eventi. I paid under $300/night CAD including all taxes and fees on booking.com. The room we got was a steal. We got a corner unit on the 20th floor with amazing views of Manhattan provided by massive floor to ceiling windows. This was probably the nicest hotel in NYC I’ve stayed in and can’t recommend it enough, especially for couples. 

The room was very large for New York standards, the bathroom was massive with an oversized walk in shower. Upon arrival, valet was quick to take our car and help with our bags. Valet costs $65/night for an SUV, which is actually cheaper than any neighbouring parking spots.

The front desk was very helpful as well as the gentlemen who helped carried our bags to our room. I wish I remembered their names to thank them. The hospitality was just amazing.

Some interesting noteworthy items as well, although the room doesn’t have an in room coffee they offer coffee down in the lobby from 6-9am everyday, as an added bonus they have wine hour from 5-6pm. The room also comes equipped with a tablet which shows hotel information as well as dining and in room options. The TV connects to the wifi and you can stream videos from your phone to the TV as well.

The bar downstairs had a pretty good cocktail and local beer list, although it’s a bit more on the expensive side.

The only negative thing I have to say about my stay is I wish the rooftop balcony/ patio was opened. From the pictures I saw it looked like a great space and I wish there was a bar up there to take advantage of that great space. Either way, there are a lot of options within walking distance of the hotel, because it’s located in such a great spot. 

Assuming the price point remains the same, I will definitely be staying here again and I can’t recommend it enough. 

Thanks again to the awesome staff at the Kimpton and keep up the great work!

title: Comfortable boutique hotel in Chelsea
text: Was very convenient for a wedding. Staff friendly and accommodating. The bike lane in the front of the hotel is concerning since you pull up when you arrive and have to get put into it. Room is comfortable and quite.

title: A well-oiled machine, in a great location, that makes for a seamless stay in the City
text: They seem to do everything right at this hotel.  Little things (the pillows are perfect, the little stool in the shower is handy) to big things (like a quiet room), they seem to have thought of everything.  Even when things go wayward — like when the battery on the room safe goes bad at 1230 a.m. the guy who fixed it knew what he was doing and had it resolved in due course — and refused any tip for his trouble “because it was our fault.”

title: 75th. birthday party
text: The service from the door man all the way through the hotel was excellent. You cannot find a better hotel for the price. Location is excellent!  The rooms were modern and spotless.  I shall return when visiting New York City.

title: Enjoyed our one night here
text: I booked our king room using IHG points. Everything was good. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was great. The room had some wear and tear, but it was minimal. Sleeping at night was quiet.

title: Great hotel but....
text: Great location, great rooms, great amenities, with a couple good restaurants. Check in was easy and the front desk staff was extremely helpful until...I was planning on renting a car the next day and asked how much it was to valet. The staffer said $50 for most cars and $65 for oversized vehicles like big SUV's. I rented a full size car from Hertz, which turned out to be a Suburu Outback essentially a station wagon. The valet charged me $65. I could understand if I pulled up in an Escalade but really? A car with a bubble hatch and he wanted to screw me for an extra $15. After making me wait 15 minutes on the street. After not having a valet ticket on him that required him to go back into the hotel. He didn't seem up to the task as a valet and had a bad attitude. Would it prevent me from staying there again in the future maybe not. But it sure left a sour taste in my mouth.

title: Modern and clean
text: I stayed here on a Saturday night in June. Great location! I took Amtrak into NYC and the hotel was less than a 10-minute walk from the train station. It's also located near a number of subway lines and within walking distance of other major attractions. The hotel itself is modern and clean. Check-in was a breeze. I arrived early but that wasn't an issue. The gentleman at the front desk assigned a lovely room on the 18th floor with a view of the Empire State Building. I was pleasantly surprised at how large it was for NYC. Everything was pristine. I had fun breezing through the hotel's iPad, reviewing the amenities and services offered. At one point, I realized that I forgot to bring makeup remover wipes and submitted a request through the iPad. Within 10 minutes, someone from the hotel brought them up. I appreciated that. The bathroom is luxurious and the bed is comfortable. I had breakfast and lunch at The Vine and everything that I had was pretty good. Overall, I enjoyed my experience at this hotel and would certainly consider staying here again.

title: Excellent!
text:
Booked this hotel last minute and when I called the front desk they were very accommodating and helpful.

Aside from how clean and beautiful the hotel was, the staff made my stay very pleasant. Room service and front desk were excellent with special requests and the room was very elegant and sexy!

title: My new go to when traveling to NYC
text: Hotel Eventi is my new go to / must stay when traveling to NYC. I travel to NY for work and have finally found my “home”! The rooms are spacious, have floor to ceiling windows, impeccably clean, QUIET (yay!!), etc! Finally a place within walking distance to Chelsea, Midtown, Bryant Park and Times Square. Check in was fast, all staff I dealt with extremely professional and pleasant. Wine hour was nice, but the plastic “walls” they had up made it sauna like. I felt awful for the two ladies in their suits; they had to have been dying. The only issue I had was the fact that there were ice machines and had to be “ordered”, however when I did order the bucket of ice was delivered in less than 10 minutes. I was extremely pleased to see they had iced coffee available at the coffee station, I took advantage of that in the mornings. Check out was speedy and I once again dealt with two very kind, knowledgeable and professional staff members. I will stay here whenever I travel to NYC, whether it be for work or pleasure.

title: Poor Service
text: I received and incorrect charge on my credit card from this hotel back in August 2018.  It has been almost a year and I can still not get anyone to call me back to address the charge.  Every time I call I get transferred to either a manager voice mail, the accounting office voice mail or transferred to a number that just rings and rings and rings.  Where it was charged to my credit card I have disputed the charge with them and run out of avenues to correct it.  With so many hotels in NY - I won't be staying her anytime soon and haven't since this issue began.

title: A real Manhaten gem
text: The beautiful hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city. rooms and lobby are very nicely decorated and staff is extremely attentive and warm. The Hotel's restaurants are also exceptionally good. very recommended

title: Front desk staff needs more training
text: The only thing I liked about the hotel was the bed. The hotel provides spacious two-queen bed rooms, which is a luxury in Manhattan. The hotel staff clearly needs more training. The front desk lady was not courteous and was inpatient at answering my questions. She tried to look friendly by calling every guest "honey". Somebody needs to tell her it's not going to work.

title: Needs updating...
text: The check process was a cluster. I waited over 30 minutes and the staff dropped the ball multiple times in the process. I escalated on twitter and eventually connected with a manager. The room was tired.  A great view but a few large wrinkles in the carpet, damaged fabric wall and black mold on the shower stool. I was not impressed and expect more from Kimpton especially since this is their 'flagship' according to management. Avocado toast and a coffee will cost you over $30 in the restaurant. The bell hops were of no use.  I won't be back to this location.

title: Lovely hotel; centrally located
text: We stayed for three nights at the Eventi, and had a great experience. Check in was a breeze. Our room was clean, comfortable, and had a decent view. Perhaps the best aspect was how quiet it was, which is something that is extremely hard to find in Manhattan hotels. There is a nice terrace on the fifth floor with a cocktail hour, as well.

title: The staff was exceptional.
text: My daughter and I took a trip to NYC to catch a few shows and explore. From the moment we arrived at the Eventi, our stay was a delight. Victoria, one of the managers, was so warm and personable, and made certain that we were taken care of, she recommended a few places to see, she went through the hotel’s amenities, and upon hearing that it was our daughter’s birthday, she sent up a treat for her. I can’t aay enough good things about the staff. Leilani made certain that we had an umbrella for our trek in the rain, ahe also was very warm and thoughtful, asking my ten year old how her trip has been, and making some suggestions. Victoria, Leilani, Kevin, the gentleman at the front door, all went above and beyond in big and little ways during our time there. We will definitely return!

title: Great hotel!
text: We were looking to stay within walking distance of attractions and great food and we found it!  Staff was very friendly and warm.  We mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary and when we got back from walking the High Line there was a bottle of champagne and cupcakes waiting for us!  Such a nice touch.  Hotel vibe was cool and room was good size for NYC hotel with a great view and very clean.  Great bathroom too - rainfall shower was awesome!

title: 位置超棒的優質飯店
text: 地點位於紐約中城區，位置很好，步行就可以走到附近景點，距離時代廣場也不遠，晚上很適合去逛逛街。房間舒適整潔、櫃台人員親切友好，推薦!

title: Comfortable Mid-Town Hotel
text: Smallish rooms, but nice bathroom. Restaurant service was a bit slow, but a good choice of dishes on offer. Bar in evening had a good buzz. Stayed because of its close proximity to Madison Square Gardens - 5 minute walk.

title: surprisingly large rooms!
text: If this room was in any other city I would say it's just okay but it being in new york city, the rooms are very spacious including the bathroom!. The walls are decently thick, the location is great and the service was pretty good.

title: I’m officially a “Kimptonite”!
text: We stayed at the Kimpton Fitzroy in London last fall, and loved it. So, I thought we’d try the Kimpton Eventi in NYC. We couldn’t be happier. Wonderful room, service, and location. Walking distance to all things New York, plus an amazing view of the Empire State Building from our room. Highly recommended!

title: Friendly Funky & Fun
text:
Loved our recent stay June 19. 

Room on 19th floor was clean, quiet & had everything we needed. Got a nice surprise from the hotel of a bottle of fizz & some mini cupcakes to help celebrate our wedding anniversary weekend. 

Our corner room had a great view of ESB and the hotel is brilliantly located for transport links around the city. The LIRR connection to JFK Air-train was reasonably easy and very quick (if you can speedily navigate the maze that is Penn station).

All in all a pleasant stay, shout out to Marilyn and Kirk for making our brief stay seamless and that bit more enjoyable.

title: Epic Kimpton Hotel, 5 Star Service, 5 Star Experience!!
text:
OMG, This is one of the most FANTASTIC Kimpton Hotels I have been to around the country, the Roof Bar Happy Hour get together is amazing, the doormen are hilarious, super helpful on tips, the WHOLE Front Desk Staff have bent over backward to help make arrangements for us the very first time, I have stayed with them MULTIPLE Times since the very first visit.

We got a Top Floor Suite, a Killer deal on it the first time during 4th of July in 2014, which by the way is when you get all of the deals in NY for everyone leaving for the Hamptons. It had a huge master bath larger than most king size hotel rooms, a living room, and an amazing king bed with floor to ceiling windows in the best decor, I loved every bit of it each time!

This is in the Chelsea District, Super cool museums, restaurants, cafes, and a short walk down to the Tower Memorial, Empire state building literally right there, just a sensory overload of awesome New York Energy. 

Give them a try!

title: First time I hated my stay in Kimpton
text:
I stayed for just one night to fly out of JFK early next morning. So I have nothing to say about amenities, etc. But still this was probably the worst experience with Kimption, which is (still) my favourite hotel group.

So what i did not like?
(1) When I checked in, the lady asked me if I want to know something about the hotel, and I said I don't know. She took it as a no and did not explain anything about the hotel and just gave me the key.
(2) I don't remember what happened when I checked out but I found that I got charged for $19.06 and I did not receive a bill (they have my email) or anything.
(3) I called an Uber from the hotel, and the doorman did not seem like it, and he was not very helpful.
In general, it is a cool hote, but the attitude of the people there are I felt sort of stuck up. This is basically what made me never to stay here again. I have to think about my royalty to Kimption as well.

Below are my usual pros and cons:

Pros:
(1) Depends on what you need to do in NYC, but location is great. Walking distance from Penn station (less than 10 min walk), and in the middle of Manhattan. Easy to get on subway to go virtually anywhere.
(2) As usual for Kimption, cool interior. Both the room, and the hotel common area.
(3) Maybe this is not the most expensive area, but the price is reasonable for a good hotel in the middle of NYC.
(4) Bar / Cafe (they serve La Colombe coffee) seem pretty good.
(5) Free wifi (maybe you need to have a membership of Kimption (free))

Cons:
(1) I paid extra for a higher floor (and hopefully better view), but the room I was assigned did not have a great view. Yes, it was on a high floor, but compared with other hotels in NYC which offers nice view on an upper floor, it was disappointing. I think the (extra) money was totally not worth it.
(2) Attitude of the people at the hotel.
(3) What is the $19.06 that they charged me?

Overall, this is the first time I decided I never stay in a Kimption again.Too bad it is at a convenient location for me, who often comes to NYC with a train.

title: Disappointment
text:
Apparently, this is a 5-star hotel. Simply, I have tried to have my confirmation e-mailed to me. I tried calling 2 times.. transferred and finally reached the front desk after 30 minutes.
The speaker on the phone system garbles the conversation.
The first attempt I did not receive the e-mail.
The second attempt I was disconnected by the front desk supervisor.
Any hotel that has an unprofessional front line staff, faulty phones and can not e-mail would not qualify as a 5 star.
Glad I can cancel.

title: Never Again
text: Normally a fan of Kimpton but not any more. Booked a suite and asked for the sofa bed to be made up. Renewed the request upon checking in. After checking in noticed there was no wine opener. Asked for that with no delivery. After renewing request for sofa bed to be made up (now late at night) response at door was here are the linens - make it up yourself. All of this is so far from customer service it’s appalling. There are so many choices for hospitality, why on earth would I choose a company that just doesn’t get it?

title: Great hotel
text: Vibrant public spaces, always full of happy people. Great restaurants, bar, sidewalk dining. Yoga on the plaza. Adequate fitness center. Rooms are nicer than they appear online, but starting to show some wear on upholstery.

title: Rare Customer Service...
text: Recently back from holiday where I stayed at Kimpton Hotel EVENTI for the second time and upon my arrival, I was SO happy to find out that I would be taken care of by Marilyn @ the front desk again. I was recommended this hotel by a friend in 2018 and booked my New Year retreat with my boyfriend for 4-Nights in January 2019. Marilyn was our front desk agent in January and was such a kind, helpful, friendly and welcoming employee; she was SO accommodating to us. I never got around to leaving a review of the hotel after my stay in January, so I made it a point to do so this time around (June 2019). The hotel screams modern, artisty-deco vibes - it screams cool, trendy people. I love the restaurants in the Lobby, which are super useful when you want to avoid the hustle of NY and need a great bite to eat. The rooms are nice and have simple decoration. My heart falls in love with the bathroom every.single.time... love! (Note: I never get a room with a tub, so not sure if they have them... ) The guys who work in the lobby are awesome too! I ordered multiple shopping packages (read: large boxes) to the hotel before I arrived and they were so helpful in getting them up to my room. Also, our flight lands early in the morning so I'm never sure if we'll get an early check-in but every.single.time I call, they accommodate. I love this place; the location (very close to 5th Ave shopping); the employees and Marilyn! Thank you all for taking care of me every time I come - these are the distinguishing factors that make you stand out!

title: Would I stay here again? YES
text: The Kimpton EVENTI is located in the Flower market district. I quite liked it's location to the Madison Square Garden, and it's also another neighbourhood to the upper manhattan that we all tend to flock to. The two bars were popular and the restaurant seemed to be well used also. I ate breakfast here but the waiter must have been having an off-day. I expected better service.

title: Good location
text: Pleasant place to stay well situated for trips uptown toward the Park and the museums, and lower Manhattan.  The rooms are comfortable with the usual amenities, and nice marble bathrooms, although the door stuck.  Only complaint is that the hotel has done away with menus and written hotel directories of any sort, and relies on a sort of tablet thing that is tricky to use, and has limited functions.  We had a lovely conversation with Tod from housekeeping who brought us a bucket of ice (ice machines evidently being a thing of the past) the first night, but after that we stopped at the bar and asked for ice each night that we wanted it.   The elevators are fast, and have updated security features (need an electronic room key to go up from the lobby).

title: Not family friendly
text:
Front desk extremely dry. Asked for a crib and the crib looked like a jail cell, old and really in a bad shape! How do you put your most precious thing in the world in a crib like that? I returned the crib and baby slept with me. No one at the hotel explained me the hotel features and the restaurant attached does not accept stroller. Breakfast in bed arrived, no salt for eggs and and the 5 dollar orange juice was in a small tiny glass!
Will not return.
Location is good.

title: Spectacular hotel in great location...
text:
We were visiting from CA and extended our stay in NYC one night. I booked a regular room here with my IHG points. We had no expectations, but were pleasantly surprised upon our arrival. 

The hotel is very cool. Probably too cool for two people in their 40s traveling with kids, but we were never made to feel out of place. 

The room with two beds was surprisingly large for NYC standards. Our view was non-existent, but that is also not uncommon. 

Every employee we interacted with was fantastic. Especially appreciated the valet personnel who let us park on the street while loading and unloading. Invaluable given the area. 

I wish we had stayed here longer and it will be the first place I check for rooms next time I travel to NYC.

title: Fab As Always!
text:
I am an LA native who enjoys visiting NYC for pleasure! Whenever I do, the Eventi is where I love to stay!

Top notch service, great views of The Empire State, an amazing location, and a meticulously clean aesthetic -all have me coming back for more!!!

Shout outs to Johnnie, Brianna,Kevin,Marilyn, & Wen! Thank you for consistently being exemplary in all you do!!!

See you Labor Day Weekend & Many Thanks,

Melanie Hart

title: A wonderful night at the Eventi
text:
We had a wonderful night stay at the Eventi this past weekend for a staycation. We enjoyed our stay from beginning to end.  The staff was wonderful and attentive even when we requested additional pillows at 11:00 PM. The pillows were brought to us within 10 minutes even at that late hour.  The room was modern and clean.  I had two complaints with the room; first, the leather chair in the room was worn and dirty.  Before I sat down, I wiped it down.  Second, not really a problem but the bathroom door was a wooden door that slides closed. It was very heavy and was difficult to pull closed.  Other than that - the room was very comfortable and very quiet.  We slept soundly and heard no noise in the hotel.  We were on the 16th floor and we heard no traffic noise either. We had a room with two queen beds as there were three of us. The bathroom was a very good size with a very large shower.  Many reviews mentioned that there were no USB plugs in the room; however, there were two attached to the IPAD station so we were able to use the USB ports as well as plugs at the same time. While there was a minibar and water bottles in the room, the prices were excessive.
Upon check in, we were greeted by Johnny at the front desk,We saw him numerous times during our stay and he was very helpful.  He gave us information about the amenities in the hotel and made our stay enjoyable and made an effort to get to know us. We valet parked our car.  It was $65 for 24 hours which I did not find that bad by NYC standards.  We also attened the free wine hour from 5:00 - 6:00 PM on Friday afternoon on the veranda.  What a lovely hour and a great view of the Empire State Building.  We did not have the opportunity to eat in the restaurants but they were lovely and the food looked delicious.  Water was provided in the lobby. In the morning, there was complimentary coffee and a detox tea in addition to iced coffee which was a welcome treat on a warm Saturday morning. The hotel also has a nice sized gym as well as a very small spa that provides massage and facial services.

The location of the hotel was very convenient to Herald Square and to Broadway.  There were many restaurants and shops nearby.  The area itself is extremely busy, but just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of 34th Street and 42nd Street.

Overall, I would recommend the Eventi for anyone looking for a comfortable hotel in NYC.

title: Wedding Weekend
text: We held our daughter’s Wedding here & it was magical. Rooms were good sized for NYC & very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were very impressed with the food both at the wedding and brunch the following morning.Perfect location for a perfect Wedding.

title: Hotel excelente!
text: Hotel excelente! Há dois restaurantes no térreo. Um serve drinks e o outro é uma espécie de italiano com pizzas e massas. Atmosfera indescritível. Próximo a tudo! Há bicicletas para passeio gratuitas! Vale muito a pena! Buffet de café da manhã é a la carte e a parte!

title: Eventi Regular
text: After my review of the Kimpton's other property, The Muse, I wanted to write about my excellent experiences at the Eventi. This is our property of choice and we stay here 3 to 4 times a year unless they are booked. The L'Amico restaurant is amazing as is their room service hamburger and grilled chicken caesar salad. The staff are very friendly and efficient. Overall the hotel is in great condition with some obvious wear-and-tear which is only natural. The beds and bedding are comfortable w well stocked amenities in the bathrooms. As with all of the Kimptons Hotels they have a free happy hour wine bar and this location has an onsite spa. Enjoy!

title: Kevin is incredible
text:
Hi,
We stayed at the hotel for one night on May 2019. We were supposed to stay 9 nights but due to business reason we had to leave the city after one night. We came in with a toddler (2 years old) and received a phenomenal service from Kevin and the staff. They allowed early check in and approved to move to a room with a bath. Kevin provided the best service we’ve ever received in the City. We will definitely come back just because of him.

title: My NY Home
text:
Ok I usually don't write reviews so the fact that I am writing one is an exception.  I travel a lot for work. So usually my reaction is ok its just another hotel.  Well that is not the case here.  From the moment you walk in, you feel like a valued guest. I was made to feel welcome and important (and that was my first visit).  Since then its a welcome back, great to see you and the likes.  They remember all the little details, room you like, things you might need etc.  Its like you're the most important guest they have.  They have an incredible team at the front desk. 

Rooms are amazing - Beds are very comfortable for a good night sleep. Love the turndown service.  Great bar on site.  Amazing location, close to everything, 

I usually am in NY 3-4 times a year and this is where I will stay.

title: Extremely Loud Hotel
text:
Me and my partner stayed here and we didn’t get a minute of sleep. The room was vibrating with the music being played in the neighborhood. The manager didn’t seem to care, I suppose this is a regular occurrence. 
Terrible customer service. 
Apart from that the room was okay, not small but no luxury features at all, pretty basic. 
We had an awful experience at this hotel, we could hear every single word of the clubs nearby and they went on until the early hours of the morning. A complete nightmare. I would strongly discourage any guest from staying here.

title: Manhattan Monster
text:
I had a monster of a time in Manhattan when I stayed at Eventi!
From the greeting at the front desk from Jennifer, who made check-in easy to the photocopies they made for my during my dinner, they outperformed my expectations

The location is stellar, from my room I could easily see a gorgeous skyline and realize I was a couple blocks away from the Empire State Building. So, off I went and up to the observation deck like King Kong, except no female companion! Location allowed me to visit several trendy bars and tried Smash Burgers, all of which I've heard about and wanted to experience. Quick stop over to The Rack, right down the street and back for an evening drink at Evanti

Room was modern, killer views and used the yoga mat provided in the room for my PT exercises, a bonus add on for me

Then a fantastic Sunday breakfast, good food and excellent service rounded out a monster overnight in Manhattan!

title: Amazing Stay
text: This hotel met all my needs and made for the perfect vacation. The staff was amazing and made the whole experience better. Paulina who checked me in was very informative and so sweet. Jen and Victoria made my entire stay a breeze. The restaurant was amazing as well as the room service. I will definitely be returning to this hotel.

title: Poor management
text:
This is a decent hotel with a great location.  But the management is just atrociously bad. 

The room had a sink that did not drain (see attached picture).  We notified the front-desk and they told us someone would come fix it. Hotel claims that someone came to look at it while we were out but could not fix it. They will have to wait until the next day. While I do not understand why, but did not have much of a choice. We were not offered a chance to move to a different room.  The sink blockage is so obvious, the hotel should not have given the room to anyone.  

No one shows up the next day. When I called the front-desk, they just said sorry we do not know what happened and will have a manager reach out to me. 

The manager emails--not call--email me. He said sorry we dropped the ball on this one. We will give you better service next time you stay with us. When i told him that I was still at the hotel, I wanted him to walk up to my room and apologize face-to-face and offer how can we make this right.  Other top hotels i have visited have done this. Instead, he emails me back saying---oh great, come see me when you have time. Of course I did not waste my time finding him.  So he said I am adding 10,000 points for the inconvenience. Only one sink in the room that does not drain is not a just an inconvenience. And by the way, no points were ever added to my account. 

While check-in was a breeze, I had booked a two bed room because I was travelling with a baby. We were offered a king bed instead because two bed rooms were unavailable. I understand and was okay with it. The manager claims that I should be happy I was given an upgrade. When you have to accommodate a baby in your bed--a safety concern--having a couch in your room is not an upgrade. 

I am platinum IHG member. IHG gives a preferential treatment to me whenever i stay at one of their properties. I usually like Kimpton hotels and get a decent treatment. .  This was just such a bad experience that made me rethink about staying at any Kimpton property ever again.  Hotel industry provides us with a lot of choices. Consider another property.  They all charge about the same for the same level of hotel. Why risk ruining your vacation.

title: Our first trip to NYC - so glad we chose the Kimpton Hotel Eventi
text: We've just got back to the UK after spending five days in New York - our first trip to this amazing place! Celine on reception was just the best - she pointed us in the right direction for places to visit and booked a restaurant for us too! Nothing was too much trouble - it really made a difference having such a friendly hotel to stay in.  The room and bathroom were immaculately clean and the bed was large and comfortable. This hotel is a short walk to the subway and so well located for all the places we wanted to visit. The restaurant on the ground floor - LAMICO is well worth a visit - the service and food is fabulous!

title: OVER AND ABOVE SERVICE
text: Johnny - the director at the front desk was extraordinary.  He assisted with an unusual request very quickly and willingly and was so kind.  I called the hotel asking for assistance with delivering an item to Bellevue Hospital, I was just looking for a recommendation for a service when he kindly stepped up and took the item HIMSELF to the hospital.  I was not in NY at the time, a colleagues daughter was injured and in the hospital and she needed some items - Johnny went to a store, shopped and PERSONALLY DELIVERED the items to her in her hospital bed.  I cannot say how grateful I was (as well as my colleague and his daughter) for Johnny's extraordinary effort and kindness.  He called me to assure me the items were delivered and he made her emergency hospital stay that much more tolerable.  I am very grateful for his assistance during his OFF HOURS and will be a Kimpton Eventi customer for a long time.  If there is any merit awards given to Kimpton Eventi employees I hope that corporate take note of Johnny and reward him excessively.   Thank you Johnny!!!

title: UBS socket is the only missing item
text:
Perfect location, short walking distance to Metro, Path train and tons of restaurants, bars, Korean town, Hudson Yards, and of course tons of shops, the largest Macy's and Times Square. 

Amenities and room were great. The bedding was soft and comfortable, helpful pleasant staff. Late night room service available and they have La Colombe downstairs for great snack and coffee. Cozy lobby and bar for a group of friends.

Wide selection of TV channels, the only thing to add would be UBS plug at nightstand and in the living room.

title: Good Choice For Exploring NYC
text:
