Second time in NYC but first time staying in the Eventi. It is a lively and well placed hotel. The Restaurant and bar were busy every night and there is a general buzz around the place which was cool. 

Location: Excellent, close to shops, subway links, etc. Was so easy to get around. We walked a lot and found that if you wanted to most things were 20mins away walking max. (Central Park, Empire State, Top Of The Roc, 5th Ave shopping etc etc) 

Room: We were actually upgraded due to mentioning it was our wedding anniversary which was a nice surprise. Room was spacious for New York and had a cool view overlooking city (18th floor). Bed was comfy and shower/bathroom very big for NYC

Overall we found everything to our liking. Maybe the only downside was the very expensive price of in room waters etc. Just buy from the shop across road if you want some water in your room at night etc. 

Would visit again and highly recommend it

title: Art lover's best hotel
text: This hotel has the perfect location, style and art collection for the art enthusiast stay in NY.  A short walk to the new Hudson Yards, The Shed, Chelsea gallery district, the Vessel and much more, this hotel made for the perfect art opening trip.  The hotel is stylish, has great, large rooms, great restaurants and  an incredible staff.

title: Once is not enough...
text: Came back to the Eventi for a second stay. First time we LOVED it.  Front desk staff were so pleasant, were so friendly to our dog.  Room was a nice size, in pretty good shape.  Pet amenities were a plus.  Second time, not so much.  I mentioned we were BACK for a second time.  Didn’t get much of a reaction.  The bellman said he remembered our dog, as a pleasantry, and the young lady at the front desk giggled. Repeat customer and we were given the SMALLEST room in the hotel.  Hot water in the shower didn’t work consistently.  Look, I don’t expect a red carpet when I stay at a hotel (although it is nice to get one when I am able to stay at a Four Seasons) but I do expect the hotel to recognize how competitive the hotel market is in NYC and the number of choices people have for the right hotel.  A good experience once is just not enough.

title: Great location
text:
Loved the hotel.  My husband and I stayed in a deluxe view king and our kids stayed in a double queen.  Both rooms had a great set up, with large bathrooms with lots of room to put things, lots of light and great views.

The location can’t be beat.  Very close to Harold Square and walking distance to several subway stops and Madison Square Park.  We were really in the heart of everything.

The bellman and the housekeeping staff were awesome.  I was very impressed with one bellman in particular and I wish I had gotten his name.  Upon check out we were waiting a long time for our car.  My husband asked this particular bellman what was up and he replied that because it was Easter Sunday things were running slow.  We waited quite a bit longer with no results.  Upon his own initiative he sought us out and confirmed we were still waiting, tracked down our car and directed the front desk to reduce our bill for one day’s worth of parking.  I really appreciated his concern for us.  I feel that these instances are what makes Kimpton Hotels stand out.

We did eat breakfast at the Vine one morning.  It was expensive (what did I expect ?), but service was good and the food was very good.  We also ate at L’ Amico one evening.  Even though it was very close to closing time, they served us a great meal.  Really loved the burrata and the prosciutto.

Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Visit to the Eventi!
text: This is my 2nd visit to the Eventi and once again we had a very comfortable stay. We spent 3 nights in a king suite. We wanted connecting rooms with our travel mates but there are no connecting suites. Wish I had been told that when I called the hotel directly to request connecting rooms. I had to take a room on a pet friendly floor in order to be on the same floor which worked out okay.  Our travel mates had a toddler and the hotel provided a crib and small refrigerator at no charge. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. Within walking distance of Bryant park, the high-line, Koreatown, Empire state building and the village. We took advantage of the valet parking which turned out to be very reasonable for the convenience.The lounge was always busy, a little pricey but very convenient while traveling with a toddler.  The bar at the L'Amico was a disappointment, the drinks were expensive and not well made, $65.00 for 3 drinks, did not pay for one as it was not drinkable. The bartender was a little rude. Will definitely stay at the Eventi again but will not visit L'Amico bar. We had departing Mimosa's in the lobby the day we left instead of in the lounge.

title: Third visit to Hotel Events
text: We just returned from our third stay at the Hotel Eventi.  The three rooms we stayed in over a course of seven nights were clean and roomy.  The only issue was with one room and plumbing issues which were addressed by hotel management.  The staff is excellent, always so friendly and helpful.  I can't name everyone but Francois Etienne, Guest Service Manager went out of his way to assist.  The location is perfect for hoping an Amtrak train at Penn Station or walking to the theater district.  We will be back next year!

title: NEEDS RENOVATION
text: The hotel is well located, but not my type of hotel. Their facilities are already old, they could remodel a bit from the lobby to the rooms.  My room had a view of the city that never sleeps, I loved that, but inside it I did not feel totally comfortable.  Carpets, bed sheets and comforters were bad looking.   I think they should improve.

title: Sexy City Hotspot
text:
I have stayed 3x now at the Eventi and love the location, vibe and style.   Exceptional service at check-in from Kevin.  He noted it was my father's 88th birthday and sent up cupcakes and vodka with a warm card.   The lobby restaurants and bars are chic and tasteful.   The rooms have excellent bathrooms with amazing water preassue (remember that Seinfeld episode??).

Comfortable beds, responsive AC, noise insulated windows, great restaurant and amazing staff.

This is my home away from home.

title: Perfect for us!
text: Highly recommend! Great location. Excellent front desk & bell service. Super sweet & helpful people!! Fast efficient check in, they upgraded my MIL’s room to a better view, they sent up cupcakes, a cheese tray, and wine to our suite, they watched our luggage before and after checkout, AND they were always welcoming!! Our rooms (a king & a king suite) weren’t enormous, but after researching other hotel rooms, I think we had far more space than other hotels. Easy fun hotel. Book it! 🗽🌃✅❤️

title: Worst stay ever
text:
We have booked the hotel for an 8 night stay to celebrate my husbands birthday. The room was outdated, old, dirty and dusty. The sheets smelled like cigarettes smoke. We have booked a suite which was very disappointing in terms of size. The bathroom was old and leaked. The staff were not helpful and did not even greet with a good morning upon direct visual contact.
The elevator stunk- the smell of food from the restaurant was dominating.
We cut our stay short and changed the hotel in the middle of our stay we honestly could not ruin the rest of our holiday. Upon check out the staff would not even help with taking the luggage to the car saying they could not leave the front deck of hotel as they must be in the camera range of the hotel- talking about steps to help the luggage in the cab. 
Do not recommend

title: Buzzing hotel
text: Overall a great NYC hotel, the Vine bar and its staff were exceptional and breakfast was also excellent. Room was fine for  New York but real issue for us was L’Amico, we only ate there once which was once too many. Food was ok but it was just too noisy.

title: Pas digne d'un 5 étoiles
text: L'hotel est extrêmement bien placé, la décoration du lobby et des restaurants est très jolie. Les chambres ont une belle vue et la literie est très confortable. Le personnel de la réception est moins sympathique que la moyenne à NY. Surtout, si vous cherchez un 5 étoiles avec les services correspondants, fuyez. Cet hôtel ne devrait pas dépasser 4 étoiles. Vous vous portez les bagages jusqu'à votre chambre, les chambres sont bien tenues, mais l'entretien des parquets et des équipements est très moyen.

title: Visiting colleges in area
text: We recently visited a few colleges in NYC and really enjoyed our time at this hotel. Definitely a unique hotel, very trendy, very friendly staff. We needed to park out front to unload luggage and got help with the bags. We had a very clean room with 2 queen beds and plenty of space. New York City hotel rooms are smaller than usual but we found it comfortable for 4. Loved the bathroom and had an excellent view from top floor. We will be back!

title: Due for a renovation
text: This hotel is in a great location and the service was good but the rooms are in dire need of a renovation.  We stayed in a Premier One Bedroom Suite and it had stained rugs and furniture; scratched / damaged furniture and walls and overall seemed worn.  The "spa" tub was pretty small and the shower was not fully enclosed.  I love Kimptons but would not stay at this one again until a renovation is done.

title: Made for a younger demographic
text: We had heard that this was a great hotel, so we decided to try it. Many issues. First, drove right by it the first time as the signage is not easily seen. Derek, the valet was very nice upon arrival. I had booked a 2 room suite, which I did not get. I know that Kevin, who was at the front desk and also very nice, thought that the room with a wide balcony would be great. And the room was great, however, he didn't mention that there would be a party on Saturday on that terrace and the loud crowd was there until 3 am. This is a place for millennials. We will return to mid town east where I ma happier.

title: Super cool and trendy hotel with a great happening bar
text: Really like this place - ultra cool hotel, great lobby, restaurants and bar. Perfect location too - we walked to loads of places. Need to get the subway to downtown but easy walk to Times Square, Empire State etc. Would stay here again. Hotel and staff have bags of character too.

title: Absolutely lovely hotel - first time in NYC
text:
The staff could not be any friendlier, especially Vanessa who offered us a free room upgrade and arranged for champagne and cupcakes to be sent to our room when we popped out for a cheeky McDonald’s! Lovely room which had a view of the Empire State Building which was surreal! Very good location, close to Penn Station which made getting the subway so easy. 

Minibar is kinda pricey - I’d suggest finding a shop nearby for water and other bits. As mentioned there is a shop opposite the hotel but I found Target to be much better value. 

One suggestion I do have is possibly switching the bar of soap to a liquid hand soap as the soap did irritate my eczema on my hands. I did ask for a liquid hand soap but I think this was unfortunately misheard. Overall had an excellent stay and found the room to be more than generous as the bed was huge! Thank you guys for an awesome stay :)

title: serious customer service TRAINING needed...
text:
at this hotel, paying for the Royal treatment and being a Platinum Member gives you nothing, not even a smile or a nice gesture...
i got in early and contrary to what IHG says it does for it's "platinum members" , they received me with a "NO WE CAN'T" and go sit at the Lobby for FOUR hours, until I said just give me a regular room and not my "suite" then amazingly it was ready...
the manager should resign!
next time I want good service i'll rather try Motel 6 or Holiday Inn.

title: Don't Think Twice
text: My very first time in NYC. I made a bold move and came solo. Not knowing anything or anyone I trusted my gut instinct and booked with this hotel based off reviews and man was it a great decision. Very nice hotel and close to all the hot spots. One of the hotel team members Alex made my trip an amazing experience. Was super friendly and didn't mind taking time to tell me how to get to places and give me directions and made sure I was going to the right places prepared and knowing what to expect. Take my advice and stay and this hotel and ask for Alex if you have any questions about places or just simply need a hand with anything or getting a ride anywhere. Would highly recommend to anyone to stay here. Thank you all again.

title: Perfect Place to Stay in NYC
text: The hotel is located right in the heart of the city an so easy to get to Greenwich, Times Square, 5th avenue and beyond.  The rooms are big and so well laid out providing extra shelves and places to put all your belongings and not feel cluttered. The staff is amazing and the happy hour each night is just perfect way to start an evening!  The ambience is upscale chic and the bar and restaurant scene is a cool place to hang out after a long day. Definitely need to check this place out!

title: Super location, but average hotel
text:
Firstly let me be clear, this was booked on points. It was chosen because of experience of this chain before and also location. The location is really great and most things you want to do in NYC are within walking distance.
But I don't think will stay here again as the downsides offset the upside.
The good: Location, bathroom was really good, spacious and with good water pressure and walk-in shower (no bath) and nice amenities, free wine hour in the afternoon, nice bar.coffee area, wifi good strength and easy connection.
The bad: Room was very small and not sufficient closet space. No USB charging and no international plug sockets. no free water, pillows were all the same so no mixture (sure I could have asked for a change) TV channels a bit unstable and streaming possible but complex
We were on 19th floor which had a nice look out over 6th Ave (and by the way a good fresh food shop across the road for getting some fruit)
Overall not a dreadful stay, but disappointed about room size and also water really. Both important I feel. Not sure I would pay $$$ to stay here though

title: First time at Kimpton Hotel Eventi..and WILL BE BACK!
text:
Great location, efficient check-in/out, employees were REALLY friendly and genuine, guest room was ample in size and I got a good nights rest.  WiFi was really easy to associate with and get online...TY for this!  Shower and water volume was GREAT!  In-room dining was a very nice experience, and the 
Caesar Salad with Ahi was delicious.  View of the Empire State Building was very nice!  Only draw back was the TV content and system was antiquated.

title: Great facility and location but average service
text: Checked in to this hotel on NYE. The hotel hardware is beautiful. New and luxurious furnishings. The service isn't on par with the hardware of the hotel, however. Nothing for status. When mentioned the social keyword "CHILLED TO PERFECTION" the front desk staff was like "oh.. OK.. Hey (to another associate), can you grab that 'chilled to perfection' thing?" The process was just very cold as if I had bothered her by mentioning that. If you can't do it right, don't advertise it I guess. And it represents the feeling of service throughout the stay. Functional but definitely not up to the 4- 5- star expectation.

title: No complaints
text: We stayed here for 2 nights while exploring NYC for the first time.   We basically only used the hotel for sleeping purposes but the beds were comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful.  Doorman was always helpful to get us a cab, etc.    No complaints.

title: Great trip
text: Stayed at the eventi From 15th to 22nd March on vacation from UK. Have stayed at a number of kimptons but first in nyc. Hotel lived up to the great standards of Kimpton, upgraded to a suite because of rewards status, very good and much appreciated. My wife realised after we had left the hotel one day that she had either left her cell phone in the room or had lost it after we had left the hotel, when we called a team member was immediately dispatched to the room to ascertain if it was there( it was, big relief). Interaction with all team members was great through the stay, enjoyed the wine hour as always. Thank you for helping make a great vacation

title: AMAZING STAFF!
text: Cannot say enough good things about the service at this hotel. Vanessa Jerome, in Concierge, helped me surprise my husband while he was on a business trip with a sweet gift and treats in his room.  She went out of her way to make it extra special and was SO helpful. Amazing place!

title: Eventi a class above
text: Great inner city hotel, terrific staff, centrally located, great breakfast and authentic NY atmosphere. I just love this place. The door men are extremely helpful and friendly considering the NY winter. Room service was prompt, good value and delicious. This is my go to NY hotel.

title: First unpleasant Kimpton experience
text:
Let me say up front that we have stayed at Kimptons throughout the West and had amazing experiences. I guess the winning streak was not to continue. Our stay at this NYC Kimpton was disappointing to say the least.

1) My partner encountered an extremely rude, outright hostile server at the bar in the Vine restaurant inside the hotel. The hotel manager basically said there was little to be done as the restaurant is managed by an outside party. 

2) We were offered turndown service at checkin. It never happened. Again, the manager replied that our IHG status was not high enough for turndown and we shouldn't have been offered it.

3) Housekeeping came to clean the suite very early, often before 9, even on the weekend. They left a note asking us to call when we were ready for the room to be cleaned. When we called and said we were ready, they replied the staff 'has a routine' and would 'get to it later'.

4) Rooms are noisy, especially due to what I suspect are groaning hot water pipes and which would would randomly become noisy at strange hours.

5) We stored our luggage at check-in as we arrived on a red-eye. When I called to have our bags sent up later, I was told to come down with the ticket and then they could be sent up. I gave the ticket to the bellhop and asked to have them brought up. He replied he was 'busy watching the door' and couldn't do it. I brought them myself.

We were staying in a premier suite and spent nearly $3K for four nights, as we usually do at Kimptons we stay at. We expected better service than we got for this expense. Our normal experience at Kimpton is a laid back, helpful vibe. This experience was anything but. It's almost as if this location is striving for that aloof, "too hip to care" vibe common in many NYC hotels of a certain class. It fails miserably. For what we spent, we expected better. Unfortunately, this will give us pause before staying with any Kimpton again. 

Finally, one bright spot. "Jillian" who always answered the Guest Services line, was cheerful and helpful consistently every time. The rest of the place could take a lesson from her.

title: Best place to stay with puppy
text: Awesome place to stay in NYC with a puppy.  There are 4 different green patches behind the hotel for potty breaks.  They also freely offer puppy beds and food bowls.  I love the Eventi and so does little Mia.  Thank you!!

title: Outstanding on all levels
text: The Kimpton Eventi Hotel & Staff exceeded my expectations on all levels. Top notch experience from beginning to end. The staff is phenomenal. If you're ever hosting or party please make sure you're working w/ Ashley Stokes, Maria Bautista, Jennifer Busanic, Maura Daley etc. they're a true powerhouse!

title: Always a good experience with Kimpton in NYC
text: This was my first stay at the Eventi. I have stayed at the Kimpton Muse a couple of times, so I assumed the stay would be a pleasant one. I was correct. The service was excellent. We were celebrating our 20th anniversary and the hotel sent up Champagne and cupcakes, which was very thoughtful. The staff in the lobby were very nice. The room was very clean and always made up by the time we returned. We had a double queen because we traveled with our teenage children. The room was not enormous but we managed without any issues. There was some space in front of one of the beds and the window was floor to ceiling so that helps make the room seem larger. The space between the closet and bed is tight. The bathroom was large and spacious. The entrance of the room is a long aisle the length of the bathroom so you do not walk right into the beds. My biggest complaint is the amount of storage space. My husband was the only one that unpacked. The rest of us lived out of our luggage because there are only a few shelves in the closet and two drawers. The closet was an ok size but since the space between the closet and the bed is tight, it wasn't worth unpacking completely. The hotel is a short walk away from Herald Square and all the subways that service that area, so that was very convenient. The neighborhood is not very touristy, it's in Chelsea. I liked that it was away from large groups of tourists. I will probably stay here again, and I recommend it.

title: Meeting in New York
text: Eventi people were great to work with for my meeting. All my guests enjoyed staying there for the rooms, the restaurants, and the bar. They all said they would stay there again. Great location - shopping, headquarters, food.

title: Customer Service lacking
text: The hotel is okay but displeased with customer service.  The hair dryer in my room did not work so I called for replacement.  It wasn’t arriving so I called back 20 minutes later and made sure they knew I had to leave for meeting. Assured me I would receive right away.  Called again 15 minutes later and again assured it would show up and was treated rudely. It did not show up and I ended up having to leave with wet hair into a very cold NY morning.  I also accidentally left earrings behind and not surprisely was not able to obtain from lost and found but disappointed because I was told two different times I would receive a call back about them but did not.

title: good location, nice room but not cheap
text: Stayed here for Business - Close to Penn Station. Good room, nice bar and room was good. Some of Business area was closed and the Meeting room was very cold. Quite a funky place and staff were very good. But expensive

title: Chelsea Must Stay!
text:
OUTSTANDING STAY at the Kimpton Eventi. Minutes walk from Penn Station. Easy access to subway. Courteous, professional check-in with an upgrade to a Premier One Bedroom Suite. Seamless check out and taxi hail to catch an early flight.
Loved the room:
•	Small hallway with closet (robes, luggage rack, safe, umbrella) feels like you’re walking to  your own little sanctuary. This insulates you from typical hotel hallway/elevator noise. You will hear some traffic noise, but it’s not unbearable—you’re in New York.
•	Floor to ceiling windows with privacy sheers and blackout curtains.
•	Substantial pocket doors affording privacy between living area and bedroom, between bedroom and bath area, and water closet.
•	Wonderfully clean with crisp, starched sheets
•	Rainshower next to a soaker tub

title: Superb Stay!
text:
This is our second stay at the Kimpton Eventi and it did not disappoint! 
The Hotel is located within walking distance to everything you want to see in NY. 
The Rooms are some of the largest standard rooms i have stayed in NYC, they are clean, sound proof and loaded with great amenities. We can't wait to book our trip back to the Kimpton soon!

title: Excellent, chic, well located hotel
text: Very cool hotel, with a helpful staff, modern and super clean room with an excellent rain shower. Free wine when we arrived certainly helped. Well decorated throughout especially reception. 12 blocks to Times Square and only 4 to the Penn train station. Highly recommended.

title: Wonderful surprise
text: So I had a free night to use.  Me and my wife decided to try a different brand with IHG because we usually go to one brand all the time.  We were wonderfully surprised at how nice the brand and hotel was we are looking forward to the next trip to try another location of this brand.

title: super hotel, super location
text: I always like Kimpton Hotels, and this is no exception.  It feels like an oasis on a busy, scaffolded block (that won't be there forever, presumably) that basically has mom and pop sized grocery, liquor, nail stores. The lobby is lovely, there are 2 restaurants/bars off it.  Our standard king room was larger than expected with a very large bathroom.  the fitness center is decent, although it could be a little larger for a hotel of this one's size.  i'll stay there again.

title: Home away from home
text:
I live in queens, when I work late or have early meetings I stay in the city. my go to place is the eventi!!! The rooms are clean quite and roomy for New York.. the lobby is buzzing and very hip.. the vine is my go to spot even when I am not staying... THE STAFF IS OUTSTANDING ..When I wak in the hotel I feel at home!! 

THANK YOU EVENITI

title: Customer Service is their priority and it shows!
text: We stayed at the wonderful Kimpton Hotel Eventi on President's Day weekend and loved everything about it.  We were given an upgraded room with a fabulous view of the Empire State Building.  Front desk staff member Marilyn was very personable, friendly and helpful with all my questions.  The Premier suite was spacious with a separate bedroom, a huge bathroom and two large TV's. The sleeper sofa was uncomfortable to sleep in but the manager Hanna made sure the housekeeper added padding and extra comforters to correct that.  All I had to do was ask!  The housekeeper did such an excellent job that it was 200% better the next evening.  I also asked if it was possible to get contact lens solution (forgot at home!) and was pleased to have some delivered within minutes to my door.  We wanted some missing candy from the Mini Bar and I wondered if I could get some from customer service.  The housekeeper across the hall immediately stopped what she was doing and got my candy!   Sunday brunch at L'Amico restaurant was excellent, both delicious and very filling..  Be sure to order Our Bread on the brunch menu.  A sweet treat enough for two or three and delicious doesn't even begin to describe it. Good location only a few blocks from Penn Station for train travellers.  This hotel has excellent customer service which extends from housekeepers to front desk staff to restaurant staff to the management.  Big thank you to John the manager for going above and beyond our expectations.  We will definitely return.

title: Great Hotel in NYC
text: This hotel has become my go-to spot in NYC. It's affordable, modern and has everything you need.  The location is great with quick access to the subway. The decor in this hotel is modern and industrial with two great restaurants. They have a delicious breakfast and I'm obsessed with their avocado toast. The service in the main restaurant is always really good.  But they also have a good wine list and appetizers. They have a wine happy hour which is a nice bonus. The staff is helpful and friendly.  The rooms are average size - seeming spacious for NYC and clean and modern with a walk in shower. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are quiet. The last trip I was here, the were full and I had to stay somewhere else and missed the Event very much.

title: NYC
text: Fabulous hotel and service.  Room was beautifully decorated.  Lobby and common areas are clean and crisp design with modern touches.  Breakfast in restaurant was delicious. All staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

title: Great Kimpton Property in NYC
text: We have stayed at this hotel multiple times on visits to NYC.  Just a 5 minute walk from Penn Station, it's location is perfect for people traveling to NYC by train as we often do. Staff are wonderful, rooms and amenities are great, the hotel restaurants are all good, and daily wine happy hour is a treat and perfect before a dinner or night on the town.

title: Excellent Staff & Great Location
text:
Great value! 

We had 5 rooms over 3 nights.   Everyone in our group had nothing back great things to say about hotel staff (front door team was awesome), restaurant quality, room quality, etc.  Pretty good bar scene in the evenings.    We will definitely stay here on our next visits.

title: Very nice, buzzy hotel
text:
We stayed in this hotel for a few nights before Christmas as part of a Virgin package deal. I did look at upgrading from the basic room but a few more sq ft of room was a lot of dollars which I felt could be spent elsewhere.  

The room, though small, was very well appointed and clean, as was the bathroom.  There was a card listing extras one could request and we asked for, and received, a coffee maker with coffee.  The hotel breakfast (not included in price) was expensive but very nice.  Due to ongoing health problems I wasn't well enough to do a lot so we ate in the hotel restaurants several times, can highly recommend The Vine (super Manager) but found L'Amico pretentious without any reason to be. There was a lot of noise from passing traffic and we were a fairway up not near ground level, but this is part of the fun of New York.  

Two criticisms. Firstly they allow pets in rooms.  The occupants of the room opposite us had a dog, but they rarely seemed to be in their room.  The room was close to the elevator and each time the dog heard even the tiniest noise it went mental.  The barking went on forever and we did speak to the front desk about this.  Perhaps if dogs are allowed in rooms they should be at the end of corridors where there will be  less footfall going past, it's not the animal's fault, they're in a strange room and hearing noises and doing what dogs do.  I do wonder what goes through the owners' minds "let's go to a strange hotel and leave the dog in the room all day and just hope for the best".  

Secondly, and this was our fault, we were persuaded on check out by the doorman to let him book a town car rather than a yellow cab to take us to the airport.  We were quoted a price + tolls.  When we arrived at JFK after a hugely circuitous route (there were delays on the freeway allegedly), the price was much more than we had been quoted and the tolls were double what we had been told, on top of the taxi fare. The total fare was almost double the quote.  Our fault, you live and learn.

A very nice hotel, helpful and polite staff in general, a buzzy, trendy hotel which we liked.

title: Slightly underwhelmed
text: We stayed at the Kimpton Eventi for three days. We did enjoy the central location. We liked the lobby atmosphere and the helpfulness of the front desk. The gym was decent with enough equipment to get a workout in. Our room was comfortable and the bathroom was spacious considering it is New York. The wine hour was not impressive with the same selection each night and a sleepy atmosphere. I would have liked to see the wine hour in the lobby or somewhere a little more lively. Past Kimpton's we've stayed at seem to have a nicer wine hour than here. There was not a doorman to help with our luggage. I guess we've taken this for granted in the past, at past Kimpton's, but you don't realize how helpful it is to have someone help with your luggage and hold the door. Overall, it was a good visit, but we were underwhelmed.

title: Wonderful Hospitality
text: I recently stayed at the Hotel Eventi for a work trip to the city. We traveled from Washington, DC and we’re exhausted upon arrival. Alex gladly assisted us immediately when we got off of the train by handling all of our bags and delivering them to the hotel. He was incredibly hospitiable and continued to show us a great time through all of our interactions even upon us leaving to head back home. He made our stay easy and it was a breath of fresh air to have someone so thoughtful and genuine helping us along our adventures.

title: A+ for Alex
text: My company just stayed at Hotel Eventi for a work trip and Alex, the front door man, really made our stay! He was so helpful, accommodating and couldn’t have been nicer. Definitely coming back thanks to him!

title: SO disappointed...
text:
I have been a long time fan of the Kimpton brand.  They have always proved to be trendy boutique hotels with devoted staff.  I was excited when IHG purchased the brand for the opportunity of a vehicle to collect points and earn free nights and upgrades.  

First off, the Kimpton Eventi is not in Chelsea, it is in Korea Town.  This is a common marketing ploy to make a location seem more desirable -- but this is not Chelsea.

The hotel has a trendy lobby with hip type restaurants and bars, but the room was somewhat tired.  The carpet in the room was stretched and buckling.  

We stayed in room 1702 on a chilly January night for my wife's birthday.  The room was cold when we left for dinner so we raised the thermostat.  When we returned later that night it was even colder.  By morning we were freezing -- no heat!  I told the woman at the front desk, she apologized and said she'd " take care of us" at checkout.  I assumed this was a one-off and had faith in Kimpton to make things right. 

A maintenance man came up shortly and proceeded to stand on the bathroom counter with his dirty boots and worked for about 20 minutes.  He finally informed us that the compressor was broken.  Upon check-out, nothing was offered to us.

I wrote numerous emails to IHG which were answered promising at least a call back from the Kimpton Eventi, but the hotel never felt it important enough to contact us.  Unfortunately, it appears as though the brand has regressed towards the mean and is now simply another Holiday Inn...typical mediocrity.  Alas, the Kimpton is not for me anymore.

title: Professional Staff
text: I have not had the pleasure of staying at this particular Kimpton hotel yet but I did have the pleasure of speaking with one of the guest service managers , Victoria T. , about a reservation adjustment for my son. Her professional , courteous and personable demeanor was greatly appreciated. We have always had excellent stays at other Kimpton properties in Boston. We look forward to a future stay at the Eventi which I am sure will more than live  up to our past experiences.

title: Great Chelsea Location
text: Great location on 6th (Avenue of the Americas) between 29th and 30th. Staff and bellman are very friendly and helpful. King rooms are on the small size and double Queens a little larger which I guess is to be expected in the city.  The Sun Sweet Fresh Market right across the street from hotel is a great place to eat at reasonable prices for eat-in or take out.

title: Beautiful Celebration at a Beautiful Hotel
text: I love the hotel, the room was nice and big.  Very roomy, very classy except the wallpaper - faded green.  You may want to change this for future business. I would work with Lisa Benoit again, she is a wonderful person and a great planner.

title: Comfortable hotel with great service
text: The reception, restaurants, and rooms are great. The staff is exceptional. they go out of their way to make sure that everything is right for you. Our organization holds an annual conference here, and the price is very fair.

title: nice hotel conveniently located
text: I stayed there shortly before Christmas. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I can always bring my dog, which is plus for me at any Kimpton Hotel. The room was small but clean. However, it was quite noisy as the hotel was extremely busy during this holiday season. We were able to reach all neighborhood attractions quite easily..

title: Great stay
text: Lovely room with a great view. The hotel bar and restaurant, the vine makes amazing food and provides awesome atmosphere. The hotel is Walking distance to tons of landmarks like the highline, Times Square and more!

title: Staff & Level of Service Make This Hotel
text: I love Kimpton hotels. As nice as the interior is, the staff really make the experience. I chose the Eventi for a business trip and, having stayed at many Kimptons previously, expected a warm welcome and top of the line service. What I received here was no different. Upon arrival, the concierge had already sent up a complimentary fruit tray and a bottle of wine to welcome me back (as a rewards member). I was also given a room with a nice view of the Empire State building. This particular property isn't my favorite in terms of the adjoining restaurant and bar but as always, I appreciated the wine happy hour and other small touches. During this particular visit I had problems with the heat in my room. I actually had to move twice because it was an extended stay and I didn't want to be cold during the entire time I was in my room. The second time it occurred I was very upset. At this point I had been traveling for over a week, was exhausted, and just wanted to relax. I explained this to them and noted I had never had this many problems at any other Kimpton properties. Johnny, the front office manager, promised to make it right to ensure I would visit again. He went above and beyond what I imagined, putting me in a huge suite with an amazing view. At this point I only had two more days in the hotel, but they were definitely relaxing and I actually looked forward to coming back. The suite, with floor to ceiling windows, a living room, giant bedroom, and giant bathroom was huge. I would recommend putting out the extra cash to stay here if you can-- I know I will in the future! I would be remiss not to note that the bellhop and doorman were also very polite and helpful. Thank you to all of the staff who helped make my stay special. See you again soon!

title: Bien mais...
text: Hotel excellemment situé à l'angle de la 6e et de Broadway. Vue sur l'Empire en prime. Les chambres (suite exécutive pour notre part) sont spacieuses et bien tenues. Attention l'eau en bouteille est payante (10us$ le litre). Très belle déco et salle de restauration. Le petit déjeuner est bon mais le choix restreint, pas à la hauteur du prix demandé (pour le buffet). La réception est fonctionnelle mais pas chaleureuse. Sympa le café et chocolat à discrétion dans le lobby toute la journée

title: Great location! Great Hotel!
text: Botique style hotel located in Chelsea. Great location and very close to Madison square garden. We walked to most of our destinations!  Our check in ran a little late-it was close to 5pm before our room was ready for us.  After that delay all was wonderful with our stay. As in any standard NYC hotel room, the rooms are on the smaller side but are beautifully decorated and have magnificent large windows. Our room was clean and very up to date. The lobby is warm and welcoming with multiple large comfortable leather couches. Besides the delay with our check in, we loved everything about this hotel.

title: Family Time at a Great Boutique Style Hotel
text: We stayed at the Kimpton Eventi Hotel for 5 nights. It was my Mom's first time to the U.S and I really wanted it to be a perfect experience for her. Special thanks to Victoria Tuchinsky for assisting us before our stay and coordinating a great arrival experience. She went above and beyond and embodies the purpose of high-level guest relations role. The hotel is in a great location. We liked the boutique feel it has. The restaurants were buzzing but the lobby experience remained private and inviting. Other special thanks to the Housekeeping team. They provided such quality and consistent service. Never missed a service or turndown. Would definitely recommend this property!

title: This is another outstanding Kimpton hotel. My spouse and I decided to stay at the property for New Years Eve, and we had
text:
Hotel- Kimpton Hotel Eventi (NYC)
Date- 31dec2018 – 01jan2019
Overall: This is another outstanding Kimpton hotel. My spouse and I decided to stay at the property for New Years Eve, and we had a great experience.  

Accommodations- Excellent.  We were assigned a One Bedroom Suite at check-in, and the room was spacious and thoughtfully designed. The bed was comfortable; the bathroom had a shower (no tub).  The bedroom closet was small but met our needs. Wine hour was paired with NYE hats and noise makers, and the guests were very happy.
IHG Rewards Club Recognition- Excellent. We were acknowledged for our loyalty, and our Reward Night room was upgraded. At around 7p, an Inner Circle amenity containing 3 small cupcakes, a box of chocolates, and both a still and a sparkling water arrived at our room. We were disappointed to learn that no Complementary Chef’s Taste was offered for IC members, as the Kimpton website states, but the restaurant food was very good. The Newspaper was not delivered but was instead available in the lobby.
Staff- Very good.  The hotel and staff were very busy, as was the lobby with many guests, but the staff handled the volume effectively.
Housekeeping- Excellent.  The room and bathroom were very clean in appearance.  Adequate toiletry quantities were provided (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, tissues, & toilet paper), and the floor and baseboards were clean. 
Pool/Gym- not evaluated
Breakfast/Meal Options- Very good.  At The Vine restaurant, we ordered the cod and the hangar steak meals, along with some appetizer cocktail shrimps & fried octopus; it was very tasty.  My one complaint for the hotel staff is that the complementary morning coffee and tea in the lobby was promptly taken away at 9a.  While this may be appropriate for most other weekdays, as I sipped mine, I watched from the lobby as many guests were rendered displeased. Some resorted to the hotel “Coffee bar;” many chose nearby coffee shops instead.
Laundry- not evaluated
Computer/Printer/WiFi- WiFi was strong throughout the hotel.
Property Appearance- Excellent.
	Exterior- From the outside looking inward, this hotel is a bustling, yet inviting, mecca of activity.  The entrance was clean, and the property was appropriately branded.
	Interior- The lobby was very pleasant, but frequently busy enough for guests to be struggling as they attempted to bring luggage through the crowd, especially for those arriving in the evening.

title: Gutes Effizientes Hotel
text: Gut gelegenes Hotel mit gutem Restaurant Italienisch oder American Style im Hotel. Gute Konferenzmöglichkeiten. Sehr vieles in Walking Distance für Touristen respektive gut gelegen. Guter Spaziergang zur 5th Avenue zum Centralpark und Quartierwechsel zu erleben. Enjoy!

title: Snazzy stay in upper Chelsea
text: The Kimpton Eventi is a very lively spot on the West side of Chelsea.  We stayed two nights and it was always hopping from the coffee shop to the wonderful onsite Italian restaurant to the late night bar scene.  Our room was small but well-designed and very comfortable.  We had a lovely view of the Empire State building out one of our windows.  The location was very convenient to both downtown and uptown activities with tons of subway choices close by in Herald Square.  We truly loved the vibe of the place.  A good, stylish choice.

title: Our new NYC hotel!!!
text: Since we often travel as a family (which includes our doggie) we need a pet-friendly hotel. Since we have a teen, we also prefer a suite for privacy. Stayed at another NYC pet-friendly hotel last year, but we were looking for something a little less utilitarian and more stylish. Eventi did not disappoint! From front desk staff to management, everyone is super friendly and warm. The lobby is gorgeous, and L’Amico is delicious! Our suite was just perfect. We can’t wait to come back. Thanks Eventi!

title: Warm and cozy
text:
This property has a great location and is within walking distance to many of the city’s great destinations! The lobby is always busy with people enjoying the couches and chairs and the great atmosphere. The staff at the front door and the front desk are very friendly and helpful! I attended a conference at this hotel. The conference rooms are nice for small groups. Unfortunately the rooms have BIG columns in them...which somewhat limit the use of the room. 
The sleeping rooms are small but well designed with big windows to lighten up the room. The bathrooms are large and very beautiful! Big showers in NYC are a real treat! 
The elevators are BUSY and SLOW! I found using the stairs to be much quicker! 
Great spot!

title: Wonderful place but even more impressive is the staff
text: Large rooms and bathrooms with rain showers.  The rest of the hotel has amazing art and details but the best part is the staff.  Marilyn, Gia, Christiana and especially Allen all went out of there way to ensure my stay was nothing less than incredible.  This is why the Eventi is and remains to be my NYC home away from home. Just booked my next stay.

title: Impressive
text: We had a five nights stay at this extremely impressive centrally located hotel. Our stay was amazing, well sized tidy room with a very clean bathroom. Iron and kattel were also available. Complementary breakfast on the first day was nice of them. Highly recommended.

title: Good, but with some issues.
text: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Kimpton Eventi from the 17th - 23rd December. It has a lot of good points to it -, wine hour, spacious rooms and bathrooms, friendly staff but then there are things that let it down. At time of booking I advised I needed a twin room however when we got there it was a double room and it was going to be 2 days before they could do anything about it so we decided that we didn’t want to be bothered moving rooms in 2 days, after all I was travelling with a best friend who I have known for 30 years and is more like a sister to me so for us, no major issue but this could have been an issue for someone else in different circumstances. The next day we returned to the hotel at 4pm having left at 9am to discover the room not made up etc - staff did not seem to see this as an issue so in effect my friend did the room and someone got round to bringing us towels. There was also an incident where my friend was called crazy (and not in a funny, oh how we laughed kind of way) when the trainee Barista made her coffee with cold water and she asked for it to be remade with hot water - imagine that. It’s not what I have come to expect as a frequent visitor to NYC. That being said I want to give a shout out to the lovely Marilyn on reception and to Captain Kirk for his good humour, help with all our bags and transfers to the airport.

title: Best experience ever!
text: Alex is awesome! He single handily made our trip!! The hotel is beautiful and all the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!! Conveniently located, easily accessible, smiling staff, great food and really good mimosas..

title: One of the worst serviced hotels we have been to.
text: The hotel is decent looking. But in terms of service- forget it. When you call reception from the room it takes more than 5 minutes for them to answer the phone. So much so that we used our mobiles to call the hotels external number which is answered before the phone from the room. Can’t wait to check out tomorrow. It’s not worth the money.

title: Hotel
text: Everything was great and the staff was wonderful.  We enjoyed our stay at the Kimpton Hotel. The food was great and the cocktails were also good.  The room was comfortable and clean.  Ever staff that we come in contact with was great.

title: Beautiful!
text: Recent visit to this beautiful hotel, looks straight out of magazine. Wanted to get information on amenities etc. and Leilani was extremely helpful and very professional. Highly recommend! Thank you Leilani!!!

title: Weekend Getaway
text: Eventi at 851 6th Avenue is a perfect for a weekend getaway.   It is located within walking distance of numerous attractions.  The rooms are very well appointed (#2303 has an amazing view of the city), the coffee bar is amazing and the staff were helpful and friendly.

title: Modern
text: Very modern style hotel.  Located near many restaurants... better than the ones in the hotel.  Hotel staff were nice, but the front desk always seemed busy, so checking in & out was a little slow.  Room was very nice.

title: We had a great time
text:
As others have written it is in a great location. You can walk everywhere. We walked to dinner and breakfast. It is a real fun, cutting edge and trendy hotel. The staff were great and attentive. Starting with check in Kevin was the best, efficient and fun to talk to. At the wine hour, we went, but was pretty sure we couldn't drink anything due to dietary constraints. But when we asked Stephanie felt so bad she went out of her way to find us something to drink, which she did.
The room was the size of a typical NYC hotel room but with an amazing view of the city

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel in a great location. Room was small but not by nyc standards and it was clean, well appointed, lots of shelves and outlets, and we had a high floor room with great city views. Wine hour was a lovely perk as was morning coffee. Staff were welcoming and helpful and again the location was just perfect!

title: Awesome
text: Five start customer service, Leilani Santiago, super friendly and helpful. My husband lost his passport and we informed her and she was in top of every single detail to help us find it. Very thankful :)

title: A great location, nice hotel with good service
text:
Just back from a one week stay here on the lead up to Xmas 
The hotel is in a fantastic position if your plans involve the whole of New York, in the past we’ve stayed around time square, which is generally too far from anything down town - so definitely recommend the location 
Cost was reasonable for a hotel in its location, internet was originally confusing because you had to be a IHG member to get it for free (although it’s free to register) - but was great once registered.  Free coffee and hot chocolate in the morning, and wine in the evening was a nice touch.  It was also our honeymoon, and were greeted with champagne and cheese/chocolate on arrival which again was a nice touch. 

The one slight negative was that reception area was very small, so always very busy and crowded, and as someone who is used to finding somewhere to get my head down and do a bit of work in a hotel reception it was more difficult than usual.  But that is minor.

Try and get a higher floor room - with Empire State Building views - they are exceptional, and blueberry muffins from the coffee shop too - they were special. 
Would absolutely stay here again if the price was reasonable

title: Chic hotel with good vibe
text:
We visited NYC to see holiday sites.  I chose this hotel for its location and good reviews and was not disappointed.  Our room had a great view of the city but there are plentiful windows in all rooms and hallways.  The room decor is modern and tasteful.  The beds are comfortable and I always appreciate reading lights. There are nice touches like umbrellas and yoga mats in the closet. 
The Italian restaurant L’Amico just off the lobby was quite good.  The deli across the street is terrific.

title: Best Birthday Ever at Kimpton Hotel Eventi
text:
I booked a suite at the KImpton Hotel Eventi to celebrate my niece's 25th birthday. I chose the Eventi because I've had lunch there on several occasions.  The food is excellent and the staff is attentive and friendly.  When planning her surprise birthday celebration, I immediately thought of the Eventi because of it's stylish decor, great location and the vibrant energy that greets you when you enter the lobby. The added bonus is the incredibly thoughtful staff, Paulina, Gia and Allan, who took time to meet with me to select the best room and told me about all of the amenities available at the hotel and in the neighborhood. They also included special touches to make sure that this birthday was memorable. The suite was chic with a view of the empire state building. There was a living area and a large well-appointed bathroom (double vanities, marble shower).  My niece was elated with the suite and the special treatment.  I even received a follow up call from the manager Allan Rodriguez to ask how everything went.  

Outstanding service, beautiful rooms, great location at an affordable price are unbeatable!  I highly recommend the Kimpton Hotel Eventi

title: THINGS HAVE STARTED TO SLIDE
text: I have stayed at this hotel at least five times in the past three years and I really like the vibe of the Kimpton brand.  My most recent trip was a big disappointment.  I booked a Premier suite through Chase Ultimate Rewards and was given a regular suite with one sink when I checked in.  This was for three women to share for four days which is why I booked a premiere suite that is larger and has double vanity etc...When I called the front desk they apologized said it was the fault of Chase but still offered to make it right with a credit and some "amenities."  I said that sounded great and that I had planned to pick up a bottle of champagne to celebrate my friend's arrival, but if they could send one up great!  The Manager said great no problem and I'll send up some cheese and fruit as well, tomorrow between 2-3pm when we usually send out amenities.  Great, my friends arrived, we waited in our hotel room, no delivery, we went out for lunch returned, no delivery.  We called, they had to check and get back to us, no delivery.  After another phone call to check up on it, they bring a bottle of $6 red wine and three stale cupcakes at 9:30pm when we were already gone.  SUPER lame and disappointing, why give me lip service if you weren't going to do it.  If I had known would have gone out and purchased a nice bottle for us like I was planning.  over promised, and under delivered.  In addition to all of this, the rooms are starting to look a bit run down, the floor made a bizarre noise when you walked on it because all of the adhesive has released and it squishes under foot, room 812, check it out.

title: Excellent Kimpton hotel in NYC
text: Had the opportunity to stay for 2 nights at the Eventi to attend meetings in Hudson yards, which is a 15 minutes walk from the hotel. Exterior of hotel was very busy with clients and diners on arrival but the front-staff was efficient and polite in checking me into my room. Lobby was small and a trifle loud perhaps because it was flanked by two restaurants/bar. Assigned room was also on the smaller side but was nicely decorated (modern motif) and clean. Work desk was located in the corridor leading to the sleeping area, which is not my preference but room had several power outlets located throughout the room. Lighting was good but climate control was sluggish. Wifi required a charge (no thanks). Bathroom had a rain shower but located inside a tub! There was also limited space around the sink that required I left my wash kit outside the bathroom. Food at both restaurants (L'Amico for dinner and Vine for breakfast) were very good.

title: Amazing views from our great room
text:
We’re Kimpton members and this is their best hotel in NYC. We had an amazing room on a high floor with a brilliant view of Empire State and view down 6th Avenue where we could see One Observatory.
Room very clean and good firm bed.
Complimentary Coffee and hot chocolate in the morning. Wine hour was not hosted in the lobby but a few floors up so there was more space for guests to mingle and enjoy the complimentary wine and very good warm apple cider with a shot of bourbon. 
A modern hotel with a great feel. Friendly staff and great service.

title: Wine Hour, Check In, and Overall Experience
text: Let me start with the Wine Hour (between 5-6pm on the 4th floor). Val and Victoria hosting the wine bar were beyond amazing. They greeted us right away and within 10 minuets, I felt like I was chatting with old friends rather than a couple people I just met. They offered recommendations for everything from lunch the following day to the best little bars for our night out. I honestly can’t say enough good things about Val and Victoria. They truly made us feel welcomed. And truthfully, it’s this kind of friendliness that we experienced since check in. Vanessa helped get our rooms situated and coordinated our check in. And she couldn’t have been more helpful or more polite. She was an excellent communicator for when we could expect to check in, and then called us (as promised) as soon as our room was available. We’ve been here for about 10 hours and I would whole heartedly recommend this spot to anyone (especially if you can make the happy hour. Vick and Val are legends!)

title: Cool boutique-feeling hotel
text: The Eventi is a great Chelsea hotel conveniently located close to MSG.  The two restaurants are very good, and the bar has a cool vibe.  Our suite was very nicely appointed, however, the bed was somewhat uncomfortable.

title: Fantastic Stay.
text:
We stayed at the Kimpton eventi for 4 nights in December. We arrived at 10.30pm to the hotel and it was full of a Christmas party. The hotel was also at full capacity and the room I booked wasn't available so they upgraded us to a suite for the night. The next day we moved to a room on the 14th floor with amazing views of the city and the empire state building. 
This hotel is in a great location and the food/drink was brilliant. 
It has a great vibe to it and every member of staff we met were polite and helpful but a special mention to Marilyn and Francisco who always went above and beyond to help us. We would love to come back to this hotel. It's got everything you could need. Thank you for helping make our stay so memorable.

title: Awesome Kimpton Property
text: Our stay at another Kimpton property was once again a great hit. We chose this Kimpton for it's awesome location, walking distance to so many of NYC's attractions, Bryant Park, Soho, Chelsea Market, ect and they are incredibly pet friendly. We arrived pretty early around 11am since we had lunch reservations nearby. Luckily, they allowed us early check in with a room on the 12th floor with awesome views of the Empire state building. We drove in with our car and was able to valet park overnight for $50. Once we got our pup settled into the room, we headed out to grab lunch and explore all the city holiday decorations. We walked to Bryant park and Rockefeller center. We were celebrating our babymoon, and the staff left us cupcakes and delicious chocolates with a handwritten card. It was a small but wonderful gesture that we greatly appreciated. I also love the Kimpton toiletries. Paraben free and smells so good. One thing to note is that this Kimpton is on a very busy avenue and the windows do not seem to be soundproof. From the 12th floor we heard honking all day and night. Luckily, I was so exhausted from the day that I slept like a rock, but if you are a light sleeper, be aware. We made reservations for brunch at L'amico which is one of the restaurants on the premises. The Vine is another one of the restaurants available. The interior of both restaurants looked amazing and were packed at all hours of the day. Reservations highly recommended. The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing and I would definitely come back for them. However, I just noticed on the reviews that they offer a breakfast bufet for $30. That would have been good to know. I don't believe anyone informed us of this at the front desk. Also they offer wine between 5-6 on the 3rd floor.

title: Modern and enjoyable
text: Stayed here on a recent work trip. Check-in was a breeze. Room was very nice. Comfy bed. Big shower. Plenty of closet and drawer space. Lobby was a great place to grab a drink at the bar and chill. Also, lobby has fruit infused water most of the day and coffee/hot chocolate with marshmallows in the morning. Conference rooms were plenty big as well.

title: The place to be in NYC with a dog
text: We had so much fun here. The staff made us and our dog feel very welcome.  Great location with breakfast vendors nearby and Chelsea Market a short walk.  NYPD station  around the corner.  Friendly lobby with coffee in the morning.  Beds and food bowls provided for the dog.

title: Marilyn is the best
text:
We won't be staying until December 7 but I had to give a shout out to Marilyn at the front desk.  I was researching the hotel and couldn't get any detailed answers from anyone on the phone(who just read from the web site)until I talked to Marilyn.  She gave me detailed information about the hotel and room.  Her attitude convinced us to stay at this hotel.  We look forward to meeting her and staying at your property.
Thanks, Shannon and Darrell

title: Great location for train access.
text: The location is very convenient to Penn Station.  The vibe is decidedly of its location, which is fine as long as you're seeking a lively (perhaps noisy), frenetic experience. Breakfast was a bust, but dinner in the Italian restaurant was pleasant.  Convenient to a number of attractions on foot, and there are decent restaurants nearby.

title: fantastisk New Yorker atmosfære
text: Føler New York helt under huden på dette sted med autentisk personale og super atmosfære. Dejlige restauranter og 100% tæt på alt 😊🇺🇸anbefales højt og kommer gerne igen da stemningen er så fed og personalet venligt og hjælpsom når man spørger om råd.

title: Luxury in a central location
text: We stayed 5 nights in this fabulous hotel. The experience was faultless. The room was large for New York (which means quite compact) with huge windows and a view to die for - of the Empire State Building and city skyline. The location was superb in Chelsea, near Penn Station. We enjoyed the complimentary wine  hour in the lobby and the veranda - a great rooftop space. The service was exemplary, as was the cleaning - it was spotless. Highly recommend and would love to return.

title: Hotel in Manhattan
text: I stayed here for a day and half. did a late check out but had to pay for the 2nd day too. its policy so ok. the standard rooms are ok, a wee bit below my expectations though, given the price. but its Manhattan so cant complain. overall the hotel was good and more imp the staff was help full. it has an resto/bar inside the hotel and another Italian resto/bar attached. so good options to eat

title: Another wonderful stay
text: The Eventi is my go-to NYC hotel. The location is central, and the rooms are nice, but the customer service truly makes the hotel the best. They're friendly even when the lobby is a madhouse, they remember my preferences from previous stays, and they go out of their way to make sure that guests have a positive experience. I travel frequently for work, and I always feel more relaxed and more at home when I'm at the Eventi.

title: Welcome upgrade; wear and tear knocks off a point
text:
I booked a city view room and got an upgrade to a 40 or so square meter 1-bedroom executive room on the 9th floor with a view of the outside theater below and surrounding buildings on 29th. 

Thank you, Eventi!

My room had 4-distinct areas -- a work area, a parlor, the bedroom proper and bathroom.

The work area's located along the long'ish hallway from the entry and had an ample sized desk with multiple drawers. The parlor had a small sofa, one chair, a table and a wall mounted TV. The mini-bar was also located in the parlor. The bedroom sported a king sized bed, another wall mounted TV, two side tables and a small closet. The bath had a stand-alone shower (no tub), a single vanity and a semi-enclosed toilet.

Hard product wise (e.g. water pressure, towels, quality of the toiletries, etc.), except as noted below, the Eventi lived up to expectations. Overall, the hotel/room was an agreeable place to start and end one's day in New York City.

Pluses/ Over-delivery: 

1/ The TVs had full (or almost full) cable. I had multiple flavors of HBO, for example. AMC and other staples were also on there. 

2/ Unlike some other hotels in New York City, the Eventi doesn't charge a fee for receiving and safe keeping packages for guests. While I don't usually receive packages at hotels, I did this time and the absence of a fee is appreciated.

Negatives:

3/ I found the in-room safe, which is located inside the closet, to be placed quite high-up. You'd have to be at least 5'10 or taller to be able to fully reach into the bowels of the safe to retrieve your stuff.

4/ Speaking of the closet, I found it a bit small. The closet's okay for hanging jackets and what not. But I had to use the built-in drawers in the "working" table to store clothes.  

5/ The cotton buds on offer as part of the toiletries are flimsy.

6/ The big negative was the visible wear and tear in the room. 

The wooden floor had multiple visible scuff marks, the table also had scruff marks, a lower portion of the bathroom door frame had been sheared right off and had not been fully repaired (it had been repainted however), and a seam in one of the sofa cushions had burst. 

Notes:

7/ I wish breakfast packages were available. When I booked thru IHG, breakfast packages were not on offer.

8/ Newspapers are provided in the lobby.

title: Hotel Eventi - Snowfall in the city
text: After a long day dealing with crazy traffic in the snow I checked into Hotel Eventi and all was right in the world! Great staff - friendly, helpful and efficient. I stayed in the beautiful Veranda room and although too cold to relax on the Veranda was able to make a snowman. And come on - is this bathroom not incredible? Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Awful service
text:
I made a reservation here for a very special family event coming up in early 2019. When i made the reservation i explained that we lived close enough to come by one day and see the type of room we’d reseved. I was assured it would be absoutely no problem.  The second time i called (a few weeks ago), the person at the desk said it would be ok but I’d need to let them know i was coming the day of so they could be ready.  
 
This morning i called (I’d taken off the day from work to look at the room) and was connected to the front desk as the phone rang and rang. No answer.
Called back twice and finally got someone who said no we couldn’t come by. When i pressed her and said we’d been told by two others we could come by, She said i had to call the sales office because only they could show us around. 

Called the sales office and asked them to call back asap so we could come by, no call back. Called the manager, nothing.  A whole day has passed and nothing. 

Such awful service and so completely disorganized.  We stayed at the kimpton in Philly for five days and loved it, but this hotel couldn’t be more different. In philly the staff was fantastic, professional and so well informed and helpful, and here it’s just the opposite.   No one seems to be in charge here or have any answers.
I’d absolutely stay away. We’re all Incredibly disappointed and now looking for a new place for our special occasion.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: I started traveling to the eventi when I worked nearby, but have continued to stay for personal and business whenever I can. They staff is exceptional. I have traveled for work all over the country, and this is my favorite hotel- hands down.

title: Can’t fault it
text: Great location, hipster lobby with bar and restaurant although couldn’t get a table at the Italian as fully booked so didn’t try it but had an adequate burger at the Vine. Rooms reasonable size, gym fully equipped and a great location. The only drawback was the breakfast - at $28 /head was a little pricey.

title: Cool
text: Hotel, room sizes larger than average, however I could hear the subway from my room on the 6th floor. Room is getting a bit old and dated, entrance door stuck, wardrobe lights not working etc, bed was comfortable, free tea and coffee in the am which was a god send. Would recommend staying here as very convenient to local attractions etc

title: A great Kimpton Experience
text: As a lover of the Hospitality Industry, I truly appreciate the Kimpton care and love I experienced this weekend! We were traveling for a weekend get away to explore the city and the front desk team was more than accommodating with recommendations for the must-see's of NYC. Complete with an amenity and a city view king room, it was out of this world special and will definitely be back for more :) Thank you Allan and team!!

title: Truly exceptional!!! Front desk beyond outstanding
text: The unbelievable experience began with Kevin at check in. This man is an asset to Kimpton!! Room was great, loved the coffee bar and wine happy hour, we will definitely return! Food in the restaurant was awesome too, great breakfast.

title: Kimpton Eventi is Simply the Best
text: I am a new fan of Kimpton since staying at two of them in Chicago. They seem to hire the very best people and just know how to take care of guests. That being said, the hotel Kimpton Eventi in Midtown is ths best of all of them. From the moment we checked in I was immediately impressed. We came in SO early just to drop our bags & were greeeted so warmly they offered to get our room ready early and asked what they could do in the meantime for us. Mind you, none of this was necessary...we were there hours before check in and had no expectation of early check in. We actually had lunch reservations and tickets to a matinee show. The Kimpton did not stop there. Later my husband and I were asking for a recommendation for an anniversary dinner, were given an amazing recommendation but Marilyn and Vanessa who work at the frint desk had wine and cupcakes sent to our room with the absolute sweetest note. I could literally list several other times the employees at the Eventi went above and beyond...during a 3 night stay bit would run out of spaces. Here is what you need to know. Rooms are immaculate, spacious by NYC standards, the perfect location for visiting the city especially for an event at MSG, or a home base for exploring all that NY has to offer. If you're nit going to NY...I would find the Kimpton in the city you're going to and book it.

title: Absolutely Outsanding
text:
Our family stayed here to enjoy a long weekend and what a wonderful choice it was.  The vibe was very relaxed, nice and a bit upscale.  We enjoyed the room and our fabulous view.  The location was perfect allowing us to get out to a few landmarks, museums and stores, making our stay even more special.  

The food at the restaurants was excellent.  We ate at both L’Amico and the Vine.  Our entire party enjoyed the food and desert. The service provided by the staff, specifically, Marilyn and Allan was impeccable.  Our children received such special care and attention which enhanced our visit.   It was simply amazing, we will be back !  Thank you so much for providing such a Wonderful experience,

title: Perfect Stay
text: We had the most wonderful night at the Hotel Event. After a long day out in the city, the staff, including manager on duty,made sure our check in process was fast and seamless and made us feel so welcome. The room was clean and beautiful with all the amenities you would want. Everything about the stay was fantastic!

title: Ok if you need to stay in mid town
text: The best thing to say about this hotel is its location. Also it's ambience in the lounge and bar is great. Unfortunately the rooms are disappointing although not cheap. Service is patchy. The one recommendation to the hotel is to get better quality cot beds that they set up for babies. The one I was given for my daughter looked like it was 30 years old and belonged in a hospital.

title: Best Midtown Hotel
text:
The Eventi gets better every time I stay. Great location, two good restaurants, front desk staff who try to accommodate your every need. despite being incorporated into the IHG model. From here you can walk most of Manhattan within 2 miles. Many bus and train options will take you faster. Close to times square but far enough away to be out of the craziness.  Kimpton properties continue to treat their guests in the manner of a boutique hotel, with evening wine hour and morning coffee and tea service in the lobby. The IHG connection is expanding Kimpton properties to Europe, which is promising for travelers who want to stay within this business model but travel oversees.
The Eventi is a great place to stay. If you haven't tried it, you should.

title: friendly staff
text: We enjoyed our stay at this well located hotel.Various attractions are within walking distance and subways are close by. Room was comfortable and very clean.Although located in the city, noise was never an issue. Lobby, restaurant and bar areas were bustling. Staff were very friendly and provided great service.

title: KEVIN rocks the front desk!
text:
Planned a stay for my wife’s birthday and a Springsteen visit. Super close to MSG/Amtrak. Great Hotel and Great service. Nice rooms, great bar/restaurant. And yes to the wine happy hour classic for Kimpton hotels.
Thanks Kevin for all the help!

title: Superb hotel for NYC
text: I had an excellent stay at the Eventi hotel for a short 3 day trip in the spring.  The location was ideal to reach many restaurants in the city and close to the subway and mid-town.  I ate at the restaurant one night and had an amazing meal with a superb wine. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating and helpful.  The room was particularly spacious for the city and impeccably clean. I will definitely stay here on another trip to NYC.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed here for a week and it was a great hotel. Location on 6th Avenue - walking distance to many good restaurants and located centrally if Manhattan. Rooms are clean and big and the service is efficient. Concierge really helpful with recommendations of shows and restaurants. Book a high floor to avoid the noise of the ongoing sirens from street level, but then again all hotels will have the same issue.

title: NYE
text: Fabulous hotel located within about 3 blocks from Madison Square Garden.  Super accommodating staff, luxurious rooms, great service.  Wish the lobby bar had served food later, but drinks were great there!

title: The staff made it.....
text:
We stayed here on a girlie trip to NY and from the minute we arrived with Allan and Brian singing happy birthday whilst hula hooping, to the day of departure nothing was too much.

Hotel staff always helpful and happy, nothing ever too much (BIG shout out to Kevin).

Rooms were perfect, clean and so quiet, beds very comfortable. Toiletries smelt delish! Lovely welcome gift on arrival too... lovely touch.

Food was wonderful too and clearly a popular place to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner as it was always packed.

Location was ideal.

I would not hesitate in recommending The Eventi to anyone.

Thank you for helping to make our trip to NY a memorable one.

title: Enjoyable stay!
text: Loved the vibe from the moment I walked it. The staff were super fun and friendly. Thanks Kevin for giving me a room with a Mediterranean view! ;) The rooms are quite comfortable, especially for New York. Location is great for walking to many great places. Seems like a great spot for locals to come and enjoy lunch and dinner too.

title: Great Service
text: Just wanted to thank Allan for the unbelievable service and accommodation when we had a change of plans. What a lifesaver. Great hotel and atmosphere. Can’t wait to come back. Thanks again Allan. Will come back!

title: Great hotel in Midtown
text: We stayed at the Kimpton Hotel Eventi for 3 nights,  Its a great hotel perfectly situated as is half way to everywhere!  Its beds are terribly comfortable, and the bathrooms nice and large.  The staff are welcoming and helpful.  Its the perfect choice if you are visiting the city for the first time, as its so central.

title: Excellent hotel, highly recommend!
text: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night and we had an exceptional stay. The room was beautiful, quiet, and sizable, and the staff was friendly and professional. We had the fortune of being under Gia and Allan's care, both of whom were super sweet and thoughtful. Thank you both for making our special night so memorable!

title: Nice room in good location
text:
We had not been to NYC in five years and were at a bit of a loss as to where to stay. The Event was in a good location - felt like real Manhattan, not Times Square, although not at all far from Times Square - close to the High Line, not a far jog from the West Side Highway, and in fact we walked basically everywhere from here, to the Whitney and ultimately all the way to One World Trade Center. 
The hotel itself has a small and somewhat crowded and loud lobby, but the staff is very nice. Did not eat or have a drink here - the outside bar was closed both Friday and Saturday evening for private events, which was a bummer but oh well. The room was really nice and larger than we have had before in New York (we also paid more than we have ever paid, but then again, it has been five years). Definitely felt hip and happening without being off-putting. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The only "meh" thing was the bathroom had one of those sliding "barn" doors and it was quite heavy and hard to move - we were going to call the front desk because it was almost getting stuck, but really were just too busy to bother and it wasn't that big of a deal. I would definitely stay here again if we were in a position to splurge a bit.

title: Our NYC Go-To Hotel
text: We come to NYC a few times a year as a weekend getaway. We used to stay in mid-town but, over the years, have decided that staying in Chelsea makes for a more fun experience.  The Eventi has become our go-to hotel. The rooms are chic and quiet.  If you are travelling with kids, the two queen-bed setup makes things easier (and is rare). The lobby always has a good scene going. The wine hour and morning coffee are nice perks.  The hotel's location makes walking in this fun city an easy thing to do, whether you're going to a fancy dinner in mid-town, to walk on the High Line, or over to the Convention Center.  The outdoor plaza and rooftop terrace are great if you're here in warm months, too. Stay here, and you won't regret it!

title: Excellent two night stay
text: Elegant hotel, excellent service, love the wine hour in the evening and the coffee in the lobby in the mornings.  Our room was very quiet; beautifully appointed with high quality appointments and products, loved the bathroom especially.  I do however feel that the WiFi in a hotel of this caliber should be included, and the music channels on the TV also are only available for an additional cost - an extra charge just to listen to music!  I feel that to nickel and dime guests for WiFi and music channels cheapens the Kimpton brand, frankly.

title: Great hotel, service lacking
text:
This is a good fun hotel, well placed and good sized rooms. 

This was a lovely and loud hotel with a great atmosphere and lively lobby. My room was great, good comfortable bed, quiet and great black out curtains. Well stocked mini bar. Good hotel gym. 

But the service is lousy, from the time I got out of the taxi, to check in, to the delay in getting a simple coffee. A real shame.

title: An amazing checkin
text: I arrived around dinner with my golden doodle after having just surprised my daughter with my visit to nyc for her bday. The checkin by Leilani and Allen was amazing.
