They upgraded me to a suite as a surprise. When I walked into the gorgeous huge room with a wraparound deck I was in shock. We will have to continue the birthday celebration today with a brunch in the room!

title: Not Good!
text: What an awful experience at this hotel. Firstly, the hotel is constantly filled to capacity in the lobby area with persons who are clearly not guests of the hotel. There is no swipe card requirement to access the hotel floors so anyone can wander around the hotel room floors. Reception were particularly rude, lacking any desire to assist and certainly giving an arrogant demeanor. Not welcoming at all. Service at the breakfast restaurant is desperately slow. We experienced the extremely slow pace of service twice (once when we sat down for breakfast and once when we picked up). The rooms are tiny (even by New York standards). We booked a car to take us to the airport on departure. When the car and driver arrived he was told by the hotel porter to leave and circle around so that they could attempt to upsell their own vehicles parked at the front. The only silver lining is the housekeeping staff who are extremely friendly. We also enjoyed dinner at l'amico.

title: Great Service!
text: Great place, great location and even better service! They were very attentive and very thoughtful! The staff is truly friendly and helpful. Leilani made us feel right at home! It made a difference to out trip. Glad to have encountered such nice people.

title: Best Customer Service
text: When we stay at a Kimpton, we always get the best service. The staff is friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel is in a grest location and our room was great. The rooftop happy hour was a nice touch. I highly recommend the Eventi.

title: How a boutique hotel should be!!!
text: It seems almost Not worth writing another stellar review for a kimpton property. But this  Wonderful boutique hotel in New York is a little bit special even among all the special properties. The staff is stellar and sophisticated and seasoned. The concierge is top notch the restaurant is really posh but not stuffy. Everything about this little kimpton gem is notable. I highly recommend it

title: Good location, good gym, but otherwise average
text:
I have historically used IHG hotels, and now that Kimpton is part of the portfolio, I decided to give them a try when visiting New York.

This hotel has several lovely touches, but there are other areas where the experience just does not live up to the hype.  When we checked in, we were told our room was not available, but we left our luggage in storage.  When our room was finally available, it took us quite a few calls to trace our luggage and get it to the room itself.  They have a turn-down service, but they never cleared half-eaten food from our room during turn-down or the daily cleaning.  The gym was quite good - it was a great space to work out, although not having water in the gym was not ideal.  The spa looks nice, but they could not take our bookings.  We had to call a number which we tried several times and it was simply never answered.  The onsite restaurants are excellent, however.

I always ask the question whether I would return, and the answer is probably not.  I think you can obtain a considerably better experience for only marginally more, elsewhere.

title: Location great
text: I was there for a business conference.  The facility was excellent.  The room itself was old but updated.  The bed was very comfortable.  It took about 10-15 mins to get to Times Square so very convenient.  Lots of pets.  Room service was expensive but I guess that’s NY for you.  There is a fresh market across from the hotel was was excellent.  Manhattan traffic is horrible.   Don’t even think about driving here, you’ll be very sorry.

title: Wonderful experience
text: Service was perfect with all the special touches for a exceptional visit to New York City. Great location, very friendly and on top of our every need. A perfect holiday. L’Amico next door was fantastic as well and became a favorite for their Pasta Bolognese.

title: A fantastic short break
text:
We’ve just come back from a short trip to New York and we stayed at the Kimpton Eventi. What a fabulous hotel! The staff were so so helpful, nothing was too much trouble. It was for my birthday and we arrived to a bottle of champagne in our room and some lovely cupcakes. 

Kevin at reception was particularly nice, but the rest of the staff, from doormen to waiting staff were excellent.
The rooms were very very nice. Beds extremely comfortable and a fully stocked, if expensive, mini bar.
We only ate breakfast once at the hotel but it was delicious. The atmosphere within the hotel was lovely. It was pretty central as well which was perfect.
Would highly recommend it!

title: Minor delay-Excellent Stay!
text: A minor delay at check-in for all guests was solved. The front desk staff was very professional and courteous  in handling it.  The location is super as other reviews have stated.  Very close to Madison Square Garden (Penn station) which worked perfectly for us to attend a concert and use the train.  Nice upgrade to a room with a view of the Empire State Building. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was very good. The room was very clean and comfortable.  An excellent stay and we will would surely stay here again!

title: Good hotel,as usual, with some issues
text: I am a fan of Kimpton  Hotel in North America. Eventi is ok with few issues: check in only after 3pm with a lot of customers waiting in the (quite) small  room at the entrance. Many guests check out at 9am or earlier: thus to let at least returning customers in a bit earlier would be nice. Room fine, as usual, with an overpriced bottle of water (not mineral) at the shocking price of 10$. No kettle in the room (an old issue with Kimpton hotels...). Free coffee at main lobby only until 9.20 am...

title: Great staff!
text:
I enjoyedmy stay here, room was clean and staff were friendly!  We attended a wedding with family. 
The Italian  restaurant is so convenient on the main floor.  Breakfast service was okay, hostess or manager seemed nit prepared with our group.  Didn’t even had a chance to have coffee ... oh I did from my daughter’’s cold coffee.  

Room was lovely though!

title: Top
text:
Super hotel belle chambre propre super service vraiment beaucoup de gentillesse du personnel j ai beaucoup aimé mon séjour zéro faute bravo 
A nY les chambres sont souvent petites et la pas du tout de l’espace à NY c’est super luxe d’avoir de l’espace . 
Je reviendrai dans cet hôtel avec grand plaisir

title: A KIMPTON MOMENTS
text:
From the moment we arrived, mum and I were greeted with a big warm welcome. Nothing was too much trouble for Johnny, Allan, Kevin and the Team. The doorman Alex went out of his way to suggest options to watch a movie, order Taxis's and generally beam a big smile every day. Kevin; a Brooklyn local, is not only the concierge, he is also the amazing artist in resident. Check out Kevin's fabulous drawings in a diary in the lobby which posts the daily location for 'the hour of power' aka 'wine hour' 5-6pm. This complimentary wine hour can be on 3,4 or 5th floor. Allan often hosts 'the hour of power' he is also known to rock out the hula hoops and gives us quick demonstration. He's actually quite good. 

The hotel is centrally located. We walked almost everywhere. The rooms were spotlessly clean. The Eventi hotel has exceptional maids, always thoroughly clean. The room service was swift and delicious. 

L'Amico restaurant turns out great Italian food. I tried almost everything on the menu that was vegetarian during my stay. 

Seriously I don't think I've stayed in such a well oiled hotel where everything runs so fast and seamlessly smooth at the same time. You will not regret a single moment staying at the Eventi. Big thumbs up from me. I just can't wait to come back.

title: Excellent Eventi! Will come back!
text: We stayed at the Eventi for a quick weekend getaway. As far as location- this is super close walking distance to Madison Square Garden so if coming for a concert, this is a great spot. It's also off the beaten path to Times Square and Theatre district so it is quiet, but still walkable to those things. I always stay at Kimptons but never tried the Eventi- super quiet hotel in NYC (relative to other areas)- close to all things you want to do. For those Peloton lovers out there, the studio is .2miles away- easy walk to do a great bike ride! The rooms were reasonably clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff were just super sweet. We did not eat at the restaurant but mainly because we could never get in- it was always packed, so we assumed it was good- will try next time. All in all, our stay was great and we would definitely stay here again.

title: Four year wedding anniversary upgrade thanks to Hannah D.
text:
We arrived at the Hotel. It was very nice, modern, and clean. On account of our wedding anniversary Hannah Degannes hooked us up with a great upgrade that included an additional living room.

The location was fantastic as it was two blocks away from Madison Square Garden, where we were heading.

I will definitely stay there again, if I need a midtown hotel.

title: Good hotel at a good location
text:
The friendly staff checked me in at a small reception desk. There are two restaurants on the ground floor - I didn’t eat in eitjer of them. Did have a draft beer in the bar which set me back $12 plus tax plus tip, a good $15. Thought that was a bit excessive. My room was on the 20th floor and had a nice view. Size of the room was good and everything in a good state. Bathroom had a walk-in shower. 

My visit coincided with the UN summit and Trump visit so the room prices were spectaculair - price value was a bit out of balance that week. 

The empire state building is nearby and there is a metro station in the area. At 10
Minutes walk is Madison Square Garden. 

Overall a good hotel at a good location but nothing spectaculair.

title: Clean room
text: Stayed here for a mini getaway with my husband. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was so clean and smelled very good. Stayed for 4 nights, our housekeeper li li always do a fabulous job, whenever we return our room was always spotless clean and smelled good! I will sure return again! Getting a taxi was quick, bellboys very helpful.

title: Great mid town hotel with nice restaurant & bar
text:
I’ve stayed at the Eventi many times on business trips to NYC. 

It is everything you would want from a city hotel:

- central location (5 mins from Times Sq, 10 mins from Flat Iron)
- friendly staff who make you feel at home 
- spacious rooms with big desks and nice bathrooms 
- great restaurant with nice room service option 
- easy to use gym with all the gear 
- openair terrace that you can sip wine on in the summer
- they are now part of IHG loyalty programme which is great for frequent travellers 

My only suggestion to travellers is try walking outside of midtown for dinner - areas like Chelsea or Soho. You’ll find a lot more restaurants and bars than in midtown.

A super hotel that I can recommend 100%.

title: Always the best place to stay
text:
The Eventi hotel on 6th Ave has been a go to spot for me for years. Located near the NY office of my company the location is tremendous. Close to Herald Square (lots of subways) walkable to Chelsea as well as Time Square. Near Madison Square Garden/Penn Station and Port Authority.

But more than the location and the appointment of the rooms, the staff will go to the end of the earth to welcome you, remember you and help you how ever you need. Kevin, Leilani, Allan and Gia are all people you can count on.

Now that I have moved to NY I still enjoy their world class restaurants for breakfast, dinner and drinks.

Do yourself a favor and stay at the Eventi!

title: Not as nice as we expected!
text:
I had stayed at the Kimpton Eventi in the past and it was nice. It has a modern dark sultry modern vibe. Great restaurant and staff!

This time it was overly crowded-the room needed some maintenance-the floors looked like they they did not even clean them-the rooms needed more lights-something was wrong with the plumbing because every time someone above us ran the water the pipes would rattle and it sounded like they were going to burst. Which leads me to believe they had once had an issue since there was a big crack in our ceiling with water damage. Also maintenance had to come to our room one day and interrupted our only day we stayed in because of the rain. Apparently our bathroom was leaking downstairs so maintenance had to come into our unit to access the problem which took a few hrs. Mattress super uncomfortable-not plush or comfy and bad pillows! :(

As for the staff the only reason I gave it 3 stars is because the staff was incredibly nice and went out of their way. The staff and restuarant was outstanding and I would give them 5 stars.

So for the $$$ I feel you can get a much better hotel for the money.

title: Outstanding customer service and amazing hotel
text: It was my wife’s 30th birthday and our anniversary so I called ahead and talked to Christina at the front desk. She was absolutely amazing. I asked if we could do something since it was my wife’s 30th birthday and Christina went above and beyond to get us an amazing room and made our stay extremely special. The best customer service I have ever experienced !

title: The Bloom Is Off The Rose
text:
One more day left of a several day stay, which is a return visit from when the Eventi was a true Kimpton hotel. Though I've loved it in the past, it seems the Eventi is not up to what it once was.

The location is outstanding, and the hotel itself is attractive and in solid shape. There are good restaurants in the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. The service is a bit of a mixed bag.

I reserved the executive suite, and though I arrived after 3pm my room was not ready. I was offered a temporary room with the promise that the next day I could swap out for an upgraded suite, even better than the one I reserved. I was promised many more treats to make up for the inconvenience.

Sounds like not a bad deal, right?

But the next day at 3pm my upgrade suite was still not ready. So that's the second day in a row of my room not being ready on time. Worse still, I'd checked out of the temp room that morning as asked to, so I've gone half a day without any room at all.

We had to remind staff more than once that we'd requested a coffee maker in room. We also needed sheets for the pullout for our daughter, and despite being told on 3 occasions that housecleaning would make the pullout bed, in the end someone unceremoniously dumped the linens off. (I was fine making the bed - it was only that the staff insisted repeatedly that housecleaning would.) 

The reception staff was lovely. They said all the right things to make up for some reasonable errors. The execution is where things fell apart. How things repeatedly fell through the cracks between what was said and what happened, I don't know.

This is not my first stay at the Eventi, but I'll consider other options on my next trip.

title: Still my choice in Chelsea
text: First stay here was exactly 2 years ago and we absolutely loved the Eventi. Stayed here multiple times since then as a family, solo traveler and as a couple. NOTHING has changed. Hotel's vibe and energy still the same- still a party hotel on weekends. Rooms are excellent, beds comfortable, water pressure great even at top 23rd floor, suites even better- you can cartwheel in them. Impeccable customer service, special thanks to Johnny. Worth every penny and definitely still my choice in Chelsea.

title: A Wonderful Experience
text: I travel frequently to New York. Hotel Eventi is one of the most fabulous hotels! Their staff including Victoria, Kevin, Marilyn and Allan are second to none. The hotel is like a spa, the restaurants are incredible and the staff are so responsive. A few months ago Inpulled up in a yellow cab and his machine was not working. He began menacing and I was concerned for my safety. The front door team came out and rescued me! Whether it is business or personal this is a place to stay! They put comfort in the meaning of hotel stays!!

title: Birthday Weekend
text: This was my second time staying at the Eventi.  The first time was a Hotwire mystery deal and fell in love with the hotel.  This time, this was the only place I considered.  I was in the city for a birthday weekend with friends.  As expected, check in was super quick and very friendly.  I even got an upgraded room for my birthday :) The lady that checked me in, Vanessa (I’m pretty sure I remembered her name correctly) remembered who I was throughout my stay.  You don’t get that kind of service at other hotels and that shows the staff cares about their guests.  The room was great and had a great view.  Love the bathrooms!  Rooms and the hotel are immaculate.  Housekeeping does a great job!  When my flight was cancelled and I had to stay an extra night, the manager also extended a discount for me.  If you want a great hotel in a great location and a superb staff, stay at the Eventi!

title: Nice hotel, not the best location for us.
text:
We chose this Hotel as we like the Kimpton Group and we thought that this was an great location to stay.  With the latter we were not quite correct.
The hotel is urban in style with a great restaurant on the Ground Floor/Street and open Reception area with the free tea/coffee, and bar/restaurant at the back.
Our room was nice - good size for New York and really good sized bathroom.  
We ate in the restaurant on the 1st night and enjoyed what we had.  The free wine hour is fantastic with the Kimpton and we enjoyed this on their Roof terrace - really lovely touch.
Reception staff were great, very welcoming, friendly and helpful throughout our stay at the hotel.
We enjoyed our stay but just didnt love the location of the Hotel.

title: Good but pricey - upsetting end
text:
The Kimpton is a lovely hotel. It's posh, comfortable, great views and great locations. It's dog friendly and all the people who work here are lovely.  There is a bar and a restaurant attached to the hotel which is cool.

Although lovely, the hotel itself is very expensive if you buy anything here. The minibar is extortionate and so is the bar in the evening. We tried to go to the bar but the prices made us turn away and go somewhere else.

When we checked out ( check out is till 12 which is amazing! ) we found out someone had put their drinks to our room! I felt very upset about this because we purposely choose not to go into the bar because it was so expensive. The lady behind the desk said she would investigate and send me the receipt, it made me feel so uneasy that I might end up having to pay the bill for someone else. 

Nice hotel, great location, very expensive.

title: Great place to stay in Manhatten
text: Stayed for a business trip and was very impressed.  The room was spacious, everything in good condition, and had everything I needed to lift the stay e.g. I always find a decently lit desk and armchair or sofa adds so much to a room, and both were present (well, armchair not sofa).  There was a good vibe around the hotel, with lots of choices for where to eat or park up for a chat, a help yourself tea and coffee bar at some points during the day and water in the evening. I thought the rate was pretty reasonable value for Manhatten, too.  All good!

title: Would be 5 stars, BUT....
text: We loved almost everything about our stay at the Eventi Kimpton Hotel. The location is superb, in the middle of Manhattan within easy travel of all the things visitors to New York want to do. The Front Desk staff were friendly and efficient and the people who staffed the door and valet were very helpful and courteous. Our biggest complaint - we had a King suite and I slept on the sofa bed. We registered three people, three guests were expected BUT no linens were provided for the fold out sofa. After a long day out we called Guest Services to request linens at around 11 p.m. They finally arrived at 12:50 after two more calls. I was exhausted and really wanted to sleep, but not on a bare fold out mattress! I even offered to come down and get the linens. By the time I made up the bed myself and got to bed I was beyond exhausted and didn't get enough sleep to fully enjoy our busy day the next day. Other than this, we enjoyed our stay. The room was comfortable and thoughtfully appointed. The bathroom was fabulous and luxurious. But since the main thing you pay for in a hotel is a good night's sleep, this was a major fail.

title: Should have been a 5...except for a couple small issues.
text:
Fine hotel, my room was wonderful.  Upgraded to a suite, overlooking Broadway. I was happy.

There are no ice machines here, so you must call for ice delivery.  I did so, and after 50 minutes, called again.  Not good.  

My 'Amenity' was a nice touch, but whats the use of a preference list for repeat guests...if it isn't looked at?  I don't drink wine, but thank you for it anyway!  (Its on my preferences....all other Kimpton get it right!).

Small issues, but just the same. It could have been a '5'.

:)

title: WOW
text: Ich war alleine zu Gast im Hotel Eventi und war restlos begeistert. Ich hatte ein City-View Zimmer im 22. Stock und die Aussicht direkt auf das Empire State Building war bombastisch. Das Zimmer war schön eingerichtet, sehr schönes Badezimmer mit Regendusche. Die Lage des Hotels ist perfekt und das Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Ich würde jederzeit wieder hierher kommen.

title: Best hotel ever.
text: Leilani, Allen and Kevin are the absolute best in the business. The Kimpton Hotel is unbelievable: the attention to detail is remarkable. The staff are all relentless in their pursuit of the ideal experience. 10 stars

title: INCREDIBLE Customer Service
text: I arrived on a spur of the moment trip, my first time to the city. Allan Rodriguez, the guest services manager, went out of his way to help make sure I was completely comfortable and situated. Valet parking was super fast and efficient, and reasonably priced. My room is STUNNING. The floor to ceiling windows are so beautiful, the view is absolutely incredible, and the entire space is very cozy and absolutely spotless. The location is super, and the very kind staff also helped me figure out the closest and best places to go for the evening so I get the full city experience. I will absolutely be returning to this hotel! Very grateful for such a wonderful stay. I would recommend this venue to anyone!

title: Poor customer service
text:
We stayed at the Kimpton Eventi June 30-July 2.  This was our first stay at a Kimpton. The hotel building/room was nice. 

After checking out and going out for a couple hours while the hotel kept our luggage, we found out our flight was cancelled.  We returned to the Kimpton and informed front desk staff about our situation and asked to use the phone to call the airline.  The first staff sarcastically asked "What, don't you have a cell phone?".  I ignored the sarcasm and informed them I was from Canada, and would get charged a lot in roaming to wait on hold.  The second staff we asked lied to us and said that the front desk phones can't call outside of the hotel.  After waiting on hold for over 20 minutes with the airline on our cellphone (getting charged a lot in roaming) I spotted a manager (a gentleman wearing a tie) appear at the desk.  I told him about our situation and he let us use the phone (that we were told didn't call out).

I am upset that the staff of the hotel we just stayed at for 3 nights could treat us so poorly in a time of need.  We were treated like bums off the street and were very embarassed. In all my travels I have never been made to feel this way by any hotel/staff.

Back home, I emailed the hotel directly to express my disappointment, but they didn't reply. I then emailed IHG Guest Relations, who promised the hotel manager would contact us within 48 hours. It's now been 2 months, and further emails to the hotel and IHG have gone unanswered.

Kimpton / IHG worst treatment of customers. Can't recommend this nice hotel to anyone.

title: Highly recommended!
text: We booked a return visit to the Eventi after a lovely stay in July. Allen the Guest Service Manager was incredibly helpful and even offered an upgrade to most amazing suite on the 5th floor. Couldn't recommend this place more - great staff, beautiful rooms and overall a fantastic experience.

title: Best Front Desk Experience
text: I never write reviews but I wanted to call out Allan and Christina who work at the front desk of the Kimpton. They exemplify, customer service, compassion, and problem-solving, which are all characteristics you need the best in class service team. Because of them, I am fully converted to the Kimpton Eventi brand!

title: Great location and awesome restaurant
text: This is the 2nd we have stayed here and we really enjoy it.  The location is great, its very central and easy to get to.  The rooms are small but well looked after.  The best though is the restaurant downstairs L'Amico.   The service is fantastic and the food is amazing.

title: Fun, high-energy atmosphere. Great dining. Very pleasant stay.
text:
We stayed at the Kimpton Hotel Event this summer with our two teenage daughters and would happily book this hotel again. 

The atmosphere was trendy, current, and bustling, but the staff and clientele were also friendly and unpretentious--this is not always an easy combination to find. We never had a chance to eat at L'Amico, but we had multiple breakfasts and evening drinks at the Vine, and everything was delicious. 

The location is central and convenient with lots of great restaurants nearby, although there aren't any major attractions in the very immediate vicinity, at least as far as we were aware. 

Our only minor complaint was that the key card mechanism in the elevators malfunctioned a lot--we were there for twelve nights and saw this happen repeatedly to many guests.

title: A perfect and vibrant hotel for a short trip to Manhattan!
text:
We stayed 6 nights @ Kimpton Eventi and appreciated its great location, the services and for sure the professionalism of its personnel. We had a beautiful, clean and spacious room with a view to the Empire State Building and everything we additionally asked was immediately offered. Very nice sleeping in its mattresses.
Special thanks to Allan Rodriguez who was extremely helpful to all of our credit card issues, and Kevin, who made our last day with its advice for an amazing day @ Brooklyn!

title: Great location
text: Ive stayed here on a few occasions and love the location close to the 33rd St station and a short walk from Macy's and the Empire State Building. It has two restaurants, an Italian & an American one which also serves an excellent breakfast. Would also recommend the lobster roll at that restaurant. The rooms are nice with very comfortable  beds. The fitness area was adequate. The one thing that was missing was a tea kettle in the room however I was later informed that it was available on request. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great Service!
text: Fantastic Hotel!  Service from Gia and Allan was excellent. This hotel is very accommodating and did everything possible to make us comfortable. The location was great as well. Great vibe at the lobby restaurant and bars.

title: Wouldn't recommend this hotel - try Crown Plaza HY36 Midtown
text: This hotel didn't rock my boat - very pretentious attitude for something that didn't follow through.  A waste of my money - would recommend HY36 Midtown Crown Plaza as better location, better staff and more welcoming!

title: Amazing Experience - Leilani at Concierge is a Rockstar
text:
Planned a surprise hotel room at the Kimpton Eventi after my engagement. The front desk team (Esha and Allan) and Leilani in Concierge were a huge help. Leilani set up the room beautifully and made this night even more unforgettable.

Thank you Leilani and Team - my fiance and I will never forget this experience.

title: perfect long weekend in the City
text:
I spent a wonderful 4 nights at the Kimpton Eventi and loved every minute of it! 

This was my first ever trip to New York, I am an avid solo traveller and new cities are always fun to explore. I landed at JFK and took the LIRR to Penn Station and walked the short distance to the hotel. The check-in process was quick and painless and I was given a king room with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. 

My room was very comfortable and well appointed, and the Hendricks gin in the mini bar did not disappoint! 

The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was clean, modern, and spacious. 

I ate three times at L'Amico, and was blown away each time. I had dinner in the dining room the first night, lunch on the patio on day 2, and brunch in the dining room the day I left. 

This was my first Kimpton Hotel experience and it will certainly not be my last! The location was perfect - I was able to walk everywhere from Greenwich Village, to the Brooklyn Bridge, to the Natural History Museum, to Times Square, to Central Park. 

LOVE LOVE LOVE New York City!!

title: Great Hotel!
text: I love Kimpton hotels so I wasn’t shocked at how cool and great this hotel was. The rooms are spacious, especially for NY standards, and I absolutely loved the bathroom. The bar area is fantastic and a cool area to hang out. Great location! Close proximity to a bunch of bars and restaurants and walked to Rockefeller Plaza Times Square and Central Park (wear comfy shoes!).  Front desk is friendly and helpful. Will certainly be back!

title: Hotel Evenit Still the Best
text: It is so refreshing to be able to stay at a place and know that you are going to have a very pleasant stay.  Hotel Eventi always comes through and makes my stay special each time.  It is the only hotel in NYC to stay at.  The staff is so welcoming and succeed in making each guest feel like a VIP.

title: We 100% chose the right hotel
text: We needed a hotel to accommodate us and our 2 dogs. The pups were travelling all the way from Australia and we stopped by NYC for holiday/transit. Kimpton Eventi was very accommodating, provided us with 2 dog bowls and bed (very thoughtful). Although, we were only given 1 dog bed, not sure if it’s a standard but anyway not a big deal. Kimpton is not fussed about size at all (we have a frenchie and a bull terrier), all of us felt welcome. The hotel itself is very clean, comfortable and cozy. Bathroom amenities were excellent. The location was great, 10mins walk to a dog park and really easy to find delicious food nearby. There is a pet shop across the street on the next block, that was handy and they were nice people too. Would definitely come back in the future with or without our doggos. Thank you!

title: Nice stay in NYC
text:
Stayed 3 nights with our two teenagers in a Premier one bedroom suite which provides a king bed  with a separate area with a sofa bed and chair.  Two tvs and a larger bathroom with dual vanities along with a spa tub and shower.
The rooms were very small but it is NY so no real complaint there.  Bed was comfortable but not fabulous and the bathroom was very nice and spacious although the door to the private toilet area did not close properly.
It was scorching when we were there and the AC wasn't working properly at the start.  This was addressed quickly and although we did have to turn it on/off at times to get it going, wasn't a major concern and the main thing is that it got it working.
Nice city view from the floor to ceiling windows and although there certainly was some street noise, once again, it's NYC, it really wasn't too bad.
Beautiful lobby area and very nice restaurant up front which we didn't go to but was always crowded.  We did have desert one night at the restaurant in the back and it was pleasant.
Front desk, bell and room attendants were all very kind and efficient.
Awesome location, lots of action in the Chelsea area and near many attractions and not much farther from many others as well as very close to the subway.  We walked, cabbed and subwayed with no issues.
Overall a very nice stay at the Eventi!

title: Glamorous and perfect for a celebration!
text: My friend and I stayed at the Kimpton Eventi to celebrate her graduation from medical school. Eventi pulled out all the stops! Our check in began with Gia at the front desk She was a doll! We are vegan and she recommended a bunch of restaurants to check out. We then enjoyed the happy hour - and let me tell you, the wine is top notch! We arrived to our room, only to be surprised with cupcakes, flowers and champagne! Gia is the best. We will definitely be back and will only stay here when we travel to NY (which is quite often). Also Gillian, one of the other staff members, was so welcoming and sweet. Overall, we had a great stay in NY thanks to Eventi! See you next time :)

title: NYC Family Trip
text:
Awesome! Please stay at this hotel...great location, fantastic staff, fabulous restaurant. You will be happy you did!
Close to all major attractions ...I would highly recommend Hotel Eventi for your next stay in NYC.

title: Great property and location
text: We love this hotel for visits to NYC.  We arrive by train and the hotel is a 5 minute walk from Penn Station.  Well located near subway lines to go anywhere and an easy walk to Times Square area and the theater district.  This past stay, we were recognized by the staff having been there almost a year earlier! That just doesn't happen in most places.  The rooms are comfortable and well appointed.

title: Another good Kimpton hotel
text: We stayed here due to the great location and a past experience at Kimpton George in DC. We were not disappointed with the Hotel. It was great for location, service, cleanliness and great restaurants in hotel. I’d go back.

title: Great stay for anniversary!
text: I really love the Kimpton experience! We made reservations for a 2 night visit at Hotel Eventi, and they did not disappoint! I told them it was our anniversary when I booked our room. When we checked in, they upgraded us to a high floor in a corner room overlooking the Empire States Building. Then when we arrived in our room they had sparkling wine and chocolates waiting for us. The room is spacious and comfortable. I love this location for access to the train and it is easy to go just about anywhere. We actually walked everywhere from the hotel. Looking forward to this being my go to hotel when i go to NYC!

title: Just Ok the second time
text: This is my second visit to this hotel.  Last visit was in June.  Last time I came for business, the reception was friendly and they upgraded me by acknowledging my platnium level.  This time the reception was lukewarm.  I booked 2 rooms this time. My husband asked about an upgrade.  Was told there are no upgrades for platnium level only spire, which we are 1 stay away from,  which kind of confused me.  We just came back from an international trip and was upgraded at all IHG hotels and only at platnium level.  I just checked IHG rewards platnium level does qualify for upgrade. They already forgot the dog bowls and bed. I had to call for that.  After a long delayed flight coming in past 1am, definitely not great.  I think front desk needs more training on IHG rewards and reception.

title: Quiet, comfortable, clean...located near Bryant Park
text: Located on the Avenue of The Americas this hotel boasts quiet rooms, comfortable beds and very clean accommodations in the heart of NYC. Located near Bryant Park with quick access to the Metro and several restaurants makes this a great place to stay. Plus, if you're ok with walking you can be in Times Square and the theater district in only 20 mins. They have a great café and restaurant --The Vine with open air dinning and offer free wine tastings to get your evening started.

title: Best New York hotel
text: Definitely 5-stars from start to finish.  The Eventi is elegant with a young vibe.  We could not have asked for more.  Service was top notch.  Loved our view of the iconic Empire State Building.  It was all a dream come true.

title: Didn’t want to leave!
text: Wonderful hotel in a great area! Great bar action at night..Loved our room and loved all the amenities it came with..wanted coffee in my room and they sent up a coffee maker right away..will most definitely stay here again!

title: A bit disappointed not  really a 5 star hotel
text:
When we arrived they couldn’t find me in the system 
Than they didn’t had the option to give me a room with two kingsize beds
Than when we finally went to the room and i used the toilet i couldn’t flush
It was horrible what i had to do ..
Than it kept on flushing
And it took them more than a hour to come
Than we went out and come back but the keys where not working
Hope this trip wil gets better since we booked for two nights

title: Positivity and Atmosphere Shine!
text:
OK, I'd like to start by saying my ideal rating is 4.5, but that's not an option; I'll explain the minor drawbacks at the end. First, why this hotel was such a pleasant surprise!
My husband and I have been to Manhattan several times, but this was the first trip with our daughter (10). We had originally booked the Cambria around the corner in Chelsea (important that it be in this area to be close to Penn Station this trip), but the week before our trip, we decided to look for something more...interesting? Exciting? Granted, we wanted a door that closed off our room from our daughter - hard to find and more $ - and decided to book the executive junior suite at Kimpton.
We stayed 5 nights, and I liked the hotel more and more as the days went on. We had asked for an extra empty fridge so we could bring food to our room - free of charge. Never felt like we were being nickelled and dimed to death, as one does in so many places. Water and/or coffee were on hand in the lobby - also nice.
We happened to mention we were going to Frozen on Broadway; waiting for us when we returned that night were celebratory cupcakes and a Frozen-themed Lego set! Wha? 
Wine hour - 5 to 6pm nightly, we only took advantage of it twice, but the locations, wine, and chance to meet other guests were all excellent! 
The one night we returned to the hotel before 10pm, we found the staff hula-hooping in the front hall. This sort of sums up the feel of this place: the staff, the other guests, the bustling atmosphere in the front area and the two restaurants (ate at L'Amico - this is one of those places people passing by want to stop at) - it all just felt GOOD. Positive. No one seemed stressed, unhappy, or negative. The good vibes were everywhere from the doorman to the fellow guests in the elevator.
OK, so why 4.5? I admit, if it had been a one-night stay, my first impression of the room being a little tired, a little dark, may have been what I took away from the place. That, and the pullout bed we made our daughter sleep on every night - sorry, Kimpton, but it was the worst pullout I've ever seen. So thin that I felt guilt putting my child to bed in it every night, but we're not really the 'family bed' type, so it was what it was.
Speaking of family, there were few kids other than mine - I kind of liked that - but still felt that it was kid-friendly enough for families.
That said, I'd stay here again. Way too cool to be a chain hotel, yet it sort of is - there are a few of these around, although all distinct I believe, and they just joined up with Holiday Inn megagroup, IHG. A plus is that we were IHG members, and that meant free wifi - yay! And Kimpton staff - Shawn, Victoria, Leilani, and everyone we were in contact with - thanks.

title: Fantastic and I'm still staying here
text:
Normally I hold off reviewing until I have checked out, but this hotel and its staff serve immediate  kudos. First the check and  concierge and my apologies for not remembering  your name but how considerate and accommodating we checked in yesterday early as my son was taking the bar exam today and he wanted to study . Well she immediately  went to work and found us a room that was ready for an early checkin . While there was a.modest up charge it was well worth it and our suite is amazing. We dined at La Amico and we know how good this place is. the spa well it's small but intimate. No thrills but if you want a great service you have come to the right place. Theresa( massage  and hernadlo , for the facial and Hernaldo( sorry of I spelled this wrong) were terrific.  
Centrally located near all trains and the garden this place is great

title: big room
text: I've stayed in a few hotels in NYC over the years and this one had the best room so far. It was very spacious and had a separate living room area. Everything was new and nice. The bathroom was huge and had a big tub/shower.

title: Trendy hotel in NYC, great location!
text: Great location, on 6th Avenue between 29th and 30th, unique design, very well furnished with modern decor. Nice rooms, clean and silent. There are two excellent restaurants in the Lobby and breakfast is very good!

title: In love with Hotel Eventi
text: We’ve stayed at the Kimpton Eventi multiple times over the last year. We LOVE this hotel. It’s become our go to spot in NYC because it’s right in the middle of the city with plenty to do right around the hotel. Alex, at the door, always remembers us and is extremely attentive to taking care of our luggage and making sure we are welcomed into the hotel warmly. He is a local and has offered great suggestions about where to visit, eat, and how to travel around the city, he truly adds a lot to the experience! We can’t wait to come back the Hotel Eventi and are so thankful for Alex and the rest of the staff for making each stay more enjoyable than the last!

title: Excellent Hotel. Great Staff and Room
text: We simply loved the room. Loved the hotel. It was located in such a convenient place for us because we were traveling on the subway day and night and needed to be all over town. The breakfast was fun and delicious and the scene overlooking outside was terrific. Really well appointed room and we got a basic small room - not a problem. Was comfortable and I have a really good memory of this place. I would go back. Such a terrific front desk staff.

title: 4.5 Stars:  few missing details
text: Second time staying at Eventi, last stay a few years ago.  Frame of reference for this rating is comparing Eventi to other Kimpton hotels I've stayed at.  5 stars for service, food at The Vine (more casual restaurant) which includes delicious vegan choices, complementary coffee/tea in the morning, decor, room size and amenities.  As usual, a very comfortable Kimpton bed.  Shout out to the spacious shower with rain head and separate hand shower.  Always appreciate Kimpton providing bathrobes.   The only reason I didn't give the hotel a complete 5 star was that towels were starting to be a little threadbare and should be replaced and there was no bathmat when we first checked in.  While picky, these details are ones I have come to expect are flawlessly executed at other Kimpton hotels.

title: New York Vacation
text: We really did like the Kimpton Hotel Eventi. The location is very good as we were able to walk to almost everywhere we wanted to visit except the 9/11 Memorial. The staff was amazing at the hotel. When we had an air conditioning issue, the maintenance department was in our room within 10 minutes and the problem was fixed. The room was a comfortable size, although not huge, but the bathroom was nice sized. If there is a complaint, I personally dislike the half door shower (no closing shower door!). I find it cold and drafty. The restaurant was very good and convenient when we didn't want to leave the hotel. Overall, this property was excellent.

title: Perfect to stay at if you want to be in the heart of NY
text: To be honest, the Kimpton Eventi didn't blow my mind. It's a nice hotel with a couple of good restaurants and it's location is great. I'm not sure about it being a 5-Star hotel though. The rooms were nice and clean, could have been a little bigger. The staff did their job, but nothing stand-out apart from the two doormen who help you hail a cab if you need one. There's nothing bad about the place, I have no complaints, I just feel like it was more of a business hotel than it was a luxury one.

title: Outstanding Intimate Hotel
text: Our recent stay at the Kimpton Eventi in NYC could not have been more enjoyable. My wife and I stayed at the hotel on our 25th wedding anniversary, and the hotel staff were amazing in ensuring that this was a special stay. We selected the Kimpton because we had a very nice stay at a Kimpton hotel in DC a few months ago, noting the Kimpton unique blend of intimacy and professionalism. Our hotel room was surprisingly roomy and modern for a NYC hotel, including a well-designed bathroom and excellent soundproofing from street noise. The lobby area was intimate and elegant, and featured a very nice Italian restaurant suitable for a light snack or a full dinner. We had dinner at the restaurant, and found the staff there to be equally welcoming. While the physical aspects of the hotel were outstanding, the extraordinary staff exceeded it. All staff members were welcoming to the point that we felt this was a second residence. The best example of this is our return to the hotel that night, easily six hours after our check-in. The staff member at the door welcomed us by name as he opened the door for us. After this experience, the Kimpton Eventi will be our go-to location for a stay in NYC.

title: Family get together
text: Good location if you like to be part of the hubub of NYC. Good walking distance to River, restaurants, and attractions.The restaurants on the ground floor are excellent. Nice not to have to work hard to find good food!

title: Wonderful staff!
text: What a wonderful staff this hotel has!! Receptionist Vanessa found out I had a death in my family during my stay. The next day, I got back to a fruit plate, cupcakes and water in my room. What a gesture!! She showed so much care! The hotel room was very comfortable. They had complementary drinks every day, was centrally located and more!!

title: Fantastic!
text:
Friendly, cheerful staff.
Super clean room, great view of the Empire State Building and the city.
Incredibly quiet, I slept fantastically! So difficult to find at any hotel, especially in NYC. 
Morning tea was delivered at the exact time requested.
Great valet service, in fact one of the easier hotels to drive right up to in the city.

title: Great location
text: The location is fantastic. Walkable from Grand Central on a nice day. Amazing restaurants within walking distance. Staff was great, helpful and welcoming. We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. The room was nice but not fantastic like other Kimpton properties. I would stay again based on price and location.

title: Great hotel in the heart of NYC
text: I'm a fan of Kimpton hotels and the Eventi certainly did not disappoint.  The staff was extremely helpful in getting our party of three situated  in neighboring rooms on the same floor. Both The Vine and L'Amico are good bar and food options within the hotel itself.

title: Nice location very poor service
text: Good location but I’m afraid the staff don’t match its position - hotels are all about service this one is poor, I requested room cleaning before 12 2 days in a row got back at 1 pm today and despite asking twice room isn’t done. For me a hotel that’s short on service and over 200 dollars a night doesn’t cut it, period .....

title: AMAZING!
text: I love this hotel starting with the decor and ambiance when you walk in. Leilani and Gia welcomed me and they were so sweet and inviting. The room was beautiful I could not get over the views. I’ll be staying here again

title: Free wine happy hour
text:
Everyday 5pm-6pm free wine for happy hour. 2 great locations in the city, the beds are enjoyable. 

The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. And did I mention free wine? The showers were cool and gave you a stool to sit on.

title: My NYC Home Away From Home
text: I am in NYC several times a week for work and it took me years to find a hotel that feels like home. I love the cozy living room feel of the lobby, the indoor/outdoor feel of The Vine, the food (OMG THE FOOD) at L'Amico, the friendliness of the staff, the comfort and views of the rooms. I am Kimpton Inner Circle (IHG Spire Elite) so I usually get a suite upgrade and welcome amenity which doesn't hurt either! I also love the convenience of the location - super walkable from Penn Station and to my office on Bryant Park. Since my first stay here this has been the ONLY hotel I visit when I'm in NYC.

title: Absolutely great!
text:
Really liked the way ( thank you Vanessa) front desk staff handled initial IHG requests and took time to ensure they were accommodated. Johnny FOM obviously relies on the excellence of these lovely staff as he didn’t respond at all to any of my emails. 
Rooms are quiet, well insulated- bathtub only in one bed suite, gym very well equipped, housekeeping thorough and always helpful. This hotel is near Korea Town a good location to be very south in hip Tribeca or more north shopping at Saks within 15 mins taxi . The Vine and Lamico restaurants are both serving decent but rustic style food in a Latino vibed ambience. The amazing 24 hr sunny shop opposite serves fresh cut fruit or salad of every combo you may dream of so you can have a healthy easy start to the day each morning. Personally one of the best Value hotels in NYC I have stayed at.

title: Midtown Manhattan Magnificence!
text:
Just returned with the family from a 5 night stay in NYC, and once again the Kimpton family of hotels has hit a home run.  The location cannot be beat in relation to MSG (six minute walk), Penn Station and other subway stops, the Library and Grand Central Station (20 minute walk), Broadway (25 minutes) and even Central Park.  We had two rooms which were kept impeccably clean, enjoyed the happy hour (free wine!), the hotel bar/restaurant, with a bustling and lively atmosphere.  With the subway stops so close it was a perfect place for excursions to the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, Central Park, Washington Square Park, Le District, Times Square, and only 30 minutes from La Guardia at off peak times.

We would stay there again as Kimpton has secured our loyalty as a can't miss boutique hotel which, while not inexpensive, has been worth the added investment each time we have enjoyed a stay at their impressive hotels.

title: Personale molto gentile e caffè bar di alta qualità per cibo e bevande
text:
Dovendo trovare un contro a questo hotel di Chelsea, che si affaccia sulla sesta Avenue e dalle cui finestre  si vede l’Empire è che gli spazi comuni e le camere danno l’idea di essere un po’ ‘vissuti’, avrebbero bisogno secondo me di qualche intervento che rinfreschi gli arredi. 
La camera in sè è piccolina (tutto corridoio), ma il bagno è grande e confortevole. 
Chelsea è un bel quartiere dove soggiornare a New York, centrale ma più particolare dei quartieri e strade attorno a Central Park alla grand central o a time square. 
Io ci tornerei senz’altro.

title: Happy in New York!
text: Wonderful place to stay in nyc!  Friendly staff, great location, beautiful room. Very accomodating .  Close to theater & overpriced restaurants.  We had such a good time here.   Breakfast area very pretty also

title: Stay was great, phenomenal atmosphere! Vanessa is a gem!
text:
We booked the executive suite for one night during NYC's pride parade weekend for a birthday celebration. Let me just say... this place has it happening! There was a cocktail hour on the 4th floor (we didn't attend), people buzzing about in the lobby, and tons of people making use of the front and back patios to enjoy company and watch the World Cup games that were displayed on a huge stadium sized screen in the back. Filled with many 20- 30-somethings enjoying weekends with friends or as couples. Elegant space, but not intimidatingly NYC posh either. Great balance with the sort of midtown-upscale/chelsea-hip atmosphere that we love. 

Our stay was great. The room was huge with floor to ceiling windows as promised. When my parents came to sit with us in the hotel for a bit, it was very convenient to have that additional seating area away from the bedroom. We borrowed the bikes they offer on the property and spend a few hours biking through central park as well. (The bike to the park is a little daunting up 6th avenue, definitely not for the inexperienced, but we didn't have any issue on the road).

The staff was also great. Vanessa made me feel extremely welcomed on my birthday. We both checked-in and checked out with her and she remembered exactly who we were! It was such a simple but kind gesture and lovely experience with customer service. While we have stayed at many Kimptons and expect the service to be one of the best, Vanessa  went above and beyond and send up birthday treats to the room.

title: Wow, surprise and delight in NYC!
text:
I read about Kimptons several years ago before customer experience was a "thing." They were one of the few pet-friendly hotels -- wanting to provide a great experience for their guests. Well, fast forward to June 2018, I selected this hotel for a trip with my Mom, sister and niece for her 16th birthday. Kimpton did not disappoint! In fact, we happened to mention off-the-cuff to Hannah (the manager) when we checked in that we were in NYC to celebrate the Sweet 16. A few hours later, Hannah delivered a stylish, sparkling Steven Madden handbag filled with nail polish, lip gloss, perfume and candy for the birthday girl. Wow -- talk about a surprise and delight moment. They mastered it! Then, one day as we left for sightseeing, my Mom accidentally turned on the "do not disturb" sign so our room hadn't been cleaned when we got home. At 5:30, as we were going out to dinner, she mentioned it to the front desk. When we returned, we had beds made, fresh towels, etc. 
The room had two queen beds and there was actually decent space for four women/girls. The location is good...close to some sights, but also easy to take the subway or Lyft. Both restaurants downstairs were really good, especially the one in front with the sidewalk patio. 
I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it anyone traveling to NYC.

title: Our Preferred Hotel for NYC Visits
text:
We used to look for mid-town hotels but have shifted over the years to staying at this Chelsea hotel.  It is located closer to Times Squar than mid-town hotels are, without the insanity of Times Square, and at the Eventi, you are close to the Empire State Building, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, the High Line, Javits Center, and Madison Square Park.  So the location is great.

Not only that, the hotel itself is just beautiful.  The rooms are large and even have the option of two queen beds, which is a rarity in New York.  Other perks include coffee in the morning and wine in the evening, which is by no means a given in this city.

There is an outdoor area a few floors up with a great city view that the hotel opens in-season; it is just lovely for enjoying the wine hour.  They also have a great gym and business center, as well as an outoor patio you can enjoy behind the hotel with a huge outdoor movie screen in-season.

The staff are friendly and can give you great tips on the neighborhood.  They are very service-oriented, too.

title: Really nice stay
text: We stayed in a room with two beds- for New York, the room was huge.  The wine hour was lovely and there were many fun little give aways for pride week.  There are two very good restaurants downstairs.  The location can't be beat.  There are lots of great little places in the area and it's centrally located.  The coffee hour (actually hours) in the morning, water and iced tea all day and the happy hour really just add to the hotel's overall vibe.  Also, we had a minor maintenance issue (my mom shut her finger in a closet door) and John from the Maintenance department came right up and helped us.  He said to my very concerned sister that he thought of my mom as his mom while he helped her remove a bent ring on her finger.

title: Not bad
text: We liked this hotel. The room wasn’t very big but it’s New York so to be expected. Customer service was ok but not exceptional. We had two coffee machines brought to the room and neither worked. My trousers went missing (oddly) from the room and they could not locate them which was annoying. I did get a reimbursement for them but there was no gesture of good will for the inconvenience of trying to find a replacement. Room and was clean and perfectly adequate for our needs.

title: Well appointed hotel in Midtown
text:
Kimpton's Hotel Event is well located in lower mid-Manhattan and is a comfortable walk to some very good local restaurants. Rooms are modest in size, well furnished and for the business traveler, there are several good amenities - lots out electrical outlets and good internet connection among them. Regarding internet, it's a no-brainer at IHG hotels to join the rewards program - for rewards members (it's free to join) internet is complimentary and that's a real gift when it is otherwise billed at $15/day.

There is also a very good bar and restaurant on site

title: Very Nice
text: The Eventi was a very nice property, with great views and great location. The staff was excellent and the facilities were just great. We would recommend this property to anyone visiting this area. The hotel manager was phenomenal.

title: Awesome!
text: Great service, rooms are comfortable and the staff professional and go above and beyond. Definitely recommend staying here! Great venue for a wedding or other celebration. Great spot to stay if visiting NY. In the heart of midtown

title: A diamond in the heart of Manhattan
text: What a delightful surprise to walk two blocks from Penn Station and find this great hotel with all the amenities you'd expect from a Kimpton - great rooms and fittings, including the obligatory yoga mat; great cocktail hour - free wine etc; great coffee bright and early in the morning, featuring La Colombe's best blend; great restaurant for breakfast and great restaurant for dinner and an enthused and helpful staff - from the greeting by Celine and throughout with help from Alan..

title: Great location, service, value
text: High quality property with modern furnishings, great service and location.  Walking distance to lots of good restaurants.  Room decor is nice.  Came here to celebrate anniversary and plan to come back again.  Highly recommend this hotel for couples and families.

title: Love this hotel!
text: Eventi is my favorite Kimpton property and I will stay here every time I return to NYC. The location is awesome, the restaurants and lobby bar are amazing and it’s everything you would expect from a Kimpton property.  The staff and level of service are above and beyond and I cannot wait until my next visit.

title: Great Location, Restaurant, and Bar
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights in early June and from the moment I checked in, I had a great experience. I was assisted at check in by Selena, I believe, and she was very helpful in providing recommendations and even gave me a complimentary upgrade.

I ordered room service a few times and the quality was outstanding. The property has two restaurants, L'Amico and The Vine. I tried them both as well as both bars, and service and quality both were great. I even got free beer with one of my room service orders and a nice handwritten note (Thanks Yolanda!)

I was out most nights and slept a lot during the day, so I missed housekeeping service, but they were quick to service the room whenever I requested. Speaking of the room, ask for one with views of the Empire State Building. It was amazing to wake up to every day.

I had one treatment in the spa which I feel was not worth what I paid, but that's literally my only downside. When I arrived for my appointment, the spa was silent (not even background music) and it felt kinda awkward, like I had just interrupted a lunch break or something. In their defense, I did show up almost 30 minutes before my appointment time, but I figured there would be some kind of relaxation room, as most spas at hotels of this caliber have. The massage itself was fine but I did feel kind of unwanted. Maybe I just had an off day.

Overall, I had a great time at this hotel, and I hope to check out other Kimpton properties in the area.

title: Attitude problem
text:
Starting with good points: location very good, rooms big & spacious 
Bad points: Staff didn't look happy; had a bit of attitude; we just felt like a number not a quests; didn't explained anything about hotel

title: Great hotel
text: Love the room with a big window from floor to roof. Spacious for being in NY. Very clean and the location is great. The bar of the hotel had a great vibe and good drinks. Also went to the restaurant, l’Amico and had a lovely dinner. Steak was delicious.

title: Wedding
text: We just recently stayed at the Eventi for 3 nights for a friend’s wedding and absolutely loved this hotel.  Great area to be in to walk to good food and nice parks. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating starting with the valets to the front desk. Allan Rodriguez the guest services manager ensured to make it a great stay for everyone and made the hotel feel like home. To sum up the things about the the hotel itself: great food/nice rooms/great city views/complementary morning coffee and wine hour daily/friendly staff.  Definitely look forward to staying here again in the future.

title: BEST HOTEL EVER
text: Literally the best hotel in nyc! Front desk is so welcoming and made me feel at home. Allan who works here at the front desk assisted me with checking into my room and we had a cool laid back conversation it felt as if I’ve met this guy before! The staff is super laid back I love them. Awesome service, awesome rooms, awesome views. I highly highly recommend this hotel it’s absolutely phenomenal! -J

title: Inattentive service
text: Inattentive staff at both the bar and the restaurant, and a robot front desk worker who launched into her "if you need anything we're just a phone call away" monologue twice without realizing it ... the rooms are fine, both nothing at this hotel makes this a "must stay" Kimpton property.

title: Good hotel, comfortable room, very spacious bathroom, friendly check-in
text:
In the last 5 years or so, we have stayed in approximately 40 different Manhattan hotels (yes, that is right, 40, as you may find in our TripAdvisor reviews). So when we say "a good hotel stay", we know the field and can draw comparisons. 
The location: 5 minutes' walk to Macy's Herald Square, 11 minutes' walk to Madison Square Park. 
Very friendly check-in. One hour early check-in was granted with no questions asked. 
3 hotel elevators handle the job right, virtually eliminating waiting times, even during the peak hours. Our standard room was decent, had a deposit safe, a fridge, a desk, an umbrella and everything else needed for your stay. The room's size was even a bit larger than what one usually sees in NYC hotels. 
The bathroom was super spacious, with an oversized shower stall featuring a convenient wooden stool. The choice of toiletries more than adequate. 
The view, from our 20th floor, to 6th Ave, a part of Broadway and the Empire State Building was superb. 
The sleep quality was good, even though the soundproofing could have been better. 
The WiFi was good, no glitches.
The Vine NYC restaurant offered a perfect and affordable breakfast (refer to our dedicated review). 
The fitness center features several treadmills, ellipticals, and a few exercise machines.   
The lobby is comfortable; it gets quite lively at the evening hours.  
There is an affordable Icon parking, right around the corner, on 29 W St, less than 2 minutes' walk to the hotel. 
Definitely recommended.

title: Wonderful weekend in NYC at the Eventi
text: The hotel was fabulous.  Modern, clean, trendy.  The happy hour on the roof was great.  Fantastic location. The people that work there are helpful and truly want to make sure our needs are met. We will visit again.

title: Loved this hotel!
text: Stayed May 3-8, no complaints at all! It was a beautiful hotel and the front desk was super accommodating.  I forgot a few things and they were very helpful.  I didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurants or partake in wine hour. The rooms were good size for NYC. The location was great for all of the things I needed to do.

title: AMAZING HOTEL!!! EXCELLENT LOCATION AND EVEN BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
text:
My family and I stayed here for my moms 60th birthday and we had an amazing time! From beginning to end, the staff here went above and beyond in all that they did to accommodate my family.  I must give a special shout out to Celine, who although we arrived earlier than planned, was amazing getting our bags checked In while we waited and to top it off...left a bottle of champagne in the room for my moms birthday!! It was truly an amazing and thoughtful gesture :-) The rooms are spacious (my mom wanted us all in the same room and for 3 adults and one child) we were not as cramped as I thought. The rooms are beautiful, well kept and the bathroom is large! My fav part were the marble and glass enclosed showers that I wish I could take with me!! The hotel doormen are friendly, accommodating and were always ready to do whatever we needed The location is great, we were able to walk to a lot of places and even when we had to go further out, the subway is close and the Ubers were not expensive. Very close to a lot of great attractions :-) 

Do not hesitate, book your next stay at Kimpton!!

title: Incompetent Hotel and Horrible Service!!
text: I have never seen such poor service from what should have been a nice hotel in my life. After complaining the air conditioning didn’t work the manager, who couldn’t be reached for a long time, finally offered not to move us but to give 100 dollars off the room. Our friends sent us a gift that they didn’t tell us about and refused to send to the room. If you want really bad service and tiny rooms this is the hotel for you.

title: Extra charges
text:
Room was nice, basic. Maybe a bit overpriced vs quality but we made our reservation quite late so that’s maybe the reason for that.
We had problem with the check which came later. There was coupon for minibar which we of course used. But then in the final bill after we had already left the hotel there was extra charges from minibar. I tried to contact hotel by mail, web forms and finally through IHG customer service and only IHG responded. They promised that this hotel will get back to us, but surprisingly they didn’t. So maybe it’s just easy money for the hotel. The sum is small but still.

So remember this, you cannot contact this hotel afterwards if they for example charge extra!

title: BEST Customer Service EVER!
text: First let me say that I love this hotel, I have stayed a few times, the location it s great nd the food/ drinks in the hotel are delicious. My husband and I were checking in after a long drive when they couldn't find our reservation. No big deal we just went to The Vine bar inside the hotel to have cocktails white they sorted it all out. PS the Pina Colada is unreal and one of the best. We walked back over where Leilani and Hannah took care of us and upgraded our room to a suite for the inconvenience. They were incredibily sweet and the room that they gave us was beautiful and HUGE and I cant wait to stay again!!!! Thanks ladies!!!!

title: Love Kimpton Hotel Eventi
text: I stayed here for the 2nd time Easter holiday 2018 and it was fantastic. I booked the City View Deluxe King room and it was well worth the extra. The rooms are gorgeous, bathrooms all marble with rain forest shower and it really makes you feel like home. The location is perfect for walking all around the city. The 2 restaurants have the most amazing top notch food, I stop in even when not staying at the hotel. Would stay here again in a heartbeat, a top notch NYC hotel.

title: A great place to stay
text: Kimpton Eventi catches you eye from the minute you arrive. The hotel is contemporary and the whole place feels like a spa experience. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed and the restaurants are outstanding. Everything you need is right there.

title: Great location and modern
text:
Location: the location is in midtown near Harold square. We planned ahead our specific destination for the trip- Central park, shopping on 5th ave and Rockefeller center. The hotel was very convenient.

Lobby was crowded but very modern and cute. 

Service: the front desk was always busy and only 2 ppl were working there. The line for check in and assistance was long. The room key was not working 1/4 times so I had to replace/ rescan the card.  Your room key is needed for elevator operation.

Room: the room is spacious for the NYC and loved the marble tiled bathroom. However, the doors were making lots of noise since many guest were not paying attention when they shut the metal doors at midnight. I woke up couple times bc of the door banging noise. There was a mini bar but the refrigerator did not have any space for the guests.

View- not impressive but We stayed at 22nd floor with some skyline view.  
$$: we went there during the memorial day weekend so the price was not super expensive as july/august near the touristic season.

Final thought: yes, I would recommend this hotel but the hotel needs to increase front desk staffs and work on the banging door sound or warn the guests about that.

title: Ótima localização
text: Eu e meu noivo nos hospedamos no Eventi, e foi ótimo!!! O atendimento é impecável, o quarto é extremamente limpo e perfumado. O hotel oferece bicicleta para os hóspedes, o que é perfeito, pois pegávamos as bikes cedo e pedalávamos por toda a ilha. Final de tarde eles servem vinho no terraço.  A localização é um ponto fundamental, está muito perto da Broadway e por isso conseguimos sair para quase todos os pontos turísticos sem precisar de transporte.

title: Good location
text:
We found that this hotel was well paced for uptown and downtown visits. The subways were a couple of avenues away which meant we could easily move across Manhattan Island. The staff were pleasant and made my partner’s birthday special with complimentary sparkling wine and cake! 
The bar provided plenty of choices and excellent t cocktails. 
We were fortunate to be on the 22nd floor so had a nice view. The bathroom was quite spacious considering we were in the city and plenty of plug points. The only downside was an absence of USB points in the room which is pretty standard these days. I would stay here again if visiting NYC.

title: Good hotel, good size rooms
text:
The hotel is right in the heart of Midtown Manhattan at a walking distance from Times Square and the Empire State. The rooms are clean and spatious. New York is a very noisy city though so the buzz from the outside will inevitably get in even if the windows are of good quality and they close properly.
Thhe only downside would be the breakfast that has few healthy options (apart from boiled eggs and yogurt) and for a vegetarian there are almost zero options. The reception is helpful and kind most of the times

title: great place
text:
I stayed one night here after a business trip before heading home the next morning. This hotel was so convenient to both CUNY Graduate School and Penn Station, perfect for my needs. Everything you could want was right in the area. The staff was so friendly at check-in and I enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel. 

The room was very enjoyable in its design. I was able to check in a bit early and got a room on a higher floor with a separate living area. That area had a pull-out couch (very comfortable for sitting on) and a chair with a television. The bedroom area had a huuuge bed, television mounted on the wall in a convenient location, and a nice window with a pretty good view for NYC and all its buildings. There was a delightful bathroom with a waterfall shower. In all, I found the room to be very comfortable and inviting, a great place to relax. 

Note that the hotel restaurant L'Amico gets very very busy - so much so that they couldn't find room for a solo diner on a Thursday night! This must be a good sign for its food, but not so good if you're expecting to eat there, so either plan ahead or find another of the many many places in the vicinity that you'd like to try instead.

title: Great Stay
text: First time staying at a Kimpton property- stayed here with friends while visiting NYC.  Great location, easily accessible to train stations and Korean Town.  I was pleased with the service as we arrived early, was able to check in quickly, and got a large room on a higher level.  Both room and bathroom sizes are large for NYC standards, and quiet. Enjoyed the stay and will definitely consider Kimpton hotels in the future.

title: Perfect girls weekend for 40th birthday celebration
text: My friends and I stayed here for two nights to celebrate a 40th birthday. It was an excellent base for a Broadway show, shopping, and dining out. Room was clean and comfortable (housecleaning was great!) Celine at the front desk was super friendly and helpful. We missed the wine hour and she sent us drinks and cupcakes.

title: great rooms, horrible dining
text: We've stayed at Kimptons all around the country and have been Karma rewards members for a long time. The Eventi is a new hotel in the Kimpton family and is in a great location. There's the Flatiron district with home shopping and great restaurants a few blocks to the south. We stayed in one of the largest rooms, which had a great Empire State Building view. It was still a bit small, but the bathroom had a large marble shower and sink. There is no coffee in the room, but it is available in the lobby--but two of the three days it wasn't available after 9am. The Kimpton wine hour was still a nice touch, but the wine could use an improvement, and there aren't any snacks, like at other Kimptons. We love Kimptons, and this is a great location, but he restaurants are another story. We've reviewed both separately. There needs to be a MUCH better arrangement between them for guests. We stayed for three nights and were refused service twice at our own hotels' restaurants. You expect to have a food and drink home in your $600 a night hotel, right?

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: We had a blast at the Kimpton.  Multiple delayed flights and a day late, but when we got there, we were treated like royalty.  The rooms were huge by NYC standards.  The location was great too for those who don't want to stay right in Times Square.  Will be staying here again

title: Wine Happy Hour Highlight!
text: Hula Hooping with Allen at the free wine happy hour was our favorite part of our stay, but everyone at the hotel was very accommodating, and the location was great!  Just a 20min walk to the theater district and without all of the usual crazy crowds that are by the hotels over there!  Only downside was the elevator key card system seems to never work on the first try, with any of the cards, or other guests we shared the elevators with.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Trendy hotel - welcoming, wonderful
text:
Spent 6 nights at the Eventi hotel and enjoyed every moment. It is very trendy hotel which I sometimes find a little “overwhelming” but not in this case.  

Check in staff were amazing (thanks Liliana) who so kindly gave us option to upgrade to a suite. 

Thanks to Victoria for organising tickets to a Yankee Game and giving advice how to get there. 

The suite was spacious with a lounge, separate bedroom, bathroom and toilet. King bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping were great. 

1 restaurant and 1 bar/cafe. Limited menu options but food was beautiful. 

Location is good with several subway stations nearby. Also a short walk to Time Square and Empire State Building. 

Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: first class experience for reasonable NY rates
text: As a long time patron of Kimpton hotels they continue to amaze me.  The staff as you walk in his amazing, friendly, helpful, never pushy and thank God they don't keep saying "my pleasure!"  Real honest regular people are appreciated.  My room (upgrade, always stay at Kimpton hotels) we beautiful, spacious, spotless.  My meal at the bar/restaurant was superb with Jesus providing remarkable service and attention for a single diner all by himself.  While I usually only give 5 star ratings to the highest and most expensive places that outdo themselves, this relatively modestly priced Manhattan hotel outdoes itself in every way possible.  I hate to share this because I want to make sure there are always rooms for me and that they don't push the rates up!

title: Overnight for a Broadway show
text:
We decided to try our first stay at a Kimpton Hotel now that their loyalty program has been merged with IHG and chose the Eventi due to its location on 6th Ave near Penn Station (so it was very convenient for a one night stay to watch a Broadway show).
We have stayed at other hotels near Penn Station, Chelsea and Times Square and this would rank as the most stylish of the lot.  It also helps that it is not a cookie cutter needle type building with two elevators (typical of most hotels built since the 90s)
Beyond style and convenience it is worth noting their staff was very helpful and friendly in all of our interactions.  
This hotel has been the only one to upgrade us to a suite in NYC as Spire Ambassador members!

title: I love this place!
text: I stayed Here a few years ago and can't believe I forgot to review it! (I probably did on yelp though). This was a wonderful hotel in Chelsea which turns out to be my favorite part of the city. It's New York so of course this place is very walkable to anything you might need. What made this place so great was my concierge. He was very helpful, upgraded my room for my 25th birthday and provided great local tips to restaurants and such that only locals really go to. it offered great view, comfortable rooms, and a lovely wine hour. I like to explore new hotels each time I got to repeat cities but think I'd want to stay here very New York stay if they're available!

title: Nice sized rooms
text:
As far as Kimpton's go, this one was a bit disappointing. It didn't seem to have the edge I expect,  and service wasn't as friendly as usual. On the positive side, the room was a nice size, especially for New York. The bathroom was large and comfortable as well. The bed was comfortable and my room on the 9th floor was very quiet. The hotel is close to the subway (less than 2 blocks) and within a 10 minute walk to the Empire State Building. I arrived about an hour before check-in, and my room was ready. I was very happy about this as there were others waiting for their room. After getting settled I went downstairs for lunch. The food was good, but overpriced. 
Saturday evening I tried to have dinner at the Italian restaurant in the hotel, but I was told a reservation was required, The person who checked me in at the hotel should have stated this when he mentioned the restaurant.
