When I was walking away, the host said I could sit outside and they could serve me there. I was very tired, so I accepted. The pasta dish I wanted wasn't on the menu that night, so I ordered the filet. It was cooked as ordered, but $90 for a small steak, one glass of wine and the tip was more than I had planned to spend.
Despite the room size, overall I was underwhelmed. There was no real sense of service that I would have expected. I also had to call housekeep for soap because it wasn't replaced after my first or second of three nights. Would I stay at this hotel again? Probably not.

title: Home away from home. Better every year.
text: I've stayed here so many times since it opened and it just keeps getting better. Location is fantastic in the trendy Chelsea/Flower District with many restaurant options in the neighborhood. Service is amazing, staff is super friendly, always prepared to anticipate guest needs. The rooms are immaculate, very modern and clean design yet cozy. Bathrooms are pristine and well maintained. With the new restaurants in the hotel you don't even need to leave to have a great meal. I can't praise this property enough and that's why I'll keep coming back.

title: New york al fin
text: Muchos anos sin venir a Ny y nos quedamos en Eventi, muy buenas instalaciones buen staff me quedé en el piso 11 muy buena habitación muy apropiada para un viaje de negocios y hasta cómo viaje de parejas, buen rest y bar, solo críticaria el que pudieran tener tarifas incluyendo el desayuno, el desayuno buffet es promedio, pero el restaurante a medio día y la noche funciona bien, la ubicación es lo mejor justo en la acción definitivamente un lugar a volver.

title: Solid stay, not sure if I’ll be back
text:
Stayed at Eventi for 5 nights, mostly for work, but tacked on a few personal days as well. Staff at check in was great - we arrived insanely early (around 9am), they let us use upstairs restrooms to change and clean up, then held our bags for us. Check in was a breeze when we came back later in the afternoon. 

The room had a great view of the Empire State Building from the 15th floor. Lucked out with the smallest room on the floor, wished I had a little more space. Housekeeping was wonderful and did a beautiful job, they were also very friendly when we saw them in the halls. A friend dropped off a gift and note for us at the front desk on Friday - it was in our room Saturday but without the note, instead we found a note from housekeeping. So we assumed the gift was from them, and didn’t figure out it was a friend till they asked about it days later! Made us laugh. 

Room was pretty, well appointed. Nothing super fancy. Bed was ridiculously comfortable. Could definitely hear street noise, but it didn’t bother us.

Tried to eat at the restaurant in the lobby Friday and Saturday night and was greeted with an hour and a half wait. Finally ate there on a Monday night and it was delicious. Cocktails at the bar are exceptional. Expensive, but this is NY!

Disappointed to have to pay for WiFi, after paying a premium for the room.  Old elevators + a black tie wedding there Friday night and a conference Saturday = super busy lobby and slow access to rooms. 

Great location, near everything, easy access to subway. Helpful and friendly staff. Wasn’t blown away, but overall it was a solid experience. Friendly and helpful staff were the real winners at this hotel.

title: Amazing!!
text: Great views of the city...close to Herald Square, Empire State Building, Penn Station!! Fantastic staff, faboo room service and amazing coffee!!  A great hotel to enjoy an evening in the city and just chill!!

title: Love the Kimpton Chain
text: Kimpton Hotels consistently "gets it right" and this stay, at the Eventi Hotel in Chelsea, was no exception.  The location is terrific - an easy walk to great shopping, Broadway, the Village.  The room, on the 22nd floor, was clean, quiet, and comfortable.  When we realized our refrigerator wasn't working, a call to the front desk quickly got a new one delivered.

title: Extra special birthday trip!
text:
I celebrated my 30th birthday with a coast-to-coast trip to visit friends.  I ended up staying at 7 different Kimpton properties and this was one of the highlights of the vacation!  (I’m an Inner Circle member for a reason!) 

One of the most memorable pars of my visit was interacting with Vanessa at the front desk.  She was super helpful, friendly and willing to answer all my questions about the property and the city at check-in.  She acknowledged my Inner Circle status and my birthday by giving me a beautiful upgrade to a one bedroom suite.  Later on during my stay Vanessa remembered my name and always greeted me with a huge smile.  She is the embodiment of Kimpton’s trademark “ridiculously personal service.”  The porters, maids, other front desk members and staff at both the breakfast café and L’Amico were also professional and pleasant. 

The room itself was wonderfully appointed with very comfortable furniture, a strikingly beautiful marble bathroom and floor to ceiling windows.  Dreamy beds made falling asleep only too easy.  

Just a few minor issues:  the morning hot beverage set up was entirely empty for two days in a row.  This was a big disappointment.  The other issue was at L’Amico- Inner Circle members always get some kind of complimentary dish or two, glass of sparkling wine, etc.  We received nothing except a puzzled look from the staff.  

Overall, this is a gem of a hotel with perfect location and lovely staff.  Do yourself a favor and stay here, especially if you’re Inner Circle!

title: Hidden Gem in the Center of all the action
text: I first stayed at Hotel Eventi during my relocation to NY from NH.  One of the front desk managers, Hannah DeGannes, was so helpful to me.  I explained I was relocating and was new to the city.  She was so kind and helpful and it really made me feel welcomed in a big city.  What I quickly realized is that the entire staff is just like Hannah.  Everyone there is welcoming, friendly and helpful.  The rooms are stylish and well appointed with great bathrooms.  The hotel has two great restaurants as well.  I consider this my home away from home!

title: Study Tour Guide
text: While on my first trip to New York in my life Eventti was above and beyond. From the event centers, the spa and above level of service no words are left to say. The one guy Alex was very helpful with all directions around city. He guided me throughout the 6 days I was there and I wanted to thank him especially for being such a friendly person who knows how to service a customer. See you next trip Eventti

title: Eventi
text: We loved our stay at the Eventi - it is a beautiful, comfy, and clean hotel with a great bar and restaurant. We had an amazing view of the ESB. And it's location is in a perfect area of the city. We will be back!

title: Staff is great! Hotel is wonderful!
text: My son and I stayed here for 2 days on our first visit to NYC.  I honestly can’t say enough about this experience! Vanessa at the front desk was the best! She sent my son the sweetest gift of treats to the room the first evening with a nice personalized note! It was unexpected and made his day!  The hotel itself is perfectly kept.  The bathrooms being a good indicator overall.  The bathroom was beautiful and perfectly clean! The beds comfortable and room surprisingly quiet.  The convenience of the location in the center of everything only adds to how wonderful the Kimpton Hotel Eventi is!  We could walk literally anywhere in all directions and not be more that 1-1.5 miles. This makes the 3rd or 4th Kimpton Hotel ( including Alexandria and Indianapolis) I have visited in the past few years and I have not been disappointed by any!

title: Enjoyable and practical
text:
Stayed a night in this hotel being well located and very convenient.
You get used to the Kimpton’s hotels quickly and easily !
Some efforts could be done with the isolation of the bedrooms but isn’t it NYC ?

title: A Tremendous Visit
text:
Here for a ‘study tour’ of bars and restaurants in NYC. This is an ideal location to access all parts of the city. Spacious very comfortable room. Great bar. L’Amico restaurant was excellent - would recommend the verde pie.

Will be back when next in NYC.

title: I love this place!!!
text:
Our go to hotel in Midtown NYC. 

The staff are superb. The rooms are a good size with all the mod cons you need. Super clean with comfortable beds. The bathrooms are top notch with lovely toiletries. 

The location is super convenient, close to Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens, Macy’s etc. 

The restaurants are nice, and they even give you free wine every evening in a social event. 

Cannot fault this place.

title: Return Visit
text: We recently returned from another fantastic stay at the Hotel Eventi.  The three rooms our family occupied were roomy and quiet. The staff was amazing, very helpful and friendly. From Leilani, Todd, and all the others (I can't recall their names), everyone was so pleasant and cheerful.  The location was excellent, walking distance to so many sites.  We can't wait to return next year.

title: Modern and Comfortable
text: The hotel is a 7-minute walk from Penn Station. It has a modern feel: plenty of USB and regular plugs by the bed and desk, dimmer light in bathroom for night-time,and yoga mat in the closet! However, there was no soap, so I washed my hands with the shower gel. The service at the front desk was fine, but the bell service was both rude and inefficient: practically threw luggages at customers. Overall, I'd stay here again if I can avoid bell service (this time I just needed luggage storage).

title: Above and Beyond Customer service
text:
I stayed at the Kimpton Evanti Hotel on April 12-13, 2018. I was in New York on business.  When I arrived Thursday evening I was greeted by Allen one of the hotel managers.

He thanked me for staying at the hotel and noticed that I was a new member to their hotel program.  He upgraded me immediately and told me he really wanted to make my first stay at his hotel memorable.  He also let me know that if I needed anything during my stay to let him know and he would assist me.  Never did I think I would have to take him up on his offer..... I went immediately to my room, freshened up and went down stairs to my dinner meeting.  Before leaving my room, I reached for my cell phone and realized I left it in the Uber I took to get to the hotel.  I went down stairs and took Allen up on his offer to “assist me with anything I needed”. 

He  quickly went to work by teaching me how to lock my iPhone and ping it.  The  Driver called Allen’s cell phone to tell us he would be bringing it back to the hotel within 30 minutes.  Allen suggested I go to my meeting and he would come and get me when the driver called him.   I was able to go directly to my meeting and when the driver showed up he came and got me out of the meeting!  He saved the day!  He went out of his way to make sure I was taken care of.  My upgraded room was clean, spacious and had everything I needed including a wonderful view.

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an exceptional customer  service and a unique hotel experience.  The restaurant and wine bar is awesome!  Thank you Allen for making my day!!

title: Welcoming Staff- Great Hotel
text: Even in New York where so many people have a bit of an ‘attitude’, the staff was engaging, friendly and super pleasant. The hotel is very comfortable with nice furnishings and clean surroundings. Only complaint if there is one is that the complimentary coffee is horrendous, but that’s very minor.

title: Clean, efficient, and fun!
text: From the lobby to the room to the restaurants, every surface was clean and organized. The staff was friendly and was eager to help with a smile and solid eye contact. There's a great vibe in the lobby/restaurants too; they were both packed all three days I was there. (I ate at The Vine twice!) I love all Kimpton hotels, but this has to be my new favorite. The location is perfect; you can easily walk to all main NYC attractions and it's only a short trip up 6th or down 7th to get to many more.

title: Heartbroken over Kimpton
text:
This is not my first stay at a Kimpton Hotel.  I have stayed at numerous Kimptons, however I have not reviewed many of them.  I don’t write negative reviews but felt our experience could be shared in order for perspective to be gained.

Look at my reviews at hotels. We travel to wonderful places.

The Eventi hotel was a horrible experience for us.  We arrived at the hotel to be told our room would not be ready until after the 3:00 check in.  My husband and I arrived at 2:00. We waited in line for over 30 min and checked in regardless.   

Upon returning to the hotel again, we had to wait in line again for over 30 minutes to receive our room key. 

We discovered our room key did not work. We returned to the hotel reception to wait in line again. 

Reception said she fixed our card, we tried it again. For the second time it did not work.

This time I asked to speak to a manager. I will not share his name but found him to be rude and arrogant. I asked him if he would go with us to gain access to our room and he he shrugged his shoulders and said, it is not necessary.  I said since it was our third try it is rather a necessity that you escort us. He did so begrudgingly. The card did kit work for him either, he had to use his card.  

He apologized and said this is not acceptable, please forgive us. 

We quickly needed to get fresher up because we had a show that we needed to get to. Due to the waiting and checking in process we missed the wine happy hour and missed our dinner reservations.

Upon returning to the hotel after our show, our card still did not work. I’m not kidding.  This time by the time we got to our room we had missed the opportunity to eat at either restaurant. They stop serving food at 11:00 regardless of the Eventi web site saying 24 hours. 

We decided to order room service: a burger, fries, salad, a Diet Coke. That total was $90.00.  

In the morning we checked out after waiting in line for another 30 min.
The manager had them take 50.00 off the bill.  

Negatives:
No doorman to be seen 
Waiting in too many lines
Rude front desk
Key card never really worked
Poor customer service especially for a Kimpton

Positive:
View of city from King suite

Will not stay here again due to too many choices in NYC for type of service.

title: Wow
text: From the moment we entered the hotel it was amazing. From valet to room service. Great team there. Front desk managers are phenomenal especially Leilani. Constant smile even when we were needy. Thank you so much for your patience. She’s a real asset to the company.

title: Upscale hotel with cool rooms and great views.
text:
Check-in I hardly remember it. Had to be quick. 

Room: Cool design, loved the bathroom, and the luxury bedding and robes. Great views of city. 

Location: Right Near Central Park. Walking distance to great shops and restaurants. 

Total cost for room 370 USD per night.

title: Best location
text: This is a great hotel with the best location. We stayed 3 nights and were very pleased. Its expensive but everything is in this city. The lobby is nice two restaurants. If you are here in summer time they also have outdoor veranda. I would definately come back to Eventi.

title: Another great Kimpton
text: I don't like chain hotels, but I have to say that Kimpton has done a great job of trying to change that. I've stayed at many of their properties and most of them are great. This one is no exception. The hotel looks great, is clean, and the room (esp for NYC), wasn't a shoebox. The staff was great, the look of the hotel is cool, and they have a great bar in the back, and the restaurant attached, L'Amico is also fantastic. Only stayed here one night as a local getaway, but would definitely come back.

title: A special birthday visit
text: My wife and I visited Hotel Eventi over Easter weekend and it also happened to coincide with my wife's birthday.  We were greeted by a friendly smile at the front desk from the time we entered the hotel through our final departure.  They asked if we were celebrating anything special and I said my wife's birthday.  Unprompted, the lady at the front desk upgraded us to a high floor, city-view room overlooking the Empire State building.  The room was above-average size compared to others that I've stayed in NY.  In addition, she sent a bottle of champagne and two cupcakes up later that afternoon.  She didn't have to do that but let me tell you how nice of a surprise it was.  The hotel is tucked into a NYC city block with very nice curb appeal.  The lobby and adjacent restaurants and warm and welcoming.  They also host a daily wine social hour which is a nice treat to break away from the city chaos.  It's perfectly located in the city as well - easy enough to get just about anywhere in the city.  Based on this stay, I would gladly come back to the hotel and recommend it to others.  Priced moderately compared to other hotels in a similar category.

title: Great hotel in Midtown Manhattan location
text:
Had a first class experience at this hotel. Very easy and efficient check in. I had a 20th floor room with a view of the Empire State Building. Room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Temperature control excellent and quiet.  Loved the shower! Rates were pricey, but this is New York City, and I felt that the rates were in line with other hotels in the area, and good value given the quality of the my room.
I did not eat at the hotel restaurants, and did not have a car, so cannot speak about parking or food experience.

title: Hidden with great views
text: I had business meetings here for several days.  The hotel is extremely difficult to find and my taxi drove around the block twice before I finally just got out to walk and locate it but once you are in the hotel it is lovely and if you are fortunate enough to have an event on the rooftop terrace, the views are amazing. The food, even for a group- there were about 35 people at my meetings- was excellent. Note though that I cannot comment on the hotel rooms themselves as I have a co-op uptown so did not stay overnight. However, assuming the guest rooms are as nice as the rest of the hotel, it would be very nice place to stay. It is a particularly good location if you want to be close to Broadway theaters but away from the crowds and mega hotels in Times Square.

title: Enjoyable stay
text: I had an enjoyable stay when I was in New York City for business meetings. It's centrally located on 6th avenue with decent sized rooms with very comfortable beds, 2 restaurants, a reasonably equipped fitness centre and free drinks during the happy hour. I missed having a tea kettle in the room but apart from that everything was fine. Would consider staying here again.

title: A Business Traveller's dream
text:
During a recent business trip to New York I stayed at the Eventi. The location is excellent for meetings all over the city. There are plenty of restaurants and stores in walking distance and the on-site restaurants are very good. The best thing about this hotel are the staff. I had supplies for an event delivered to the hotel ahead of time. As I walked up to the desk and gave my name they were already finding my box and asking if I wanted them to continue to hold it or deliver it to my room. Kevin Morgan delivered the box  for me and from that moment on he greeted me by name every time I left or returned to the hotel. I felt like family!
Every staff member was friendly including Kevin (not Morgan) and Alex who helped me fedex back my left over supplies at mid-night one evening. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms lovely.

title: AMAZING Front desk staff and hotel
text: Great location, 8 min walk from Penn Station.  Awesome decor and the L'Amico restaurant was delicious.  There are a lot of great hotels in NYC but the front desk staff at the Eventi is what puts this hotel above the rest.  If you have the pleasure of interacting with CELINE or SAMANTHA you wont be disappointed.  I was lucky enough to see their smiling faces multiple times.  From the moment I checked in I felt like I was talking to a great friend I hadn't seen in years.  I was celebrating my honeymoon and these two ladies helped kick it off to a great start!  Samantha challenged me a hula hoop contest...yeah, you can hula hoop for an upgrade (I suggest you practice before, she's good).  Celine and Samantha gave us great recommendations for NYC, ask them, they know what's up!  I could go on and on and on and on and on about these two but I hope you get to meet them on your trip and see for yourself.  If you want superior service, friendly faces, and  two great friends you never knew you had stay at the Eventi!

title: Is Alex a Superhero?
text:
The hotel is a bit difficult to find due to the lack of a noticeable sign, but once we found it, the hotel staff took great care of us. Food and drinks in both restaurants are really good, and many people enjoyed the wine hour, which is a bunch of free wine on the third floor.  What's not to like? The rooms are comfortable and larger than a lot of rooms in the city, and the floor to ceiling windows are a nice touch.  The bathrooms are very large and the hotel was a nice place to return to after a long day out.  

Then we met Alex, who I guess is a doorman, but really he does it all.  We spoke for a while at the door after I walked my dog, and he seemed genuinely interested in the fact that my wife and I were at the hotel to celebrate.  The next thing we knew, Alex had upgraded us to a suite and delivered some wine, beer, and snacks to the room.  He said he figured we needed more space since we had our dog with us, and wanted to help us celebrate with a gift.  We were very surprised, my wife was thrilled that she now had a tub in the room, and the dog was grateful for all the space to wander around.  

Today my wife texted me a link to an article and in all caps she wrote, "ALEX SAVED CHRISSY TEIGEN AND HER UNBORN CHILD!" And, she was right.  Is this guy NYC's real Superhero??  Hotel Eventi, please tell Alex "The Lang's" say thank you for our wonderful stay.  And for saving Chrissy Teigen. See you next time!

title: In and out stay
text: Had the luxury of using credit card points to stay at the Kimpton Eventi in NYC recently. Only needed a room for one night. So happy that I gave this boutique hotel a try. It was lovely - staff was so nice, free happy hour from 5-6 was very fun (loved the hula hoop efforts), room was very comfortable and large by NYC standards, and coffee was complimentary in the morning!

title: Couldn’t have been happier!
text: Fabulous!   Perfect location in Chelsea.  We had two rooms and they had cool views, cozy beds, soft linens and robes  and pristine bathroom.  The staff was so helpful.  Of course we always enjoy the free glass of wine at a Kimpton happy hour.  Really, could not be improved.  I will absolutely stay here again and I have already recommended it to others!

title: Thank you, ALLAN!
text: I always try to stay here when I'm in NYC, and I've recommended to everyone I know.  Beautiful property; convenient location; great bar, restaurant, espresso bar!  But what really makes this property stand out is the customer service.  In a huge, fully booked hotel on a busy weekend, the staff all greeted me by name.  Allan, the manager, especially went out of his way to check-in on me to make sure everything was satisfactory and provide that extra level of service that really made my stay feel special.  And his staff clearly is led by example, exceptional service from Vanessa, Celine, and a barista who's name I didn't get as well.  I can't wait to come back!  Just one request to make my stay perfect, Kimpton, it's time to update this gym!

title: central NYC
text:
We had a great stay here at the Kimpton Hotel Eventi. Two small things that I would change if I could.
One, extend the coffee in the morning. I traveled in from the West Coast so I would wake up right when coffee was ending at 9am.  
Second, there is no water dispenser in the fitness room.

Other than that, it is a lovely hotel. The location is very well located to several different subway lines and Penn Station.  It is not the most charming part of the NYC but feels safe because it is so busy and is very conveniently located.  The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was comfortable. The lobby is nice as other reviewers have said but always with crowded with people and their laptops that there was seldom a place to sit down.  That is ok though as we were up and out most days.

Would definitely recommend.

title: Kimpton Eventi
text: Lovely hotel, excellent staff and wonderful accommodations.  Staff aimed to please and came through.  Area of town was wonderful and neighboring outlets were great.  Food was great and service was excellent

title: great hotel, great restaurants
text:
I've stayed here several times and I always enjoy it. There rooms are comfortable and facilitate good organization. The staff are friendly and its exceptionally clean and orderly.
The happy hour is a lovely touch and the restaurants are really excellent.
Its located well making it easy to get around no matter what sort of transportation you use.

title: Comfortable, well located but outside the bustle, large rooms
text: I stayed 5 nights in March, got a nice price for an extended stay in a slow season. Great value. Enjoyed the location. Easy to get cabs on this part of 6th. Traffic not too heavy or loud at night. Many delis, takeout places and a super Fairway market nearby as alternative to eating heavy. Almond croissants from Fairway each morning was a staple, coffee from the lobby. My room was on the 9th floor looking east, good sunrise view, quiet. It felt large for NYC, especially the bathroom was generous. Nice sitting chair, place to do desk work with adequate light, big windows, comfortable bed. Orange line and Yellow line subways are nearby, walking distance from 34th St Penn Station. It worked well. Free newspapers, including Sunday.

title: Daily Wine Hour!
text:
Everyday between 5-6 they have wine hour. Located just outside the craziness of time square, still allow easy access to all the attractions but with a little space to breathe. 

The bed is cozy, the pillows are outstanding. And they have a stool in the shower, which seems lazy, but is worth sitting and thinking about.

title: A special touch
text:
I've been a frequent guest of this hotel as well as numerous other Kimpton Hotels. Two employees, Victoria and Kevin consistently go above above and beyond to make my stay a first class experience. They always greet me by my name and with a big smile. They accommodate my wishes to the best of their ability. 

The property is well run and one of my favorites in the Kimpton portfolio. Truly a great location for the business traveler or family visiting the city.

title: Great hotel, but better service (DOORMAN)
text: I've stayed in New York City multiple of times now and this hotel tops it off with the service. I could not believe how GREAT our door man ALEX was. He was extremely personable & very helping throughout our stay. ALEX knew everything about the city, like where to eat, the great views, & bars to go enjoy a beverage at. I would stay at this hotel again just because ALEX. Beautiful location with great service.

title: One of the Best in New York
text: We stayed at this hotel over New Years Eve for 5 nights. Location was perfect!  Room was perfect!  One of the most comfortable rooms we've ever had.  Everyone was super friendly.  Check in & check out was quick.  Room service breakfast was very good also. The bar in the hotel was perfect for drinks of all kinds. This is where we'll stay again!

title: Fantastic hotel- thank you Allan Rodriguez
text: Had a great stay with my mother at the Kimpton Eventi. A huge thanks to Allan Rodriguez who is an excellent addition to the hotel. He went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. We were delighted to return back one evening to find a complimentary bottle of wine waiting for us. Thank you Allan! We are already planning our next trip to NY in September and will definitely stay at this hotel again. Great service and a stunning hotel.

title: Great Stay!
text: This is the second time I've stayed in a Kimpton Hotel and the experience was great overall!  Beautiful property, great staff, lots of interesting food and beverage options, very comfortable and well appointed room.  Kimpton does a great job of creating a unique and special boutique hotel experience at their properties, which make the stay more enjoyable than the typical major flag hotels.  I make regular trips to NYC and look forward to my next stay at the Eventi!

title: Cool hotel in a central part of NYC
text: I liked the rooms as there was enough room to live for 10 days.  I liked the lobby as it has a cool vibe and a comfortable place to hang out. I liked the restaurants associated with the hotel because the food was good, the drinks were good and the people watching was even better. I liked the hotel staff as well, they were pleasant and accommodating. We also did some work there as Johnnie-O was showing in the hotel.  All in all a good experience.

title: Perfect stay in NYC
text: So our power is out and we have been freezing in our home for three days. Our daughter has a birthday party planned in NYC Saturday and so we decide to stay in an NYC hotel and warm up. We pulled out our Klimpton hotel sign in and tried to set up a reservation. Alas our password had expired but one phone call fixed this minor glitch and we reserved a room without difficulty. When we arrived at the hotel around 11 pm  we were professionally greeted (thanks Alan) and to our surprise upgraded to a suite. Our car was zipped away to the parking garage( for an extra charge of course) and we were given our hotel key and advised of the wine get together the following afternoon ( sorry we missed it)The room was on high floor, it was clean,spacious and quiet  Did I mention it was warm? The location was very convenient for us but the midtown location is close to a variety of mass transit so I would think it is a good starting point for any planned explorations in the city. Overall  the stay was perfect and I would not think twice about staying again.

title: Perfect Escape into The City
text:
If you are considering booking a room at this hotel, DO IT!  My husband and I arrived around 4:30 and we were worried about making it to our 5:00 massages in midtown.  The valet parking was very convenient, and from the moment we met the hotel staff, we knew we had discovered a special place.  The service was perfection.  Alex, the doorman, helped us with our bags and led us to the front desk. Alex is a great guy and made us feel very welcome. The lobby is decorated really well and is a cool hang out. The front desk staff checked us in fast once we told them we were in a bit of a hurry, and we were in our beautiful corner room with a king size bed in no time.  
We soon realized I had misplaced our suitcase (it was a little hectic because we brought our dog lol) and my husband went down to the lobby.  Again, Alex took great care of him.  The suitcase was soon located and all was well.  Alex then knocked on our door, and because we had mentioned we were in town for our anniversary, the front desk had sent up champagne and cupcakes! (Is there anything better?)  We left for our massages and when we returned, Alex greeted us at the door and asked if we would like to move to a larger room since it was a special occasion and we had our dog.  Before we knew it, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite!  It was a fantastic room with a view of the Empire State Building, and the bathroom was amazing.  (I soon found myself sipping champagne while in the jetted tub!!!) 
They also provided bowls for our dog's food and water, and offered a dog bed, but we had brought our own.  This hotel is very pet friendly! No charge for pets, no weight limit, you can even bring more than one pet.  You just have to sign a form saying if the pet causes any damage, or the room is soiled, you pay for it.  I think it is a great policy because I hate having to pay high fees for my well behaved dog.  
We had drinks at the bar and my Moscow Mule was of the best I have ever had.  In the morning, we enjoyed breakfast in the on site restaurant The Vine. Our waiter, An Tazul, was fantastic and made sure our meal was perfect.  I had the Ruby Grapefruit Brulee and a blueberry muffin, while my husband enjoyed the oatmeal with fresh berries. They also had a breakfast buffet option that looked very tempting and if I had a larger appetite I definitely would have tried it.
This is the kind of hotel where every staff member is very professional and good at what they do.  It is a great deal for the price. They actually care enough to personalize your experience and make sure you enjoy your time at the hotel.   We can't wait to return and spend more time at this great spot.

title: cozy hotel and great location
text: Great location, check in was fast and very friendly front desk.  Room was very clean with a comfortable bed.  We missed the compliment wine hour but definitely will try on our next visit. I had a best waffles at The Vine restaurant.

title: Loved it — clean, comfortable, and convenient
text: What a nice change — something different — great overall feel to this hotel. Yes, I know, the elevators are slow and the card reader a bit cranky — but there is an energy in the lobby and the bar that draws you in. My room was quite large, the bathroom very modern, the bed was comfortable, and it was totally clean. I was grateful for the extra night’s stay because of flight cancellations during the big storm this week. Finally, you can step outside and be enveloped by the sights and sounds of Madison Avenue and other Manhattan shopping districts within short walks.

title: Close to Penn Station
text:
If you’re traveling into the city via train, this hotel isn’t a bad choice for the proximity to Penn Station / Madison Square Garden. 

The hotel staff is extremely helpful and kind, the hotel is not bad, maybe a little outdated in the rooms, but being right in the middle of midtown it’s location is it’s strong point. 

Nice showers, comfortable bed, and large windows for you to have great views of the city.

title: Great hip hotel
text: Hotel was great and so were the people, especially Samantha at the front desk! Thanks for all your help! Restaurants were also great. Parking is $50 overnight for valet, though self-parking is an option which we did not know!

title: No Complaints - Nice Stay
text: Had a nice stay here. We were lucky enough to nab a suite on the backside of the hotel, away from Avenue of the Americas. Was very quiet, especially for NYC standards, and a decent-sized room. Overall, no complaints. Would stay here again without hesitation.

title: Very good location
text: Love the location at this hotel. You will find shopping next door and some very good bars and restaurants as well. We had a suite in 19th floor with good view. Very good beds and big bathroom. Floor too roof windows with nice view of the city. Don’t miss the breakfast.

title: I would stay here again
text: The Kimpton provided good service and a nice comfortable room.  I like the location with Madison Square Garden almost right around the corner, and plenty of things to do nearby.  The price wasn't too bad either.  I was only here a short time but it made me want to come back again in the summer.

title: Great Location near Penn station
text: Stayed at the Eventi Hotel for a business related trip. I was in room 1509, which was comfortable. It also had great views of the Empire State Building. I attended several meetings within the hotel's ballrooms, which were catered by the hotel. All the food was good. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I had breakfast at the hotel, which was decent. There is a subway stop only a block away. I would consider staying in the hotel again in the future. The only annoying thing was the street noise, there were street repairs happening one of the 2 nights that I stayed in the hotel. There was jack hammering going on from midnight to about 3am, which kept me up through the night. Not anything the hotel could control overall.

title: Great location, great hotel
text: Just to update my last review, I can’t say enough good things about the Eventi. The location in Midtown very close to Subways, shopping and Penn Station is very convenient. The staff is wonderful. They are friendly, helpful, courteous, but never get in your way—they are there when you need them, but not intrusive like some luxury hotels. The rooms are spacious, clean, comfortable and have all the amenities (including Frette bathrobes). We visit 4-5 times a year and we are treated like regulars—no, more like royalty! Just love this place.

title: More of a shame!  I was looking forward to it!
text: Booked a one bedroom suite.  It’s a well located, externally fine hotel.  Staff and service greeting OK not great.   Arrived early, suite not ready which was fine.  The issue for me, is that (and I looked at a few different one’s after the first!) is this: The rooms are tired, obviously all partied hard over the years! They need a refurb and overall it’s not recognised in their external PR and advertising.  Room service poor, nobody answers the phone from the room, but, front desk team great!  They try and cover up the cracks!  Anyway.  Enjoyable, not worth the money!

title: Loving the Kimpton brand lately - Hotel Eventi is no exception!
text: Hotel Eventi is in an 'up and coming' area of NY.  I was really surprised at how many new restaurants and stores have popped up in this area - it's so convenient to anywhere in the city - I highly recommend the location.  I used to trudge by here when I commuted from Penn Station years ago and there was nothing.   This hotel is a very classy, non-uppity, stylish, comfortable hotel with all the amenities.  Love the coffee set up in the AM, wine in the PM, great lobby, lots of places to hang out if you don't want to be in your room.  The rooms are great - bathrooms are great (though can't wait until those open showers go away - make me nervous) too!  Beds were super comfy - they had movies on demand.  I was all set!  Highly recommend this place and while we usually don't stay in midtown - we're definitely coming back here!

title: Great Hotel
text: Stayed for just one night. Hotel is in Chelsea so a quick walk to mid-town and not so far to the Village. Hotel staff super friendly. Bar lively. We had a good-sized room with a fantastic view! Definitely will be back.

title: Good location
text:
The Eventi hotel is in a good location in midtown for work and for sightseeing. The rooms are nice and specious. Beds are comfortable and the service is good. The two restaurants offer decent food.
There is one downside which most of the hotels in the U.S. struggle with due to bad building: the walls are paper thin and if you have a room with a connecting door you can basically hear everything what the person in the room next to you does. I woke up with the alarm clock of the person in the room next to me. Not their fault U.S. buildings and hotels just don’t offer privacy. I guess that’s what you have to get used to coming from Europe. Noise isolation is just not existing. At least if you stay make sure to get a room without connecting door...still not perfect but a little better. 
Other than that the hotel is really good. I would stay there again because I was really happy with the service and the general facilities of the room.

title: Awesome customer service
text: We stayed at the Eventi for my birthday trip with friends.  We got a junior suite so the 3 of us could stay together.   Room was lovely with a large bathroom and a great view.   As pretty as the hotel is, it’s the staff that made this place great.  They sent up cupcakes and champagne for my birthday and everyone was just so nice.   The location is great if you’re taking a ride at the Peloton Studio on 23rd.

title: Great spot if you need to be in the neighborhood
text: Kimpton hotels are consistently my favorite properties and this one was no different. The front desk was incredibly helpful when we had some complex checkin needs. The rooms were decent sized (for Manhattan) and well appointed. Easy access to anywhere you want to be in Midtown/Flatiron areas.

title: Very bad customer service / management ECHO CHAMBER; bad sleep quality
text:
It pains me to write this review. Across many stays over 10+ years, Eventi has always been my GoTo hotel in NY. This last experience, due to a totally non-responsive customer service ECHO CHAMBER at the front desk and the management levels, made my experience unpleasant in the extreme.

1. I noted in my reservation that I would like a room away from the elevator, housekeeping closets, and other noise sources.

2. Upon reserving a room online, I was offered a $12 upgrade. I accepted. Because I lurve the Eventi.

3. Two days later I got an email invitation for a second, $45 upgrade. Of course I accepted. BECAUSE I LURVE THE EVENTI!

So what room did they give me? A room right next to the housekeeping closet, which the maid banged open and closed two dozen times between 6am and 9am. The room was also on the noisy construction side of the hotel, and the backup BEEP BEEP BEEPING started at 7am and never stopped. Being from the west coast, I ended up with 4-5 hours sleep per night throughout the conference.

Upon checkout, I told the desk staff about the problem and requested that the second upgrade of $45 be removed from my bill - since they had effectively upgraded me into a room that was the antithesis of what I wanted, and had failed to provide the most basic service any hotel can provide (a good night's sleep). Given that this partial refund was about 10% of my spend per day, it would have been a good compromise. Front desk guy said his boss was on the phone, but he'd speak with him to get the ok on this partial refund as soon as possible. He also handed me the boss's card - it said Bill [-].

Two days pass. Nothing happens. No Bill [-]. No one calls or emails.

One more day passes and I get an email from Hannah [-], Guest Services Manager, asking how my stay was. I replied courteously with the info above. No response from Hannah [-], nada. Probably a robot.

One more day passes and the Eventi sends me a SURVEY asking me how my stay was. I courteously write all of the above into the survey. No response, nada.

So why was the front desk unable to address my problem?  And why is Eventi sending me a phony "we care" email from a phony Guest Services Manager Bot and a 10-page survey that nobody at Eventi ever bothers reading?

I am so disappointed. I really enjoyed the amenities at this hotel, from the bedding to the view, room service to the restaurant at breakfast, through several stays over the years. And I really liked the location - just far enough away from the Times Square madness yet walk-able to so many things, including Javitz. But being ripped off by "upgrade" after "upgrade", and being completely ignored through FOUR SEPARATE ATTEMPTS to get a resolution to a problem is the worst customer service ever.

Kimpton: if you're not going to actually read any responses from all your robotic inquires, you're better off not sending them at all. This is a black mark on the entire Kimpton chain.

title: Love this amazing artistic hotel
text: I loved the room size and service at the Kimpton Eventi.  The bathrooms are large, clean and have wonderful showers.  The rooms are beautiful and pleasant.  The service is impeccable.  You will have no complaints and you will be back again!

title: Wonderful room, wonderful service
text: We booked this only 2 hours before arriving. We were given a free upgrade, 2 adjoining rooms on the 21st floor, one with a corner view. Rooms were spacious, clean, comfortable and didn’t feel run down. Room service came accurately and promptly. Great location. Would definitely stay again.

title: Awesome location, so-so service
text:
This could have been such a great visit! The location is perfect, only a couple of blocks from Union Station and really within walking distance of Times Square if one were to choose that route. 

The design of the hotel and adjacent restaurants are really cool and modern, with a lot of details in its design that are beautiful. The rooms are standard small for New York. 

After a request upon arrival, we were upgraded to a room with a partial view of the Empire State Building, which was cool at night although the bed should have been placed on the opposite side of the room to fully enjoy it. We asked for two bed covers upon check in, which did not arrive until I had called several times to remind them. And instead of making the bed, they just gave me the sheets. I requested for housekeeping to please make the bed with the two covers separately for the rest of our stay but they did not one time remember to do so. 

They pride themselves in being animal-friendly. I love dogs but not barking dogs in adjacent room while I'm on vacation to relax, especially not late at night. I called numerous times about this and instead of moving the owners with the dogs, they told us we could move and that we had to accept the fact that this is an animal-friendly hotel. Strike one.

My sister and I went to the spa, which is extremely small. The massage treatment was divine. The masseuse was so good and really took her time. The scrub treatment felt extremely rushed and was not relaxing at all. When going to the showers to rinse off after the scrub, there was no shampoo. I asked for it and although they looked, they could not find any and did not arrange to have any brought there. Strike two. 

On three occasions, the room key was demagnetized. This happens. Sometimes. Usually not three times. I had all my identification in the room and was thus not able to provide that upon their request, which brought on a lengthy interrogation to verify my identity. It happened again, very shortly thereafter with the same front desk staff. And without recalling me or the incident that had happened within an hour prior, they proceeded with the same interrogation methods, without a smile or attempt to ease the situation. Strike three. 

This property is beautiful but I'm not impressed by the service. They make no attempt to get to know their customers. I would have gladly stayed here again upon first glance but don't think I will. There are plenty more excellent choices where feeling valuable as a client is important to the hotel.

title: Nice Hotel but starting to get run down
text: I have been staying here occasionally since this hotel opened around 2008 or 09. My most recent trip was a 8pm or so check in. The bar and restaurant were still hopping although on the two restaurants is closed now about to become a coffee shop. The elevators are creaky and a little scary as well.  Rooms on the upper floors have great views, but everything is a little run down and looks it's age. Also I have to say the noise between rooms seems to be more than I remember. The front of the hotel was a little dirty and it just feels like it's ready for a redo. Incidentally, it's either not a Kimpton anymore or is about to be redone under another name according to the staff. Hotel team is always good here helpful and try to give you the room you want etc. While not larget the exercise room is well equipped.

title: Amazing Staff and Venue
text: Our Office has an event annually in NYC and we have conducted it for the last few years at The Hotel Eventi.  The staff and events team is amazing! From the front desk to the event venue space we were pleased!

title: Fantastic hotel, really love it
text: We really love this Hotel, it is superb. My friend and I took our wives to Manhattan for his 50 birthday and we chose this hotel as we have stayed at Kimptons in the past and they are always excellent. One nice little touch at Kimptons is they have a complimentary wine tasting hour and as the price of wine in Manhattan is astronomical it was a nice touch. The rooms are not large but they are well furnished and the continental breakfast was good. Will definitely stay here again when we go back to New York

title: Room with a view
text:
Kimpton is always my choice in any city.
Very well appointed & clean. I visited this location in a previous trip and on my return opted to upgrade to
a suite with a view, and i might add well worth the few dollars. Sweeping views of the skyline were spectacular at night! 
Give them a try, you will not be disappointed.

title: Stayed 2 nights in Jan for a biz trip
text: This hotel is great.  Clean.  Looks new inside.  Rooms are big, clean and comfortable.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Bathrooms are big too.  Wifi works great.  Fun vibe in the lobby with 2 bars/restaurants off of it.  Central to everything.  Food at the Vine Lounge is excellent...if you love crispy bacon you won't go wrong here.  I would recommend staying at the Kimpton Eventi on your next stay in NYC.

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC
text: The Kimpton Eventi exceeded all my expectations — a friendly and helpful staff, clean room, great view of the Empire State Building and a wonderful location to walk all over the big apple. This will be our new go-to hotel when we visit NYC.

title: Pour son emplacement
text:
Hôtel très bien placé au cœur de Manhattan, offrant un confort appréciable sans pour autant justifier tout à fait les 5 étoiles annoncées sur le site de réservation et donc un peu cher.
Toutefois, le personnel est très agréable, prévenant et très compétent et contribue pleinement à passer une excellent séjour. Les chambres sont propres.
Globalement nous sommes très satisfait de notre séjour.

title: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff
text: Very lovely hotel in a great location! Staff is helpful and courteous!  Restaurant and bar in the hotel is very nice!  Wine hour is a nice addition. Room has nice beds and beautiful bathroom.  Wifi available.

title: Hospitality at its best!
text:
Even prior to arrival we got an email from johnny the front desk manager welcoming us to the kimpton. Upon arrival parking was a breeze with a garage right underneath. Upon check-in we were greeted by Allan who was super friendly and notified us we were being upgraded to a king suite!  What a great start. The suite was nice and clean. Not huge but it's Manhattan, that is to be expected. 
When we got back to our room at the end of our evening (a concert at MSG just a short walk away) there was a bottle of champagne on ice and cupcakes waiting for us compliments of johnny the front desk manager! Bed turned down and chocolates on the bed. 
We felt like it was our honeymoon all over again...this hotel knows how to treat it's guests. 
Oh and there is a wine hospitality hour everyday! 
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the area. Good location and great hospitality.

title: Hot hotel in Chelsea
text: This sexy hotel offers a great experience. From the plush lobby, the 2 excellent restaurants and the lounge areas with sleek furniture and art to the mind-blowing unisex bathroom. Enjoy free-flowing wine at the happy hour. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows with views of Manhattan and the deluxe rooms have large marble bathrooms with a rain shower and large bathtub together behind a glass window pane. The gym offers state of the art equipment and a spa offering treatments across the hall. Great location on 6th and 30th, and only a block away from Penn Station. Just do it.

title: For the price, you can do so much better than this hotel
text: First, we experienced an unpleasant staff reception at check-in.  Second, we got to deal with slow, creaky elevators which seem to stop at nearly every floor during busy times.  Next, we were given a room which was not what we booked (two tiny full beds instead of a king) which had trash in it from previous guests.  Gross.  The rooms were super dated with no usb charging plugs and the front desk had none to spare.  Any noise from the hallway was very easy to hear leading to a not so good night sleep.  I thought this splurge would be a treat but honestly, I've stayed in nicer hotels that are half this price in NYC.  I will say they the front desk did send up an apology bottle of wine and treats.  Although, a ten dollar bottle of wine cannot fix my disappointment at wasting money on this hotel.

title: Convenient location, large (for NYC) rooms, better-than-average room service
text: Hotel Events was the first time we stayed at a Kimpton brand hotel; they will certainly be on my radar from now on. This hotel is located on the edge of the Chelsea neighborhood and just below Herald Square. Its location makes many parts of NYC easily reached by foot and due to Herald Square, it has easy connections to many subway lines. The entire staff we encountered from doormen to front desk to housekeeping were bright-eyed, friendly and genuinely seemed well-matched for jobs in hospitality. This is a lively hotel, but not too "club like". The lobby has two restaurants connected to it, and both are high quality. Our room was fantastic (we booked a Cityview room, more $ but worth it for the stunning eastward view of the Empire State and the Metropolitan Building (the one adorned with the golden pyramid on top). The bed was truly comfortable and clean, and the bathroom was really nice with plenty of room and good lighting. We enjoy room-service breakfasts and plan for the ridiculous expense incurred. However, when the food is delicious and arrives hot, we do not mind the extravagance. I have been to many NYC hotels that serve Lender's bagels and as a native to this City, it has always offended me greatly. So, I was pleasantly surprised to find out they serve true NYC made bagels and the lox platter was fresh and delicious. You really should start a NYC with a good old real bagel with a schmeer and some fresh lox! And just try not to dwell on what it just cost you, enjoy the sunrise view if you're on the east side of the building and plan your day. We would stay here again and are pleased we took a chance on a new (for us) hotel chain.

title: Fantastic modern hotel, Fab Location Midtown
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights having spent the first 5 nights in the financial district. This hotel was fantastic and comes highly recommended.  

Firstly the decor throughout this hotel is so stylish and well furnished. We loved it!!
Located in Midtown, only few mins walk from Penn station and Macy’s was perfect. You have everything you could want and need on your doorstep.

We got kindly upgraded to a high floor corner room which was very spacious and exceptionally clean and modern. Beds were comfortable and floor to ceiling windows offered great views of the city. On check in,  Team were excellent and also due to my pregnancy sent a complimentary package to our room to congratulate us containing drinks, cupcakes and a NYC baby-grow. Such an unexpected and lovely gesture.

Hotel has 3 restaurants downstairs, we eat at the Italian one night where the food was excellent. Complimentary coffee in the lobby and the wine hour was a really nice touch that they offered.

Overall a fantastic stay. Visually modern and to our exact taste, Great guest service and location is spot on.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text:
My daughter and I returned to this favorite hotel and were once again impressed by every aspect of our stay.

From the minute we walked in the front door we felt catered to in every way and  comfortably at 'home'.

The atmosphere at the Eventi is modern and sophisticated without trying too hard.
Our room was spacious and beautifully appointed. 
Breakfast is always delicious at the hotel - love sitting by the fire!
Every need was answered by the very friendly and well informed staff at the front desk. 
It is worth noting that Allan Rodriguez was particularity helpful and professional.

We look forward to our next visit to the this New York City favorite!

title: Christmas trip with my daughters
text:
I like Kimpton hotels and this one is very nice. I stayed four nights as a pre-Christmas trip with my two young-adult daughters. Rooms are nicely decorated and clean (robes and yoga mat are a plus:). Our room was quiet and we slept very well. The complimentary wine hour is great and very much appreciated! Hotel staff members were friendly and helpful at all times! I would definitely recommend the hotel if you like this area of the city. There is plenty of shopping nearby and a short walk to the subway station. it's not the area where we normally stay in NYC. We decided to try something new this trip and enjoyed it but I do prefer our other location closer to Central Park and other shopping areas. However, I did like this hotel better and it was fun to explore a new part of the city!

AYZA Wine & Chocolate bar was great and is a short walk! The hotel restaurants were always buzzing and busy but we didn't try them. 

I'm a little disappointed to read that so many guests were offered upgrades. I'm a rewards member and was not offered one at all. Also, just so you know....queen/queen rooms do not have a view of the Empire State Bldg and do not have bathtubs. Our shower was huge and had a bench to sit on after walking all day though, so that was nice! Our view was the roof of another building:(

The only problems we had while here were with housekeeping. We returned one day to find a housekeeping "key" left in our door. The key said our room was being serviced. We entered and no one was there. Then, on our last day, we left our DND sign on because we left our belongings out, our safe open, were in a hurry, and did NOT want housekeeping in our room that day. They came in anyway. I called the front desk to express my concern and was told a manager would contact me. No one ever called. Fortunately, we checked everything and all was well but I am not happy that they entered our room when we clearly left the do not disturb sign on. 

Overall, this is a really nice hotel with many amenities and we would definitely stay here again!! My daughters especially enjoyed it because of the younger, trendier, crowd and the overall decor of the hotel.

title: Couldn’t check in, then stuck in elevator for an hour. A zoo. Horrible management. Avoid!
text:
Family & I stayed at this badly run hotel for a one night visit to NYC from Dec 27-28. It was a horrible experience, that the hotel did absolutely nothing to try to improve.

We arrived around 3pm (check-in time) on the 27th and were told one of our rooms wasn’t ready. Ok, fine, they’re busy, it’s the holidays, these things happen. But our room wasn’t ready until 4:30pm and this is supposed to be a 5-star property. No offer of a drink at the bar? Nothing? Ok fine. Off on the wrong foot and a delay to the start of our family’s one night together in NYC, but that’s maybe a 3 or 4 star review at this point.

The next morning, I went down to a nearby coffee shop to grab coffees for my whole family. On the way back up, I got in an elevator with two ladies visiting from Europe. As soon as the doors closed, the elevator jerked violently. From that point, all the electronics were unresponsive and we couldn’t open the doors. We thought we were still on or near the first floor, but weren’t sure. Fortunately the two ladies were lovely about the whole situation, and none of us panicked. About an hour later (yes, an hour stuck in an elevator), they finally got us out from the elevator, which was not aligned with the ground floor and had indeed jerked down about a foot and a half, so we had to climb up and out. It appeared to be stuck there. Not fun.

My family had been wondering where I was since our phones didn’t work in the stuck elevator. The hotel hadn’t bothered to tell them anything.

Coming out of the elevator I now had $25 of cold coffees in my hands. The staff were apologetic and took our room numbers, but there was zero follow up. Nothing. Nada. Zip.

How does a five star hotel in New York City justify service like this? If guests are given the atrocious experience of literally getting stuck in an elevator, there is no attempt whatsoever to remedy that? The very minimum would be to offer to pay for those cold coffees, and really, they should be refunding our rooms for an experience like this.

On our way out a staff member asked how our stay was. I told him it was pretty awful due to our rooms not being ready and then getting stuck in the elevator for an hour. Really trimmed down our time together as a family in NYC.

“At least you’ve got a great story to tell now!” he said cheerfully.

I took his advice. “Good point, I thought. TripAdvisor would be a pretty good place for that story.”

title: Kimpton experience
text: I love Kimpton hotels. Like other Kimpton properties, this has stylish design and a wine hour featuring cocktails. Inner Circle members get special amenities, which make me feel so special! This property is very well located, within walking distance to Penn Station and Chelsea.

title: Would have been perfect EXCEPT...
text: Had a good night, beautiful breakfast. We realized we left something behind and went right back to to the hotel to get it. They kept us waiting about an hour just to report back that the item we certainly left behind was "gone." "Housekeeping said they didn't see anything." They didn't offer a cup of coffee, a discount on a future stay, a bar ticket- nothing. It was just handled in a bad way and left a bad taste in my mouth. I won't be returning. Won't recommend.

title: Outstanding as always
text: We stay at the Eventi every time we come to NYC. We go to concerts at MSG and it’s a perfect location to everything. Clean, staff is so courteous. Only wish they had plant based options in their restaurant

title: Great stay at Kimpton Hotel Eventi
text: We had a great stay! Room was great with a view of the Empire State Building. It was my birthday and they treated me with sparkling wine and chocolates. The complimentary happy hour each day was fun and we got to meet guests that are now friends.  The location is perfect being 2 blocks from Penn Station and near Times Square.  The restaurants located in the hotel were amazing. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Amazing overnight stay
text: My boyfriend and I are from NYC, but we wanted a romantic night at a nice hotel. Our stay was PERFECT. Everything we wanted. It started by Celine at the front desk giving us an upgrade to a suite. The room was absolutely beautiful. We ate dinner at The Vine downstairs and our food was delicious! We’ve stayed at a Kimpton resort before in Grand Cayman and this hotel reminded us of that. Kimpton is the best! Thank you for everything!

title: Love all Kimpton properties!
text: The Eventi is a great hotel with a great staff and in my experience alway immaculate. Great restaurants just off the lobby as well. The hotel is centrally located one block from the hottest area in NYC right now, NOMAD, for great bars and restaurants. It is also smack in the middle of KOREA TOWN, for shopping and dining too. Convenient to many of the main subways makes it a good hub. My husband and I stay there when on our own, when we bring 20 students to NYC every May, we stay at Kimpton's Ink 48, as the kids like the closeness to Times Square.

title: Christmas and New Year
text:
My other half and I stayed here over Christmas and New Year and were very pleased. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was clean and well looked after. The location was excellent, we could see the Empire State from our room, and we were only a short walk from Times Square. 

We only made it to the wine hour twice during our stay but it's an excellent bonus!

We would certainly return if we visit NYC again.

title: Great stay!
text:
Wow this hotel was amazing, they did just about everything to make our stay confortable. They offered Prosecco and Chocolates for my boyfriend's birthday! Room service was impeccable :)
L'Amico had a great Christmas menu, super expesive but oh so worth it. 

I would completely recommend this place and would certainly come back!

title: NYE 2017!
text: Thanks to the exceptional service of Jason Blake, I continue to come to Eventi often.  Always appreciate them doing everything they can to make my stay memorable! Cheers and thanks as always, look forward to seeing you all again.

title: It's the little things...
text:
from the doorman to everyone on staff, upbeat, positive, on the spot helpful. Wine hour really cool in 3rd floor space with big original art on walls & they fill your glass! 
 Ginormous marble shower with rain shower head even a bench to sit on. 2 restaurants, coffee bar, careful they are $$$$...gym is great, stocks headphones and apples too..small reading lights over bed so you don't disturb others after lights out...robes in closet..bag storage before/after is a breeze..4 blocks same side of the street to subway..no ice machines..order from room service or do what I do and bring bucket to staff (great way to interact and learn more about hotel and area) 
room service kitchen open 24/7 including holidays with a round the clock menu available...

title: Fantastic hotel, location and all round experience
text:
Excellent.

There is no other word to describe the experience we had whilst staying here for 7 nights.

We booked this on booking.com whilst it was on offer, after reading previous reviews.

From entering the hotel it had really nice furnishing and decor.
The young girl on reception was lovely and very polite and couldn’t do enough to make sure we had all we needed and wanted before going to our room.
The room was ready before the 2pm check in which was fantastic.
Every time we needed something the hotel staff couldn’t do enough to answer our questions or sort out our wants. 
Didn’t eat in the hotel but did have the  banana bread and it was the best I have tasted.
On leaving we had the same warm smile form the girl on reception and left me in no doubt that I could recommend this hotel and more highly. 

Also there is a great deli opposite and bagel shop 2 streets down.

title: Great hotel, staff and location
text: Just come back after staying here over Christmas.  The hotel is lovely, rooms are great and a good size for NY.  Nice touches like coffee in the lobby in the morning and free wine between 5-6.  The staff are very helpful and friendly.  They couldn’t do enough for us.  A special to mention to Anton the doorman, what a top guy.  Lastly the location is perfect, a little away from the hustle and noise, so a good nights sleep, but very walkable to Macy’s, Empire, Times Square and all of the big attractions.  We walked to all of them.  Would definitely use a Kimpton hotel again.

title: Great location!
text: Our room was spacious, clean with a comfortable bed.  If I have to fault it in any way it would be a lack of shelving in the bathroom for travel cosmetics - not great for the majority of ladies, like myself, who travel with plenty of makeup, sprays and stuff!! Even though there is complementary tea and coffee in the reception area every morning, it's a shame it is not available from a coffee maker in your room - you just have to make the effort, get dressed, and in our case we had to make our way from the 7th floor down to reception and return to our rooms with a couple of coffees! The vibe and atmosphere of the hotel is buzzing. The bar and restaurant attached to the main foyer was busy every night and even though we did not include breakfast in our hotel stay, it certainly looked appertizing.  The hotel is ideally situated and if you don't mind a short walk, access to some of the top New York attractions are within easy reach.

title: Do not worth 5 Stars.
text:
Room is small, furniture are old, and dirty. 
The white leather armchair, is no more white, the carpet on the floor would worth to be changed, and have holes in the sheets.
You clearly ear the corridor from your bed, so I don't recommend to take a room not far from the elevator.
Don't expect a great view from your window you will have a view on neighbored building, meanwhile the location is excellent, next to Macy's, and the Empire State building.
As usual with Kimpton Hotel, you have in the room everything you need, iron, table, even a carpet for morning Yoga.
I don't recommend to take the breakfast, which doesn't worth the price you will pay for it.

title: Nice hotel-great location and very nice staff.  Avoid The Vine for breakfast.  We had very poor service and it was quite
text: Nice hotel-great location & very nice staff...but..avoid "The Vine" restaurant for breakfast.  Very slow service and it was quite pricey for what you get.   The beds were very comfortable and everything was clean and well kept up.

title: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic spot.
text: After a really long day travelling we arrived at our hotel and were greeted by its very friendly staff who couldn’t do enough to welcome us. The hotel and the rooms are clean, with excellent facilities and atmosphere. The room was amazing and they upgraded us to a view of the Empire State Building (plus some gifts) which was the perfect start to our honeymoon. The location is excellent and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, so do not hesitate to stay here.

title: A real treat of a stay
text: Our stay at Kimpton Eventi was wonderful. The service is warm, and the room was huge - we were two adults and two children, and had no trouble fitting comfortably in the King Room. The restaurant behind the lobby is very good. The only downside in my mind is the location, as midtown / broadway is not to my taste, but I know many others would consider that a plus. Excellent value for money - affordable luxury, in fact.

title: A holiday surprise!
text: I booked the hotel because they had a great holiday rate. I had no expectations, except comparisons of hotels I had stayed in previously at similar rates. This hotel blew them away. The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. I booked the weekend to spend in NYC with my daughter. We arrived early by about an hour and they graciously let us check in. We were even upgraded. I had joined the Kimpton Karma club, and they ask for your room preferences. All of my preferences were honored and I did not expect that. The rooms were modern, clean and relatively spacious for NY standards. The front desk staff was so friendly. They really bend over backwards for their guests. Other hotels have made me feel as if I were putting them out by requesting anything. The Kimpton Hotel Evanti staff not only did not seem put out, but went above and beyond by anticipating my needs. When were were leaving one morning to go to The Empire State Building, the staff overheard me and offered a free upgrade pass to skip the lines. Staying at the hotel was a pleasure and I look forward to visiting thm again next year,

title: Busy, Hip, Good Food, Expensive
text:
Stayed here with my husband, parents, sister and brother in law for an NYC weekend for my dad’s birthday. Hotel is conveniently located within a short walk of Penn Station. Was very crowded and clearly very popular, but hotel reception service was friendly and swift. 

We had snacks and drinks at the Cafe, which were good. Service could have been a bit more attentive, but overall fine. 

Rooms were nicely sized, especially for the city, large bathrooms, though no tub, just shower, which isn’t untypical for NYC. Beds were comfy and cozy. 

Room came with mini bar and available Voss bottled water which were an outrageous $8 and $10. I mean, come on. You also needed to pay extra for music via the TV as well as WiFi - $14! I overheard a guest complaining about the overpriced WiFi upon checkout, to which reception commented that free WiFi was available - apparently just hard to find and for guests to connect to. Suggest asking about it at check in. 

Overall, very nice, clean and comfy hotel - if you’re willing to pay. Would stay here again if I wasn’t trying to stick to a particularly low budget.

title: Great hotel
text: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff, performed the hoola hoop in the lobby and got a free upgrade on the room, complements of Allen at the check-in desk. I would highly recommend this hotel. Free happy hour is killer, lobby restaurant was great.

title: Eventi rocks
text: The Kimpton Event is a chic upbeat hotel in Chelsea. It is a great location for downtown and midtown access. The Event is all about service. the staff is super friendly and helpful. The perks of a Kimpton are wonderful like free wine happy hour and morning coffee.

title: Not my Eventi
text: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past 10 years.  Love the location and staff usually are top notch.  I was happy years back when the lobby was renovated and the restaurant added.   Booked 3 months out and glad I did because the hotel sold out my weekend.   Upon checking into our room the condition was not the hotel I was used to.  The carpet had stains and was gathered up causing a trip hazard.  The doorman’s were all scratched and torn up.  Desk/phone covered in dust.  Stain on the bedspread. The tub tile discolored and old.   I know hotels take a beating but it was apparent no one really cares.  At $500 x night this hotel is not a Hampton Inn.  Just felt let down and realized I need to find a new go-to hotel.  I’m now in search of my new Eventi...

title: Favorite City Staples!
text: I've stayed at this hotel anytime I'm really looking for a weekend getaway with friends or my significant other! It's in a great location, the restaurants & bars are amazing, the staff is extremely friendly. Luxurious. Amazing views. Very comfortable & clean amenities. This place is really my standard go to in NYC.

title: Kimpton Christmas shopping
text: Spent three nights at the Kimpton. Evening Bar staff and food were fabulous. Great atmosphere in general. No feel of Christmas in the hotel which was disappointing. Beds comfortable, but bedding was flimsy and no warmth. Would have loved to have seen a duvet (time of the year) and for the bed/room to have felt more cosy. No tea or coffee amenity and this should be a standard in a Kimpton.  Breakfast service setting is lovely, especially by the fireplace. But lacked personality by servers.

title: Noisier than expected due to location
text: I am a fan of Kimpton. The hotel rooms and food were very good. The location is on 6th is just noisier than a mid block location in a quieter neighborhood. The rooms on high floors NOT on 6th are quieter.

title: Very busy
text:
Rooms are nice, front desk staff and concierge pleasant. Bar and vine restaurant staff aloof. Bar is full of locals most nights so don’t expect to get in if you are staying at the hotel. 
Lupulo maitre de unpleasant, gum chewing and also aloof.

title: Faultless
text: Great hotel and great location. Staff superb and attentive and our room on the 15th floor certainly had a view with the Empire State greeting us night and day. Room spotlessly clean and huge comfortable bed. A very special thank you to one staff member by the name of Elsie. It was our 25th anniversary during our stay and we mentioned that this was why we were in New York. Next thing a chilled bottle and chocolates appeared in our room which was very kind and thoughtful. Sadly didn’t  see her again to thank her in person but it was very kind. Every evening at 5pm is wine hour and it’s “on the house” Don’t miss it and don’t hesitate to book this hotel.

title: AMAZING HOTEL IN AN AMAZING CITY
text: With so many hotels in NY it was hard to pick one and we certainly made the right choice, even before our trip Sam on the front desk was so helpful, the location is perfect slightly away from the hustle and bustle but near enough to be part of it, our rooms were amazing , every staff member was happy and helpful , the bars and restaurants have amazing atmosphere.  I can not remember the ladies name who was on the front desk with Sam who was a real foodie but she gave us amazing advice on where to eat etc (and to hotel management she did rate your restaurants highly)  I would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation.

title: Excellent Location
text: Travelled here on Business, previous years stayed in other hotels, room sizes are massive compared to other more expensive hotels around. Staff are very friendly, food is good, all in all an excellent experience.

title: Great location
text:
I stayed at Kimpton Eventi for one night (due to its proximity to Penn station). I have  been to other Kimpton hotels before so I knew what to expect (cool, quirky, fun brand). To my surprise upon check in I was upgraded from a basic king room to a Veranda suite. The suite was quite lovely, with an enormous master bath, large living/dining room, well appointed bedroom, a half-bath near the entrance and of course a veranda. I even got a partial view of the Empire State building. The robes were comfortable, as was the bedding. Hotel provides various amenities for travellers, such as a toothbrush kit. There is a small bar area in the living room, with a mini fridge and a sink. There is a large TV in the living room and another one in the bedroom. 
Two things to note. The elevator shaft adjoins the suite and it's quite audible, especially in the night. The electronic controls (lights and such) are a bit hard to figure out. 
The check-in was super quick and friendly (Celine was the person who checked me in), and I did the check out via TV in the room. 
There is free La Colombe coffee downstairs, which came in handy in the morning.

I would definitely stay there again, either before travelling or for a game at MSG.

title: All Kimpton Properties, NEVER Fail!!!!
text: This boutique hotel, as only Kimpton can do, is great! I have stayed many times with Kimpton where their brands are impressively located, such as, Washington, D.C., and , San Francisco, but, New York City has three great properties, ALL rooms, restaurants, public spaces, are as always, innovative and impressively appointed! You will love the Manager's Happy Hour, everyday at 4pm, and, all of the extras!!!

title: Epic Wedding!
text: Great facilities, friendly staff, nice rooms and good food. All the components you need to host one of the most important eventS in anyone's life. We are happy that we chose the hotel for our wedding and guests to stay for exploring NYC!

title: Mediocre service doesn't match the great location and well-designed rooms
text:
My two-night stay at the Eventi was marked by great "hardware" in the form of a well-designed room in a convenient location, but mediocre service "software" from the staff.

Location:  The Eventi is a short drive and a manageable walk from Penn Station.  Times Square and the theater district, Chelsea, and Flatiron are all within easy striking distance on foot, and midtown offices and shopping are also relatively close by.  The neighborhood is vibrant and safe, with plenty of restaurant options - including the Korean spots in "Koreatown" - nearby.

Room:  The Eventi is a newer, high-rise property.  To avoid noise, ask for a room on one of the upper floors.  We were on the 18th floor, on the back side of the building, and had an open view of the city.
