I believe that rooms at the front of the hotel would have a view of the Empire State Building, but also face busy Sixth Avenue - if you're on the front side, definitely ask for a higher floor so that noise isn't a problem.

Our room was clean, spacious, and bright, with a large window, good lighting, and easy-to-use controls.  The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom had a simple, intuitive design with a great marble shower enclosure.  

Service:  We stayed at the hotel over Thanksgiving weekend, which I'm sure is especially hectic for the hotel staff.  We arrived by car and used valet parking, a format that I suspect isn't typical.  When we pulled up by car, there was almost nowhere to park in front of the hotel, and no hotel staff outside the building to answer questions or deal with bags.  I went into the hotel and eventually found a staff member who was able to help with parking, which costs $50/day plus tax, with no in/out privileges.  Your car is available within 30 minutes of making a request.

We arrived around lunch time, but check in is at 3.  The lobby was a zoo.  We eventually found someone to store our bags, and asked the front desk to alert us if a room became available before 3.  While eating lunch, we got a call to say that our room was ready, and went back to the hotel - only to be told by the front desk that no rooms were available until 3.  Obviously, there was poor communication between staff members.  In any case, we were finally  able to check in before 3.  Note that bags are not delivered to rooms - guests carry their luggage.  

Housekeeping came to service our room at 10 AM one morning, a bit early for a weekend, and we had to request service for later in the day.  

We planned to leave the hotel at 7 AM.  Since the front desk was crowded earlier in the morning, I tried to check out at around 6:30, to take advantage of a window when the front desk wasn't busy. My partner was still in the room. The front desk said I couldn't settle the bill early, as the hotel would have to send housekeeping to prepare the room for the next guests right away.  I was surprised that I couldn't settle the bill less than an hour before I planned to leave the room, an arrangement that most hotels agree to without question.  

The service issues I mentioned are all minor, but they added up to an experience that wasn't quite up to par with the stays I've had at other Kimpton properties.        

The Eventi scores well on location, room comfort, and overall value.  While individual staff members are friendly, they often appear to be on auto-pilot - a small amount of sensitivity and flexibility would bring the service into line with the rest of the property.

title: Fix The Elevators!!!!!
text: We were two families in town to take in a play as well as a concert at Madison Square Garden.  The location of this place is great.  3 blocks from the MSGarden is huge.  Close enough to mid-town and theater district but as annoying as Time's Square.  Macy's nearby too.  The only negative I need to share is that that system in the elevators where you have to insert your key card to get to your floor was "wonky" at best.  Many guests were having trouble as did we.  Up, down. Up, down.  The card reader malfunctioned in each elevator car for the two nights we were there.  I am assuming that management will take card of this and no reason to stay away, as long as it gets fixed!

title: Pleased Guests
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel and were extremely pleased with the hospitality. We were checked in by a man named Allan who was very accommodating. He provided a lovely room with a great view. We grabbed a bite to eat at the restaurant L’amico which is located inside the hotel. It was excellent and my wife highly recommends the scallops. When we returned to our room we found a bottle of red wine and a plate of fruit. This again was provided by Allan who made this mom and dads night away very special.

title: my first review- on trip adviser
text:
I arrived to NYC early Sunday night- it was a stopover so I had 4 pieces of luggage.. it was very hard to find the hotel no signage-when the cab driver finally found the hotel, it was a mad house out there, cars double and triple park, bike lane (I nearly got ran down) and no staff in the front to the hotel to assist guests upon arrival and departure, I was left on 6th ave in the middle of the street with 4 bags and no assistance. when I finally got all my stuff in the lobby...still no help! Check in was easy, hotel lobby feels more like a club for the 80's only thing missing was a mirror ball. 

room was nice, needs some updating, but clean! 
The entire hotel needs updating!!

I had to catch a 7:00pm flight monday so I stored my luggage, left the hotel around 3:30, still nobody outside to assist with a cab a luggage. I choose Kimpton hotels when I travel because of the service they provide.... This is the first time I stayed in the Eventi, service was not bad, just absent.  

For the price they charge I do expect service- I would not return

title: Another Kimpton Winner!
text: I have come to really love Kimpton Hotels and I try and stay in them as often as possible.  The Eventi lived up to my expectations in every way.  It was my first time to this location but it won't be my last.  The staff was friendly, attentive and accommodating.  The room was spacious, clean and well-appointed.  Unfortunately, I was only there for one night and had to check out very early in the morning but I will definitely be back next time I'm in NYC.

title: VERY GOOD WITH DRAWBACKS
text:
I stayed at the Kimpton Eventi on Friday & Saturday night 10/11 NOV 2017. It was a last minute booking over Veterans Day and it simply was the best deal by far for what I needed. I actually wanted to stay in a boutique hotel in Chelsea, but this was the closest for the price & standard I could find.

I arrived in a lobby that frankly looked like a train station full of people. I expected a long check in process but it was seamless and Jason was great - prompt yet informative. My room was large, modern & clean with a view of the Empire State Building. The bathroom is huge. I had a good work space. Over all the room was better & larger than most in this category of hotels in NY and for what I paid. It lacked tea/coffee making facilities which was a bit annoying, but there is free coffee in the lobby. I ran into a cleaning ladies once or twice and they were extremely chatty & friendly, which seems like something small - but friendly/happy staff reflects well on the hotel. They have a happy hour on the 3rd floor with free wine which is lovely. Free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel etc all great.

The drawbacks to watch out for : ask for a room away from 6th Ave (so basically no Empire State view) as the traffic noise & construction on other buildings are relentless and 24 hours - even with all windows closed - and the highest floor you can afford. Despite my request for a quiet room I ended up with an inter-leading room (voices and tv heard clearly) and next to the linen room (which frankly didn't bother me too much). Obviously room service, drinks etc are crazy expensive - this is Manhattan after all - but there is a 24 hr supermarker across the road (just don't get run over on 6th).

I feel like my 3 star rating is perhaps a bit unfair and it really should be 4 stars - just that I wanted/expected a quiet boutique hotel in Chelsea - which this definitely is not. It feels more like a Times Square/Midtown type hotel. I've stayed at Kimpton in Pittsburgh which felt much more exclusive, but alas a very good hotel chain.

Hope my comments are fair and helpful to other guests.

title: Comfortable
text: Our check in experience was a little odd as we had real trouble understanding what the receptionist was actually saying to us.  Anyway, the room and shower facilities were well appointed and once we'd had a bit of a wrestle with the air conditioning, it was comfortable too.  One big plus for us was the complimentary drinks hours at about 5pm - with a decent 'heavy pour' too.

title: Home away from home
text: We spent 13 nights at the Kimpton Eventi and highly recommend it. The staff are friendly and go above and beyond to ensure you enjoy your stay. The hotel is in a great location with MSG & Macy's a short walk. The rooms are clean, modern and spacious (we traveled with 5 suitcases and a set of golf clubs and still had plenty of space in our room!). Lots of deli's close by, a starbucks a block away and a new Nordstrom Rack has opened on the next block. The restaurants at the hotel are fabulous - beautiful fresh produce and a great menu. This was first visit to the Kimpton Eventi (our regular hotel had closed) but we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else now. We've found our home away from home! Can't wait to go back.

title: Great hotel.
text:
Great vibe. Has a good bar and also serves La Colombe coffee!!! 

Rooms are modern and yet comfortable. Going to make this my regular hotel from now on. The price varies hugely so book early and get a good price

title: Perfect Location
text:
During a recent trip to New York for a wedding we decided to try another Kimpton hotel. I've been a Kimpton rewards member for years and generally enjoy their hotels, and this was another excellent stay.

Our room was a City View Deluxe room with views of the Empire State Building and Sixth Avenue. It was clean, quiet, well-appointed, and comfortable. The only foible was a slow internet connection that didn't reflect our price point or location. Other Kimpton hotels have had 100 Mbps connection in the room, but this was closer to 5. Legally it doesn't qualify for the FCC definition of high-speed internet. 

The best was adequately comfortable with nice linens and pillows. We didn't eat from any of the restaurants, but did order room service a couple of times and were impressed each time. Our food was prompt and hot. 

Parking is valet and about what I'd expect for New York. Our only issue was it took almost an hour for our car to arrive when it was time to leave, but the manager took some of the parking charge off our bill. It was inconvenient, but rectified to our satisfaction. 

I'd especially like to praise Aston during our check in. He managed our attempt to park in front with aplomb while ensuring our bags were handled with care and delivered to our room. He is an excellent representative of the Kimpton brand and made a wonderful first impression. 

I'd recommend the Eventi for couples looking to visit downtown New York in a convenient location. There is plenty of restaurants and sights nearby while having excellent access to taxis and the subway. Pets are welcome too. 

I'm sure we'll stay at the Eventi again. I just hope they get a faster internet connection.

title: Grands espoirs vite déçus
text: 4 jours en famille, en avril. Plutôt beaux espaces communs au rdc, wifi partout, bar agréable avec des matériaux chauds (vieux cuirs, bois,..). L'hôtel est connecté au restaurant portugais contigu qui est un peu cher mais top. Environnement immédiat très central pas de remarque à ce sujet. En revanche les chambres sont minuscules, nous avions réservé une junior suite familiale mais une fois le canapé lit déplié, plus une place pour ouvrir les valises, pas de penderie!. Autre désagrément, le 1er jour en ouvrant le canapé nous découvrons que le matelas est maculé de tâches d'urine (certainement des enfants précédents non encore étanches). J'ai eu le plus grand mal à me faire changer le matelas, outre l'attente (45mn à 22h) j'ai du un peu hurler pour qu'on finisse par trouver un matelas propre (le type voulait simplement retourner le matelas qui était aussi peu ragoutant en dessous). En résumé marque un peu prétentieuse pour un produit quelconque.

title: Another Great Stay
text: This is the second time I have stayed at Kimpton Hotel Eventi & this stay was just as wonderful as the first.  The location is perfect, the decor is beautiful, the beds are cozy, room is a decent size, the staff super friendly & helpful.  I will definitely choose to stay at this hotel again.

title: Fabulous hotel in Chelsea!
text: A great location and a cool vibe in this Kimpton hotel.  The lobby is hopping and a place to gather.  Friendly and efficient front desk staff made check in quick and easy.  They offer a complimentary happy hour every evening, which is a perfect way to start the evening.  Rooms were modern and well designed.  Loved the animal print bathrobes :) Very clean and beds are super comfortable! I will be staying here again!

title: Consistently Great
text: I have stayed at this particular Kimpton hotel a number of times and it is by far my go to choice for a boutique hotel in NY. The staff are friendly. The rooms are well appointed and quiet and the restaurants in the hotel are great.

title: Best hotel ever
text: Amazing - so sweet to my very large dog too! Will definitely be coming back - everyone on staff was absolutely fantastic. Bravo Hotel Eventi - I have never been so impressed by a hotel in my life! Great job and thank you!

title: Love The Location
text: My hip son-in-law recommended the Eventi and I’m so glad he did.  My friend and I appreciated being close to the subway, short walk to the Highline and Eataly.The front desk and doormen are a little less formal than some hotels but that made it more relaxed and fun. They made we 60-something’s feel young!

title: Super trendy hotel close to attractions!
text: My boyfriend and I went for our anniversary and this was not our first time to nyc. We typically stay at the waldorf astoria, but wanted to switch it up a little bit this time around! I was overall very pleased with our decision. The location is ideal for checking out lower manhattan and the empire state building (its right there) as well as madison square garden and those types of things. My only complaint was how far central park was): not the hotel's fault obviously but that's my favorite part of the city and it was always a little harder to include it in our plans for the day. Overall, the room was beautiful and comfortable and we had a nice view of the city.

title: 8 Night stay.
text: Great location able to walk to Time Square, Chelsea Market. Fabulous restaurants within walking distance. Great food right in hotel too. Arranged late checkout and then they will store your luggage till home time. Books up quickly so book ahead.

title: Great dog-friendly hotel!
text: We stayed at the Kimpton Eventi for my dog's 11th birthday, and the Kimpton staff could not have been nicer! Samantha at the front desk even made a special trip to get treats for my dog -- such a sweet surprise! The room was clean and quiet (and pretty spacious by NYC standards!), and the hotel location was convenient for our needs -- close to the High Line, and an easy walk to Central Park, Union Square, etc. Everything about the weekend at the Eventi was perfect! Can't wait to go back!

title: Good Midtown hotel
text: We stayed in an Executive suite for our honeymoon, it was a good size (by New York standards) & we had a great view of the Empire State building.  However, on  the downside the furniture & overall room was a bit worn.  The staff here were very friendly, the manager left cupcakes & champagne in our room for us which was a lovely touch. The wine hour was great & we especially enjoyed wine hour on the roof top terrace. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Kimpton Eventi.

title: Amazing experience. Would recommend! Must stay.
text: My husband and I had the most amazing stay at this hotel. It's centrally located to all the awesome brunch and dinner spots (Eataly). Try the hotel restaurant (L'Amico). Do attend wine reception (every night from 5-6). I mean you could never leave the hotel and have the best experience. The ambience is everything here. Additionally, CELINE in concierge made this stay so great for us! She was so helpful, kind, patient, and provided excellent recommendations for food, entertainment, and sightseeing. Give that girl a raise!! I look forward to coming back to this city. NY gives me life.

title: Boutique, Modern hotel - good location
text: Is at 29th and 30th Street. Modern hotel with compact but good rooms. Room was very good. Front desk was very helpful but go out for meals - next door was very good. Close to Penn Station - 5 minutes walk which is a bonus. Only a couple of blocks to Times Square and Broadway.

title: Flawless
text: Had a 2 day business trip to NY. The thing I noticed most was there wasn't anything that I noticed that wasn't perfect. Air conditioning, bed, bathroom and amenities. Folks at the desk were really nice. Check-in was quick. Just love it when there isn't anything at all to critique. The rates were reasonable as well (for NYC).

title: Cool vibe, Rooms Need Work
text: Cool vibe in lobby w/coffee bar and restaurant/ bar. Rooms are worn- floors scratched, furniture stained. Had a suite and while modern decor everything looks like it gets a lot of traffic. Not what I expected from a Kimpton. Disappointing.

title: Viisi päivää New Yorkissa
text: Vietimme viisi päivää New Yorkissa lomaillen. Majoitumme Hotelli Eventiin, kerokseen 18 kahden hengen huoneeseen. Maisema oli hieno ilta-auringon puolelle. Huone oli siisti perushuone, kylppäri oli siisti ja hyvä. Sijainniltaan hotelli oli loistava, koska siitä oli kaksi kortteli eli n 10min kävelymatka Madison Square Gardeniin katsomaan lätkää. Myös Macy´s oli kolmen korttelin päässä! Alakerrassa oli ravintola, jolla on Michelinin tähti, L´Amico, loistavaa ruokaa, italialaisia herkkuja. The Vine -ravintola taas tarjoaa aamupalaa korkeaan hintaan, joten aamupala kannattaa napata paikalliseen tapaan Delistä. Hyvä Deli oli kadun toisella puolella. Voin suositella hotellia.

title: Horrible Experience with Hotel Management
text: I booked our wedding anniversary stay based upon location and reputation.  A family situation arose requiring a date change...the staff and management simply said NO!  There wasn't any flexibility, no other options and we lost our payment.   I will never book here again and tell others about my experience.

title: I am a complete fan of the Eventi!!
text:
With so many choices in New York City for hotels, let me make this easy for you.....stay at the Eventi!  I am a frequent business traveler, and I can't say enough about the place!
The front desk staff is welcoming, friendly and helpful, and always make me feel at home. The bellmen are always smiling. The lobby is pretty, the bar and restaurant are full of energy.  Ask for a room on the Empire State Building view side, it is magical. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean.  The proximity to penn station is really convienient, and the neighborhood is truly up and coming. Kimpton also has a great loyalty program and they are pet friendly. Overall, this is a great choice, you won't be disappointed!

title: Superb hotel
text:
I honestly can’t recommend this hotel highly enough.  It’s extremely centrally located in Manhattan ( if that’s what you are looking for ).

It’s well decorated and appointed , and has a great selection of restaurants ...  three I think. 

What really sets this hotel aside though, are the staff.  They honestly couldn’t have done more to be helpful and really went above and beyond, without making it feel like an imposition .  Really enjoyed me stay and will definitely be back !

title: My home away from home in NYC
text:
My favorite hotel in NYC! Hands down!! I've been staying at the Eventi for over 2 years, and I truly feel like it is my home away from home- I'm there at least 1x a month for work, and I never want to leave! The staff, the location, the restaurants, the rooms... I've never been disappointed! 

- Front Desk Staff: My frontdesk people are the best!! Victoria & Kevin make me feel so welcomed, I get so excited to check-in. They even write handwritten cards welcoming me. They are always trying to accommodate their guests & so friendly and helpful, I can't boast enough. 

- Bellmen: Even the bellmen recognize me and welcome me back, its heartwarming! 

-Restaurants: Steven manages the restaurants and is so amazing - he is such a friendly face to see and always does his best to ensure me (and my friends) are taken care of!
The Vine: More of a bar w/ delicious food and great drinks. They open the windows during the summer, and have a cozy fireplace during the winter. When I'm lucky, I sit in a cozy couch & work all day from there bc I never want to leave! The hostess & bartenders are great & welcome me with a hug. 
L'Amico: Beautiful restaurant w/ amazing pizza ovens. DELICIOUS food!! (I'm obsessed with the hangar or skirt steak & Brussel sprouts, kale salad... its all so good!) Yna is my favorite bartender here- she's the best! Many nights I just hangout at the hotel restaurants instead of go off property 
.. not to mention their amazing amazing event space on the Second Floor! It's breathtaking. 

Rooms: The rooms here are bright & airy with floor to ceiling windows. The suites are amazing & so comfortable- I love the soaker tub! Their bedding & beds are so comfortable I never want to get up! They help accommodate for anything you may have forgotten. They even have yoga mats!

I refer all of my coworkers to the Eventi, and I have never heard one complaint- only praises and people that want to stay more frequently! I can't wait to be back in a few weeks & see Victoria & Kevin as I walk in! :)

title: Rien à redire
text: Nous avions réservé une chambre pour 7 nuits avec surclassement : superbe vue sur l'Empire State Building ! Le personnel était agréable, mis à part un certain portier qui ne nous a jamais ouvert la porte, considérant sûrement que nous n'étions pas assez bien habillées ! L'hôtel est très bien situé : à quelques minutes à pieds du métro, position centrale idéale. Pour la chambre, auncun problème, bonne literie, relativement silencieux par rapport à l'emplacement, belles prestations, bonne douche, chambre spacieuse, beaucoup de place pour ranger les affaires. Quand nous reviendrons à New York, c'est l'hôtel que l'on choisiera.

title: Quiet but uncomfey bed and lacks warmth
text:
Stayed here for our first 3 nights in NYC.
Pros: great views from top floor room. Nice arty reception and resteraunt/bar. Free coffee in the lobby. Great pregnancy massage in the spa.
Cons: we booked a suit as we usually sleep in separate rooms at home, and liked that the room divided into 2 areas if you used the sofa bed to sleep on- I'm not fussy about beds usually but the bed was so saggy in the middle it wasn't sleepable-on! Staff at the desk could not replace it and didn't offer us another suit, so just took a standard room. For £400/night you'd expect at least a functional bed. Also, we love boutique hotels and we usually 'click' with everyone we meet traveling, but certainly found the desk staff a little cold. Add no sauna or steam room and an expensive breakfast, and doesn't really justify the cost of the room.
We're in another boutique hotel a few blocks away now near the public library and it really is chalk and cheese !

title: Best time
text: We had a great stay here thanks to the staff who helped me celebrate my birthday. Jason went above and beyond. Steven also was fantastic. Close to everything, clean, modern and cool. Food at the restaurants was fantastic and we slept great too. Signature happy hour was wonderful. Can’t wait to come back!

title: A hotel that lacks coordination and hospitality
text:
I am now in a 2-week business trip in New York and has been staying in Eventi Hotel Kimpton on 851 Avenue of Americas for over one week but still, I got to stay here for nearly another full week.  Prior to the departure of my trip, I have already paid for the 2-weeks of hotel charges.

My experience with this hotel is it’s (i) chaotic and non-transparency in charging customers, (ii) lacks of effective communication amongst staffs, and most important of all, (iii) fails to provide hospitalities up to expectations.

When I checked in, I was told to have USD700 held up from my credit card as deposit to which I of course agreed.  But, few days later, without informing me or seeking my approval, a further USD1,600 was charged to my credit card with the reason that I am going to stay in the hotel for nearly 2 weeks.   If so, why I was not told that at the time when I checked in but rather having my credit card charged any time the hotel like? 

Besides, after having one breakfast and laundry in the hotel, I was immediately charged USD167 to my credit card despite I had told them before all those expenses should add to my final hotel bill and for which I will settle when check out.  When I called the front desk to get to the bottom of this, I was told the hotel was trying to take a ‘proactive approach’ to charge my credit card.  Seriously?  Anyway, at the end of the conversation, he agreed to have the amount to be refunded and will have the refund receipt be ready to send to me when it’s ready.

On the next day, when I talked to the so-called Front-desk Manager ‘ISHA’, she told me the hotel had refunded the USD167 but for the refund receipt, I have to get it from the front desk.  When I told her to leave the receipt in my room, she told me the hotel will not do so.  When I heard that, I was astonished.  How come the hotel cannot entertain such a simple request made by a customer and if so, what kind of hospitality and services that is?

One more thing, I reserved the hotel restaurant “L’Amico” at 9 pm on 27 Oct night.  Though I was there punctually, I had to wait for 45 minutes for a table for two.  Anyway, the foods were no surprise and I would compare that to a Bistro.  Disappointing enough.

Worst of all, on the night of 28 Oct, when I was resting in my room with the Do-Not-Disturb light turned on, a guy kept locking on my door at around 10pm.  When I answered the door, he asked me did I smell any cigarette.  I told him that I couldn’t and then he asked me to go out to smell. Supposing, he’s accusing of me of smoking in the room which I hadn’t caused I am not a smoker at all. He carried a bottle of air freshener in his hands and asked me, ‘do you want to smell this”? What is that supposed to mean? He then warned me, this is a non-smoking hotel and we do charge a cleaning fee the guest smokes. I am confident in telling him, ‘yes, and how does that concern me’? Anyway, what a great night to be disturbed on a Saturday relaxing night! 

Last but note least, as I have to stay in this hotel for few more days, I don’t know what’s going to happen.  Perhaps you will hear the second part of my story a few days later.  I just hope the hotel can at least improve a little bit on its services – especially to a customer who had paid around USD6800 staying there for over 2 weeks!!! Not a cheap hotel, but up to this point, I am receiving cheap services!

title: Buona posizione
text:
Ci sono stato per lavoro. In posizione strategica e con due ristoranti che hanno lo stesso accesso della hall. Questo rende la hall davvero rumorosa e caotica. Il personale della reception non è molto cordiale anzi...
Le camere sono pulite il bagno molto bello e funzionale ma un po' piccole.
Il costo rispetto alla qualità è piuttosto alto

title: Weekend girls trip
text:
Both my cousin and I are Kimpton fans so that's one reason I chose this hotel for our NYC weekend.  Overall we thought it was great, but I don't think it's worthy of 5 stars.  The pros:
-Location - perfectly centered to walk (if you don't mind 20+ minute walks) everywhere but away from the crowds
-Clean- our room was spotless and quiet at night (although I do wear ear plugs).  The bed/pillows were comfortable although I could hear a bedspring pop in one spot on the bed.  The shower was fantastic (although the glass shower doesn't make it particularly practical if you're more than one to a room- there can really only be one person in the bathroom at any time 
-Lobby - the lobby, while small, was cheerful with close by access to coffee bar (excellent cappuccinos) or cocktails.  

Cons-the front desk staff wasn't as welcoming as I would have thought.  When I initially checked in, the girl didn't tell me anything about the wine reception (however, I already knew about it from other Kimpton stays)...I just happened to find the little note of the location by the water in the lobby.  She just rushed me through - taking my cc and gave me room key
-there was no water in the lobby a couple of times we stopped by  - and it was a warm weekend
-Often times it seemed like the front desk staff was busy chatting when they could have been more helpful to guests - that being said there were 1-2 staff that were quite helpful; it was just a mixed bag
Overall a great stay - just not 5 star

title: LOVE this hotel!
text: Can't say enough about Kimpton Hotels; and this one is so convenient to Penn Station!  Service awesome, restaurant amazing, rooms beautiful, cool and modern.  The haircare and other products superior. My hotel chain of choice!

title: Trip to New York
text: Excellent Trip to New York and stay at the Eventi Hotel.  We received excellent service at check in, staff was friendly.  We experienced the Vine and L'Amico and service and food was good.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing!
text: The staff were polite and courteous. Our room overlooked the Empire State Building. It was clean. The breakfasts though a little pricey were delicious especially the pancakes. There was a Happy Hour on the roof terrace from 5-6 pm each day. Evening meals had a good variety of foods. It was well placed for site seeing. I will certainly go there again.

title: Требуется ремонт и генеральная уборка
text:
Останавливались в этом 5ти звездоночном отеле с отцом на 4 ночи в номере с двумя кроватями квин-сайз.
Локация отличная. Основные туристические достопримечательности в 10 минутах ходьбы. Метро 2-3 квартала. Много кафе и расторанчиков рядом , особенно между 5th Av. and 6th Av. по 32-33 street. 
Отель откровенно старый, но популярный. Вечером шумная тусовка в баре. 
Отелю требуется  обновление и главное -генеральная уборка, т.к. Отель очень пыльный , побита мебель, кнопки в лифтах плохо работают. Из-за полумрака в лобби и других помещениях все это не очень бросается в глаза. 
Checking in . Возникли проблемы, утеряли мою прямую бронь , сделанную на их оригинальностях сайте. Регистрация заняла около 20 минут.
Incidental депозит в размере 100$ за ночь снимают при регистрации. Возврат жду, обещали 3-5 рабочих дня. 
Комната не большая и не Маленькая , для двоих достаточно места. Окна нашего номера выходили на противоположную улицу от входа с 6й Авеню на 21 этаже. При закрытых окнах тихо. Слышна речь из коридора, но в целом тихо. Есть шторы с блэкаутом , поэтому огни города не мешают спать. 
Номер Очень пыльный! Фото прилагаю. 
В 1-й день дали объявление, что уборки не будет. Дальше была ежедневная , но «по-верхам».
Выключатели освещения в номере раскиданы по комнате и следует выключать /включать каждый по отдельности. 
Мини-бар забит до отказа на любом вкус.
Вода в номере платная 10$.
Шкаф встроенный , немудрёная дверь в него.
Душ понравился очень- хороший напор, лейка большая прямо с потолка. Косметика хорошая. 
Тапочек , кофе или чайника в номере нет. 
Внизу есть кафе отеля и итальянский ресторанчик -очень популярное и шумное место, но еда достойная. 
Завтрак в кафе отеля разнообразный ,американский, но можно выбрать и более диетический вариант по меню . Завтраки в среднем на двоих 40-50 $ без чаевых. 
Утром до 10:00 в лобби есть комплиментарный кофе и чай.
А вино с 17:00 до 18:00 на разных этажах , о чем нужно читать информацию в лобби возле Кулера с водой. 
О том, что существуют такие предложения/комплименты от отеля  нас на ресепшн не уведомили ни разу. Заметили сами. 
Checking out быстро, без проблем. Чемоданы при выселении оставляли на пол дня в комнате для багажа, забрали быстро без проволочек.

title: Things are changing...
text: We've used this venue for a lot of events recently and the quality is declining. It seems there have been some staff changes, or at least procedural changes and they haven't been for the better. The rooms are still nice and the bar is good but for events some work needs to be done.

title: NYC - Kimpton Hotel Evenit vs. Kimpton Muse
text:
A few weeks back had the opportunity to stay some nights at the Kimpton Hotel Eventi and then switched over to the Kimpton Muse in NYC. 

First off - I am a fan of the Kimpton chain and a Kimpton Karma Rewards member (if you are going to stay at a Kimpton well worth signing up for Karma Rewards - free wifi, raid the bar, eventually get a free room night, offers, etc).

Kimpton Eventi - great staff, rooms are clean, good size, nicely laid out, contemporary furnishings, good bar and restaurants options on site and great location to get around the City (edge of Chelsea and NoMad area of Manhattan, PATH and Subway only a few blocks away).

Kimpton Muse - great staff, rooms are clean, smaller room, room furnishings and decoration are little bit dated, bar/restaurant not open on Sunday or Monday, 1/2 block to the Times Square madness and only a few blocks to Broadway theaters.

After staying at both - my preference would be the Kimpton Hotel Eventi.

title: Très belles prestations
text:
Bel hôtel, avec des chambres très confortables et bien équipées.
Personnel sympathique et serviable.
Tarifs un peu élevés, mais difficile de trouver bon marché à Manhattan de toute façon.
Un peu bruyant car les new-yorkais adorent jouer du klaxon, même en pleine nuit, et cela perturbe, quand bien même on se trouve au huitième étage, comme c'était mon cas.
Pour le petit déjeuner, préférer le buffet qui est nettement meilleur marché que le choix au plat.
Situation excellente, juste à côté de l'Empire State Building, et à 5 km de Ground Zero et Battery Park d'où l'on peut rejoindre la Statue de la Liberté.
Le restaurant de l'hôtel (L'Amico) est assez cher, mais il y a pas mal de restos coréens près de l'Empire, pas chers et très bons.

title: Great stay
text: Great stay !  Always friendly staff - clean rooms great customer service - I always look to stay at a kimpton anywhere I travel - we went to a show at Madison square garden and the hotel was about a block away- great dining inside the restaurant !

title: Great Room Block Experience
text: Sheneka and her team were very helpful in the planning of my wedding block. She helped guide us through the process for a seamless experience. Would highly recommend booking a block here. They made our honeymoon suite special too. Not to mention the room was gorgeous!

title: Great location and wonderful hotel!
text: Such a great hotel! Nice bar, and I loved the shower in this hotel. The central location made it great to get everywhere I was headed in the city. Breakfast was a little pricey, there were more inexpensive options nearby.

title: Very good hotel in great location, but does have room for improvement
text: Whilst I would not normally consider this a truly 5 star hotel I have been told that by New York standards it is around the mark.  Nice hotel and in a great location for a tourist.  Vibrant bar and overall hotel does have a good ease about it.   Staff are very good and friendly.   Negative for me was I didn't like pets being allowed in a hotel. One large dog was in the lift with us where the owner proudly bragged as how they lied about it being a "service dog" so it could come on the plane to NY, really! We had a couple of "yappers" across the hall during the day time, fortunately they did not play up at night avoiding us needing to complain. Maybe a dedicated floor for animals would at least be considerate to other guests. Lastly the hotel could be more proactive about marketing it's services and activities. They kept moving "wine hour" to various rooms and you only find out by turning up to where you think it is and then tracking down someone as to the actual location. As for other services didn't use spa as it wasn't promoted so I had no interest.  Don't know if I missed any other activities.

title: Fantastic stay
text: I want to start my review by thanking Tyler the concierge. Myself and my boyfriend visited here last month for my birthday. He travelled from the uk (unaware to me) with my present in his suitcase. Upon arrival my boyfriend requested balloons to be put in our room on the night of my birthday and have my present sat out. Tyler went above and beyond decorating the room and going to get the balloons himself. It was a challenge for them both to hide this from me! As for the hotel, it was perfect! Amazing location, clean, generous sized rooms, fab decor! I loved it and will definitely visit again!!

title: Fabulous hotel - stay here!
text: We stayed for five nights and loved it. Our city view king room was quite small but very comfortable - great bed, spacious bathroom, excellent shower and a view of the Empire State Building. The location is good - 6th Avenue is busy and interesting, and the hotel is close to the subway, shops, bars and restaurants. Luckily the soundproofing is good (probably also because we were on the 18th floor) and we slept really well. The free coffee each morning and daily wine hour were much appreciated. We ate in all three restaurants and they were all excellent, both the food and the service. In summary, we can’t recommend this hotel highly enough and hope to come back again in the not too distant future.

title: Great
text:
Top to bottom a great hotel. 
Nice gym. Fantastic albeit pricey coffee. Daily wine reception for guests. Lots of nice touches. 
Friendly and very helpful staff 
Not a great location. Not much to do nearby. 
A solid four star but not five star.

title: Great quick weekend getaway
text:
Traveled to New York city for a three day weekend. This was our first time staying at Eventi and wasn't sure what to expect. The moment we walked up upon the hotel we instantly fell in love with it's charm and vibe. 

Our room had a view of the Empire State Building. Huge floor to ceilings windows were great to view the city around and below us. At night the drapes block out all lighting from the outside so don't worry you'll sleep like a baby. 

The building directly across is under construction, although we didn't experience any noise issues what soever. Great masculine room with lighting that is not over done. I travel a lot and there is nothing worse when hotels have harsh bright lighting in small rooms. This room had plenty of soft lighting but wasn't harsh and helped me to relax. Great large bathroom with tiled shower. 

We used room service and the concierge twice, both times they were quick to meet our needs and requests. Thank you for that! I can't say anything negative about this hotel. It's close to a lot of shopping and greta dining and nightlife. I truly enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay here again. Book with confidence.

title: Great place to stay
text: The Eventi is well located (6th & 30th) with nice rooms, great coffee shop, and several fun, hip restaurants. The rooms are nice, small, but it is NYC. Good gym and a friendly and knowledgeable staff.

title: Elegant, comfortable, convenient
text:
I had the pleasure of staying for two nights on a recent trip to NYC. The check-in was efficient, and the hotel lobby very welcoming. I felt the room was very comfortable, although I am not a fan of the way the sheets are tightly tucked in under the bed!

The view was great, and the room was spacious and comfortable. The location is convenient, especially since it's just a short walk from Penn Station. This makes commuting to/from JFK especially easy.

My one complaint is that the aircon is very loud, and when you get used to it being off (ie: the room is at the desired temperature), and then it suddenly turns on, it is jarring enough to wake you up.

That however, is minor, and I would certainly return to this hotel!

title: Like!
text:
There's nothing I dislike about that hotel. We stayed for three days and needed two connected rooms. The rooms aren't small and bathrooms are specious. One room had a shower, the other had a bath which was very convenient. We lived on the 10th floor and almost didn't hear the sound of the city (which is usually loud 'cause it's New York) :))) 
We liked our stay and I'm sure we will come back.

title: we will stay there again.
text: This was a very nice hotel experience in NYC.  The hotel is well located with easy walks to many attractions and the subway.  Our room was spacious and very well appointed.  The service was friendly (yes, even in NY), but there is no Concierge, and it wasn't always easy to get things like directions.

title: Amazing hotel
text: What can I say. I had booked another hotel and last minute changes to the Kimpton Eventi. We arrived early and got checked in to a great room.  Hotel staff were welcoming and food at the restaurants was very good.  We ordered room service and loved it.  The king sized bed was perfect. I would stay again as the location was great and midtown. It was within walking distance to the concert we were seeing at Madison Square Gardens.  I would highly recommend.

title: Fine hotel in a less than fine neighborhood.
text:
The room was quiet and large for NYC standards.  Comfy, restful sleep.  Elements of the room seemed worn and the colors were drab but it was perfectly fine.

Service and vibe in the hotel were top notch.  Not pretentious and everyone friendly.

Restaurants and bartenders top notch in my opinion.  Fabulous margaritas.

Overall, a fine option in the no-mans-land edge of Chelsea.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
lovely hotel , room was perfect , immaculately clean . An abundance of towels which makes a pleasant change , also robes . 
Very handy for Empire State Building , Macey's & Penn Station. 

Free wine hour was fun & also free tea & coffee every morning in the lobby . 

Staff were very helpful

title: Neat hotel. Convenient to MSG and Midtown.
text: Nice room, friendly accommodating staff.  We drove in and had them valet our vehicle, that process was flawless.  Would definitely stay again.  Good restaurant within facilities, service in them was okay.

title: Very good option if you're looking to stay in Midtown.
text:
The room was good, definitely above average for something in the city.  Nothing particularly memorable, but overall, good.  

The bathroom is what was memorable.  All white marble, ample space, and a rainfall shower head that was pretty life-changing.  

The room service was also very good.  I had it two nights in a row and both times, the food was excellent.  By far the best quality food I've had via room service in any hotel in the city.  

Overall, very happy with my stay here and would definitely stay again.

title: Fab hotel in mid town Manhattan
text:
Cool hotel, great staff, great location (10 min walk from Penn Station).
Room was spacious, clean, comfortable.
We ate breakfast in the restaurant which was great, again the staff are friendly / attentive.
Also had a great dinner in L'Amico - its popular, so book in advance. Ordered room service on another occasion which was really good.
We didn't go to the 'wine happy hour' on the outdoor terrace, but that was because were always out and about, but the terrace was nice.
Only reason we've not scored this 5/5 is the cost of the minibar....extortionate prices....why?
Still, we'd happily return to Hotel Eventi when we're next in NYC

title: An "Almost Hidden" Gem
text:
I first came across this hotel in an Expedia listing for 4-star or better hotels in the greater Manhattan area back in May.  As I was looking to set up a nice trip for our 10th wedding anniversary, I wanted something better than a Holiday Inn.  When I narrowed my search to hotels in or near Times Square, the Kimptons popped up more prominently.  I read the reviews, looked at the pictures, checked the actual location - and decided to go for it.  I prepaid two nights and basically hoped for the best.

There's something to be said about hope (and my fellow Yelpers, lest I forget) - this hotel basically knocked my expectations out of the park.  Despite being from NY, I've never really stayed in any of the hotels...since I grew up and lived on Long Island, any sojourn into the city was always a day trip, no need for overnight accommodations so I expected the worst.  You know, space is a premium in NYC in general, and a lot of reviews I'd read of other hotels often brought up the rather minimal square footage with the caveat that it is NYC and thus to be expected. This was most certainly NOT the case at Kimpton Eventi.  I upgraded us to the Master/King's Suite (I forget the exact moniker) so the room we got actually had a separate bedroom w/a king size bed; there was also a living room, a hallway with a full size closet, flatscreens in the living and bed rooms and a well appointed marble bath, with a separate closet for the toilet and floor-to-ceiling windows in both rooms that offered excellent views of the city from the 17th floor.  Talk about a swanky hotel room, it also had hardwood floors throughout, nice appointments, modern fixtures with Wi-Fi and numerous USB hookups for all of your toys.  We were one block over from MSG and a few blocks over from the Empire State Building and some 16 blocks from Times Square (which works out to about 3/4 of a mile from the hotel), ideally situated for the plans I'd put into motion.

When we first arrived at the GPS location, I wasn't sure what I was looking at- I saw what looked like a couple of restaurants w/outside seating, but no signs or indicators that there was a hotel on the premises.  I ended up circling around a few times looking for the hotel itself; my wife called the front desk and we were instructed to pull right up front and the valets would take care of the car and our bags and get us inside.  So, after what seemed like forever to get back around the block (one thing I didn't miss was the traffic- it took

title: mi aspettavo di più
text:
Hotel ben posizionato nella zona centrale di manhattan, a due passi dall'Empire e non lontano da Times Square. 
Per il resto sembra che diano più spazio e importanza alla ristorazione (ristorante stellato etc..) che al resto,  infatti l'ingresso dell'hotel è quasi anonimo, si accede alla reception "piccola" rispetto agli standard degli altri hotel di manhattan tutto in penombra e luci soffuse con il vociare di gente ai ristoranti e bar attigui. La camera veramente piccola (quadrupla), che seppure era una  standard mancava materialmente lo spazio vitale, se si aggiunge che l'armadio era talmente piccolo da non consentire di svuotare le valigie e con gli spazi limitati che non permettono di tenerle aperte in camere, potete solo immaginare le acrobazie mattutine per poter prendere gli indumenti.......Positivo il bagno, nel complesso pulizie ottime.  Aggiungiamo che la cassaforte non funzionava (segnalato ... ma causa il mio inglese approssimativo non ho ben capito i motivi della mancata sistemazione), lo scarico del lavandino leggermente otturato (chi fa le pulizie non lo segnala?). Sicuramente richiamano clienti con il FREE COFFE al mattino e FREE WINE alla sera, ma a me interessa il confort prima di tutto.
La sensazione si riassumere in una sola parola "angusto".
A parità di categoria e forse anche qualche gradino sotto si trova di meglio nei dintorni (esperienza diretta).

title: A sweet 16 birthday stay
text: The staff was excellent. Cupcakes delivered to our hotel room, for my nieces 16 birthday weekend. The front desk was wonderful. Good location. Nice resturants, bar, great vibe; very warm and welcoming to us.

title: The best place in town!
text: The Kimpton hotel was absolutely amazing. They always have the best service. The three restaurants to choose from were top-of-the-line.   We search for restaurants and a few compared to the ones located at the hotel.  We love Kimpton!!

title: Romantic Night in the city
text: We spent our anniversary at the Kimpton Hotel Eventi, and we were excited when we were upgraded without asking to a room on the 18th floor with a beautiful floor-to-ceiling window view of the skyline, including the Empire State Building.  The view was amazing--and different at different times of day!  One of our favorite parts of staying at Kimpton Hotels is the cocktail hour, where we can grab a free drink or two and relax for a bit before heading out on the town.  All around, it was a great visit!

title: Great stay and service
text:
I was here for about a week for business. Housekeeping was friendly and attentive. Any time there was an issue with anything, the front desk was immediately on top of it. The room was a great size by NYC standards. It's well laid out and comfortable for 2. We had a nice view of the Empire State Building. It's also a nice location, if you are here for Fashion Week or something at Madison Square Garden. 

The gym here is nice, too. It's small and fills up on the weekend. But during the week it was perfect for a quick workout. It has everything you need. 

It's also a nice perk to have several restaurants in the lobby.

title: Comfy stay
text: Big comfy bed. Room is a nice size. Lots of plugs and lights. Great view from 6th Ave side. Nice large bathroom with nice shower and bath amenities. Comfortable robe. Nice flat screen tv. Enjoyed free wine hour. Kimpton staff always great and helpful. Had a wonderful anniversary stay.

title: Good choice for NYC
text:
Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Eventi and was pretty impressed with my experience. The hotel is in a good location, close to two subway lines, walking distance to NoMad and Madison Square Garden. It is on a busy street, and less of a neighborhood feel, but that is both a benefit and a drawback - it just depends on what you are looking for.

The lobby was warm, welcoming and trendy. Check-in was seamless and the front desk staff were accommodating. What I really like is that they honored my request for a quiet room away from the elevators. This is a simple request, but you'd be amazed by how many hotels either overlook or ignore it. There have been many times when I've been placed right next to an elevator. I'm an extremely light sleeper so this bothers me. The fact Eventi acknowledged and honored the request scored points with me. 

The King room was a nice size and very well appointed. The carpet was plush, bed comfortable, and the contemporary decor was nice. The bathroom was a good size including the rain shower. My only complaints would be that the room didn't have a full-length mirror, and the connecting door to the neighboring room was not soundproof. This allowed me to hear the people next to me come in late and night and talk loudly. These are not reasons to not stay here again, but I will certainly request a non-adjoining room next time.

In a city full of a few great hotels, and lots of terrible properties, this is a great option for New York

title: Lovely, classic Kimpton experience
text:
The Kimpton Eventi is a comfortable boutique hotel that contains many of the elegant touches I’ve come to associate with the Kimpton group. Classy décor without being ostentatious sums it up.

Rooms were nicely furnished and of a decent size although not large, bed and pillows were comfortable. 

Service was decent on the whole although the guy at the front desk was a tad brusque probably due to the large number of early arrivals.

Special mention to Captain Kirk, a great asset to the hotel, who not only chatted with me as I waited for my Lyft driver to arrive but also went the extra mile to look for my car as it approached the nearby intersection.

Would I stay again? Certainly. The Kimpton Group is a welcome change from the large chain hotels so many of us have become used to.

title: Blah! - at a high price!
text: This was my third stay at this hotel and I now realize that at this price $400/night it is simply not worth it.  NYC is full of great hotels and this is not one of them.  The location is central but does not have the 'vibe' of other neighborhoods.  This is '5 star' yet rooms are small, gym is tiny and lacking.  The hotel staff and accommodations are nice enough - but at that price, should be better.

title: Cool Hotel
text:
Loved staying at this cool hotel. The Executive Room very comfortable, fabulous bathroom and great amenities. 
Free coffee and tea in the lobby every morning.Great Bar, great vibe, great location. Walking distance to Time Square, Macy and the theatre district.

title: Wonderful Hotel in Chelsea
text:
Stayed for 1 night at the Eventi, and was overall impressed with my stay. Room is on the smaller side, but that is to be expected in New York. Everything was very clean and I had a great city view, which included the Empire State Building. Wifi was spotty at times, but that was really my only issue. Outside of that, the lobby is really neat and inviting, hosted wine happy hour was great per usual. Gym was also quite nice as well

Lots close to the hotel from your footsteps..

title: Wonderful stay
text:
I was in town for one night to meet friends and see a show. I didn't want to be far from the venue I was going to that evening, so initially found the Eventi based upon location. I was glad I did as I found the hotel terrific. 
Check in was great, as the gentleman at was friendly, warm, and accommodating. I was informed of the "happy hour"/reception that unfortunately I was unable to attend. As I only had a small bag I didn't need the service of the bellhop, though that was available if needed. I was given a high floor which resulted in a very nice view out of my large windows in the room. I was staying in an Executive one bedroom, as there was the possibility that friends would be coming back later and I wanted the sitting area. The room was spectacular, with everything appearing relatively new, fashionable and stylish, and top of the line. Both the sitting room with television, desk, and pull out sofabed and the bedroom and bathroom were spacious (especially for NY standards), and included a fridge with minibar and a large closet for my hanging clothes. Also included were two plush bathrobes. After traveling that morning I needed a shower to freshen up, and the large bathroom was extremely comfortable with all high end fixtures. The shower was huge and partially open, and the bathroom was stocked with very nice Atelier Bloem products. 
I had a great nights sleep as my room was very quiet and the blackout shades worked well. My three interactions with the staff were once again top notch the next day. Two different woman at the counter were extremely pleasant, friendly, and helpful. And I needed to leave a bag after checkout that I was going to retrieve before departing for the airport that afternoon, and the bellman too was friendly and courteous. The management and staff "get it" - by "it" I mean outstanding customer service. 
The hotel was decorated beautifully, and the lobby had a vibrancy to it. I didn't get a chance to experience any of the amenities, like the outdoor plaza or veranda with "sweeping " views or complimentary bike or shoeshine, but did have an espresso in the attached coffee bar. Next time in town or for a longer visit I'll try to explore the hotel more and take advantage of all that it offers. 
One minor complaint - though I got free wifi for joining the rewards program while I was there, guests don't get credit for their initial stay unless they sign up preceding their stay. I wish the website was more clear.
Overall a great stay!

title: The Perfect NYC Hotel!
text:
Beautiful lobby! Great location!
Staff was excellent! Room was a nice size! Bathroom was large and shower was fabulous!
The restaurant and bar offered delicious food- a bit pricey but that's expected- wait staff not so great!

title: Contemporary NYC hotel
text: This new hotel is hip and young.  It is close to Penn Station and convenient to the subway.  The room was small, but had all the needed amenities.  The bathroom was quite large and nice.  The restaurant was OK, but nothing special.  This hotel is in a gentrifying neighborhood.  If it bothers you, be careful which streets you take at night.

title: Mostly wonderful
text: Overall, this is still my fav NYC place when they have competitive pricing.   Beautiful space, capable staff, very comfortable and great location. A couple small issues this time.  First, it was disappointing that the veranda was closed all 3 days of my stay.  Also, please advise hotel staff that the "do not disturb" sign means just that, please don't come knocking and open my door at 11:30 when checkout time is noon.

title: Close to Penn Station, very comfortable
text: The hotel is great for location and comfort.  Walk to Penn Station, Macy's, garment district and all of Midtown.   Great dining at the Vine and L'Amico. Don't miss the breakfast buffet - or cocktails -  at the Vine.

title: A Beautiful Hotel that puts a big smile on your face.
text: Stayed in the Eventi and I was not disappointed. From the moment we walked in we were greeted with a smile. Jason checked me in and was very helpful. Cocktails on the terrace was a special touch. The views are beyond amazing over looking New York City. We ventured out to The Vine downstairs for wonderful cocktails and a great music. We then dined at the L'Amico in the hotel with amazing food and stellar service. The beautiful host Amy, Tajana, and Ashley greeted us with open arms and made us feel right at home. Service was great and the food was beyond amazing. This is definitely a place to see and be seen. There is so much to do in this hotel that we never left the property. A wonderful day in New York staying in the best hotel in the city. We found our favorite hotel in NY and will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We had such a wonderful stay in this hotel. First of all they accept pets with no extra charge. We were so happy to bring our dog with us, he was even provided bed and bowls for food and water. Staff was very friendly. The room and bathroom were large in NYC standards. The bed was comfortable and absolutely loved the shower. Housekeeping was doing excellent job, everything was very clean and even the carpet felt like freshly steamed. Location is great depending which areas you are visiting, lots of restaurants and little coffee shops as well as delis nearby. Also can't never go wrong with complimentary wine hour. Can't wait to return.

title: Views and Location!
text:
Great friendly service was a good start, then I entered my room and my jaw literally dropped! The view was phenomenal! Big open windows looking at the Empire State Building- it was flawless. The bathroom was huge, bed comfy and fast wifi. Really no complaints.
The location was fantastic. Especially for shopping. 5-10 min walk to Macy's. Also about 10mins to Penn Station and Empire State. About 20mins to Times Square.
Loved it.

title: Can't believe what you read!!
text: Went and stayed at the hotel, only because of the great reviews.....when we got there, it was dark and dungy (if thats a word)....very young people, kind of laying around on the couches there. Yuk....went to our  500ft. suite,,,,,so not what you expect,,,,very dirty. Even though you get you a $15.00 dollar credit in the mini bar,,,,open it up,,,it was filthy in there....on our bed laid  a small blanket, it had a big brown spot on it,,,,who knows what that was???? At that point my husband and I looked  at each other and said, let's get the hell out of here....and off we went,,,,

title: Perfect
text: The front desk is always a pleasure to deal with and check in is quick and efficient.   The rooms are bigger than others in the neighborhood and super quiet .  You never hear anything in the hallways which is rare with hotels in this neighborhood.  The bathrooms are spacious and rooms very clean.The higher floors have great view.  The $15 Raid the minibar coupons are great too for that late night snack or water.  The restaurants are always packed the food is great.  The bar has a great atmosphere.

title: sehr angenehm
text: Das Personal ist super freundlich. Die Zimmer sind ausreichend groß, Klimaanlage funktioniert und nervt nicht. Die Betten bequem. Was will man mehr. Die Lage ist auch super. Im Haus gibt es zwei Restaurants, beide gut. Schön ist, dass man auch auf der Terrasse sitzen kann. Das einzige was mich etwas enttäuscht hatte, war die Dachterrasse -  die ist echt nicht schön. Da könnte man mehr draus machen. Aber ich würde das Hotel auf jeden Fall weiter empfehlen

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text: This is the second Kimpton Hotel in NY I have stayed in and I have found my new New York home away from home.  Not that the other Kimpton was less than this on I loved the location of this.  Being in Chelsea I was central to all my travels uptown/downtown and midtown.  It is not one of those monster hotels but has everything one would expect in a fine hotel and even more.  It has two restaurants within the hotel that are a destination restaurant for some New Yorkers.  Great people, Great Service and Great modern spaces.

title: Stay If You Can
text: If my first experience of New York was staying at this hotel, I think I'd be spoilt for life!  Totally delivers on the Kimpton standard, and even entry-level rooms will sometimes gift you an iconic New York view.  The rooms are generous for New York and the location is oustanding.  Had a great late night burger downstairs in the restaurant and there's plenty of great dining and shopping options nearby.  The staff were a little more New York cool than some of the friendliness I'd encountered elsewhere in the US, but they knew their stuff and were supremely professional.  I really hope I get to come back and stay here again.

title: Mother and Daughter trip to NYC!
text: My daughter and I had an amazing time in NYC, thanks to the Kimpton Hotel Eventi!  Everything was top notch!  Gina and Celine at the Front Desk were wonderful!  Our room was beyond beautiful, and we also enjoyed room service a few times!  The food was delicious!  Everyone that we came in contact with that worked for the hotel treated us with kindness!  That is a biggie in my book!  The lobby, veranda and third floor that hosted the wine hour, were beautiful!!  We ate at two of the restaurants that were located in the hotel, The Vne and L'amico.  They were both fabulous!  I will separate reviews for each of them!!  We hated to leave the Kimpton Hotel Eventi, but we can't wait to return!  I wouldn't stay anywhere else while in NYC!  One last thing, we were in walking distance to The Empire State Building and Times Square!

title: We stayed here when we got married and continue to visit their restaurants. We love this place
text: We spent the night before our wedding and our wedding night here. The room was cozy and the bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The morning after we got married we had breakfast at one of the restaurants below the hotel. My breakfast was delicious and the service was awesome. We returned on a separate occasion and brought our 5 year old nephew. The waitress went above and beyond for us when my nephew asked for an apple (which was not on the menu). She went to the hotel and asked their kitchen staff for an apple and had it cut for him after we told her she didn't need to. We appreciated her doing that, it was very sweet and she made my nephew smile after we had a very busy day at the museum. Each time we visit the service is better than the previous. We will continue to stay at Kimpton hotels and eat at their restaurants.

title: Great weekwend
text:
We reserved the suit which included a king size bed and an open sofa. The room was large enough for a family and large in NY terms. 
The room was sparkly clean, all amenities seem new.  We asked to make the bed and house keeping came within minute. 
We really loved the atmosphere downstairs with the two bars and the restaurant. It was very sexy and New Yorkish. 
We also were very happy with the staff who helped in and issues we had,  provided umbrellas when rained. 
The hotel location is nice but a but far from the subway.

title: Still one of the best in NYC!
text: I love this hotel so much. The rooms, the restaurants, the verandah, and one amazing staff! Jason Blake at the front desk is an extraordinary guy and went above and beyond to make our trip as perfect as can be! Cheers and Thanks, will try to come back for New Years like last year!

title: Never disappoints
text:
Admittedly, I am a Kimpton devotee.  I have never had a bad experience with any Kimpton.  Somehow, Kimptons (and in this case, the Eventi in particular) always find ways of making your stay extra special, in unexpected ways.  The hotels are always designed beautifully with a fun and lively atmosphere.  The rooms are comfortable and the staff are friendly and helpful.  The Eventi lived up to this description to a tee.  

This consistency of service, combined with reasonable rates keeps me coming back to NYC Kimptons (Eventi and Muse) again and again.

title: Great location, Nice Rooms
text: My wife and I have stayed twice at this hotel and both times had a great experience.  Both times we've booked a King room and have been pleased with accommodations.   We frequent the city a lot and always check this hotel.  The rates vary so we don't always stay here but we do when the rates allow.  The restaurant and bar are both great as well.  Location wise you are close to MSG, shopping, bars, restaurants, theaters.  Korea town is around the corner with lots of great asian cuisine options.  Definitely a hotel I will continue to stay out when I come to the city.

title: Girls Weekend!
text:
We booked the Kimpton Hotel Eventi because it offered the best rate for a one bedroom suite with king bed and a living room with a pull out bed. This was my first time staying at a Kimpton hotel and it certainly won't be my last. 
As soon as we arrived at the hotel, it was buzzing and that's exactly what we were looking for. 
The room was a very clean and the bed was super comfy. The pull out bed was less comfortable, but we requested some extra blankets from housekeeping and layered them on the pull out bed mattress and it was fine. The bathroom was a good size, with a huge shower. Since we were 3 to the room, housekeeping did an amazing job keeping us fully stocked on toiletries and towels. No issues with noise at all but on our last night we started to smell cigarette smoke coming into our room from the vents. We did notify the front desk but the response was a bit lukewarm. We opened the windows to air it out and it dissipated. 
Don't miss the complementary wine hour (5-6pm) at the hotel. The location changes daily, so check with the hotel staff. 
If you are a Kimpton rewards member you receive a "raid the bar" $15 credit which came in handy for the mini bar. The hotel bar at The Vine was a great place for a drink and snack. The Nomad and Ace Hotels are not far and they have great bars to check out as well. We were mostly in the Chelsea and West Village area for dinner and drinks and it was easy to get to via taxi. Dinner reservations were usually later so there wasn't as much traffic. 
The hotel does offer a continental breakfast buffet with some decent options. The coffee is fantastic so no need to find a Starbucks. 
The location of the hotel was convenient for taking the subway. The 28th St stop is a short walk away. 
There is a food market store across the street so if you need to pick up any essentials, there is a good selection. 
Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Kirk for being so helpful: )

title: Pleasant stay
text: We live in LI but choose to stay in the city for a family event. Derek took my car quickly so I did not have to deal with the traffic, the front desk let me check in at 1pm for my 3 rooms so I didn't have to sit around & wait. The rooms vary in size, but none are too big. Nice size marble bathrooms, very clean. Fridges don't work too good. They need to fix black out curtains because if they don't actually meet up in the middle, you still get sunlight in! The closet light works on a sensor but it's on test mode & doesn't come on easy or stay on for more than 5 seconds. Great location.

title: Good central location
text:
Great hotel in central Manhattan.  Lovely rooms with views of the city.  Clean and spacious with comfy beds and well-appointed bathrooms.  Atmosphere was welcoming and unstuffy.  Relaxed and high quality.

Make sure you use the subway from 34th street to go up and down town.  It's cheap, quick and safe.  Local pizza places are cheap and welcoming.  Freidmans is great for breakfast.  There is also an amazing deli type place opposite that is great for snacks and coffee.

title: GREAT EVENT & Staff
text: The staff made the already great location perfect! They went above and beyond for set up and breakdown. They also made planning process easy.  Helped in ways they didi not need too.  Event space, large patio was perfect!

title: First Class hotel with bags of style and character!
text: I stayed for a weekend Thursday to Sunday and was upgraded to a suite on the 22nd floor. The accommodation was spacious,stylish and luxurious. The bathroom was marble throughout and huge! We ate in all three restaurants in the hotel and the food in each was superb. Our favourites were Lupulo and L'Amico. All the staff were very professional.  One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in .It was a great experience from start to finish.

title: Super Cool Hotel with a Great View
text: This is a superb choice in NYC! We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room. For a NYC hotel - the rooms were on the larger side and a pleasant surprise. The bed was comfortable and the room was well appointed. The hotel offered complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning and a complimentary happy hour in the evening. Staff were all accommodating and friendly. There is a plethora to do and see in the area and we walked everywhere. Subway access was nearby and a convenient way to get to both Central Park and the Financial District. This seems to be a versatile hotel and would be good for both business and leisure!

title: Amazing stay
text:
It was probably one of the best hotel experiences we had, the staff was so kind and courteous.
Please give the restaurants a try we were blown out by the quality and ambiance.
This is the only place we will stay in New York moving forward.

title: Great location, excellent value
text: We had such an amazing experience here. We got off a red eye and came in at 7 am to see when we could check in and leave out bags. We were met by Victoria (I believe) and she pre-checked us in, pointed us to a place we could change, and then checked our bags. We were able to check in at noon, which was amazing! We had a beautiful corner room with a view of the Empire State Building. The room was very well cared for and was a good size by NY standards. Overall, this place reminded me why I love Kimpton and I highly recommend.

title: My new favorite hotel
text: We don't often stay on the West side of NYC, but we will be for now on. The Eventi is a great hotel. The rooms are good sized, well decorated and clean. The bar and coffee shop in the lobby is an extra that I now can not do without. The staff are helpful and go beyond the call of duty. Such a wonderful experience.

title: Repeat Guest, Had Some Hiccups This Time!
text: I am a devoted Kimpton customer and have stayed at the Eventi (and many other Kimptons) 4 or 5 times in the past several years.  I stayed several times before they updated the hotel with the new restaurants/lobby and have stayed a few times since. The hotel has gotten a lot more expensive since I discovered it.  I had to be in the city for business in the fashion district and it is very convenient for me.  I checked the rates and they were prohibitive for me, almost $500 a night which I prefer not to do.  Rooms were in the $300s when I first started staying.  I decided to look elsewhere and when I looked on Hotels.com the rates for the Eventi were much cheaper.  I am not a fan of Hotels.com but decided to go ahead and book the room since it was so much cheaper than the Eventi advertised rate.  I am eligible for a Kimpton upgrade so I asked about it as I checked in and told there was not an upgrade available.  When we arrived at our room, it was the way smaller than any room I had ever stayed in before at the Eventi.  I was shocked and very disappointed.  It had a good view of the Empire State Building but that is about as good as it got.  We were running late for dinner and I needed to quickly iron my top.  I tried the iron and it did not work.  I check a few plugs and they appeared to work so I called for another iron which came in about 10 minutes.  Tried it again with no luck.  I then called the front desk to ask them if there was a secret to the iron.  They sent another gentleman up with a brand new iron, still in the box.  While we were waiting on him to come, we tried all of the plugs in the room and I think only a few worked.  By this time, it was time to go, so we asked the man if he would stay and fix the plugs.  I went to dinner in the clothes that I had worn all day while traveling because I never got to iron my outfit, with all the chaos. The next day I went to my meetings and left my husband in the room while I was gone.  He had planned to do computer work and watch TV until I came back.  Much to his disappointment, the TV did not work all day since they were changing providers. The rest of our stay was pretty uneventful.  We stayed for just 3 nights, it was a quick trip.  I still think the hotel is a great place, but I was very disappointed about the size of our room and all the issues we had.  I am not sure if I will stay there again because I think they have priced themselves out of my market and there are no more loyalty perks for Kimpton Karma members. I am sick about it because the location it so perfect for me and I love all the positive changes they have made as far as the restaurants plus the exterior and lobby upgrades.

title: It was nice but is getting dated
text:
Don't go by the website either. The hotel bar closes at 11 pm not 1 am as stated on the website.

We stayed here two years ago and thought it would be great for a long weekend but it's getting dated. We have been at Kimptons in Vermont, LA, Boston, Cambridge, and Austin and all are nicer. The rooms here are small and dark and the bathroom and bedding could use a facelift. The bedding is flat and whatever that dirty throw was on our bed I did not want touching any of us. 

I wasn't happy that coming back from a show at MSG that while there were a ton of people at the bar we were told that it closes at 11 not 1 as listed on the site.  

It overall wasn't a great visit at all. People kept leaving trash outside of our door too and even though housekeeping was still working on our floor we had to call or had to move it ourselves or our dogs would have been trying to eat it every single time we went out. 

Also if you have a larger dog, they don't have beds large enough for them so know to bring your own. The beds are tiny and flat so even our 22 pound dog couldn't sleep on it and it was not even an option for our 70 pound dog. 

It was a nice hotel but it's going downhill.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Kimpton Eventi!! The location is great and convenient to a lot of places. The room was very comfortable and the staff were so friendly and helpful. We ate breakfast several times at the hotel and really enjoyed it. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Unicorns and Angels
text: I can not even begin how this trip made me feel. Let me start by saying that this was all from Gina Jang. What a woman. She deserves to be the face of the company. I booked my stay with her directly and told her it was a special night since I would be proposing to my now fiance. Not only did she assist with coordinating the entire night of dinner, lounge options for after but OMG the room decorations. We showed back up late at night and it put my fiancé in instant tears. It was arguably one of the most magical moments of the night. It was as if leporcons decorated the room, magic came from every corner, and unicorns and rainbows threw themselves at you. We had balloons with our names, pedals on the bed, a bottle of amazing champagne and cupcakes!!! Who gets all that? I have to give the most respect and unconditional love to this angel of a woman, Gina Jang who did this from the kindness of her heart. We can not say thank you enough for this magical night. You are a goddess and the crown on our special evening.

title: Great location with nice rooms
text: When we have things to do in mid town and are arriving via Amtrak, this is the place we want to stay.  It's a short walk from Penn Station, the rooms are very nice and the service levels are very good.  You can walk to the theater district, Herald Square, Times Square and have a wide variety of subway lines you can pick up just a short walk away.

title: Dog Friendly Hotel was Perfect for Us!
text: My dog Sophie and I recently stayed at the Hotel Eventi in Chelsea, NYC, and it was fantastic! The staff and hotel are very dog friendly and they made us feel very welcome. The little touches like a cozy dog bed, treats, poop bags and dog bowls they include were really nice; Sophie wanted that bed to come home with her! :-) The hotel is very centrally located near Madison Square Park, midtown and downtown. The restaurants are really good; I've eaten in both and would recommend.  All in all, with or without a dog (I've stayed there without my dog, too), I'd highly recommend this hotel.

title: Enjoyed the cocktail hour.
text: Great room with modern fixtures and bathroom.  Great location for our visit.  Friendly staff. Cocktail hour was nice.  We met some interesting visitors as well as a hotel employee.  We have stayed at three Kimptons and enjoyed them all.

title: A Overall Great Choice
text:
I'm an original NY'er returning back home for some quick biz and family mix for an extended few days before the 4th. And I had a few days in the city before visiting some family at their homes.

I wanted a nice hotel away from the gawd awful crush of Times Square, yet uber cool and close enough to Penn Station  for my nieces to come in, and also to be centrally located to Chelsea and able to head to the museums and shopping/ restaurants we'd be hitting.
 
I'm also a bit of a snob about decent rooms so I wanted quality rooms for both myself and the girls. I was treating them as a gift and wanted a good hotel.

This is my first time with Kimpton. Both my husband and I are IHG members, but I understand that Kimpton and IHG are still separate despite the new merger. Since the hubs wasn't along this time, I felt it was important to find a hotel that met my needs first; quality; location; comfort; price. 

I Have to say, I was pleased with the pricing on Kimpton Eventi for NYC hotels ( which are by no means cheap) and joined their Karma rewards for the added perks, a nice bonus for the wifi and raid the mini bar, which the nieces loved! Just be prepared for a little sticker shock with the city hotel taxes, but that's any hotel you book!

Pros: Relatively newer hotel, in a great location at the top of Chelsea. Nice sized rooms (for NYC) with super views, comfy bed. I had reserved a king deluxe for myself with a city view; and a double queen deluxe for the nieces.
