My room was very clean( and I do really check it) only saw a small old strange stain on one lampshade back by the bed ( not asking?!) but all else look new and clean. Bed was some kind of foam type bed, really comfy as said, linens clean, soft and nice too. I have no problems falling asleep here. Rainfall shower and bench in the bath, absolutely fabulous!

As said: pricing, very reasonable for Manhattan. Room well worth it. I also used their valet parking for my car which ran $50 a day, to garage it; but you have to remember it's NYC and yep everything costs. 

Karma rewards helped covered a bottle of water and some snacks for the nieces in the mini fridges in the rooms. A safe in the room, as well as a iron, ironing board, robes to use...

Reception staff and front desk ( even reservations) honestly all were genuinely friendly and great to work with. Everyone was sincere, always smiling :) I missed the wine reception at the evening. But it is very busy come evenings at the hotel so be forewarned on that. Always people in the lobby and lounge from early evening on.

Cons:

Not much: only a few thing I can think of.

No coffee makers in room if that's your thing and must. But you can easily go downstairs to the restaurants to get one there or order up.

The hotel is very very busy in the evenings. The free wine reception, into the dinner hours on. So, if you do not like crowds avoid the lobby areas. Also the Italian restaurant, as a hotel guest if you expect any extra privilege for seating it won't happen. You'll have to wait, that was a bit disappointing.

Lastly, I did have one small incident where I left my phone charging cable out plugged into the outlet on the nightstand while out. I guess when the maid came in to clean she used either the vacuum or some type of Roto cleaning tool as my cable had been cut (actually like sliced) along with the hotel phone cord too, when I looked at that closely too, after noticing my own cable. The room had been totally cleaned, and my cable was still plugged in; I hadn't noticed it till next day. Anyway; I get it that they didn't want me to notice they cut my cable for fear of an incident; maybe losing their job or whatever, so I let it slide, w/o making a big stink. However cleaning should have made note of that to the customer, it's appropriate to do that; and such a little thing like that can be replaced is all. By the time I had found out I was already packing to leave and it was more frustrating that it was kind of hidden, if you know what I mean. So the cleaning gets a demerit.

Overall, the hotel Eventi has ranked really high on my list for excellent choices for hotels in Manhattan. Especially Chelsea/midtown area where you are looking for independent distinctive comfort in a trendy environment; flushed with restaurants, shopping, and things to do nearby. Well worth a room if you are looking into that area of Manhattan.

title: Flying visit to NY over Independence Day Weekend
text: Very centrally located, excellent value for money, great free cocktail hour, friendly staff and excellent service. We were there over the July 4 weekend and while the hotel was busy, service did not deteriorate. Union Square and Time Square were both within reasonable walking distance and there was no shortage of good quality ethnically diverse restaurants and up market coffee shops.We did as lot of walking but at no time did we feel intimidated or at risk..

title: Great location in NYC
text:
As with most New York hotels, the room space was limited but the decor throughout was cool & had everything we needed for all the time spent here. Choosing an ideal location in this city is always subjective as it depends on what you want to be closest to and how you plan to travel around (by foot, taxi or subway?). This was a central base for us with great views of the Empire State Building. 

We never had a chance to try the restaurant here but it looked great. The only improvement I would suggest is to serve nibbles during the wine hour (as found in many other hotels).

I normally aim to stay in a different hotel on each visit to NYC but would not hesitate to return here.

title: Wedding Host Hotel
text:
My sister in law was married in NYC in March and her host hotel was here. My husband and I had connecting rooms with our son. 

The lobby is pretty, though tiny and typical Manhattan size and layout. Elevators take quite a bit of time. Check-In was efficient, even for a busy Friday afternoon crowd. 

The rooms are clean and fairly large, especially for NYC standards. Marble bathrooms are nice and airy. More than we expected for such a decent nightly rate. 

The Sunday morning farewell brunch was held in one of the event spaces at the hotel and the food was pretty fantastic. As someone who 'may' have had one too many drinks the night before, I appreciated this very much. 

Overall, great location and clean rooms for a very reasonable cost.

title: Excellent stay, excellent location
text: Recently spent the weekend in NYC and stayed at the Kimpton Eventi Hotel.  We had an excellent time and the hotel was fabulous.  Jason at check in was kind and patient with all of the questions we had regarding sights in NYC.  He was very willing to assist us and looked up venues and offered suggestions.  The wine hour was fabulous on the outside terrace.  The rooms were well decorated, super clean and beds were amazingly comfortable.  The bathrooms was outstanding replete with Carrera marble shower with a dual rain head and standard shower.  Very luxe, Would stay here again.

title: Great location + service
text: This is a great location for a corporate meeting.  I love all of the Karma benefits of staying at a Kimpton - definitely worth registering. Thanks to the super helpful staff for making my stay enjoyable.

title: Excelente
text:
O primeiro contato não foi o melhor. Durante a reserva solicitei um upgrade para o quarto com vista para a cidade após ter feito a reserva do meu quarto. Quando fui olhar a fatura do cartão, ambos os quartos tinham sido cobrados. No entanto, fui prontamente atendido no chat e instantaneamente resolvido o problema. O serviço de concierge é extremamente rápido e apto a resolver qualquer problema. Quando cheguei ofereceram um upgrade para um quarto alto e um pouco maior. 
O hotel define a modernidade, decorado no estilo "boutique", com dois restaurantes muito bons e contemporâneos. O café da manhã não é incluso, mas o restaurante do café é bastante agradável e a comida é incrível. O wi-fi é grátis uma vez fazendo uma conta no kimpton reward program. Os quartos são muito bons, com banheiros excelentes e camas muito confortáveis. 
Qualquer problema é resolvido de maneira simples e agradável pelo concierge. 
Me agradou muito o local e a forma como o serviço é conduzido pela equipe! 
Com certeza ficarei sempre que for para Nova Iorque

title: Great hotel. highly recommended!!
text: Stayed here for 2 nights. the rooms are big for NY standards. Very clean, Rooms do not smell. Great staff. Hotel is fresh and not run down. Quiet rooms. i travel a lot so i pay a lot of attention to details and must say i really liked this hotel and would come back!! also great location.

title: A great NYC choice!
text: Every time my husband and I go to NYC we stay at Hotel Eventi. We love the location as it is really convenient to all NYC neighborhoods with lots of subway options nearby. The lobby was renovated recently and it's so nice. Plus we love Kimpton Karma benefits. The staff is always very friendly and helpful and the rooms are a generous size for NYC. We look forward to our next stay!

title: Great Customer Service
text:
A friendly welcome.  Great selection of restaurants.  Wine event daily with free wine.
Easy walk to Time Square and other attractions.
A great night sleep each night no noise in the hallway to disturb you.

title: Perfect
text:
Perfect service, clean, greatness bed and bedding friendly staff great location
Loved it last time and came back
Gave us very early check in 830 am 
I will come back defiantly and will send my parents on September

title: New York Cool
text: This was my second stay at the Eventi, and there will certainly be more. Just like other Kimpton hotels, there is a great blend of comfort and unique style with this property. And while I have no clue how many rooms it has, it feels intimate and personal.

title: Great room, but little too noisy
text: The room was clean and spacious and the bed was comfortable. The house keeping service was great, too. Unfortunately, the noise tends to leak through the wall and door and I was able to hear the conversations from the next room and also the uncomfortable noise from a room when I was walking in the hallway...

title: Weekend getaway
text: This hotel is really nice very clean and it's centrally located , close by to major attractions .  The check in process to check out process was easy and staff were very helpful when we needed stuff , thank you

title: Surprise trip for my daughter
text: Everything from check in to check out was amazing. The staff went above and beyond to make the trip memorable. Vanessa at check in upgraded us to a corner room with a view of the Empire State Building. My daughters face was priceless when she opened the curtains.

title: amazing
text: Wonderful service, warm welcome friendly help you all the way find solutions great accomodations, great renovation I would not find any complain to make great experience, amazing place freidnly people

title: Great Stay!
text:
Wow! I booked this hotel partly because of the great reviews on TA, but also because I had stayed in a Kimpton in Chicago a few months ago. When I booked my stay, I mentioned that we were celebrating a special occasion for my son. The staff was awesome and we did not expect such amazing service! 

I didn't think the hotel was hard to find like some reviewers had said. The hotel is a quick walk from Penn Station, located on busy 6th Avenue. We got there super early (11:45) and Tyler at the front desk told me our room was ready, and offered us an upgrade to a one-bedroom suite on the 18th floor. The room was huge for NY standards had an amazing view of the Empire State Building.Tyler told me someone would be coming up with a gift later that night.  Around 6 PM, we received cupcakes, gummy bears, water, and a bottle of prossecco and a nice note from the concierge!
Service was fast when we called to ask for the sofa bed to be made up. We decided to tour the hotel and came back 20 minutes later with the sofa bed made. Our room was clean and the bathroom was huge, with a rain shower. All of the staff we interacted with were really friendly and helpful. They always greeted us and the doorman was so helpful getting us cabs. My only complaint was that the sofa bed was really squeaky. The regular bed was amazing. We would definitely come back!

title: 24 Hours in the City
text: We grabbed a night at this hotel on Priceline. I wasn't sure we would get a city view since we paid far less than the going rate. I told gentleman checking us in that it was our first time in the City and he said he'd upgrade us to city view. Boy did he hook us up!! 22nd floor with amazing view of Empire State Building!

title: Mostly Great
text: We love the Kimpton brand and stay at their hotels wherever/whenever one is available.  The Eventi is well located and convenient, and the service - from valet to front desk to room service - was outstanding and top-notch as usual.  This, however, was the first time we felt that the property was not up to the ususal Kimpton standards.  While the decor was upscale and unique, the overall impression of the place was tired.  Our room had threadbare furniture, the carpets were worn, and the overall cleanliness was not what we are used to at Kimpton.  I'd stay again, primarily due to brand loyalty and the convenience of the location, but I was not "wowed" as I have been every other time (numerous) I've been to a Kimpton.  I suppose the high traffic at an NYC hotel is the culprit - but I've stayed at other properties in the city that did not have the same issues.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: Eventi is in a great location (outside of the craziness of Times Square but close to everything). Vibe is great, food in both restaurants is top notch. What sets it apart is customer service. As soon as you walk in the door, the staff is attentive, ready to help and answer questions and that does not stop until you check out. I'll stay here again soon.

title: Great hotel and great staff
text: Rooms were clean and well appointed, with very contemporary design.  Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Great convenient location- lots of great dining and nightlife and less congested than some other midtown neighborhoods.  Would highly recommend.

title: Great stays at a difficult time
text:
Due to a family health emergency, we had to go to New York City in May, and then return in June. Our stays at the Kimpton Eventi made a very difficult time for us much easier. Jason and Samantha went well above and beyond to help us during both of our visits. We received an upgrade at check-in with some goodies, and any questions we had were met with kindness and good advice. 

This excellent hotel is an oasis in the middle of the city. The rooms are very comfortable, clean, quiet, and well designed in a modern style, as are the bathrooms. In addition, the restaurants serve delicious food. The location is super. It is very easy to get anywhere in Manhattan from the Eventi, and New York landmarks are close by. We felt so comfortable during both of our visits, and would like to thank Jason, Samantha, and the entire staff so much for their kindness and care. They made our stays the best they could have been. We will be back whenever we go to New York City again!

title: Excellent
text:
Stayed here to celebrate my husbands 60th Birthday. The location is very convenient .We had a suite on the 17th floor with a view of the ESB.The suite was very comfortable and very clean. We were here for 10 days and toiletries were refilled every day and the bed was extremely comfortable .We had opted for a suite with a jacuzzi bath as we anticipated we would appreciate a long soak after walking the streets and exploring the city, it was worth the extra cost

We had asked beforehand for a coffee machine to be placed in the room as in the week the coffee service in the lobby is cleared away at 9am . We went once for the free wine hour but the room was very crowded and seemed to be full of business people networking so didn't bother on the other evenings.

We didn't eat in any of the hotel restaurants so can't comment on the food but there seemed to be a buzz about the place and good atmosphere. There are many local opportunities for breakfast and dinner and we particularly enjoyed Friedmans which is a couple of blocks away.

Over the years I have stayed in several hotels in Manhattan and the Eventi was without doubt the best. Would I stay again? A resounding YES.

title: Great stay in a great hotel!
text: First time staying here and it was great. Lovely, well designed room with terrific view in a convenient part of the city. Staff was very, very helpful and contributed in large part to 5 star rating - especially Gina J and housekeeping team member whose name I unfortunately did not get.

title: Great hotel & Location
text:
We booked this awesome boutique hotel in September 2016 as part of our mini-moon We emailed ahead to the hotel and advised we were travelling for a special occasion and on check in they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite with a partial view of the Empire state building - nice touch. 

The room itself was sleek and contemporary and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was on another level - huge and plush with his and hers sinks, bath tub and rainshower. 

The bar and restaurant downstairs was lovely for drinks (we didn't eat here) as had reservations at a few Michelin star restaurants during our few days in NYC. 

The front desk staff were so accommodating and friendly, something I always find when I visit NYC. The location of the hotel is one of the best things about it, located so close to 5th Avenue and not far from Soho or even tourist attractions like Times Square and Rockafella. It's in midtown and suited us perfectly - although getting around Manhattan is relatively easy on the subway.

Thanks again for the great experience, would highly recommend.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The Kimpton Hotel Eventi  was a pleasure.  From the excellent onsite restaurants to the central location close to subway transportation, we truly enjoyed our stay.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, and well-appointed and the staff friendly and helpful.  We will definitely make the Kimpton Eventi our go-to hotel whenever we come to NYC!

title: Awesome Hotel & Location!
text: I thought this was a great boutique hotel overall. The room was very comfortable, the property was in a great location, staff was friendly, and the restaurant was very good. I will definitely stay here again. I traveled to NYC for business, but also visit the city for fun sometimes. I would recommend this hotel for business or fun.

title: Another great visit to Hotel Eventi
text: The front desk made me feel like a VIP. My room was kept very clean and they even stopped back in the evening to see if I needed anything. I had a view of the Empire State Building which was stunning at night. The food is excellent in the restaurants. Just an overall great visit.

title: Excellent!
text: Staff here is awesome. Attentive, friendly, ready to help. Hotel is beautiful. A bit pricey but really nice. Modern decor is warm & inviting. Rooms are good sized for NYC. If someone else fits the bill, I'd stay here again.

title: Ideal Location
text: As first time visitors to New York, we thoroughly enjoyed the trip overall. This Hotel was found to be a good place from which to start our very busy days, located only a few blocks from the Empire State Bldg, Macy's and Maddison Square. The staff were friendly & helpful and always smiling, even at the unearthly hour of our eventual departure from this great City. The room was spacious, albeit it didn't quite have the city view we thought we had booked and had expected,nevertheless it was clean, tidy and a comfortable super size bed to have a restful sleep, allowing us to start the following days refreshed. Therefore we have no hesitation in recommending this as a great place to stay.

title: Fantastic customer service
text: I came to NYC for a client meeting and decided to stay somewhere close to Penn station. The Eventi is a 7 minute walk, and is an awesome hotel. The location is perfect and the staff are extremely nice. Gina specifically took care of my trip with outstanding customer attention, which I appreciate, especially because I travel so much for work. I had a corner room on the 15th floor and it was super nice - great view, comfy bed, fancy bathroom. Also, I ate at 2 of the 3 restaurants downstairs and the food was amazing!!!

title: Great centrally located hotel
text: I really enjoyed the stay and think the staff try really hard to create a nice experience. I found the location incredibly convenient and even though the rooms (other than the bathrooms) are unremarkable I still found the hotel enjoyable. I particularly liked the attached bars/restaurants downstairs.

title: Reasonable (for NYC), good location
text:
This was our 2nd stay at the Eventi after a hiatus of 4 years. They had remodeled the hotel in the interim. As always, the staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful.

We went back principally because 1) we previously found the hotel's location excellent for a multi-day visit to the city and 2) we had found the price to be reasonable for mid-town Manhattan (Chelsea area).

The location is still excellent (2-3 blocks from major subway lines). The price is still good.

The remodeling was something of an improvement, but as others have pointed out in previous reviews, it doesn't stand up well to wear and tear (scratches, etc.). But it's clean and the bed was comfortable.

One of the best aspects of this hotel is that there are now two very good restaurants on the ground floor: Lupulo (portuguese) and L'Amico (Northern Italian). We had excellent meals at both. The hotel's breakfast was good as well.

title: Hospitality Plus
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at Eventi. The staff went above and beyond to extend their hospitality to us on many levels. They COMPLETELY understand what a stay in a fine hotel is all about! We were treated very graciously and made to feel special. Oh yes......I might also add.... Our fabulous room with a view of the red,white and blue Empire State Building was also a nice touch........  Eventi  has surged to the top of our list for NYC hotels!

title: Not 5-4 stars
text:
Good: location, friendly staff, good shower
Bad: Small room for a "5-star" in NYC. Called for help regarding valet and drop my luggage at the hotel, useless and careless "help". Noisy even at a high floor. 
Conclusion: fair price due to a promotion, not worth full price, you are not paying for a 4-5 star.

title: Kimpton delivers
text: Everything that the Kimpton said it would offer it did! Awesome location, great restaurants, amazing service and just a great vibe. In addition hosted wine hour was an added benefit - something to ease the pain of how expensive everything in New York is!

title: Terrific hotel.  Flawless.
text: Everything here is perfect. The rooms are beautifully done. The staff is welcoming and otherwise excellent.  The Italian restaurant entered through the hotel lobby is a great surprise: a restaurant attached to a hotel that has  great food.  Hard to imagine being disappointed here.

title: great employees
text: I'm mad at myself because I didn't write everyone's names down.  But I'm the friend of Bill Kimpton's ... Great hotel experience!! 5 of us were there for my daughter's masters graduation at NYU. I sincerely thank ....the great guy with linen shirt (better looking if unpressed!) who gave me coffee every morning at the bar, the charming lady from (I think) Ghana who helped with my room, very charming guy with wonderful hair also from Africa who brought me my meals in room, and the wonderful man at the desk who seemed to work 24/7 and helped with everything. Gracious and beyond.  We loved out stay.  I will be back.  Thanks to all.

title: Very Nice Hotel, centrally located
text: Overall, room was very comfortable & hotel service was really good.  That said, some websites call this a 5-star hotel and I would say more like 4-star (not meant to bash the hotel, just set expectations).  Room had very comfortable bed and pillows.  Great location 2 blocks from NY Penn Station. Subway is a few blocks away.  Front desk was very helpful.. no business center, but you can mail them anything you need printed, etc. Also, free one-hour happy hour if that's your thing...

title: Extremely Helpful Staff!
text:
My brother was visiting NYC and stayed at the Kimpton. A friend mailed a package via USPS for me which did not arrive before he left the city. In a nutshell we thought the postal service had lost the package as the tracking was showing that it was delivered. The head of security, Meri, went above and beyond to locate the 'lost package' even calling the USPS helpline on my behalf (I live outside the US). The staff sent me daily updates and when the package was eventually delivered they informed me immediately so it could be collected.
I am from an island where tourism is our major export and even though I wasn't staying at the Kimpton if this is how they handle a lost package I could only imagine what the service is like.

title: Gorgeous Hotel
text: Lovely hotel, lobby just beautiful. I had an upgrade to my room with the view of the Empire State Building all night from my bed. Truly magical. Gorgeous bathroom, plenty big with rain shower. Location is good, near walking distance to many great areas like Chelsea and Flatiron. Would stay again for sure.

title: Helpful staff, clean, convenient and comfortable - and WINE HOUR!
text:
Hotel is near Penn station, Madison square garden and Empire state building.  No New York City attitude - very friendly and helpful from the front desk to the cleaning ladies! We are active people and with the staff's help, we were able to plan a great walk around the southern tip of Manhattan via the Greenway (Hudson River Park), World Trade Center memorial, Brooklyn Bridge, Greenwich Village, Soho and returning up 5th and 6th avenue to Chelsea in a day.  The staff helping us plan our busy day were phenomenal. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable and the cleaning lady wrote us a thank you note when we tipped her.  So nice!  We loved our stay.  
We also loved that it is dog friendly.  Although we didn't bring our dog, it helped us miss her less getting doggie kisses in the elevator.  Of course, you don't have to ride up the elevator with dogs but we wanted to.  There was no smell or grime and the place was very clean everywhere so no worries about that!
Wine hour was right on time and even featured a free homemade cocktail in addition to a selection of a nice red and white wine.  
Great weekend stay!

title: Beware of bait-and-switch tactics
text:
I reserved and paid for a "Cityview Deluxe King Room." The hotel describes this room as follows: "1 King Bed, 300 square feet, Located on floors 14-23, sweeping city views"

When I checked in, reception handed me my room card and told me to enjoy my stay. I checked my room number and saw that I was on floor 6 (the lowest guest floor possible). 

I was shocked -- reception hadn't mentioned this change in my reservation and was clearly hoping I wouldn't notice. When I told them I had paid to be on at least floor 14, I was told that "Everybody wants a high floor. It's always subject to availability. Other guests are refusing to move." Essentially, they were treating me like I was unreasonable and uninformed, yet I was asking for no more than what I'd already paid for. 

They eventually agreed to give me a room on floor 9. I had just come off a 16 hour flight from Hong Kong and didn't have the energy to argue any further, so I accepted. 

My room was technically a "suite" but definitely did not feel like an upgrade. It was dirty and had a view of a brick wall. I could hear traffic noise all night. Plus, if it were really an upgrade, wouldn't reception have described it that way rather than trying to sneak it past me? 

Summary: I spent extra to get a decent room that was elevated above traffic noise, but Kimpton Eventi ignored our agreement. It was very disappointing to me.

title: So much to love
text:
Kudos to Victoria for starting my trip off right with an upgrade to a 22nd floor Empire State building view room! What a treat, especially since I'd gotten a good deal, it pays to be a Karma Rewards member. Loved the cleanliness and minimalist modern decor in the cozy king room, the marble bathroom is gorgeous and the rain head shower was amazing. It was a cool comfortable place to relax after a hot city day, the floor to ceiling view was perfect. For me the bed could be better, even though it was a pillow top, it's on a solid platform, and since the mattress wasn't extra thick it had a bit of a hardness and bottoming out feeling to it, don't know if it would be ideal for a heavy person. 

We ate twice at L'Amico, one of the three eateries on site and it was delicious. Kale salad and mushroom pizza were fantastic. The location is great, near Herald Square without the craziness of Times Square, but a very short walk to the 7th Ave Subway, the east side, and fun funky places along 29th Street. A nice choice, would definitely stay again.

title: Elegance and comfort near Penn Station
text: I took the train down from Boston and stayed at the Klimpton because I had an early Sunday morning train home and didn't want to have to go far. It was beautiful and elegant with great restaurants and wonderful service. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Spring visit
text: Stayed on a cold rainy April night with my daughter.  The hotel is very easy to walk to from Penn Station and had a welcoming lobby.  A little jarring to walk into the happy hour but once you adjust it feels fine.  Our room was very pretty  and the view of the Empire State Building from the event floor was beautiful.  We had room service which came quickly and was yummy. On the whole - lots of style and you really feel like you're in NYC and with the flash sale we had, a good bargain.  Would highly recommend.

title: Service 2nd to none
text:
This is the 3rd time I have stayed at Kimpton Aventi on 6th avenue. From the 1st time I noticed the exceptional customer service, they go out of their  way to make sure the customer is happy.  
When I made the reservation I had told them the we were celebrating our anniversary, to my surprise, they had set up the room with flowers, champagne and cupcakes, also a nice hand written card.
I stayed there last night and again, service was exceptional, because I have stayed there in the past, they upgrade my room to a 1 bedroom suite, unbelievable room, could never afford it otherwise.
The Aventi on 6th avenue is 2nd to none, beautiful place with a service to match.

title: Nice 4 star hotel
text: An value priced 4 star hotel in the heart of the city.  Rooms are new and fairly large, I found the service is cheerful and helpful and it had a busy bar/restaurant area.  Third weeklong stay for me, been consistent.

title: Great room size
text: I love the Eventi Kimpton.  I usually travel to New York with my son and daughter-in-law.  When we go we need a larger room.  Suite hotels get expensive.  The Kimpton rooms are great.  Large enough to move around in.  Great location, comfy and clean.  It is always good to have a great room to come back to after a day of sight seeing in the city.

title: Great 4 * hotel
text:
Great hotel with a perfect  location! Will definitely consider staying there again. 
 Got a very nice looking 4 * room with comfortable beds. Stayed there for 6 nights with 2 children (9 yrs old) and the 3 of us loved it. E-mailed in advance and asked for a room high up in the building. They responded right away. 
Got a room with 2 double beds at the 22nd  floor with a stunning view. Loved the floor-to-ceiling windows! The bathroom was perfect and modern. The room and the bathroom was perfectly clean both when we arrived and the everyday cleaning. 
Good breakfast at the vine (a bit overpriced though). Used the hotel gym twice and it was good, being a hotel gym. 
Good wifi. 

The staff was friendly but not very informative about the hotel facilities when we arrived (got no information about  breakfastpossibilities, gym, wine hour, coffee in the lobby, verandas etc and I couldn't find that info in the room either). Also Not very interested, when I asked about the best ways to get to the airport from the hotel. Friendly and polite but just not very interested in helping and service minded. Unusual hotelstaff experience for me and it surprised me. 

Overall I'd give the hotel 4 * with a plus. It's not a 5 star hotel, but a very good 4 star hotel!

title: great hotel, great location
text: i really liked thus hotel. Large rooms (enormous by new york standards),  a happening bar and lobby and located walking distance from all the major downtown sights. the lack of free wifi cost them their 5th star.  but a very solid 4. i would stay here again.

title: Best Choice
text: This hotel is beautiful and very clean. The room was quiet (which is rare while staying in the city) and all but the bar staff were very welcoming and accommodating. The location is perfect and within walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. I've stayed at many other NYC hotels in the same price range and Eventi is by far the best overall option.

title: Chelsea exemplified but budget friendly!
text: Dad and 3 kids weekend in a double queen room and it worked! 21st floor room with a decent view. Very comfy room, great bath with nice product and was very very clean and safe right on avenue of the americas! Great jump off point for Chelsea market, the highline, Chelsea piers, Henry Hudson park along the water and a good walk to the village and little Italy and or cross town to flat iron! Mid town Is easily walkable ; location is great. Lobby super comfy and lush and the staff was friendly and not stuffy at all. Outdoor patio spaces and a wine tastings and free coffee on weekend mornings! Fits the bill

title: Nos encantó.
text:
Lo escondimos por su estupenda ubicación caminando a todas partes y el metro a 1 cuadra, el personal muy atento y amable, las habitaciones impecablemente limpias y ordenadas, rico el desayuno y restaurantes. 
Vamos a volver.

title: Great overnight stay
text: We had a blast and the staff could not have been friendlier- no ny attitude! Everyone was so nice and helpful. The hotel is in a great location for seeing the city and walking. Great views from our room.

title: Ok but not great
text: I stay in the One Bedroom Premier Suite for 3 nights on May 2017.  Firstly my welcome to the hotel could have been better.  The lobby is confused and has the feeling of a bar lounge rather than a hotel lobby. The desk clerk at reception told me I could not check in until 3pm without even asking for my name first, just told me to come back after 3pm.  The room itself was fine, the bed was super comfy but all other amenities were limited.  The sofa was uncomfortable, no slippers provided, towels need upgrading.  I was on level 7 and found the street noise was a problem, I know it's NYC so a bit of noise is to be expected but having stayed in other hotels in NYC this was far worse than others.  The area was great but did not compensate for everything else.

title: 美しいデザイナーズホテル
text: クリスマスイブに宿泊しました。エンパイアステートビルディングのライティングがクリスマス仕様になっているのが部屋から見れてとても良かったです。少し部屋は狭いですが、清潔で問題無しでした。

title: The best staff
text:
Perfect. It has the best staff in NYC.

I moved over from Intercontinental Times Square after I had the worst 2 days there for Christmas. Staff members in that intercontinental were the worst I'd ever met in a hotel. It couldn't be worse. I read all the reviews just to make sure the staff in the new hotel was fine. 

I made the right decision to choose Eventi. Perfect!

title: Best hotel in NYC..very cool home away from home
text: I have been staying at the Eventi Hotel for several years when I go to NYC for business. The staff is unbelievable. Victoria Tuchinsky the manager is the best and always remembers my preferences, takes care of me every time. Kevin and the whole staff are awesome. The rooms are amazing, the food is great and the vibe is trendy and fun. The rooms are big for NYC hotel standards. It just keeps getting better. The service is impeccable all around. I love seeing all of the staff when I visit...it's like seeing old friends. Great hotel and highly recommend...everything is easy there. Makes a long work trip much more enjoyable. Must stay,

title: Exceeds my Kimpton expectations
text:
I'm heavily biased for Kimpton, but I'd rank this as the best property in their portfolio that I've stayed at.  The location is perfect--equidistant from two subway stops, two very short stops to my favorite places in Soho, and accessible to anywhere you want to go in the area.  

The front desk was friendly and warm, and checked me in without delay.  The room was tidy, peaceful, and I had a good view of the Empire State Building.  There was construction underway across the street, but I didn't hear any of it from the 16th floor.  

Wine hour has great selection, and I like how they don't host it in the lobby.  

Keep up the great work!

title: Nice Hotel!
text: Great hotel.  The rooms were clean and service is amazing in the conference area, as well as housekeeping.  Food at the event I attended was great.  Restaurants onsite.  I would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the area.  Was able to walk to Times Square and broadway areas and the Empire State Building was visible from the hotel.

title: LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Live in NYC and stay here from time to time :)
text: Pleasantly surprised by this place - really loved it! We're in the middle of some apt renovating in NYC, so have had to sneak out to hotels a few nights here and there over the past several months. Being New Yorkers, we have high hotel standards, but this one is a real gem. We've stayed a few times, and it's definitely become our go-to in NYC for our last minute nights when we need a local hotel or recs for friends/family coming to town. Location is not the most trendy, but it's very convenient if you're taking cabs/subway. For tourists, it's pretty good location too, very easy to access the Must-sees of NY. Rooms are clean and very roomy for NYC standards! We've stayed in many NYC hotels and keep reverting back to Kimpton Eventi on 6th Ave - the price is not too bad for NYC, but the hotel is really a notch up from what we've seen! The food/coffee downstairs is great - trendy and desirable hotel all around. Oh and great view of the Empire State Bldg too! Very happy and look forward to returning soon!!!

title: Stopped in for drink amd burger
text: Short visit for drinks and a cheese burger. Burger was awesome and setting / decor is very cool. Its a hotel bar though, so pricey amd full of people going in and out. Nice looking hotel with good service.

title: 6 Days and Nights saved by the Eventi hotel
text: We had a fantastic time at the Eventi!  We were originally booked at the Hilton on 29th, but it was so bad that when we walked around the corner to get some dinner we went to the Eventi.  Talked to Chai, the bar manager, who immediately got the Esha the hotel manager who held two beautiful rooms for us.  We checked out of the Hilton and into the Eventi.  Best move we ever made.   The staff was great and we had a blast with them. The hotel food was some of the best we had on our trip.   We highly recommend this hotel.  The staff could not be nicer or do more.  From Esha to Chai, MiMi, Erickson, Kiera and all the great staff. They made the trip so special and fun.   Thanks for saving the NY end of our  vacation!  After crazy days wandering around NYC the Eventi was a great place to come back to.  Thanks Eventi, awesome.

title: A Pleasant Surprise
text: I checked in for a one night stay on 8 April 2017 for business. The hotel is the perfect location if you need to handle anything in the Fashion District and the fact that it's a Kimpton made it a perfect selection for me. What made this trip even more special was that I was upgraded to the Veranda Suite. After my week it was the perfect place to kick my feet up for the work I need to handle that Sunday. The room was clean and spacious, check the photos. The sound proofing was perfect even with the floor to ceiling veranda windows. Check-in and check-out was quick even though the lobby can get a little crazy. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. They accommodated my late check out request without any issues. This was honestly one of my best Kimpton stays thus far and will be my go to NYC hotel.

title: Trendy & welcoming in fun central location
text:
The Kimpton Eventi is in a great central location to get out of the current madness around MIdtown because of all the Trump security issues. We never went above 35th street and explored Soho, Chelsea, Nolita and East Village.  The eventi was welcoming and trendy all at once.  It's on the busy Avenue of the Americas, but the wonderful restaurant is on a beautiful little quite space between buildings with outdoor seating.  Our room was small-ish but perfect and with everything we needed (we were there with our teen boy - so three to a room). The staff was beyond wonderful and is why this cool, trendy hotel also feels warm and welcoming to anyone of any age.  Loved it!
Great location for exploring Manhattan south of Mid-town.

title: Amazing experience
text: I stayed at the Eventi with my family while visiting New York  and the service was incredible. We were treated with the utmost respect and I have no complaints. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by Esha and she made sure we enjoyed our stay. We were thrilled when we received a hand written note and cupcakes from Esha later that evening. We will definitely be staying at the Eventi again!

title: Still my favorite NYC hotel!
text: I've stayed here a couple of times before on business and this time was just as great. I got to try more of the restaurant options so that was nice and my room with a view was perfect. I will say that rushing to get your key card in the elevator to select your floor isn't always convenient but I appreciate the security measure. If only the rates were more affordable I would stay here when I visit for pleasure too. None the less, the hotel and staff are great!

title: Romantic, Modern Hotel
text: My wife and I enjoyed our stay here.  The room was clean.  The decor is hip.  The lobby is great.  The staff was very helpful and nice.  I would like to stay here again sometime.  We went to a show at the Garden.  This is a great place to stay, if you are going to a show.

title: My favorite hotel in NYC
text:
I've stayed here numerous times going back to ~2011. I'm a huge fan of the hotel and the staff has been top notch, every single time. 

The wine hour is a great perk, but the quality of the staff, and rooms are what set it apart from the pack. I find the location to be great and easy to get to anywhere walking/ubering/subway. I highly recommend this hotel, and hope that with the pending merger IHG doesn't take away from all that great Kimpton components.

title: Surprisingly enjoyable
text: As in many of my reviews i was in staying on business. I had in mind a premier inn type of stay, but I was very positively surprised. The rooms are a decent size (for NY), well equipped, free wifi, though annoyingly you have to register each device you want to use which means joining their loyalty scheme, in my case three time? (this has the reverse effect for me - makes me anti loyal!) Nonetheless, the choice of 3 good places to eat on site including a decent sports type bar serving food late was perfect for my needs. It's in a great location and relatively quiet for NY. This would be top of my list when I siting again - fair price for NY and everything you need for a day or two stay. Great if they sorted the wifi as totally free log on. Will certainly look at other Kimptons in future.

title: Great stay in a prime location
text: Room was nicely decorated with an excellent view of the Empire State building. Overall excellent experience because of the personalized service from the top notch staff. They gave us their individual favorite off the beaten track tourist activities and could not have been more helpful and friendly. Would not stay anywhere else.

title: A must stay in New York
text:
An excellent and well run hotel. The overall service right from Victoria at the front desk through to Alex's welcome and help at the front door was tip top.
When you visit New York the Kimpton is the hotel to book.

title: favorite hotel in NYC
text: Our family just returned from 10th trip to NYC.  We always stay at Kimpton Hotels, and Hotel Eventi is the best!  The hotel is in a good location, close to MSG, Penn station, and decent shopping.  The staff are wonderful, always helpful and pleasant.  I want to thank Julia Malara for making our stay perfect.  She is the gold standard for excellent customer service.  I can't recommend this hotel enough.

title: Terrific service and relaxing rooms
text:
I stayed at the Kimpton Eventi for a recent business trip. Be warned, it's in the swirl of Midtown, but you forget where you are once you walk inside. Staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, and the decor and atmosphere were great. I was able to check in early to freshen up before my meetings. 

The rooms were very comfortable. Big with luxurious beds. Three restaurants to choose from on the ground floor. There's also a fitness center. Worked out perfectly for business, but it would also be great for a fun trip to NYC.

title: Best hotel for Madison Square Garden
text:
What a great hotel.  My wife and I stayed here when I took clients to a Rangers game.  
Check in was great.  The lobby was hoping at 5:00 with wine hour.  We grabbed our glasses and headed to our room.  We stayed in a Premier one bedroom king suite.  What a great space.  Had a great view of the Empire State Building.  Room had a great layout and a nice large bathroom.  Staff was super nice, helpful and attentive. Had a great dinner and drinks at L'Amico and then took a short safe walk to MSG.

Great hotel in NYC.  Can't wait to comeback!

title: Solid hotel in a great location, starting to show a little wear and tear
text: I stayed at the Eventi on a recent business trip. The lobby is active, comfortable, hip and well designed. Check in was  a breeze and the staff was very attentive. Coffee in the morning was well located. The room was modern, nicely laid out, and also well designed.  Chips in paint and dings in the furniture were apparent though. The bathroom was totally updated, with a walk in shower (good water pressure), lighted art and good amenities. The hotel has a great location in the center of lower midtown if that is where you need to be.

title: The event team is great!
text: Hosted a wedding here and could not have been more pleased.  The staff,food and space were really exceptional. Our 100+ guests all commented on how wonderful the evening was. The hotel rooms are nicely appointed in eco-chic and are quite comfortable.  Breakfast at The Vine was really very good.

title: Great hotel
text:
Loved the location and the atmosphere of this hotel! The rooms were very spacious too.
They also had a free wine/happy hour on Saturday, which was fun. Really enjoyed the hotel and would absolutely stay here again!

title: Great hotel, perfect location lovely staff!
text: Me and some colleagues have been to this hotel last year in november due to a business trip. Check in with kevin has been quick, professional and very funny. Captain kirk stored my luggage cause I went to a knicks game. Relly funny guy and the type of person you want to have as a doorman. When i came back julia from the front desk handed out my room keys and spent some time for chat. Really nice girl. My room was located on the 19th floor. Which was great as the sunrise in the morning has been beautiful. The restaurant, the breakfast and all the staff has been great to us. When I have the chance to visit new york again, i would definitely stay there. Mainly because of the handsome and funny staff. You have been great to us. Thanks a lot and sorry for my late review! :)

title: Birthday
text: Wow! The hotel was in the perfect place for us. Very easy to go shopping and explore all the sights. The food and and service in the hotel are fantastic. We did have some problems with our room due to my sister being disabled. A note to other disabled people ( no handrails around the toilet, shower or bath) in the accessible rooms. However Gabrielle and her team went out of their way to make things as easy and comfortable as possible for my sister. Alex,Trevor and Kevin were brilliant!!! We had a fabulous time!!! Thank you so much we will back xx

title: Great hotel!
text: I really like this hotel.  My room was very quiet and the bed was so comfortable.  Also, I had a great view of the city.  There is a great restaurant and bar downstairs.  The restaurant manager (sorry but I can't remember his name) was very welcoming and helpful.  The coffee is delicious.  I will definitely stay at the Eventi on my next NYC visit!

title: Pet Friendly awesome hotel
text: Love love love everything about this hotel. Location so close to Peloton studio. Pet friendly. Caring staff. Immaculate room. City view. Great robes!!! Awesome floor plan. Go. Check in today. Love love LOVE.

title: Excellent location
text: Stayed for work for 5 nights, being upgraded to a king room on a high floor was really appreciated as it was actually quiet - a huge plus in a busy city - the room was plenty big enough and the floor to ceiling windows were great. Even on the 22nd floor being able to open the window so you can get "fresh" air was fantastic, so much better than blasting the aircon. Only very minor drawback would be the in-room dining menu - when you've got restaurants attached it would be good to be able to order from a reduced restaurant menu rather than the typical room service fair - especially when you're staying for a few nights the choices are pretty limited. That said, would definitely stay again.
